description:
Hold up. Wait a minute!? I don't have a review written for my go-to cookie shop? Wow. Well, here it is. A solid 5 star review for Anthony! This has been my jam for 5 years and counting. I keep coming back for more! 

There's not one cookie that I've had that disappointed me. All our damn right chewy, ooey, gooey!  However , my fave has got to be the cookies and cream cookie. This paired with a glass of milk would make Santa Claus one happy fellow! Or maybe, come to think of, what if Anthony is Santa Claus? These cookies are the gift that keeps giving!
author: Briana H.

description:
We were in the 24th and Mission area for lunch and wanted to grab dessert of a chocolately nature, and Anthony's was one of the highest rated dessert shops in the area. 

We walked over and were greeted by Anthony in the middle of baking and a cashier, both of which seemed super happy to see us. They were really nice and even recognized some of the other people that came in during our time there. Definitely felt like a neighborhood joint where everyone knows everyone, which I haven't had the pleasure of experiencing in SF up until this point. 

Anyway, the cute chalkboard menu was on the northern wall of the shop and the cookie lineup was super long. There were maybe 20 options listed, although only 5-10 of them were available when we came in (identified by checkmarks next to them). There was also milk to go along, ice cream and a couple drinks to choose from.

We ended up going for a German Chocolate cookie, which had nuts in it and had a really interesting texture. We also ordered an oatmeal cranberry cookie which was wonderful as well. 

The only downside was the pricing, as these two cookies were 2 inches in diameter each (pretty small, 2 bite cookie) and cost 2 dollars each. There was a larger option for a little more, but it was hard for us to stomach 2 dollars a cookie when we can make huge delicious cookies for a fraction of the price at home. Even so, it was worth visiting, and I would recommend stopping by and spending hard-earned cash on the more exotic varieties of cookie.

Thanks to Anthony for the welcoming atmosphere and great cookies! I'm sure we'll be back.
author: John B.

description:
So the peanut butter and cookies & cream cookies are amazing. 

My biggest gripe about this place is the prices. The cookies are about $2.50-3.00 each and they are sized like chips ahoy... if you have a big wallet and can afford the calories this is the place for you.
author: Brandon I.

description:
My boyfriend and I made our way here on a Sunday morning not too long after they opened shop. I was a bit disappointed when I took a bite of each of the cookies we ordered. I thought they were buttery and good, but not spectacular. I put them away and totally forgot about them until later that night. I figured I should eat them since they're $2 a pop. Holy cow, they tasted amazing. I'm not sure why, but they tasted amazing when they were old! Not kidding. I would definitely come back here again. 

My favorites were the oatmeal chocolate chip, chocolate chip, and cookies and cream. They're $2 each which is a bit pricey for an average sized cookie, but I'm a sucker for a good cookie. 10/10 would buy again (and buy more)
author: Christine L.

description:
Delicious cookies but so pricey for the size of the cookies. Had the toffee chip and the cookies and cream and yes definitely get the cookies and cream! 

Probably wouldn't really come back specifically for the cookies since I'm not used to spending this much on cookies. Parking is also incredibly difficult here, but the 24th street bart station is only a couple blocks away. Nevertheless, the cookies were delicious, but I've also had better cookies.

Worth trying at least once!
author: Sara T.

description:
Seriously not worth $2 for one cookie. Like seriously it wasn't da bomb cookie. I got the toffee and no it wasn't to die for whatsoever.  No it wasn't that great of a cookie. This is what you do next time you go to this place. You sample them all you decide what's worth it to you. 

The lady behind the register was kind and accommodating. The place was small but had a picnic table that could fit a minimum of six peeps.
author: Tim E.

description:
I love the cookies here!!  I can't wait for Anthony to open his shop in Los Angeles.  I bought a dozen, and tried a mix of chocolate chip, chocolate chip with walnuts, cookies and cream, German chocolate, white chocolate chip and oatmeal with chocolate chip.

We came right when the shop opened at 11:00 am on a Saturday morning, so the cookies were fresh and absolutely delicious.  I ate a few and brought the rest home to Orange County, and they were still amazing the next day.

It was also nice that Anthony was willing to come out and say "hi" and tell me he's opening up in LA in the near future.  Yay!
author: Krys T.

description: I have only tried the gluten free chocolate chip cookies but they are quite delicious. I imagine there is quite a bit of butter packed in those cookie morsels. The store has a simple design, with one large communal table you can sit with your cookies and milk (which they of course serve!). My sister said the chocolate chip and cookies and cream flavors were good as well. It's worth a try if you're in the area. Parking can be a pain so plan for that.
author: Mel L.

description:
This was definitely a good find!

I was introduced to this place on my last trip up to SF from OC.  I was not disappointed.  I came at about 5pm and many flavors and a lot of the larger cookies were sold out.  That didn't stop me from still making 7 cookie purchases for only around only $10.  All of them were delicious and even yummy a few days later.  My ultimate favorite was their cookies and cream flavor.  It is a must get.  The only one that was different than the others was the peanut butter flavor because of how brittle it was.  It basically fell apart when I got back home.  

There were so many cookies and for so cheap.  If you are really set on a flavor you like, I recommend coming a little early during the day to ensure it is not sold out.  I believe this place is a good find and worth checking out.
author: Cat N.

description: Don't get me wrong - the cookies are good. I just have the luck (curse, when I'm on a diet) of living with a baker - so I can tell you that I've had better. We had the chocolate chip, toffee chip, and cookies and cream. All of the cookies have a great balance between crunchy (edges) and chewy (center), but the flavors were average. I felt the toffee chip could've had more toffee - and the cookies and cream tasted like they crushed oreos and mixed it with the regular chocolate chip batter... nothing too interesting. To each their own? ¯\_(ツ)_/¯
author: Larissa M.

description:
Why did I bite into one of your cookies? 

Now my tastebuds are spoiled. B got some cookies for us and when I first picked one up, I thought "how good can this get, they are cookies?" Yea, expect these cookies are light, fresh, made with quality ingredients, full of flavor and not overly sweet. They have a lovely chew, slightly crispy on the outside and soft within. I wish Anthony's would ship their cookies so I could share these works of art with everyone. 

Cookie perfection!
author: Kimberly J.

description:
There's no much going on here but that's what makes it unique. It's straight to the point. There's a menu on the wall which tells what's available for the day. The second you walk in, the place just erupts with fresh & hot cookie batter which is smells amazing. You can see the open kitchen with stacks of trays and people baking. It's defiantly a sight to see.

Their top two must popular cookies are the original chocolate chip and cookies & cream. I really enjoyed both! I like how the cookies can be crispy and a bit tough in a sense where there's a short snap to each bite. It's honestly what I prefer as oppose to those soft-baked textures. My favorite was their cookies & cream because it has that nice milky taste which is delicious. Cookies here range in price but for about $2/cookie which can be a bit pricey but they're gourmet so it makes sense. They also sell Straus Family Creamery milk which is a local brand that distributes milk & cheese. 

Next time I come, I'll be sure to eat half a dozen and take another batch home! The cookies here are definitely worth trying. They are better than most cookie shops!
author: Allister D.

description:
I was so disappointed when I tried the cookies here. I ordered almost a dozen cookies: 2 chocolate chips, 2 toffee chip cookie, 2 german chocolate, 2 peanut butter, and 2 double chocolate chip. I'm not saying the cookies were bad but for the price, I think it's too expensive and it's so small. I finished my cookie in two bites and each cookie was close to $2. I didn't think it was "special."

The peanut butter was really delicate, once you take a bite everything crumbles. I thought the texture was weird, my mouth started to get really sticky (powder like). I did enjoy their toffee, regular chocolate, and double chocolate chip cookie. I prefer my cookies a bit chewy. The german was okay for me, it was loaded with nuts. 

Overall, I think I will have to opt this place. Quality was not how I expected. I really had high expectations for this place. Again, price played a big factor, I just don't think it's worth it.
author: Noel K.

description:
Decent cookies! My favorite was the toffee chip followed by chocolate chip then cookies and cream. I was a LITTLE disappointed because I did expect the cookies to be warm though (especially considering we arrived at Anthony's exactly at 11am - the time they open their stores on weekends). 

I think I'd definitely come back to their toffee chip flavor!
author: Angelina H.

description:
Some of the best advertising a bakery can have is the smell that hits you when you walk in the door (or pass by on the street!).  Anthony's Cookies has a captivating scent that lets you know their products are fresh and tasty

The cookies are reasonably priced at around $1-3, and have a satisfying chewy texture, despite their thinness.  I tend to prefer thicker chewy cookies, but that's personal preference.  I suppose my ideal cookie spot would offer a range of textures, or maybe some more out-there/inventive flavors, but Anthony's excels in offering a comfortable, satisfying, and familiar product at a fair price.
author: Neal B.

description:
This place is wonderful. We met the owner who was so warm and welcoming and loved chatting with us. 

My partner got two of the dark chocolate walnut cookies and he loved them. I got two gluten free chocolate chip cookies and they were indeed delicious! 

My only issue is how expensive the cookies are, for $2.25 for one normal sized cookie was a little steep for me. However, if you're looking for good soft cookie, I would recommend it:)
author: Gita r.

description:
Anthony's cookies is a gourmet cookie shop located in the mission district. Think of a elevated mrs fields... yum. 

I found out about their cookies when my sister brought a dozen of their cookies & cream cookies home. Wow... I mean WOW these cookies are everything. Their perfectly moist in the center and crisp on the outside. The cookies & cream cookies isn't something you see at a bakery very often. I highly recommend trying the cookies & cream over any flavor. 

The cookies are all baked fresh daily. It literally smells like heaven the moment you walk in the door. There aren't must seats, I suggest taking these cookies to go.
author: AJ C.

description:
Came here today after having lunch around the Mission district.

They have their cookie menu and what's available up on the wall.  1 oz cookie = $2, 2oz cookie = $4

At 1:30pm they didn't have much selection left.

I bought 1 dozen 1 oz cookies that cost me $24. 

 *3 cookies and cream - cashier said this is the their best seller. I think they're just ok.  They weren't even warm cookies at this point. 

*3 white chocolate chip 
*2 toffee 
*2 oatmeal 
*2 double chocolate chip 

I asked the lady if she could put the cookies in a box she said minimum 2 dozen cookies for the box otherwise it's an additional $1.50!! - umm no thank you.  Already paying $24 for cookies why charge for the box? Anyways the cookies are just ok.  

I wouldn't go out of my way just for these cookies.  There are other places in San Francisco to buy cookies that are way much tastier and cheaper! For instant B.Patisserie hands down have the best chocolate chip cookies!  It's the size of your face and it's only $3.25!! And they're always warm!
author: Junaline G.

description:
Hands down, one of the best cookies ever. It's a good thing that I only get them whenever I'm in the city or else I'd eat them every single day. They're that good! 

I recommend the chocolate chip and cookies & cream cookies. I've tried their other flavors before, but those two are my faves. I especially love it when I get a fresh batch from the oven. They're kind of a combo of crispy and chewy. The right amount of chocolate chips. All that is missing: a glass of milk. And guess what? They sell milk here too!
author: Anna N.

description:
REVIEWER # 1507

Believe the hype!!!

I finally was able to try some of Anthony's Cookies and boy, oh boy, did I fall in love at first bite!
Anthony's puts these others cookie companies to shame, baby! Known for making fresh cookies from scratch daily, I love that! The BEST part about those delicious cookies is that they have many different flavors, which seem to change day-to-day. I came in for my first time on 10\5\17 and was greeted by a lovely gentleman, and was given a sample of the white chocolate (YUM)!

The menu was so easy to read and straight to the point. The flavors are all listed on the menu; based on what they have, they will add a checkmark next to the flavor. Anthony's offers 1oz and 2oz cookies. The 2oz are only available Monday, Wednesday and Fridays. They advertise their "special flavors" of: Walnut Choc Chip and Dark Chocolate, and also have gluten free chocolate chip cookies. 

Prices: 
1oz=$1.85
2oz=$3.70

My favorite flavors are: White Chocolate, Oatmeal Raisin, and Cookies & Cream. Not only do they taste delicious, but they are soft and chewy (just how I like it)! The inside is nice and spacious. They also sale milk, located in the refrigerator (by the cashier). The inside offers a nice comfy feel. Limited seating; but many people don't hang around anyways. 

It truly melted my heart when I found out that Anthony's gives any leftover cookies for the day to non-profits. 

I rarely have a sweet tooth, but when I do, I will make sure to pick me up some of those tasty, scrumptious cookies from Anthony's!
author: Porsche C.

description: DELICIOUS. Like everyone else was, I was skeptical of a $2 cookie initially. I came in when the staff was laughing and having a good time with the customers. Anthony is super sweet and so are his staff. I ordered the Toffee cookie as well as the cinnamon spice -- the cinnamon was my fav!!! The texture is perfect. $2 a pop is the price you pay to keep a great person in business doing what he loves.  BUY THE COOKIE!
author: Hannah F.

description:
These cookies may be expensive for the portion you get, but oh man are they worth it. They're probably the best cookies I've ever had in my whole life and I've had many cookies. I rarely crave cookies nowadays, but if you tell me that it's an Anthony's cookie I would definitely devour it. 

My favorites are the cookies and cream and the chocolate chip cookies. For the cookies and cream cookie, you rarely ever see anyone selling those, but wow the flavor and texture is amazing. Also, the way they look all pretty and marbled hints to you that it's a good cookie. The chocolate chip is classic and I don't know what they add to the cookie, but they're addictive. It's really all you want in a cookie - chewy in the middle and a little crispy but chewy on the outside. 

The line can sometimes go out the door, but it really is worth the wait. You just know that the cookie is going to be amazing right when you walk through the door and see the simplistic decor and smell the oven baked cookies. Yes, the cookies are priced highly and the size of the cookie isn't the biggest but you could see how high quality the cookie is and that's all that matters. I truly recommend trying at least one of their cookies - it's life changing. 

We met the owner, Anthony, and he said he wants to expand to LA in a couple of years and I think that would be the best thing ever. I would be there every single day if I could! Great customer service and even better cookies. Definitely a mandatory stop when I go to SF.
author: Julie N.

description:
Womp womp. For a specialty cookie store, I expected better. I expected softer, or gooey chocolate or warm or something, anything.

We tried the cookies and cream and the chocolate chip. They were so normal .... I feel like I can bake better at home :/
author: Cynthia X.

description: I could've sworn I wrote a review on this place already. Anyways, I believe Anthony's has the best cookies in SF. Super unique molasses chewy texture to these thin-ish cookies. They are not the crumbly type or the super thick type. I "believe" their popular flavor is the cookies and cream, but let's be real, you can never leave there with just one. The toffee is good if not better than the cookies and cream. Must try if you're in the city!
author: Tina S.

description:
If Santa knew about this place, no one in California would get their presents on time. I have probably destroyed some of my friendships because of their cookies. I have promised to deliver cookies back to San Jose and they always seem to disappear before I make it back. 

Protip: Go early so that they still have all of their flavors. The dark chocolate chip will be the death of your diet.
author: Denise I.

description:
Cookies are not worth $2!!! First of all, the cookies are tiny! They taste great but not amazingly great. There is nothing special about them. I order 6 cookies: 3 chocolate chip, 2 cookies and cream, and 1 oatmeal. I love the chew to the cookies but like other Yelpers have mentioned it taste like the frozen store bought ones. 

If you're curious like me, go for it. Would I come back to get more? Nope. Not worth the trek and not worth the money.
author: Marie N.

description:
Suuuper overhyped. I really don't see what's so special about this place. The cookies are expensive, small, and I've definitely tasted better. To be honest, I'd rather buy the frozen cookies at the grocery store and bake it myself...

Coming here, I was super excited because of all the good reviews. I'm a cookie fanatic, and I loved a chewy, moist chocolate chip cookie. I ordered the chocolate chip and white chocolate chip cookies. I was surprised by how small they were. They were cold, and although they were nice and crispy on the outside, they were kind of hard on the inside. It was really disappointing. I don't know if I came here on a bad day or something, but next time I'll be saving my money and baking at home!
author: Tina L.

description: Probably the best cookies I have ever tried in my life. I'd recommend getting one of each because they are all good!
author: Katherine G.

description:
Food 5/5. Service 5/5. Ambiance 4/5. Bang for your buck 4/5.

Finally I got to try the infamous Anthony cookies. Whenever I'm in a mood for a cookie coming home from work, it always seems to have run out of cookies. But I'm so glad I got to try it today. 

Let me tell you, these cookies are so good. They are on the chewy side which I love, with just the right amount of sweetness. They are about $1.85 dollars for a 1 oz cookie and $3.50 dollars for a 2 oz cookie. They are somewhat pricey but they are oh so worth it. 

Today I got the toffee chip and chocolate which were both divine. If I ever get here early enough I definitely have to try the cookies and cream and peanut butter. 

Tip - Come early to get your cookies, they will run out.
author: Brian N.

description:
My first reaction to eating the white chocolate macadamia was pure joy. I came here around 6PM at night and unfortunately, they had already run out of a good number of other cookie flavors...so definitely come earlier! While I wasn't able to try everything I wanted, I still really enjoyed this place. 

This isn't really a sit down bakery since there's only one table that people could share so be prepared to bring heaven to-go if there's no room.
author: Jennifer D.

description:
I'm seriously a sucker for chocolate chip cookies. So there is an obvious difference between a great chocolate chip cookie and a subpar chocolate chip cookie. Anthony's would definitely be one of the greater more expensive chocolate chip cookie that I would come back for over and over. It's my guilty pleasure. Two other excellent flavors would be toffee and cookies and cream. The buttery goodness is too good to shy away from and when the chocolate chips is in the melty texture is when it's just perfect. 

Parking is terrible.
author: Ernest Y.

description:
Great customer service & delicious cookies! 

I must say that these are the best cookies in the bay area!

Must try!
author: Raquel S.

description: $33 for a dozen cookies are you out of your damn...  wait, these are delicious!!! There are copycats but don't let 'em fool you... these are the best cookies and cream cookies everrrrrrrrr.
author: Ryan A.

description:
Anthony's cookies! My favorite cookies in the city. The only thing stopping me from giving them a five star is that they have a select few flavors that are great, and the rest of them are okay. Also these cookies are super expensive for the size you get, but I haven't found anything like them, so it's the price I'll have to pay.

I've been coming here for over 7 years. Discovered them when they were only charging $1 or $1.25 a cookie? Over the years they slowly increased the price to a whopping $1.75 a cookie, and introduced two sizes for certain flavors. To date, I've tried several of their cookies, either from taste testing prior to purchase (yes they allow this), or purchasing it. My favorites ranked are the cookies and cream, toffee chip, and oatmeal chocolate. I've had the coffee, pecan, and a handful of others, but most of them don't even come close to these top three.

Aesthetics are nice, staff is friendly. Parking sucks. My only issue with the store is that they constantly have flies inside? And their cookies are left out in the open. I try not to think about it..
author: Eva C.

description:
Definitely taste the freshness but not outstanding to the point I would buy a box of these. 

I do like that their menu is simple and easy to read- checked boxes mean flavors for the day. However, how come they never sell 2 oz cookies....? 

They brought back PB cookies! This was absolutely delicious (if you're not allergic to peanuts). Tasted like a jar of peanut butterrrrrrr. 

Location wise, kind of far from central Mission. Very quiet area to sell cookies....but hey- they're still around so I guess it's okay? 

A bench inside to sit if you want to devour your cookies on the spot! We opted to-go and got a little brown bag. 

Overall, bucketlist checked! Flavors on point but if you're looking for thick cookies, these are flat and soft.
author: Hurjane V.

description: Is there a rating for OMG and yet a rating for does a dozen come with a gym membership!  Especially if you happen to pair these with salted caramel ice cream. These decadent little creatures are attitude adjusting, addicting, and hopefully you have a round table, because everyone congregates around them. It became the center of conversation - did you try this one? You have to try this one! One slight recommendation, may we please have the spatula with the batter along with our dozen ;-)
author: Sheryl F.

description: $2 for a cookie. Love their cookies & cream cookie and their toffee chocolate cookie. Milk and ice cream are also available on their menu if you're looking for a pairing.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Feel so bad for the rating but the cookies were very disappointing. Out of the five cookies we tried only one was really good- the spice cookie. The rest were kind of flavorless and kind of over cooked. The peanut butter was like powder, crumbled apart before we could take a bite. My husband eats every chocolate chip cookie around, even the free samples at Safeway are better. He says my homemade cookie are way better.

Spice 4/5
Chocolate chip 3/5
Peanut butter 3/5
Toffee 3/5
Cookies & cream 2/5
author: Nicole J.

description: Fun moment when you go into Anthony's cookies, end up having a great conversation with the cashier about our future, loving ourselves, loving who we are and just being confident. He also said that I was a little ball of light that could light up the whole room. I told him he made my day, he literally inspired me to be more confident in myself. Turns out his name is Anthony....as in the owner of the cookie shop...guys...hes an amazing person and the cookies taste equally delicious. Stop by this place if u have the chance.
author: Becky Mae A.

description:
The moment you step in, you're surrounded with the delicious scent of freshly baked cookies. The cookies here are special because they have a crispy yet soft chewiness. The outside is cooked to the point where each bite has texture for your teeth to grab on and also the juiciness where the inside part is tender (my description sounds like meat.. lol). Love the balance they're able to maintain here and it shows quite awesome skill!
They've got daily flavors and seasonal flavors all which are marked in stock if they have a check mark next to it. I like that. Makes it easy and shows that they're trying to constantly have cookies out in a timely manner so they retain their freshness (I'm guessing, ahha). 
Regardless! Staff was kind and openly showed they appreciated my business. They were patient as I stared at the board for a long time. The cookies and cream cookie is definitely one of my favorites. I also purchased the German chocolate cookies for my father for Father's Day, and twelve cookies did not last longer than 2 hours... Needless to say! Definitely a jewel in San Francisco!
author: Kim N.

description:
The first time I tried to come here, it sold out super early and they closed. This time, I came on a Saturday at 4pm and to my delight, they still had cookies left! The venue itself is really small with space for you to line up at the register and one large common table for seating. When I arrived, it was completely empty so I ordered swiftly and sat down with some water to eat my cookies. Shortly after however, the place became super packed and I don't think the line subsided for the next 30 minutes I sat there for.

I decided to get 2 of the 1 oz cookies to share with my boyfriend. I got the peanutbutter cookie and the chocolate chip. They were so tiny but they cost about $2 each (I think the peanut butter one coast more) so it seemed a bit of a rip off. The chocolate chip cookie wasn't that impressive so I was a bit disappointed. The peanut butter cookie however was a whole different story. They had a board dedicated to saying that the peanut butter cookie had returned, which means this was probably a really good and popular choice. When I bit into it, it pretty much just melted in my mouth. The texture was unlike any other cookie I have ever tasted. It was so soft and rich and tasted just the perfect amount of peanut butter. I wanted to get another one but I stopped myself haha but it was really good. I highly recommend people to get the peanut butter cookie if you love peanut butter.
author: Catherine S.

description: Nice warm cookies on a cold day....yum
author: Gary W.

description:
I can't believe I haven't written a review for Anthony's Cookies yet. My husband and I have been getting cookies from Anthony's for almost the entire duration of our relationship - that's 10 years! You really can't go wrong with a box of these incredible cookies - the cookies are crispy on the outside and super chewy and delicious on the inside. What's super crazy is that every single time we pick up another dozen - the cookie never fails to still wow us. 

Our favorite flavors include Cookies and Cream, Toffee, Chocolate Chip, and White Chocolate Chip... but, to be honest. All of the cookies are REALLY REALLY GOOD. 

The inside hasn't changed much over the years. It's definitely had upgrades though! The set up makes it easy for lines to never feel crammed and there's a long farm table with long bench for you to sit and enjoy your cookies. 

You have to try Anthony's Cookies if you're in SF.. they're the BEST COOKIES IN SF. Yes, I said it.
author: Diana P.

description:
I'm a sucker for the Cookies and Creme cookie. And Anthony's does this combination the best way. If I ever find myself in the Mission District, rest assured, I'll find the shortest and most efficient route to Anthony's. While I've tried other classic combinations like the toffee chip and the chocolate chip, I have been consistently impressed with the Cookies and Creme. The crunchy texture, the softer interior, and cookies and creme flavor without the overpowering chocolate chips make this the ultimate cookie. The only qualm I have at this location is that I cannot request a batch of cookies in advance. I have tried (maybe more than a couple of times) to order on the phone, but have been politely declined. Hopefully, this will change in the future!

Long story short, get yourself over to Anthony's cookies and buy a dozen of the Cookies and Creme (or don't because they are so addictive).
author: Jessica E.

description:
A haven for fellow cookie monsters.

Don't get discouraged if what you wanted get sold out by the time you get there. They have fresh baked ones so be flexible!
author: Yad L.

description:
I have spent a LOT of my time attempting to perfect a chocolate chip cookie recipe and even more time eating chocolate chip cookies. By Malcolm Gladwell's definition, pretty sure I am an expert in chocolate chip cookies at this point. 

So all that to say I think I have some credibility in citing Anthony's as a top notch chocolate chip cookie. The product is moist, crunchy and has the same quality of chewiness that is so enjoyable in handmade pasta or dumplings - I know this description isn't doing it justice. Get there and try it for yourselves. I personally favor the dark chocolate chip and toffee chip flavors but Anthony's consistency across types is remarkable. 

Might be the only place I've visited that doesn't try to incentivize you to "upgrade" to larger sizes, as best I can tell it's a completely per ounce price. The small one ounce size is $1.75 and the two ounce is $3.50 and there is no discounting for bulk orders (I inquired, I ordered 200 of them awhile back).
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Very cool spot. I tried the the classic chocolate chip the white chocolate chip and the cookies and cream and far and away the best for me was the Cookies and Cream. I really enjoyed it and if I was young and trying to get over a girl or a deflating sports team victory I would soothe myself with Ice Cream and Anthony's cookie's and cream cookies.

I like lists what can I say? 
When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. 

Here is a look at how I rank the SF Bakeries I've visited and I indicated what they're known for or a dish I recommend:

Rod's SF Bakery rankings (and what they're known for or what I like). ?) Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.

2 B Patisserie=Choco Bannana croissant
3 Zanze's Cheesecake=Regular cheesecake

19 Craftsman & Wolves=Rebel within
20 Bob's Donut & Pastry Shop=any donut 
21 Noe Valley Bakery=dipped cupcake
22 Café Greco=Cannoli 
23 Kings Bakery=Tres leches cake

26 Cups and Cakes Bakery=cupcakes
27 Good Mong Kok Bakery=dim sum
28 Karas cupcake=cupcakes
29 Mission Minis=cupcakes
30 Sift Dessert=cupcakes
31 Tartine Bakery=lemon tart
32 Jane The Bakery=matcha twist , cardamom Lattice Bun
33 Café Madeline=various goods
34 Panaderia La Mexicana=mexican sweet bread
35 Hot cookie=Cookies
36 Les Gourmands Bakery=Croissant
37 Mee Mee Bakery=Cow ears
author: Rod M.

description: Anthonys cookies have redeemed themselves! service has much improved. The prices have gone up, but given its SF and rent is out of control, I cant say I am surprised. The quality is still top notch so I can say it has not changed. I hope they opened one closer to where I live in Concord, but hey, everytime I visit mom in SF , I make it a stop to pick up some cookies n cream for sure
author: Christina M.

description: I would give this place 10 stars if I could. Service is always friendly and the cookies are to DIE for! My favorites: toffee chip, cookies and cream, and chocolate chip walnut. They somehow manage to get both a nice crispy, caramely bottom but a rich soft inside -- the perfect mix. It's dangerous living so close to Anthony's, I'm definitely going to gain a few pounds!
author: Sahar B.

description:
Unfff amazing cookies!! So decadent and moist (or as my fiance called it, "tender"). 

My favorites are toffee, chocolate chip, and cookies & cream. The cookies are expensive but if you're around the area, it's a nice treat. It's also disappointing they don't have a deal if you purchase a dozen or half dozen. If you know you're coming here, I advise bringing a carton of milk.

There's also very limited seating here... kind of a bummer.
author: Janet H.

description:
I get chocolate chip cookies from Whole Foods regularly and they're made from quality ingredients. Their website claimed that they make cookies from local organic ingredients whenever possible. The interior looked a bit sloppy and the one table was dirty. There wasn't a long line thankfully. The cashier lady wasn't extremely friendly, but wasn't rude either. The cookies have a crispy edge and soft in the center. It would've been good if it was warm.  After trying the cookies here, I don't feel that they're a step above the cookies I get from
Whole Foods except the edges are crispy. I got 4 one oz chocolate chip cookie, one 2oz walnut chocolate cookie and one 1oz toffee. I don't think I'd go out of my way for their cookies again. I might bump it up a star if the toffee cookie blows my mind. Update: I initially gave this place a 2, but will bump it to 3 because the toffee wasn't bad and my friend likes it.
author: Kosmo Z.

description:
The environment of this place is so cozy! Except for the fact that there's only one long bench/chair and the window sill area to lounge around...

But you're here for the cookies! So let me tell you about them. We got the dark chocolate chip and the oatmeal cranberry. Both cookies were very moist and had the right amount of chewiness. I would say the dark chocolate chip didn't stand out too much - although you could see the chocolate, you can't really feeeeeel the chocolate presence when you bit into it since the chocolate and cookie melted together a little too well. As for the oatmeal cranberry cookie, I really enjoyed it! The oatmeal gave it great texture and the cranberry the perfect amount of tanginess!
author: Jacqueline T.

description: The cookies here are amazingggggg. My only regret is that I didn't purchase a box before my flight home to Seattle. Each and every cookie was nice and crisp around the edges with a chewy ooey gooey center. The way a perfect cookie should be. I ordered a variety dozen. The cookies n cream, toffee, white chocolate macadamia, oatmeal chocolate, chocolate chip, and german chocolate. Each cookie was full of flavor and not overly sweet. I was impressed! I would highly recommend to any locals and tourists! I know that I will be back (:
author: Somaria C.

description:
Nothing special.
Overpriced and small.
Don't get me wrong, I ate them, but I would go back.
author: Kim S.

description:
I never knew cookies could be this good.  

My favorite is the Oreo cookie.   Buy two instead of one.  I wish I had.

I look forward to trying more flavors in the future.
author: LaSha G.

description:
Whenever I'm in the mood for cookies, I'll gladly make the trip out to Anthony's from the Peninsula. 

I love the crispier, chewier cookies this place has to offer. At first, I wasn't sure I liked this style of cookie, but they grew on me because of the flavors (my favorites are toffee, chocolate chip, and cookies and cream), quality ingredients, and friendly service. They offer cookies in 1oz or 2oz sizes and often sell out of popular flavors by the evening, so drop by earlier for a full selection.
author: Edwina D.

description: Their cookies are the perfect consistency crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside. There were plenty of chocolate chips. The store was clean and menu was easy to read. I paid about 12 dollars for 6 cookies and an 8oz clover 2% milk. Which is alittle steep for me but the cookies were definitely good.
author: Michelle P.

description: I flew from in from Honolulu and made sure that Anthony's Cookies was one of my must  eats while in SF. After taking the slowest Uber ever - complete with the sweetest but most talkative Lady, who made me fall asleep because she sounded like Mary Poppins - we finally got to Anthony's and thankfully they had a ton of cookies left. We bought chocolate chip, cookies and cream and toffee. The cookies made it back to HI but lasted less than a few days because I ate them (mostly all of them lol). I think my kid ate three and Gem ate two. Yeah they're good but glad we're far away from this place cuz you'll be broke from eating here all the time. Two dozen cookies was $50 or more. Kinda pricey, far from where we're staying but worth the memories. The place is still super clean too. They also have their own milk which I still haven't tasted. It's also good to know they opened up another shop!
author: Cameron B.

description:
BOMB ASS COOKIES! The cookies are ADDICTING (like drugs, jk but seriously its hella good!). I've had Anthony's cookies before and it was one of the best cookies I've had. The cookies are so fresh and delicious. It's best to enjoy them the day of or the very next morning because it won't taste as good. The staff is nice and attentive. The prices for the cookies are more on the high end but it's worth it. Parking sucks though since it's all street parking's and sometimes it's hard to find parking in that area. 

Anthony's cookies, I will be back again soon!
author: Monica W.

description:
Their cookies are good, the atmosfere is very pleasant but they lack more coffee options. There was no cappuccino or other expresso drinks. 

Also, we got a box of cookies for a present and they require you to buy 24 cookies. Oh, you also have to pay for the box. Sometimes you only want a few cookies in a nice box for a gift. 

Please have smaller boxes option.
author: Marcia d.

description:
Delicious cookies, but prices are kinda steep..
Make sure to get here early or you'll find yourself in a limited position in terms of cookie flavors!

They serve cookies in 1 oz. or 2 oz. increments at $1.75/oz. This means, thinner cookies are cheaper, and if you want one packed with walnuts or other ingredients, you're gonna be paying $3.50/cookie. My bf and I got a toffee chip cookie and a cookies and cream cookie. They've got the texture down beautifully, with a crunchy outside and a soft inside, but in terms of flavor- it was pretty tasty, but not anything like I'd crave this again tasty. 
Milk to go with your cookies are $1/pint, so I definitely missed out there. Definitely would return if they had ice cream in their menu as well ;) I feel like these cookies would taste pretty darn delicious with some ice cream!
author: Mary F.

description:
The place was good, but not sure I was blown away like others. I also felt it was a little pricey and by the end of the day they didn't have many options and the cookies weren't warm. 

There is also very little seating, and what they do have isn't comfortable. I found the atmosphere to be lacking overall.
author: Stephanie M.

description: One of my favorite places to get a sweet treat. The toffee and cookies and cream are hands down the best flavors. Looks like they just opened a location in Berkeley too that serves ice cream!
author: Kristy L.

description: I was given a cookies and cream and walnut chip cookie the other day. It was a nice treat but found myself finding it a little on the pricey side (size and quality) and didn't leave my palette satisfied. I felt that it didn't live up to the hype. Maybe, it was an off day or my taste buds were asleep. I'll be sure to give Anthony's another try before checking it off my list.
author: Kristina S.

description: A solid selection of old and new favorites with just the right amount of crunch and chew to remind you of Mom's.
author: Max K.

description: Boy has this place gotten worse. I know right, it's hard to believe it but it has. A few years ago the cookies were like 1.50, now keep in mind that the cookies are already really small. Now the same cookies are about 1.90 now that is ridiculous. Don't even get me stared on the just slightly bigger cookies and even bigger ripoff. Don't get me wrong the cookies are pretty tasty. But you are honestly better of going somewhere else that has bigger cheaper cookies (Arizmendi)
author: Alexthebest 8.

description: I have been coming to Anthony's Cookies since they opened up and I have always been a loyal customer! I repeat this has nothing to do with the quality of, the cookies, if you ask me they're the best I've ever had!! My issue is with the customer service! It sucks ass!!! I love giving these cookies out as gifts to close friends and every time  I ask for a box there is always an excuse of why I can't get one or why they have to charge me!! Now know that this policy is different with every employee and I always get resistance from those who don't want to give me a box! This is ridiculous now!!! I have spent hundreds of dollars buying cookies over the years and always get the same BS! I hope this situation gets taken care of
author: Duke Of Frisco X.

description: I was expecting the cookies to be warm and big being it was 2 dollars for one cookie.  The cookies are good though. Nothing special about them. We bought one of each flavor they had. I've been to a lot of bakeries where the cookies were warm soft , fluffy and big and was only 5$ for 4 huge cookies. But hey good for them.
author: Lana L.

description:
Cookies were good, even though didn't reach my higher expectations. 
I gave it a 3 star because of the customer service. It was my first time here and while I was ordering the girl taking my order looked at me with a confused mixed with disgust face. You can't work in front customer service if you can't keep a neutral face while in front of a customer, that was unnecessary and left a bad expression as I left.
author: May A.

description:
Sample them all before you decide on what you like. My favorite cookie is not my favorite here. I don't like the chocolate chip here cause I prefer a salter version less buttery. 
However, the oatmeal cookie in general is my least favorite but OM at Anthony's I'll take only Oatmeal chocolate, oatmeal raisin. Oatmeal craze'n is how I feel with a cup of coffee. If I could have had a scoop of vanilla ice cream in my coffee it would have been
author: Leah M.

description: Cookies and cream cookie and the toffee cookie were my favorite. I love cookies that are thin, crunchy on the outside, but soft in the middle and that's exactly how these cookies are!
author: Nina M.

description: Not sure how this place got 4 stars, but definitely people who rate 4 stars don't know about good cookies . I bought every flavors including specialty flavor and all cookies was mediocre. I disappointed and expected more for 4 stars cookies.
author: Selvyana T.

description:
Today! Gluten free chocolate chip cookies
I'm lost for words, I literally took my time eating my cookie, it was that good this was my first time going by today.  I'm really glad to here about this cookie shop. I will definitely return soon and put the word out man! What an awesome place keep up the good work.
author: Darlene M.

description: I was so excited to try this place! I've heard people comparing it to Antoine's in San Mateo. Unfortunately, Anthony's did not live up to the hype for me. Maybe I came here on an off day, so I might come back to give this place another try. I think I came near their closing time, so the cookie selection was very limited, the cookies weren't warm, and it seemed like the cookies they had left for sale were the not-so-great ones. I got a couple of regular chocolate chip cookies. They were cold, hard, and crunchy. Not impressed at all. The taste was ok, but the texture...not a fan. So after months of awaiting this visit, I was pretty disappointed. Then again, maybe it was an off day. So if I'm in the area again I'd love to give it another shot.
author: Ashley Y.

description:
Anthony's cookies are quality standard cookies. There are so many great flavors and the menu changes a bit from time to time. The toffee cookies along with the cookies and creme cookies are worth a visit! We went during the end of the business day so the cookies were not as fresh (much more on the crunchy side which, unfortunately, is not our kind of cookie) but you can still taste the quality ingredients and the care that goes into each cookie. The staff members are super friendly and personable! 

This would be your place if you enjoy cookies that are on the crispier side and the all-time classic flavors. The sweet tooth was somewhat satisfied after this trip but still honestly needed some Haribo gummy bears a couple of hours later. Good solid bunch of cookies and stop by for a visit if you're in the 'hood :)
author: Meli.Lars M.

description: The cookies and cream cookie was a divine combination of an oreo and a chocolate chip cookie. Can't go wrong with the classic chocolate chip cookie as well! $1.85 for a cookie is a little much but quite worth.
author: Lydia S.

description:
Anthony's is probably my favorite cookie in the world. They're always baked with love and you can tell the effort has been put in with each batch. 

My go-to, like most other reviews, is the cookies and cream cookie. People have tried to replicate it but there's nothing like the original. It's an Oreo and a sugar cookie basically married together and it's excellent. You can't go wrong with any other classic flavors like their chocolate chip. 

Street parking in the mission is always difficult nowadays but I promise you, circling the blocks a couple dozen time will be worth it when you bite into one of Anthony's cookies. 

1 oz cookies (normal sized cookies) are ~ $1.85
2 oz cookies are ~ $3.50
author: Stefanie S.

description:
I was craving something sweet yesterday afternoon so I figured a cookie would hit the spot. Came here and parking was all metered and generally difficult to find. When we arrived, the place was empty and many of their cookies were already sold out. I wanted to try the regular chocolate chip cookie (2 oz) and got the cookies and cream too (1 oz). There was seating on this large bench in the shop.

In terms of taste, they weren't warm since they were sitting out on the trays. Still - the consistency of both cookies was chewy and thick which is just the way I like them. They were also quite sweet, so having about 1.5 cookies pretty much took care of my sweet tooth. If I had to choose between the chocolate chip vs the cookies and cream, I would definitely pick the cookies and cream one. It tasted like it has pieces of oreos in it.

Pricey cookies, but worth it if you want a small treat.
author: Jenny W.

description:
It's 7:10pm and I arrived at Anthony's with my friends. We are celebrating a birthday, but we did not get any cookies. The lady at the front told us that they didn't have anymore and that they were closing early because they ran out of cookies. Why couldn't they have made more cookies and closed at their advertised time of 8pm? We said we would have waited, but instead we had to leave with no cookies. We asked if we could have one of the samples since apparently that was the only cookie left - the lady at the front said "sure" rudely. We then took all their samples and left with no cookies. 

I gave them 2 stars because I normally love the cookies, but they were rude to us and closed early for a terrible reason. They also were not sorry which made us feel worse.
author: Sarah W.

description: Ive heard about this cookie place for the longest time. I made my boyfriend drive all the way to SF to take me here. I thought it was this amazing cookie place but it turned out to be a really small shop. I immediately got cookie happy and quickly ordered two dozens. When the cookies came out, I had a jaw drop moment. And no, not in a good way. The cookies were SO tiny. I had to wait a good 15/20 mins for my cookies. It's a good thing they are fresh, but i was not prepared to wait! Be aware that the cookies do run out and they do not make anymore once they are sold out. I wanted to like these cookies so bad, but I just couldn't. For the price and size of cookies, this was a hard no for me. The rating are so high here and my expectations were really high for this place.
author: Emily L.

description: Incredibly perfect cookies at an incredibly expensive price point. I loved the product.  They were out of some of the classics when I got there closer to closing time.
author: Ernie A.

description:
The location matters, people!!! BE CAREFUL because the address on yelp takes you through Orange Alley which is the back of their store.  It is a straight up narrow alley way.  What you can do is drive through it and park on 25th street like I did.  Keep in mind only street parking is available. Anthony's Cookies is about two doors down from a pub so if you get lost, look out for that pub on the cross of Valencia and 25th. 

Now let's talk about cookies!!!  They offer numerous variations of chocolate cookies such as double chocolate chip, dark chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, etc.  They offer other flavors also but if you love cookies and chocolate then this is the place for you!  The flavor that won me over was their cookies n cream. I'm glad I only bought two of those and shared them because if otherwise, I would be in trouble!

I went to Anthony's Cookies around lunch hours and their cookies still seemed pretty fresh.  The texture of their cookies is perf! Nice and crisp on the outside while being soft and chewy on the inside.  There was also no line at this hour and the workers were very welcoming.

The only reason this place is getting a 4/5 instead of a 5/5 is because of the fact I got lost and had to circle around once or twice.  Other than that, do your sweet tooth a favor and check this place out.  If you get thirsty from all the sugar, don't worry! They sell milk and other drinks as well.
author: Rossel C.

description: Ouuuuweeee Anthony's cookies are bomb! I was able to try many flavors but to no one's surprise, the cookies and cream cookie was my favorite. This flavor is seriously so good that the majority of my cookies were these! My second favorite was the toffee chip. They were chewy and perfectly sweet. Anthony's cookies are a must try. Yomssss!
author: Annie H.

description: Yummy. Found this place by accident.  Cool vibe.  Yummy cookies.  Great service. Very nice
author: Keriena T.

description: The best cookies in the city! It's a bit far for me, but definitely always worth the drive, especially when I get that sweet tooth. Try getting here when they open, before all the cookies sell out! My favorites are the chocolate chip, toffee, cookies n' cream, and dark chocolate. Yum!!!
author: Monica-Leah A.

description:
When you're hungry in between lunch/dinner time, so you get a cookie at Anthony's as a snack. You would think that anything would taste good when you're hungry...

I had the oatmeal cookies ($1.75 for one) which turn out to be not as tasty as other places that I had tried. Even local grocery store bought one tasted even better. I also tried the white chocolate chip which was slightly better. 

All in all, decent cookies but definitely not the best. I would not go out of my ways for these cookies...
author: Owie N.

description:
OMFG. I dream about these cookies. I'm totally serious. They are what cookie lovers dreams are made of. 

The BFF (best foodie friend), Yelp bestie, lover of food, and all around cool chick (when and why did we start putting labels on EVERYTHING and EVERYONE?!) told me about these when I asked her for some SF recs. She had only tried the choco chip ones and said they were worth the hassle. I trust her tastebuds, so off I went. 

Upon arrival, I KNEW it would be good. Why? It's just a small shop with one register selling nothing but cookies. Yup, JUST COOKIES! Well, milk and coffee too, but those don't count, darn it. And the smell, lordy lord the smell. Cookie heaven! Many varieties and diff ones each day. There's a list on the wall of which cookies and sizes of said cookies are available for the day. Choose wisely!

I ordered a dozen with a mix of choco chip, cookies and cream, toffee chip, and white choco chip. After receiving my nicely packed box I sat down to try one and immediately got up to order another dozen. I'm a glutton, but one who loves to share good finds with friends! They weren't ALL for me ;p 

Choco Chip: Delicious! The "one ounce" smaller sized cookie was perfect in size, taste, and texture. Best in the west and small enough so you don't feel too guilty after devouring it. Who doesn't love choco chip cookies?! Tied for my second fav at this shop!

Cookies and Cream: My fav of the bunch. Ugh. I die. SorryNOTsorry, my new "blonder" hair got me thinking, speaking, and acting like a basic b*tch. Whatevs! Creamy, chewy, and not TOO sweet. I'm craving these as I type. Le sigh. Anyone going to SF soon? Bring me some cookies please, I'll be your best friend, sister, lover, wait... Scratch that last one! No. No. No. We can be friends tho, right ;)

Toffee Chip: Crunchy bits between chewy cookie bites. A tie for second fav. I love toffee, but only in small doses cuz it's usually too sweet. These cookies however were fantastic! Anyone else hate those small bits of toffee that get stuck on your molars tho? I'm always shoving my tongue back there to "flick" it off. Wait, that don't sound right. Hehe. Don't mind me. 

White Choco: Too sweet. I knew they would be. Texture was on point (or "on fleek" as the young kids say) like the rest tho. I'm sure the "on fleek" kids would love these cuz kids love sweet things (thangs? What's the diff? Someone explain it please. Lol) right? 

If you live near here, I hate you! Please send cookies... Pretty please?! Kidding, sorta ;p
author: Grace C.

description: Found this place on yelped and picked up some chocolate chip cooked and they were delicious! They were crunchy and moist and had the perfect texture. Definitely would come back to the city for these cookies. Unfortunately I didn't get to take photos of the cookies.
author: Koger V.

description:
Oh my good gracious how did I not know this was here before I went looking for the best cookies around my neighborhood???

I wanted to treat a co-worker to some cookies since she won a little pool at the office on a project we were working on. So I wanted to get some freshly baked chocolate chip cookies. I googled something like "best chocolate chip cookies in San Francisco" and found Anthony's. 

They are simply perfect. The perfect amount of crunch with the perfect balance of gooey. Plus, a wide variety of flavors! They even have a dark chocolate chip cookie! Dark chocolate chips!

I love these cookies. I could eat them by the dozen!
author: Brent D.

description:
These cookies are perfection! They are chewy and extremely addicting! Must try the cookies and cream. It isn't overpowering or overly sweet. Even a few days later, the cookies still tastes the same and do not get hard or stale. 

I got them as a gift and didn't realize how crazy good they were until I had a bite, and another, and another....I couldn't stop! I doubt you will be able to as well.
author: Tracy N.

description: Sooo incredibly tasty! Semi sweet chocolate chip cookies to die for! I'm ultra picky - what can I say, I'm a San Franciscan who loves quality food & treats. I usually get Anthony's cookies at Rainbow for just under $3 per cookie, so this place is a deal! And they're made fresh throughout the day. I'm addicted :-)
author: Kim W.

description: This place cannot be beat for freshly baked awesome cookies. They are the best, anywhere. It's not hype. They are that good. Cookie types change daily. Check online or check the board for posted specials. Try the cold brew coffee, it's delicious.
author: Mosey S.

description:
Jeez, I spent over $50 on cookies....yolo, amirite???

I bookmarked this place and wanted to bring goodies back home.  The cookies were $1.75 a piece.  I guess I bought over 30....

They were pretty good and I guess worth trying.  The cookie I really wanted to try was the cookies and cream one.  I couldn't really taste the cookies and cream-ness but it gave me ideas of how I'd make my version of a cookies and cream cookies.


What I like most was that the bakers were blasting east coast hip hop...lol...(Jay-Z)...lulz

#Brooklyn

(Waits for hate mail...lol)
author: Ming T.

description: Fresh tasting cookies, even when purchased in the afternoon and eaten hours later. They offer a discount for bulk purchasing. Oatmeal raisin was better than most oatmeal raisins. The toffee, chocolate chip, and snickerdoodle were my favorites. Cookies and cream I would've expected would be my favorite, but it was a little "one note" and too sweet. Interesting combo though, to have the Oreos crumbled in!
author: Christina G.

description: Not that it needs another amazing review, but this is one of my favorites in the city!  I really like the Oatmeal Raisin, but will settle for some fresh Oatmeal Chocolate, which I feel like is always fresh! Everyone loves the Cookies and Cream, especially my husband! I've even purchased a box for the nurses at St. Luke's when i haf my baby 4 years ago. They were in heaven and so thankful that we got them this treat! My brother and our friends make this our go-to every Pokemon Connunity Day! (Dorky, I know. But my daughter wouldn't have it any other way) Yes, $2 is a lot but you have to decide if you can live without having these cookies. We couldn't.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
The best cookies I've ever had

Must haves:
- cookies and creme
- white chocolate 
- toffee chip 
- actually everything else too
author: Emily L.

description: Got one of the 1oz cookies - cookies and cream flavor. It was really good and chewy but it sucked how they only took cash. Could only get one tiny cookie.
author: Mira B.

description: Owners are friendly and cookies are delicious, what more can you ask for! Kind of pricy as it's two bucks for a small cookie
author: T R.

description:
What's with the hype? Are the cookies good? Sure, I guess. Are they maybe better than what else we have in the city? Maybe.... I didn't really find anything to separate them away from something like a Mrs. Fields and they are nothing close to the beloved Insomnia Cookies so I'm scratching my head as to why there is some sort of hype train here. 

That said it's not like they are bad; I just wouldn't travel (as I did) across the city for them.
author: Leo I.

description: Ok for dieters because the cookies are tiny. It's a clean spot & they've many options. However don't expect any sugar free or infinite options. Good but really sweet.
author: R C.

description:
The cookies do taste good, but I don't really see what makes them special. They sell very classic flavors. The selection stays true to the traditional idea of a cookie, which I respect. My taste buds can't discern how these cookies are unique to any other butter, flour, + sugar concoction. 
Also, the cookies are on the pricey side for their size. 
A 1 oz., or a palm-sized cookie, costs $1.75, and the 2 oz. is $3.50
The Coffee cookie, made w/ Four Barrel, is $2. It did have a good coffee flavor and a nice chewy texture, but definitely steep for the size.
I do appreciate that the cookies are baked fresh, but for the price, you would expect that. It's a nice place to stop by if you are in the area craving milk & cookies.
author: Joy W.

description:
One of my coworkers got a box of cookies from Anthony's on Friday, May 6th. Since it was a huge box, she shared her treats with everyone in the office.

I decided to try the Cinnamon Spice Cookie. It was soft and chewy with just the right balance of cinnamon and sugar. I adore cookies like ginger molasses, gingerbread, etc, so this cookie was right up my alley. I also love soft, chewy cookies, so this had the perfect texture. The cookie is also a good size. Not too big, not too small. Perfect as my after lunch dessert.

Writing this review makes me want another cookie. Maybe I'll come back and get my own box of cookies one day.
author: Elena N.

description: If you are in SF, this is the place to go. They bake the best cookies -crunchy & crispy on the outside & chewy on the inside. The cookies are baked fresh daily and the staff is welcoming. If you are not sure what cookies you want (because you will want more than one), ask for a sample of whichever! Parking may be a bit hard to find but it is definitely with it. The store is clean and the color patterns they use remind me of a hip cafe. The cookies & cream is a must! But whatever you decide, you will not be disappointed.
author: Janine C.

description:
Not worth the hype!  I sampled the Oatmeal Raisin Cookies and it was way too sweet.

I purchased the Toffee, Chocolate Chip and Chocolate Chip with Walnuts.  For $29.60/lb ($1.85/oz x 16)......I expected really great cookies.  They're not.  They're just alright.

They're like grocery store cookies.  Not worth the price. Not worth the drive.  Not worth the hype for sure.

I'm just being honest.

2 stars because the place looked clean, the folks were friendly and the store looked nice.  But it was empty @4pm on a Wednesday.  The other star because they're a small business and I'm sure they have heir fans.  I'm just not going to be one of them.

I'm really critical because I myself bake and cook and I just have higher standards I suppose.

The cookies also didn't look as appetizing.  They were flat and a little over baked.  I would say Hot Cookies is way better when it comes to flavor, mouth feel and overall appeal.
author: Ivy M.

description:
Really good cookies. Staff is super friendly and nice. 

Expensive if you buy a dozen or more. You could make them for much less yourself but then again you are buying them for convenience.
author: Kathy J.

description: This place has the BEST cookies! My favorites include cinnamon spice and walnut chocolate chip.
author: Jacqui C.

description:
I'm actually fairly surprised at how high ratings this place gets. I came here one time mid to late afternoon, and unfortunately they were sold out of a lot of their cookies. I ended up getting the chocolate chip walnut and the toffee chip, both of which were just ok. A little overpriced, but nothing too crazy (it's as upscale as cookie places can get). 

My biggest complaint was that the cookies, while made fresh, were not warm. I feel like they would have tasted so much better warm. I don't  think I'd come back here. Again, nothing special. I wouldn't come out of my way to come here. Maybe fun to experience once because they are famous.
author: Trusha S.

description:
I'm a chocolate chip cookie purist and I didn't think I'd ever find something I love more than chocolate chip. But, Anthony's has dethroned my beloved chocolate chip with cookies & cream!

The texture/size of the cookies here are perfect! The cookies are about the size of your palm and they aren't too crispy or too chewy. The cookies are so perfect that it makes me feel like machines make them but it looks like real people back there! 

So, what's so good about this cookies & cream cookie? Well, if you're like me, I prefer the oreo cookie to the creme filling. The cookies & cream cookie takes a cue from the oreo cookie itself so it's less sweet. I can't even articulate how awesome this cookie is. Just go try it!
author: Tiffany H.

description:
At first glance, I almost missed Anthony's Cookies thinking they were closed. But the front door remains shut to "maintain the freshness of the cookies". Upon walking in, the bakery was smaller than expected, but there were trays and trays full of freshly baked cookies stacked high in the kitchen. Counters decorated with many Straus milk bottles, I couldn't help but wonder what it'd be like during an earthquake...

To me, baked cookies are like salads and chicken dishes at restaurants - why would I buy something I can make so easily myself at home for a fraction of the price? I'm no cookie snob, but THE BEST texture and consistency for a cookie is a crispy, almost airy circumference and a soft, chewy, and very moist middle. Anthony's Cookies fit my ideal cookie description perfectly, but for a whomping $1.75 per piece, I restricted myself to purchasing only six flavors - cookies and cream, chocolate chip, dark chocolate chip, double dark chocolate chip, toffee chip, and cinnamon sugar.

Everyone raves about the cookies and cream, and I must admit, it was one of my favorites too. Other standouts were the toffee chip, which was sweet and delicious, and the cinnamon, which was very fragrant but not too strong.

The cookies were very fresh, and quality ingredients were used. Most flavors are offered in two sizes: 1 oz or 2 oz.

Were Anthony's Cookies delicious? Yes. But absolutely mind-blowing? Not so much. I would return if I'm already in the neighborhood, but I wouldn't travel across the city for cookies.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Cookies are FANTASTIC. Actually went back for seconds. Loved the Cookies and Cream, Dark Chocolate Chip and Toffee. Only thing I'd change is the service. The woman at the register had zero personality and wasn't very friendly. She seemed miserable.
author: Nicole K.

description: The cookies are so tasty!! just typing this review is making me drool. love the dark chocolate. Its a must go in the mission!
author: Alf D.

description: Always freshly baked and made. Their bakery may look small from the outside, but it is very spacious inside.  It is preferred you call before to make sure they have the cookies you want because they do run out pretty quickly of their best-sellers. Customer service was pretty fast and attentive. Anthony's offers samples. The price of cookies ranges from $1.85-$2.00 each. Now, stop reading this and head over to Anthony's.
author: Monica Colleen D.

description: Who said milk and cookies are only for children. This place is good for it and it always has a line. They also sometimes run out of stuff too so make sure you go early :P
author: Kevin L.

description: Solid cookies. I have a weakness for Chocolate chip cookies and Anthony's chocolate chip cookies were great.
author: Robin H.

description:
Every time I come to San Francisco, I like to stop by Anthony's Cookies and pick up a batch of their delicious cookies to take back home with me. They are amazing! The Mission District has so many hidden gems, but if there is something that you need to take home with you or gift to your wife from a San Francisco business trip, this has to be the place. Their variety of cookie selection is second to none, which flavors like Classic Chocolate Chip, Dark Chocolate Chip, Peanut Butter, Cookies & Cream, Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin, Toffee Chip, and my personal favorite, Double Dark Chocolate. I especially love that they sell milk by the glass bottle here. Even though I'm lactose intolerant, I imagine it makes the cookies that much more enjoyable if you want to eat them on the spot. The service is also super friendly and serves you efficiently to keep the lines moving fast.

Do yourself a favor and stop by Anthony's Cookies. Pick up a dozen and tell me what you think. I guarantee you won't regret it!
author: Steve N.

description:
COOKIES AND CREAM. I literally go there and clear them out every time I'm in sf. It's so worth the high price tag for a small cookie. I've tried to replicate these cookies at home and I simply can't. The texture is so soft and chewy. The flavor profile is damn good. Who would have thought an Oreo flavored cookie.... Come early. Flavors run out quickly bc people like me buy everything. 

Best cookie I have ever had. Ever. Ever ever.
author: Tracy V.

description: Its ok. Came in on a Sunday morning. Dude behind the counter hated to be there. He's a piece of crap. Hope he's not one of cookie maker.
author: Jorge K.

description: Really overhyped cookie joint. Ive definitely had better cookies at places. I would've liked to try the more abstract special flavors but they didn't have any left around 1PM when I went. Just got the chocolate chip, dark chocolate chip, chocolate walnut and the cookies and cream cookie. All were really basic and nothing like the hype this place has been getting. The place itself was really clean and good looking on the interior but its easy to miss from its exterior. Its on Valencia a little bit down from Clooney's bar and its pretty easy to miss because its signage doesn't really pop out. If you have a cookie fixing you can definitely scratch that itch by coming here but I wouldn't go out of your way for it.
author: Navdeep D.

description: We drive all the way from San Jose just to have these cookies! These cookies are HELLA GOOD! Toffee Nut, Cookies & Cream, Chocolate Chip with some milk, I highly recommend! Thank you Anthony's Cookies
author: Trish B.

description: Toffee chip cookie and cold brew coffee on a beautiful summer day. They have several other flavors that I have tried that are also delicious. I would also recommend the cookies and cream flavor.
author: Richard L.

description:
Errrmmm, yeah. These cookies were good, but I wasn't blown away or anything.

In order of favorites:
Cinnamon spice
Dark chocolate chip
German chocolate
Toffee chip
Cookies and cream
White chocolate chip

I don't know, but I kind of didn't get it. Like what is the deal with all of the hype? None of the cookies except cinnamon spice tasted particularly like the flavor they were supposed to be. Like I'm not sure how dark chocolate chip tasted different from chocolate chip, even if both were good.

I really liked the menu though where you could easily see what flavors are available for the day. Normal cookie for $1.75, bigger cookie for $3.50.
author: Alice T.

description: Great cookies at $.75 5 years ago. $2 today not so much...inflation has increased at 1.9% per year. Not sure why cookies are well north of 100%
author: Rob L.

description:
These just might be the BEST cookies in the world. They are crisp to perfection you'd think its fried but no! They are baked, possibly baked in heaven. 

My favorite is  the dark chocolate chip: semi-sweet, crunchy and chewy all at the same time. CLASSIC. Other favorites include: TOFFEE, OREO, and yes... even OATMEAL RAISIN. My least favorite cookie in the outside world, but Anthony's spin on it makes it a cookie I can easily eat over and over again.
author: Caye Q.

description:
If I were to choose anything to bring back home to SoCal.. It's gotta be Anthony's Cookies hands down!

Came here pretty late, probably an hour before they were going to close? Thankfully they still had a good couple of cookies left! Enough to fill out a box & to still give out samples!

COOKIES: They have such a good variety from their usuals like Chocolate Chip, Toffee Chip, & Cinnamon Spice. To specials such as Walnut Chocolate Chip, Candied Pecan, and Cinnamon Spice w/ dark chocolate! My favorite one that made me buy all that was remaining was toffee chip! So do try that one.. You're welcome!

Heads up:

- Flavors get pretty limited past 8:30! So if you want access to all the yummy flavors, come early!
author: Julienne D.

description: So I went later on in the day. That might have been the issue but half the cookies I wanted they had no more. On this day in particular they weren't excepting cards so I had to go all the way to a bank for cash because it's only were excepting, system was down. The cookies were good not as chewy and moist as I thought they'd be. Their premium cookies might be much better but they had none that day. My suggestion go early on in the day when they're fresh and plentiful
author: Mondo V.

description: Cookies tasted like the cookies i bake at home from a premix. I tried the chocolate chip and cookies and cream.
author: David V.

description:
I'd rate these a 3.5 but i'll give them the benefit of the doubt.

I ordered a half dozen for about $10 give or take. These cookies weren't as good as I expected. I've had some pretty good cookies such as Levain bakery cookies, but these didn't hit the spot for me.

Chocolate Chip Walnut: 3.5/5
Toffee Chip: 3.5/5 
Cookies & Creme: 3.5/5
Dark Chocolate: 3.5

The taste of all of these cookies were good but it's he texture that bothered me. I like my cookies soft but a little crispy but these were on the harder side. They weren't as soft as I would've liked. They crumbled and broke very easily. I wouldn't go out of my way to buy these cookies, they're just average cookies.

Location isn't that bad, but definitely when there's traffic I can imagine how long it would take to get here.

Parking is street parking as it is in most places in San Francisco.
author: Jenny L.

description:
For over a decade now I've been enjoying these delectable little morsels.  Every time I'm in the city I make sure I stop in.  One dozen for me, one dozen to take home and share with others.  Anthony is very humble and genuine you'd never know he was the mastermind behind it all, met him on various trips to his cookie shop over the years (: 

....don't forget the milk
author: christi b.

description: Love both the Berkeley & San Francisco locations. Cookies are chewy, flavorful and a good price. Tiny amount of seating if you want to eat there. Staff always very friendly. Parking is eh.
author: Chayla G.

description:
Great fresh baked cookies, nice variety that changes slightly every couple of weeks.  Customer service is lacking though.  Takes a while to get your cookies boxed up and ready to go.  Last visit I picked up a dozen cookies and waited for what seemed a long time while the person who worked there completed the transaction.

It kinda went like this...  Boxing up cookies, tying ribbon on box, putting sticker on box, chatting with co-employee, ringing register, forgetting what the cookies cost, scratching head, etc. I'm betting that during my last visit, it wasn't only the cookies that were baked all the way... knowwhatimean?
author: Richard A.

description:
Whenever I go to San Francisco, I have to come here to get cookies! They have the best cookies, super chewy in the middle and a little crispy on the outside - the perfect classic cookie.

I give this place 5 stars for the cookie and flavor but 4 stars for the size of the cookie. For $1.85/cookie, you would expect the cookie to be a little larger but these cookies are pretty small for the price. 

My favorite cookie here is the toffee chip, it's extremely moist and when it's broken apart, you can see the string of toffee! I bought two dozen cookies here, now I can't wait to get home and share them with my family & friends!
author: Jennifer N.

description: Best cookies in the world! I don't say that lightly too - I consider myself a cookie connoisseur. I love that they have gluten free chocolate chip cookies. I can't wait till they have more flavors for gluten free! And Anthony is a delight. Such a sweetheart and has so much passion for baking cookies.
author: Sarah S.

description: I have to agree with some of the reviewers.  The cookies are good, but I am not going to go out of my way to get one.  I was in the neighborhood so I decided to check them out.  Service was super slow, there was only one woman in front of us buying a few cookies, but the girl at the register took FOREVER to check her out.  I was so close to just walk out.  The person who came in after me ended up leaving.
author: Marisa S.

description:
Nice people.
Good cookie.

But I still prefer hot cookies better :)
author: Candice L.

description:
Some good ASS cookies!!! Especially the cookies and cream... These cookies are orgasmic in your mouth. Makes your tongue so happy and then the belly so happy. 

I will say finally the cookies got bigger. Before the cookies were so small and so not worth the cost. I can say now it's kinda worth the cost but still needs to be bigger or less the cost. The cookies are great here. So if your ever in this part of San Francisco try the cookies and cream. You won't be disappointed.
author: Kat T.

description: Pretty good Cookies and Cream cookie. Not good enough to justify its price but I mean I think any old cookie is pretty good. So this place is just ok, not a bad thing though.
author: Lilian K.

description:
The cookies here are SO good! They have the perfect combination of crunchy and chewy. They're excellently simple and I think that's what sets Anthony's Cookies apart from the rest.

I tried the cookies n cream cookies and they were delicious. Unfortunately, I didn't buy milk because I took them to go and I wasn't sure if I could keep the milk cold, but I wish I could have! The cookies taste like they're milk's favorite cookies-- watch out Oreos!

The ambiance of the shop is so cool too. It's very modern but cozy. I feel like it's the kind of store I'd find in Manhattan. The staff members are friendly and were really helpful in my decisions on which flavors to get. I was really indifferent since I didn't know what was good and what not, but what I bought ended up being great. Thanks guys!
author: Julie Ann D.

description:
Anthony's, you have ruined me for all the other cookie places. Nowhere else compares to you. I've tried searching high and low for some place that could satisfy my cravings, but nothing compares.

Cookies and cream cookie is the greatest thing that ever graced this planet. The toffee one is a close second. Cookies are the best of the soft and chewy, yet crispy combo. 

Price is a little steep per cookie, but look, once you have the best, you'll never want to settle for less. (Treat yo self) Best served with milk, but even without a glass I would devour a whole box.

 Can someone deliver me a box now, please?
author: Cindy D.

description: They had a great variety of cookies. We got a chocolate chip, chocolate chip walnut, cinnamon spice and cookies and cream cookie and they all had a great flavor!
author: Courtney L.

description: The cookies here are fine. I mean, they're cookies. You can taste that they're pretty high-quality ingredients. But there's no wow factor. I tried the dark chocolate chip and the double chocolate, and I was surprised by how I couldn't get a clear taste of the chocolate chips, while the dough part of the cookie tasted aggressively unremarkable.
