For this kind of taste (and size--they were so small for a specialty cookie place!), these cookies are overpriced. I would have preferred to have just gotten a package of chewy Chips Ahoy. Overall I think this place is overhyped.
author: Janet L.

description:
Love the chocolate chip and toffee chip cookies here! Can get a little pricey when you realize you've bought over a dozen ($1.75 each), so not sure if I'd continue making the trip out to keep buying more. They sometimes run out if you visit near the end of the day, so make sure to get there early to get the flavor(s) you want!

Space is small so not much room to sit and enjoy your cookie(s). Would probably stop by if it was convenient or on my way and buy a ton to indulge at home.
author: Megan K.

description:
I love their cookies! Especially their chocolate chip and cookies and creme. Those two are my favorite! 

I really like them when they are warm, so I would just microwave them for a few seconds. The chocolate would just melt and ooze into my mouth. 

A little on the pricier side for cookies. Bought 8 cookies for $22.50. Each 1 oz cookie is $1.50 and 2 oz cookies are $3. Still worth trying and buying again. They have a range of different cookies that everyone of all ages can enjoy.
author: Stephy L.

description: Best Cookies in AMERICA! Dont Argue... just get there. Super soft, extra tasty. You can tell that they put a lot of love into what they do.
author: Rob G.

description: These are some delicious cookies and Anthony is very humble and nice guy.  You can definitely tell these cookies are made with love!  I buy dozens for my office and clients and they can't get enough of them!  Dark chocolate chip is my favorite but they're all so tasty!  This place is a must visit!
author: Julian C.

description:
Anthony's Cookies has the best cookies in the world, no contest!

Their cookies are baked with only the best ingredients and are made fresh every day.  It's hard to decide how many of each we want to buy every time we visit - we want to stick to our favorites, but try some of their new/seasonal cookies at the same time. The answer to that probably is to keep coming back, obviously.

Best-selling cookies include the Cookies & Cream cookie (the owner once told me it took them 10 years to perfect the Cookies & Cream recipe) and their classic Chocolate Chip cookie. My fiancé and I are also huge fans of their Oatmeal Raisin, Toffee Chip, Cinnamon Spice, and Peanut Butter cookies. 

Be sure to show up earlier in the day if you want to secure your faves - these cookies sell out fast. Anthony's Cookies is worth every minute it takes for us to find parking in the neighborhood, just to get a box of their delicious, freshly baked cookies.
author: Audrey L.

description:
One word: amazing.

Apparently yelp won't just let me post the above lol. If I had to choose one cookie it'd be Cookies and Cream.
author: Jul C.

description: Best cookies in San Francisco, period. The quality and taste of the cookies are unmatched. Anthony has been at the shop each time I've gone and he's a delightful person to talk to.
author: Edo C.

description:
Got there around closing time and they only had 1 type of cookie left (chocolate chocolate chip fudge) and had them at a discount. I bought all that was left, 1/2 a dozen. I asked myself, why did I buy 6 cookies when I have never tried these and don't know what to expect? Well, good thing I listened to Yelp reviews because these cookies were amazing. It had a lot of flavor bursting out of every bite. It was soft, but not too soft, almost felt like eating a brownie in cookie form. All 6 cookies were devoured within 3 hours. 

Gourmet cookies at gourmet prices, but worth it!
author: Andrew S.

description: Wow this place really does have the best cookies in San Francisco!! The outside of the store is kind of hidden, I didn't even know I walked by it. When I went in it smelled delicious and their were two samples out to try. The staff was really really nice and let me know the most popular cookies. I ended up getting 2 cookies and cream, 2 chocolate chip, and one cinnamon cookie. They are so good!!! Perfect taste and texture, everything you want in a cookie. I want to go back when they have the peanut butter cookies and coffee cookies in stock. I will definitely be back whenever I am in the mission!
author: Hayley D.

description:
Something to note - these are the best cookies in San Francisco. (NYC still wins the cookie game though. This review is on a scale of normal cookies. Don't come in expecting something from Levain.)

When you walk in AC, you are hit with this warm front of delicious cookies. It's like you've been transported into a loving grandmother's kitchen if she had the cookie creativity of Julia Child. It's a must stop if you're in the Mission and craving something sweet. 

Low down on the cookies:
1. They are a balance between an outer crunch and chewy center. A wonderfully delicious balance.
2. Cookies & Cream is a must.
3. Cinnamon spice with dark chocolate on the menu? Yeah, get it.
4. Friendly staff.

My only question now is: for a Mission Dolores picnic, are burritos, Bi-Rite, and these cookies going to be doin too much?
author: Kathryn T.

description: I heard this place was the place to go to for the BEST cookies in the Bay Area. At least that's what I heard in the past... Well... I went at 4:00pm on a Thursday (last week) with one of my friends and two kids. We got three different flavors: dark chocolate, white chocolate and cookie cream. Unanimously we all found that the cookies were really hard, and they tasted "okay"... The kids (who usually are pretty easy with sweet treats) didn't want to eat them... I mean I imagined them being soft, tender, and a little bit thicker.. Very disappointing :(
author: Looblue L.

description: Perfection!  Just the right level of softness and chewiness; not too sweet; and just the right portion size to feed the sugar craving.
author: Judy H.

description:
I would give 3.5 stars if i could.   These aren't the best cookies I ever had, and I was able to easily stop after one cookie, which means it was good, it was satisfying but not among the best.     

Place would be much improved with a wider and fresher selection of milk.
author: Rachel L.

description: Exceptional cookies! Tried couple at the Mill. Nutty, melty, chocolaty. Everything cookie should be.
author: Irina B.

description:
Who's Anthony? The man of my dreams!

I don't know who bakes back there, but there's magic in these cookies. Food is directly connected to my emotions, and when I think about these cookies, I can't help but smile. The chocolate chip is a combination of lightly crisp on the outside and moist on the inside with melted chips. It's not too sweet either! One cookie is the perfect amount for me, but I can see why people go in always ordering a dozen.

Flavors are first come first serve. And as you can imagine, chocolate chip sells out by the end of the day. I recommend going in early to get first dibs!

Also, I love that the employees stamp their names on the cookie bag. Makes the cookie feel so much more personal.
author: Nitar L.

description: My favorite cookie place, ever. Their toffee chip cookie is amazing, and I wish they didn't run out as often as they did because I can't always make it here early enough. Their cookies are on the pricey side but are a worthy splurge!! I always get the smaller cookies because there are more edges. Occasionally (uh, most of the time), when my eyes are too big for my stomach, I buy way too many BUT I've come to realize that if you freeze them and then defrost and eat, they are still really yummy. This is both bad AND good for me!!
author: Lily C.

description: These cookies are soooo freaking delicious , I got a dozen of cookies all of them was very good but my favorite was the chocolate chip walnut best cookie ever !!!
author: Dejsha B.

description: Cookies here are soo good! I love their toffee chip and their cookies and cream! They are a bit pricey for cookies, but if you ever catch them with their $5 boxes (day old cookies) on the side then you should definitely grab a box or two! Lines could be long, but they move fast.
author: Lisa H.

description: So happy that Anthony's has a GF cookie option: The GF Chocolate Chip. Pretty tiny for 2 dollari, but biting into it! Delizioso! The ratio of chocolate chips to cookie was perfect. Buttery, melty, just yum!
author: Charlene N.

description:
Came here for the first time over the weekend when visiting the city with some friends.  It's in a cute little neighborhood and the little shops that line the street are really cute.  The staff was super friendly when we walked in and they were very quick in serving everyone. 

We got there and they had a good selection of cookies. I got chocolate chip, cookies and cream, and the German chocolate cake cookies for my family.  The cookies themselves were crunchy on the outside and softer in the middle, not really my preference but they had pretty good flavor.  The chocolate chip was my favorite of the bunch. 

I would say the only drawbacks are that there is only 1 table to inside can get a little crowded when there are a lot of people inside and when we were there their wifi was down so they were cash only.  We got there and had to go find an ATM because we expecting to pay by credit card.
author: Allie E.

description: If you like eggy cookies, but who does, then this is the place for you. The cookies here are just okay
author: Jade L.

description: WOW. Just wowow. Thank you, Anthony, for the delicious cookies and chill vibe! Perfect sweetness, chewiness, saltiness, balanced cookie.
author: Lin L.

description:
One of my fave bakeries in the city! I first had Anthonys when my friend brought me a box and after that I was hooked. I always go for the cookies and cream cookies (AMAZING). 

The shop is a long narrow shop with a bench for seats. Other than that there's not much else inside. Cookies get sold out quickly so be sure to go early in day if you have a favorite. The cookies here are large and worth the price. They are moist but not too soft and have a good crunch. 

The service is great and the staff friendly. They usually have samples on a tray but you can always ask to sample another cookie.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
tl;dr: They're good cookies, but not life-changing IMO. My favorite were the toffee chip & german chocolate. They serve it to you off the baking sheets so you know they're fresh!

Random observations:
* They have two kind of cookies, flat cookies (thin and crispy) and mound cookies (soft and chewy)
* There are seasonal cookies that aren't available every day and daily cookies that are available (until they sell out of course)
* Cookies are expensive! At the time of the review they were $1.75 (they are also 1oz in weight each)

Tried (and stack ranked from best to worst -- none were bad, but not as great):

German chocolate: One of the mound cookies and it was incredible! Soft and chewy and filled with cocoa, coconut and chocolate. A tough combination to beat.

Toffee chip: One of the flat cookies. A little crispy on the outside but the middle was chewy and deliciously caramelized with toffee. It was a subtle sweetness that felt right.

Cookies and cream: Another flat cookie that was oreo-like in taste but with the chewiness of a chocolate chip dough. Honestly I wasn't very impressed with this and thought it was a bit dry.

Candied pecan and chocolate chip: A mound cookies that was chewy and nutty. The chocolate chips didn't add to the experience but the candied pecans were yum!

Chocolate chip: A staple cookie that I get everywhere because it really speaks to how well the cookie dough is. Unimpressive as I thought the chocolate chips and the dough were separate entities and didn't fit well together. It was sweet and chewy but nothing spectacular. 

White chocolate: The white chocolate chips were small and felt separated from the overall cookie. Just tasted like a sweet cookie with bits of creaminess mixed in. Not impressed

Cinnamon spice: The closest they have to a snickerdoodle. The sweetness and cinnamon flavor was overpowering so I wasn't a fan but that's probably just personal taste
author: Carrie X.

description: These are like THE best cookies!! Especially the cookies and creme one - I could eat them all the time, it's a good thing I don't or I'd be getting them gainsss.
author: Jeana Y.

description:
THE BEST COOKIES I'VE EVER HAD! 

Anthony's Cookies is one of the best cookie shops around, and many people won't understand why until you try one. My first experience with Anthony's Cookies was when my boyfriend brought some home one day. Without knowing where or what kind of cookie it was, I took a bite and fell in love! Ever since, I make sure to come here EVERY time in the area (is that a little too obsessive? who cares!). They have a variety of many many flavors, but do make sure to come here early if you can because they do run out. The workers are super nice and great to have a small conversation with as they get your orders and package your cookies. My favorite cookies would be the Cookies and Cream & Toffee!
author: Victoria K.

description: Great tasting cookies just a little expensive. Parking is difficult which is normal for that area. Don't alway have my favorite available but they do have a good selection.
author: Kirk K.

description: I was expecting incredible cookies, but was a little let down. I tried the cinnamon and the coffee cookie. They were both good, don't get me wrong, but not the best I've ever had. Wish they were a bit softer. And for the price? Nahhh. I paid $2 for the coffee cookie and $1.85 for the cinnamon. That's a bit steep, especially considering their size. One of my fave cookie places in San Mateo (Antonie's Cookies, funny how similar the names are right?!) charges $1.40 per plus the cookie is bigger, and they offer 1/2 dozen day olds for $5.
author: Lexi R.

description: Cookies were good, though maybe a bit sweet. Also, kinda pricey (1.75) for each one, but it's SF so what can ya do? Toffee chip was really good, though.
author: Ruobin W.

description: The best cookie is the BAY AREA and maybe event WORLD. The cookie and cream cookie is moist and mouth watering. I've been coming here for the past 6-7 years. I usually buy a dozen and give it as a gift to friends and family visiting the Bay Area.
author: Freddie V.

description:
Oh wow! Oh wow! Oh wow!

What awesome cookies!!! Ordered the following, and they were all "hella" good! LOL. The texture and consistency is perfect. The flavors are amazing. And fresh!!!

Classic chocolate chip
Walnut double chocolate
Cinnamon dark chocolate

Thank you for putting up that fridge of milks. That probably helped make the cookies taste amazing.

The milk bottle display was very cool.

There is a large communal table available.

Take-out, obviously is available and highly recommended!! So you can have one on the way home, and another one WHEN you get home!

Parking.... Ugh. We're in SF. We walked here from Mission Pie. Which wasn't that bad a walk actually. Also, it was a good thing we walked because the store front blends perfectly well with the rest of the units in the block. Which I kinda like. Doesn't stick out like a sore thumb.
author: Kislev A.

description: SO YUMMY!! If you have a sweet tooth like me and looovvvee cookies this is the spot for you . Fresh baked everytime with the right crunch on the outside. My fav is cookies and cream !! I would've gave them 5 stars  but they are a little pricey for a small cookie but im a cookie monster and didn't mind buying a box today!
author: Mimi S.

description: Cookies and cream cookie was good but I wish it were warm. Tried the cinnamon sugar cookie and that was so delicious. I wish I had ordered more variety but the fiancé told me they were known for their cookies and cream ones.
author: Jen C.

description: The cookies were good, but would've tasted so much better if they were warmed up, and they said they couldn't. Did not live up to the hype.
author: Joel P.

description: Can I leave more than 5 stars? Let me tell you, I am not a sweets person, nor do I crave cookies. HOWEVER, I crave these cookies every week .. I know it's bad but these cookies are the bomb.com, they melt my heart because they are super delicious. They just bring you in, located in the mission, it's perfect. I absolutely love the toffee one, and the white chocolate one. I also got the milk that they were selling and it was actually pretty good. I didn't like that cream thing that was on top of it, so just drain it out. Overall, I love it! (inexpensive for a great ass cookie!)
author: Katie L.

description:
Average cookie....for steep price. ..helpful server.

Cute clean business....

Purchased a few different cookies....chocolate chip, dark chocolate, and cookies & cream. Though a plain chocolate chip cookie is usually my favorite...these very unimpressive. 
BUT.....the "cookies & cream" were delicious.
author: Sharine d.

description:
Simple yet tastefully crafted cookies. 

Cookies and cream is my favorite. 

Organic local perfection.
author: Rosalyn W.

description:
I appreciate Anthony's commitment to freshness and good ingredients, that you can buy them individually so that you can try all sorts of flavors at once, and that there are even cartons of milk for sale, as if you were still in a grade school cafeteria. Otherwise, the cookies are on the smaller side and despite being reasonably scrumptious, they're simply... cookies, for me. 

Perhaps if you got them in batches as gifts for people, they'd be an extra thoughtful and special treat, but on their own, they're simply OK. Nothing that gets me terribly excited.
author: Vincent L.

description: Anthony's Cookies has the best cookies and cream cookies. It's the perfect balance of chewiness. And the slightly meta take on a cookie-flavored cookie is pretty fun too. These are probably my favorite cookies in San Francisco. Closes slightly early sometimes when the cookies sell out but worth it. The more interesting flavors seem to sell out earlier in the day too.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Not sure what's all the rave about this place. Seems like a pretty normal cookie store to me.

Don't get me wrong, the cookies are pretty good, and the wait staff are very friendly, and the decor inside is clean. The prices are also decent. But is it really 5 stars? The cookies were cold by the time they served it, and the milk is pre-packaged cartons from other manufacturers, instead of using actual cups/drinkware. There's a bench for sitting, but no seats other than that one bench. The decor isn't anything special either.

Overall, a pretty good place, but definitely nothing special. If you look at the other reviews, most people are just describing their love for cookies in general, instead of how the store is special. Perhaps people just like cookies and gives cookie stores higher ratings? Is there anything about the cookies here that would be hard to find at other places that sell cookies? Are the cookies here better than cookies at nearby bakeries? Did it defy the expectations you had before walking in to the store?

The cookies seem to taste as expected at least to me. Not sure what all the fuss is about.
author: Henry L.

description:
Could be because I came an hour before closing but the walnut cookie and cinnamon spice cookie i got was OK. for $1.85 for a small 1 oz cookie (wut?!)  I guess I was expecting it to be warm atleast.

Also - it was empty when we walked in, so it would have been nice if the lady at the counter said hello or acknowledged us.
author: Trish M.

description: Brandon told me to check the place out. So i stopped to try a cookie. I can't have chocolate right now so the only cookie i could eat was oatmeal raisin. Not my favorite but it was tasty. Had a brown sugar quality and deep taste. It was nearly $2 for the cookie and it was on the small side. This place is also cash only. For a price like that it should be double the size or maybe offer 2 cookies for the price of one.
author: Benjamin G.

description: I am not a cake fan, not a cupcake fan, and am picky about pie, BUT I am a true cookie monster.  Always on the look out for delicious cookies.  Anthony's has some great cookies. They really nail the ratio of soft to crunchy.  The inside is chewy and moist and the edges are crisp.  They also smell like butter heaven.  I love the varieties offered and could easily kill a box of them.
author: Chelsey G.

description: These cookies are AMAZING. Walnut chocolate chip and toffee chip were delicious but I dream about the cinnamon spice...so perfectly chewy. Not a cozy place to enjoy your cookie though, just one small table available and the ambience isn't cozy or warm. Seems mostly like a cookie packaging or pick up for orders type of storefront.
author: jane c.

description: Cookies and Cream are a specialty of Anthony's I have taken them to clients all over the country and to Rave responses!! They are crunchy and so flavor rich inside. Better than your standard chocolate chip. They bake fresh Everyday All Day, I always special order mine a few days ahead. Street Parking in the area is tight.  Five Stars thank you Anthony!!!
author: Lisa S.

description:
Tiny cookies for hella dollars. 

They're like Mom would make, so go have Mom make you some instead!
author: Sarah Z.

description:
Cookie Aroma For Blocks!

The little one and I were taking our own walking tour of San Francisco after having afternoon tea at  Lovejoys. The aroma of cookies filled the air and we were at least two blocks away. We asked a shop owner and she told us it was Anthony's!

The front of the house is small compared to the kitchen. When you walk in the door, you can see the entire shopnstraight through to the kitchen. 

~Cookies and Cream Cookie and Butterscotch!
These cookies are the real deal. We stood in line looking at the board and we knew right away which ones to get.  The cookies are not overly sweet. However, they are filled with hand crafted flavor that really is unique. These cookies are very reasonably priced. 

The shop also sells a few other items including milk.

This is a must stop for cookie lovers! I am a fan!
author: Nick H.

description:
Cookies tried:
Chocolate chip
Cookies and Cream
Toffee Chip
Cinnamon spice (their speciality)
Dark chocolate & cinnamon spice

1 oz. cookies are $1.50 & 2 oz. are $3

Let's note that the size of your cookie is dependent on the ingredients in it because it's by weight.

I was frankly not impressed with any of the cookies I had. They were definitely better than your store bought variety, but this place won't even crack top 10 in my books. Also, they weren't warm. :(

In hindsight, after the excitement for the cookies died down, I realized I paid 3 dollars each for  average sized slightly above average cookies. At $36 dollars a dozen, I'm pretty sure I can find a sweet granny to bake me a dozen fresh ones for cheaper.

Not. pleased.
author: Trang B.

description: If you're ever at Valencia and 25th, grab some! Price isn't too bad and the chocolate chip hits the spot. Definitely get a batch if you're having friends over
author: Rishi G.

description:
Anthony's was my last stop in a hunt for good cookies in the mission. All the way down past 25th street, it turned out that I had saved the best for last. 

They have very few items on the menu. Actually they don't have a menu, they just have cookies and some drinks. What they lack in variety though, they more than make up for in quality. 

I ordered the cinnamon, the cookies & cream, and the chocolate chip and all three were perfectly soft and chewy with delicious flavor to them.

Anthony's certainly doesn't try to reinvent the wheel with their cookies, but focuses on doing one thing and doing it reliably well. I approve of that. This will probably be my go to place for cookies and I would definitely recommend it to others.
author: Mark O.

description: I had the biggest cravings for cookies and was really glad I ended up at Anthony's! I was greeted with samples and it was love at first bite! The one I really wanted to get was the German chocolate but they just baked a fresh batch and couldn't serve the cookies while they were still warm. Sad but there were plenty of other delicious options! I had one that had coffee grounds baked into it which may be too bitter for some people but I really liked it! Also had the chocolate chip with candied pecans and they were to die for!
author: Jennie C.

description:
First time at Anthony's cookies and I can't believe I hadn't gone sooner! They've been open for 5yrs! 
As my friend and I opened the door we were hit by the delicious smell of COOKIES. That just got me super excited to try these bad boys! While in line I decided on the toffee and the uniquely popular cookies and cream. My friend got the chocolate chip... We headed to their one and only (communal) table and I had already sample one of each cookie plus I was working on trying my friends chocolate chip. All three were delicious! I walked straight to the counter and order a box to take home! 

If you ask for a sample they cut you a piece of the cookie to try (I tried the white chocolate chip, also good).

$1.50 per cookie (on the smaller side)

No extra discounts when purchasing a dozen

Shout out to the cashier Friday afternoon!!! Great customer service! Smiled and very chatty (in a good way).
I will be back!
author: Liz N.

description:
Since I'm from SoCal, I definitely had to go to Anthony's Cookies so that I could bring a dozen home! Came in the afternoon after lunch and bought a variety of cookies. Toffee nut, cookies and cream, chocolate chip, pecan, and the white chocolate. The store is relatively small, but there is plenty of room to sit. My favorite cookie is the toffee nut! Cookie has a nice crusted edge and the center of the cookie is still soft and tender. Have to admit that I ate 2 of the cookies on the flight back home. 

I will definitely be back again for some toffee nut cookies!
author: Michelle S.

description:
I love Anthony's Cookies! I get a box of their cookies every holiday season and they never disappoint. Their cookies are small, but very dense and chewy. Their cookies are always fresh and they pride themselves in never selling day old cookies. Expect their cookies to last 3 days at most, due to the fact that they don't use preservatives. 

They have a solid lineup of daily and seasonal menu items, but my favorite is their cookies & cream cookie. You can order individually or by the box. Ordering in bulk and don't feel like trekking to the Mission? They deliver with a minimum order of 9 dozen cookies for a $20 fee. They also take pre-orders for a minimum of 2 dozen cookies.
author: Helen C.

description: Great cookies! Some flavors rotate...so you should go frequently. :) Everything that I have had here is excellent!
author: Jen G.

description: anthony's cookies are the bomb.com! the best ones are chocolate chip, cookies and cream, toffee chip, and walnut chocolate chip imo. they run out of the cookies and cream one often bc it's such a hit, so grab em when you can! so worth the price
author: Sandra S.

description:
Anthony and his team have perfected the recipe to make crack cookies that are just the right amount of sweet and chewy with a good crunch when you bite into them but melts in your mouth at the end. Unlike other cookies (Mrs. Fields and some homemade ones) I don't feel like I'm gnawing into raw cookie dough at all.

I get my sweet toof fix whenever I'm in the mission and want something other than bi-rite or Mitchell's ice cream (although, bi-rite ice cream WITH an anthony's cookie is pretty bomb!!!) It is a bit pricey at $18 for a dozen, but they are certainly quality cookies that I don't mind spending some dough (ha) on.

The menu changes daily, but some of my favorites are the white chocolate chip, cookies and cream, toffee and the classic chocolate chip. A dozen can last a few days even after sharing with family, but they still taste great up to at least 3 days til they start getting a little stale. My fix to that is usually popping them in the microwave to pair with a glass of milk...mmm!
author: Georgina G.

description:
Got me feelin' that droolin' type a way.

To my fellow reviewers, you hath not failed me! Tried a variety of cookies. Here's the list:

Cookies and cream - reminded me of oreos. Ah my childhood.
Toffee chocolate - this. Is. My. Favorite. Urgh. Sweet toffee, crunchy chocolate. Heaven.
Oatmeal walnut chocolate chip - oatmeal tastes way better with some sweetness, so kudos to the chocolate walnuts.
Oatmeal raisin cookies. - basic oatmeal raisin, but the cookie itself is really yummy and crunchy, which I prefer over the soft cookies.

Each cookie is $1.25, which might seem a bit expensive, especially for the oatmeal cookies since they're smaller than the others, but the tastes definitely makes up for it.

Definitely worth coming back to. The workers are nice, and they accept card, with a $5.00 minimum. They sell drinks too, which i hope to try the next time I come back.

Funna turn me into the cookie monster whydontcha, Anthony.
author: Jerianne G.

description:
A stand alone shop that only sells cookies?  I definitely don't see that very often.

I hate to give this place a bad rating, but I really don't see what everyone else sees or tasted for that matter.  Sure there is a plethora of different flavors and yes they use quality ingredients, but at the end of the day a cookie is a cookie.  Still bad for you and chock full of sugar. I can't justify spending that much for a small  cookie that wasn't even warm right out of the oven.  I would much rather get a box of girl scout cookies or one from the Doubletree Hotel.  Sorry.
author: Truc N.

description:
There are very few shops that dedicate their menu to just cookies, and the blatant fact that Anthony's does, already says something about the quality and confidence they have in their cookies. What Anthony's does best is bring you fresh-baked, straight-from-Grandma's-kitchen  type cookies that are exactly what you'd hope for in terms of texture and taste. They're crisp and caramelized on the edge, chewy and moist in the middle, and have a distinct flavor that is representative of the name. Not too much to ask for, but you'd be surprised with how many places can't get this right! 

Honestly, many Yelpers describe Anthony's as life-changing and the "best cookies they've ever had" which in my opinion is merely sugar-coated hyperbole. They're great cookies, don't get me wrong, but they're not anything particularly special. You won't find daring combinations like Cayenne Cocoa at Hot Cookie, or Cornflake Chocolate Chip Marshmallow at Momofuku, and they don't have the wow factor of chunky Specialty's cookies. However, they do have a couple unique cookie types that bring some childhood nostalgia to the table, including Toffee Chip and Cookies 'n Cream. These two are my favorites, along with White Chocolate Chip! 

At $1.50 a pop, these little buggers are pretty pricey, considering how they fit in the palm of your hand. They cost almost as much as a macaron, and they're pretty much the same size. However, Anthony's cookies are quite delicious and I do think they're worth it every once in awhile. 

The shop is clean and simple, equipped with a large picnic style wooden bench, a fridge full of milk, and a chalk board that lists the flavors of the day. As a seasoned baker, I came in with high expectations and Anthony's came pretty close. They're a solid, reliable bakery with excellent cookies, but because of their lack of unique combos and small cookie size, I can't quite give them 5 stars. Definitely check 'em out if you haven't already though. You won't be disappointed!
author: Deanna Y.

description:
Don't hunt me down. Don't throw your cookies at me when you read this review, because we all have our own opinions.

Now I'm no cookie monster, but I will tell you that I prefer Hot Cookie or Mrs. Field's to this place.

I think they must have raised their prices because it was $1.50 per cookie.

I sampled their Cookies and Cream which was like a tougher version of an Oreo Cookie.

I bought their Chocolate chip and some nut cookie; I forgot which nut...maybe walnut? Tasted like an ordinary chocolate chip and nut cookie.

I bought their dark chocolate chip cookie, which tasted like dark chocolate chip as advertised.

I don't taste the bliss and I don't feel any joy from eating these cookies. It tasted like something my Aunt would bake.

I'm looking for something that would be better than something my Aunt or Granny would bake, and though these cookies are okay...I'm not dying to know their recipe and I'm not craving a return visit.

I'm no cookie hater. I just have my preferences.
author: Jack R.

description:
I've bookmarked this place for quite sometime and i finally got to try it when my cousin from socal wanted to get their cookies for his friend. When you first walk in, you can instantly smell the cookies so thats why they have the sign on the door that says 'please close the door to keep the freshness of the cookies.' They have different type of cookies to choose from that they listed on their chalkboard. 

Had the german chocolate (something that i never heard of) and classic chocolate chip cookie. Both cookies that i tried, It had that chewy texture and softness. It has the right among of sweetness. I thought their cookies are good, but i felt that their prices for their cookies are quite pricy. In one of the boxes that we had, there were about cookies and cost around $17. Its a cool place if you enjoy eating cookies, buy as a gift, or bring to parties
author: Julie N.

description:
How do you know you are eating a good cookie? To me, a cookie is just a cookie. What makes it so special? I never could tell what defined a good cookie, that is, until I discovered Anthony's cookies. Whoever this Anthony guy, I'd just like to say... thank you!

Holy crap these cookies are damn good. I ended up trying the oatmeal cookie, toffee, cookies and cream, and the coffee.

The two winners were the toffee and coffee. Damn those cookies are freakin' delicious. They use real blue bottle coffee for the coffee cookie. And the toffee... Perfect balance of sweetness and texture. Each cookie is about 1.50. You can get a dozen for $18.00. It is kind of pricey but definitely worth a visit. Place they will give you samples if you ask!
author: Jessica Y.

description: My favorite cookies in the bay comes from Anthony's! Them Cookies and cream are on about level
author: Mista N.

description: I think from all the reviews, I thought Anthony's would be comparable to Levain. The texture of the cookies were wonderful maybe a little too crinkly on the outer edges. But I just thought they were too sweet. Tasted like someone added too much sugar to the recipe. I did enjoy the walnut best. Not sure this place was worth the extra drive
author: Asma w.

description:
Cookies is all they have. And they're amazing. (Oh, and they have random swag)

Of all of the cookies I've eaten in my life, I have to admit Anthony's Cookies had some of the best cookies I've ever had. They're not super oily/greasy yet they have so much flavor. Perfect texture and consistency. Just the right level of chewiness and sweetness. 

They have a lot of different types of cookies but they will run out of most of them by mid-afternoon so if possible, I'd go in before noon if there's a specific one that you want and it's one of the more popular ones.

If you're in the area, even if you're not in the mood for cookies, stop by and buy a bag of them. Your future self will thank you for the investment.

Price: $1.50-$3
Wait: Little to none
author: Pourio L.

description:
This place is AMAZING! The people there is very helpful and suggests a few things. It's a nice & cozy place to hang out and have 1-2-3 or more cookies with a big glass of cold milk lol.  Didn't realize how close this was to my job, now it's gonna be a problem. I would definitely recommend this to EVERYONE... Skip, Hop, RUNNN. HAHA 

Heard a lot about the cookies & cream (which are amazing) chocolate chip (to die for) double dark chocolate (very yummy) toffee (it's ok) overall is soooo gooood
author: Mona Lisa L.

description: Can you guys please sell cookie cups with milk inside??? That would be really awesome! Thank you :) plus no where else is doing that!
author: Bridget A.

description: Love Anthony's Cookies! Hands down, best fresh baked cookies in the City. Stopped by this past weekend to get the to-die-for toffee chip and cookies and cream. 6 of each are never enough! I have to say, that while we did not immediately realize Anthony (the owner) was there that day, he was very nice and we could tell he puts love and time into making sure his cookies are tasty and delicious. He even expressed his hope that his Berkeley location will be just as great. I just hope the Berkeley location doesn't mean the Valencia one will be closed. We love this place, and wish there was actually one downtown so I could go after work! Thank you, Anthony!!
author: Patricia B.

description: A friend told me these were the best cookies she'd ever had so I had to try it.  They're really good but not the best.  Maybe if they were served warm, it would be better.  Chocolate Chip, Toffee Chip, and Candied Pecan Chip were good.  Coffee cookie was just ok.  On a Saturday about 3pm, they had run out of about half the flavors.  The cookies were $1.75 each.
author: Kim T.

description:
Anthony's makes cookies every hour using only the finest ingredients. I can appreciate their dedication, but the cookie I got was nothing fancy. 

I mean, it's a cookie. Of course it is good. However, after all of the hype (and cost) I felt like it could have been something more, something...transcendent. As it stands, it's just OK.
author: Casey S.

description:
Anything sweet is pretty much my own personal downfall so when I saw a throwback photo on Instagram of national chocolate chip cookie day, the first thought that came to my mind was Anthony's Cookies. I've never had one up until now, but my coworkers talk about it enough to make me wanna come here so one day I did. 

Anthony's Cookies is located in San Francisco so a lot of the parking is metered till 6pm. If that doesn't work with you then you can try to find other street parking that are limited to 2 hours. 

Once you step inside, you pretty much see everything that there is to see. The register is in front of you and behind that is the kitchen where the magic happens. There's 2 menus of different cookie options and then a 3rd menu of everything else they offer. There's one table to sit at and that's that. They sell bottled milk for $5 which I thought was a nice touch. 

I've visited this place twice already and got to try their double chocolate walnut, regular chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, and their cookies & cream cookies. To be honest, double chocolate walnut and oatmeal raisin weren't my first choice, but they just happened and they were definitely good. My only real problem was that I found their chocolate chip cookie to be way too sweet, and I can usually handle sweet things! 

Service is friendly and patient so you can take your time deciding what you want. Prices are also marked on the board so you'll know what you're getting yourself into if you find yourself ordering too much.

Overall, yeah, I would definitely come back. Cookies are my weakness especially their cookies & cream one.
author: Venus L.

description:
Let me start off with the fact that I don't like sweets. I'm more of a savory person

Anthony's cookies however, blows me away. My favorite are the toffee and the cookies and cream. 
These are the only cookies that I ever crave
author: Tiffany G.

description:
COOKIES SO GOOD
Don't come here if you're a hella good baker like HELLA GOOD. because it's so expensive here. A 2oz cookie (aka normal size cookie) is 3 bucks! And then their normal size cookie (smaller) is $1.50. A German chocolate, oatmeal chocolate, 2 2oz Chocolate chip cookies, and 1/2 pint of milk (elementary sized carton) came out to 
TEN DOLLARS. 

But definitely coming back here because the cookies here are so good, the perfect combination of crispy and chewy that you can't get out of baking Nestle cookies at home.
author: Davina B.

description: One, don't ever be a bakery specific to cookies and not have chocolate chip. It's unconstitutional. And please don't have 20+ flavors and choices but only have 5 cookies to choose from. Horrible.
author: Sean R.

description:
Some of the best cookies in the city

Cookies and cream 
Toffee chip
Double chocolate when they have it

Not good for your waist line, but who cares if you are looking for cookies
author: Lyman C.

description: I don't usually have a sweet tooth but I do when it comes to these cookies!! Everything I've tried so far  has been delicious. My personal favorites are the cookies and cream and oatmeal chocolate chip. The regular chocolate chip is amazing too. Be prepared to spend $$$ here because the cookies aren't necessarily cheap but they are super addictive!!
author: Melisa W.

description: The place is nicely designed. Once you walk in you get a whiff of the cookies. I got the coffee cookie made with four barrel coffee. Local cookie company with local ingredients. I am a big fan of supporting local companies. The coffee cookie was out of this world. The best coffee cookie I ever had. It just melts in your mouth. Sweet and savory. They offer cookies and milk. I have wait to try their strauss organic milk with other cookies. The place is a nice size and has a very comfortable and chill vibe.
author: Brian C.

description:
Anthony's Cookies is pretty cool because they give you a healthy dose of free samples. Considering their huge lineup of cookies, you should really use their free samples to help you strategize your purchase.

Regardless of what you sample, I think the Cookies&Cream is a must. To have a Cookies&Cream flavored cookie, it means that they must have put a cookie inside of a cookie. And if that cookie in the "Cookies&Cream" is also Cookies&Cream flavored, you'll have a cookie inside of a cookie inside of a cookie....

Lookie, that cookie just got your rookie mind to boogey. #Freestyle

Anyway, eat two cookies on the spot and then bring a dozen home. Microwave two of them to use as a sandwich for a scoop of Ice Cream. You just gave CREAM a run for it's money.
author: Ringo M.

description:
Did not like these cookies and don't know what the hype is about.

The texture is not particularly great; it's your standard chewy cookie. Flavor didn't pack a punch...could have used a bit more vanilla in the cookies to round out the flavor.
author: Bonnie L.

description: BEST. PLACE. EVER. There are no words to describe how satisfied I am. Seriously, though, these cookies are delicious and they have so many flavors and they taste fresh and homemade in a good way. Also ANTHONY! He's so sweet and you can tell how much he loves what he does and the cookies reflect it. So delicious and great service. I will definitely come again and again.
author: Fabi P.

description:
Crack cookies. Pretty much.

The walnut chocolate chip, chocolate chip, and the cookies and cream are my faves. Bring these to a party and they disappear FAST. Trust me, I know. I ate four in one sitting. 

Not much signage to indicate the shop and only one register inside. People line up single file and for some reason still have a hard time deciding which and how many to get once first up...so even a short line can mean a ten minute wait as the cashier is also the person boxing up the cookies. A little form and pencil would make for a more expedient operation. But heeyy, keepin' it small scale and maintaining the quality of the product.

A little pricey at $1.50 each given the size and no discount for bulk orders, but nice as an occasional treat or way to gain respect at a grown up party.

P.S. Will keep for three days and no refrigeration necessary.
author: Jan P.

description: Definitely the best cookies in SF! The right blend of crispy & chewy, baked fresh daily. And you must try the Cookies & Cream - it's like a chocolate chip cookie with a chocolate cookie baked into it. Tough to explain, easy to eat!
author: Rachel R.

description: My optometrist is right next store to Anthony's which is great. I always stop in for chocolate chip cookies and milk when I'm nearby. They are amazing especially when still warm. I live in the other side of the city but I'll keep my optometrist, in part because she's awesome and in part because her office is next door to Antony's.
author: David S.

description:
BEST COOKIES. I have only tried cookies and cream and walnut chip flavors and they were exquisite. They are perfect cookies just the way I like them - soft & not terribly sweet. Grab a carton of milk with your cookies and you are good to go. Their flavors vary by day, so I can't wait to try some of their other flavors. $1.50 for a small, $3.00 for a larger one. The price may seem a bit high for just one cookie, but it's definitely worth it once in a while.
Update: 1.75 for a small
author: Jaime F.

description:
Not usually a fan of cookies because I think they all taste the same everywhere. Came here as part of a mission food crawl outing where my friend refused to tell me the itinerary beforehand knowing my researching-before-everything neurotic tendencies. 

Went to Anthony's Cookies with below zero expectations and took a bite of the cookies & cream, I then met sugar Jesus.

No idea cookies could taste this divine.
author: Tian Q.

description:
Amazing cookie place. By far THE BEST peanut butter cookie I've ever eaten. And the people are so amazing. You just want to hang out and eat cookies all day. :) 
If you're looking to satisfy your sweet tooth I recommend Anthony's. You will not be disappointed.
author: Sandra S.

description:
As the cookie monster says " Me eat cookies! nom nom nom nom nom" . I'll be honest with you. This place will make a monster out of you, a cookie monster that is.  I've been hearing so much buzz about this place over the years, i finally got a chance to check it out.   The problem when you step into this place is trying to figure not just which cookies you are getting, it's trying to figure out just how many of each you are getting. I ordered one dozen cookies and in the end i realize it wasn't enough. I realize i can finish all these cookies within the hour, ok maybe half an hour. I ordered 1 dozen cookies for the cost of 15.00.  If you order a premium cookie such as double chocolate chip, it cost .50 cents more. There's what i ordered

3 cookies n cream
3 toffee
3 oatmeal raisin 
2 chocolate chip
1 chocolate with walnuts

The chocolate chip and oatmeal raisin was both chewy and soft. But i felt that there was a hint of peanut butter. It also tasted like there was peanut butter in the toffee one, but that didn't stop me. I still loved it.  The best of the best just had to be the cookies and cream one. I think i can finish 2 dozen of this on my own? Don't believe me? Buy me 2 dozen of these and I'll show you.  I was expecting it to be super sweet but it turned out just perfect. I love just how soft it is and you can really taste the freshness. These were far the best cookies I've ever had. Wow, reviewing about these cookies are making me tired now. It's time for me to go to bed and dream about the world of cookies.
author: Belinda C.

description: I was feeling basic and decided to only try their chocolate chip cookie. Needless to say, it was delicious! I also liked how they provided a table inside the shop along with refreshments to wash down the cookie. Would definitely come back :)
author: Allison T.

description: Cookies and cream was my favourite by far! If you like soft tasty cookies that melt in your mouth. This is the place!
author: Christopher L.

description: Love these cookies!  They do run out of some flavors, so if your craving a certain cookie, go early!
author: Christine H.

description:
What can I say about these cookies that hasn't already been said. Are they tasty?... Yes! Are they soft?...Yes! Do they have a slight crunch with a slight chewiness ? ..Yes!

They are perfect. The peanut butter makes me think about skippy peanut butter.  I could eat a spoon ful now. The toffee cookie was perfect.  The infamous cookies and Creme cookies lived up to the hype.
author: Tae S.

description:
A few nibbles will tell you the story - You'll hear that crunch when you bite but you'll feel the inside is moist and chewy. Yummm...   I'll join everyone in saying that Cookies & Cream is off the charts. Delicious flavor guaranteed to make you want more.

These are no ordinary cookies but I just don't understand why they have to cost the earth.  $15 for a dozen is way too much.  They can stay with $1.25 per piece but maybe give a discount if customers are buying by the dozen.
author: John L.

description:
Really good cookies.. Chewy, rich and just simply tasty!! 
A dozen of cookies was like 30+ bucks... WHAT? Yes... it's $3 a cookie... will I come back again? Yes! Will I get another dozen? Probably only if I am REALLY hungry ;) 

I'll come back for a cookie after the burrito...
author: Danny T.

description:
This was another place I had bookmarked for a while and I didn't realize that this place was only a couple blocks off my normal commute home so I finally gave it a try.

I didn't see a menu until the cute girl behind the counter pointed me to the side wall. There was such a huge selection that I had to ask which were the favorites. So I got the regular chocolate chip, toffee chip, and the german chocolate (which the counter girl said was her favorite).

I got about a dozen and they put them in neat little box to take home. The cookies weren't cheap but were worth the price - moist, chewy, and not overly sweet. My favorites were the german chocolate and I'm drooling thinking about them right now. If you're a fan of the cake form like me, you'll love these too.
author: Art O.

description:
I'm a total weirdo and don't like chocolate, so my options at Anthony's Cookies were severely limited, especially since they were out of Oatmeal Raisin Cookies when I visited.

So, I had the Cinnamon Spice, Walnut Chip, and White Chocolate Chip cookies. My favorite was the Walnut Chip cookie, which was was small, chunky, and packed with walnuts. The White Chocolate Chip cookie was a bit too sweet, even for me. Generally, the cookies were good: soft and moist on the inside. I was expecting them to be served warm, which would have been great given how chilly it was outside. 

This definitely may be a case of "it's me, not you, Anthony." Although it didn't blow me away, if you're looking for good cookies, give Anthony's a shot.
author: Mark C.

description:
Wow! I tried 4 cookies here and they were one of the best cookies I've ever had,ever! Chocolate chip, toffee, white chocolate chip, &a cookies and creme. I actually ate the cookies the night I got them and they were a soft crunchy which I like. But I can only imagine how goo they are when they are freshly baked and warm. When I received the cookies they were already pretty warm but I went during the day so they were probably not fresh out the oven. 

Anyways the cookies and creme and the toffee were the best.

Definitely recommend!
author: Marilee A.

description:
I've tried a lottttt of the flavors here, but I have to say toffee is the BESTTTT in my opinion! White chocolate and dark chocolate would be tied right after, but that's coming from someone who prefers dark chocolate over milk chocolate. I didn't find the cookies and cream flavor to be all that, but all my friends really like it. These cookies have that perfect hint of chewiness to it, they're SOOO delicious! A must try if you're ever in SF. To top it off, the workers are always very friendly and kind, at least all the times I've came here they were.

TOFFEE TOFFEE TOFFEEEEEEE
author: Cassie T.

description:
This is poop and we alllll know it. Michelle S knows it, Scott L knows it. We allll know it. Tracy V, Caye Q.. You know what I'm talking about. This is total poop and I literally have a double chocolate cookie in my bag right now that I'm about ready to set on fire and leave on their porch. Because it is total dog poop. 

^ is what I'd say if I were about to die and this were my last meal. I showed up at 7pm and got 1 2oz chocolate chip and 2 1oz double chocolate chip. $7 later I'm completely unsatisfied and would like to call out this Yelp inflation. This cookie tasted like any other cookie ever. I'll give it 3 stars because it wasn't actually canine excrement. Maybe it was because it was the end of the day, but seriously? 4.5 stars. I think because it's such a rip off you feel inclined to give it high marks. Let's walk through your average clientele for this establishment. 

"Hi my name is Tim and I just got home from work at Faceboogle. I make sure the things you search on the Internet show up in your news feed and I like to spend the money I save on public transportation on Anthony's cookies. I can't get laid but this shop is the equivalent of buying a gallon of toll house cookie dough and eating it while I cry watching Marley and Me on Netflix alone on Valentine's Day. Except I can only get a single 1oz cookie for the price of a 12oz toll house but I can afford it because I work at Faceboogle, did I mention that already?"

I digress... This place was aiight. That's just the way the poopies crumble.
author: Adam G.

description:
Wow. 

First time.

Someone gave me some a while back and I wasn't impressed then. But then again, it was secondhand. 

I finally made it in. We got one candied pecan chip (my favorite) and one oatmeal raisin (he loves it). We absolutely loved them. We ate them outside, and barely two minutes later, I walked back in and got one more of each, plus the coffee cookie. 

Candied pecan chip = perfect blend of nuts and chocolate chips in a soft cookie. 

Oatmeal raisin = lots of sugar, cinnamon and raisins in a chewy cookie. 

Coffee cookie = yup, it's definitely got a kick. Not for the weak. 

Prices = $1.50/cookie, $1.75 for special (i.e. coffee). 

Service = friendly. 

And yes, they have milk. And coffee. 

Enjoy!!! 

Definitely impressed and will return for more.
author: Fannie S.

description: This place has some of the greatest cookies I've ever had.  I tried the cookies and cream and white chocolate cookies. They were the perfect consistency when you take your first bite. Perfectly sweetened and goes great with a cup of milk! The only regret I have is not buying a whole box haha
author: Nerissa M.

description:
Awesome cookies! Definitely a great place if you need a cookie fix. I got roughly 2 dozen for a work party and it was definitely pricey. The cookies were delicious! We tried chocolate chip, cinnamon something, oatmeal chocolate chip, and toffee chip. Really good cookies but a bit of a steep price. 

Again, great place to get a few cookies to cure your cookie cravings!
author: Akshaya V.

description: Good place if you catch the cookies you want limited sometimes but that ok since you know its fresh! Parling is ok so make sure you time that correctly... Choc chip is good and the cookies and cream!
author: Jay A.

description:
Anthony's is a cute little store in the Mission. I went around 3:30 and there was absolutely no one there, which surprised me since I had read about there being long lines.

My friend and I split and cookies and cream cookie and a toffee cookies. The cookies and cream cookies was really great! It tasted just like the ice cream, but in cookie form. I would definitely recommend getting that type. The toffee was good, but not as memorable.

Both cookies were soft but didn't taste extremely fresh. With such high reviews, I was hoping and expecting it to taste more like they were fresh out of the oven. However, Anthony's does have a ton of amazing flavors to try. Even though the cookies didn't taste like they were a gift from God, the flavor options alone would be enough to make me want to come back to try them all.
author: Lucy C.

description:
1.50 for a cookie, a bit pricey but it's worth it for the good ones!

I came here after work, around 5, and they sold out of the oatmeal cookies ( which is my favorite!) however, I got others instead.

The toffee cookie is by far the best here! The combination of flavors just makes me crave for another one!!!

I also got the cinnamon spice, which was definitely very spicy! 

I also ordered a few dark chocolate for others. I personally have no comment but they seem to enjoy it! 

Definitely come here for the toffee but beware don't go up Dolores from 25th! That hill is steeeep!
author: Josie H.

description:
OMG these are some of the best cookies I've ever had in my LIFE. Five stars is underrated. 

One of my friends lives right around the corner from here, so his apartment is always smells like fresh baked cookies. The lucky bastard. I stayed with him for a week while visiting sf and caved the 2nd day and came home with a dozen cookies... And then kept buying the until I left. Bad news - I gained about 5 pounds. Good news - I am his roommate's favorite house guest. 

All of the cookies are delicious, but the best are the cookies and cream. You can't find that gooey sweetness anywhere else. Like all places who don their craft so well they don't give af, the place is easy to miss. But just follow the smell of cookies and look for the big red door.
author: Suzy C.

description:
The cookies are good
Nothing too exceptional though, like there isn't much to them that is really unique
Yes they are good but nothing I would be too excited about
author: Jad A.

description: What a cute cookie shop! Located in the lower Mission, Anthony's Cookies is the perfect afternoon snack!  The Cinnamon Spice cookie was fragrant, semi-soft, and yummy! The Toffee was a good runner-up, but slightly too sweet for my taste. No worries though; I had a great time and I will be back (ps: they sell mini milk boxes here, a la elementary school, to complete your milk and cookies moment).
author: Chase B.

description:
Anthony's Cookies is great. I've been here twice and each time I've left in a delicious cookie coma. I haven't had a single cookie that I didn't like, but my favorites are the chocolate chip and the toffee. Both are crisp on the edges and soft and chewy on the inside. If you're some kind of crunchy-cookie-loving heathen, you might want to look elsewhere for treats. 

You should come early in order to get the full selection. When I've arrived around 5pm, most of the specialty options are sold out. And remember to close the door behind you to keep the cookies fresh!

P.S. The service here is fast and excellent. I love the little detail of stamping the bag with the servers name!
author: Leah T.

description: Really Great Service ! Great cookies as well a little out the way but not to far from Delores park also they have a lot of choices in milks non fat , whole , low fat , fat free , just not in the big bottles I only drink low fat whole milk is to much and non fat is to watery ! Just being in the store for 5mins a lot of service which was great for a cookie shop!
author: Barbara P.

description:
TIP:  Inhale the air when you enter this establishment.  The aroma of freshly baked cookies is unlike any air freshener you can ever buy in a spray can!  No comparisons, this is how freshly baked cookies should smell.  Ahhhhhh!

My co-worker and I were on a dessert hunting mission, which happened to be in the Mission District.  She ordered 2 dozen cookie and creams cookies for a farewell party for the office.  I waited patiently for her to finish her purchase...

In the meantime, there were samples... toffee chip cookies.  1 nibble of that and BAM!  I was waiting in line to buy some to bring home.  I wasn't planning on buying anything but the sample got me!

All chewy on the inside and a slight crunch texture to the outside...
!) Toffee Chip
!!) German Chocolate
!!!) Traditional Chocolate Chip
!!!!) Cookies and Cream

I just spent the best $5 of my life!  

Hot yoga classes, here I come.  Time to melt off those tasty desserts!
author: Jenny T.

description: Whenever I'm in SF, I stop by Anthony's Cookies. If you can buy at least a dozen. Eat a couple, then save the rest for your favorite ice cream to make a sandwich.
author: Marc S.

description: I'm not much of a cookie eater and nothing memorable really stuck out. It was decent and delicious though. Soft and flavorful, very sweet and will definitely satisfy a sweet tooth.
author: L T.

description: I'm from San Diego, but every time I come to San Francisco this is one of my first stops. I would give it a 5. But sometimes I come to town and they don't have my favorite cookie. German chocolate yum but i would have given a 5 if I was able to get it every time I came.
author: Ha H.

description: The cookies here are excellent and though I lack much of a sweet tooth, a good cookie is always a treat. They also make great gifts!
author: Misha T.

description:
So yummy! I try to stop by every time I'm in the area. It's too dangerous though. 
MUST TRY: cookies and cream cookie. I could eat a dozen at once (don't judge me I looooove sweets).. okay maybe not a whole dozen but a lot more than you'd think haha. 
The toffee chip and oatmeal are good too. They sell milk cartons (how cute!) and a handful of other beverages. I always grab a box to bring home, too. Everyone loves em!
Weekends can get busy. The first time I came here on a Saturday the line was out the door and they were out of a few flavors. But last time I came here around 6pm on a Thursday and there was nobody there at all!
author: Amy H.

description:
Came in here right before closing and was able to snatch some cookies before they ran out. Understandably the selecting was sparse, but I had the toffee, oatmeal raisin, and German chocolate. 
Cookies were not as fresh, probably because they were out all day. Makes sense we came late. 
The German chocolate was amazing. Definitely coming back to try the other flavours!
author: Gavin L.

description: Great sugar spice, German chocolate and toffee cookies. Great recommendation from my coworker
author: Denise T.

description:
SO. FREAKING. GOOD. 

I finally got to come here after craving these cookies for months.  I never seem to be in the area, and it's a pretty far drive from where I live. Plus the past two times I have managed to come here, they were closed. My craving was finally satisfied!  The cookies are nice and chewy, and they have excellent flavors!  I would recommend checking their website for the flavors because they only serve some on certain days!   

My favorites to get here are the toffee chip and cookies and cream!! But I've also liked many of the other flavors that I've tried.  

My only complaint is that this place is out of the way from where I live, and I'm never in this area.  Also, make sure to come early cuz they run out a lot of the time! :( I came pretty early on a friday, but they were already out of one of the flavors that I wanted.  I think it was the coffee.
author: Kay A.

description: Phenomenal! Delicious and always fresh!!!! Seriously unforgettable! Every time we treat ourselves we are NEVER disappointed! Thank you Anthony for sharing the goodness!!! My favorites are German Chocolate, Coffee and both walnut cookies!!!! The hours are great and convenient when you need something quick for a potluck!
author: Rihnei N.

description:
3.5 Stars
.
Darn!!! A few friends and I picked some up after lunch near by. I quickly jumped on yelp to see which flavors I'd want to try. I LOVE chocolate chip cookies with walnuts so that was a must. I also got to try cookies and cream (which looks like a fav around here) and toffee chip.

Of course my fav was the walnut chocolate chip! It had just the right ratio of chocolate to walnuts. I've had some cookies that were too chocolate-y. (How strange, right? Given I'm a chocoholic!) 

When I read that the cookies were small, everyone was right-- they DEFINITELY were! The $1.25 you pay per cookie is steep, given the size. (- 1 star for that.)

Overall, the cookies were quite good. I really wish these cookies weren't that small, otherwise I'd be a huge fan.
author: Mimie L.

description:
The best cookies. They give the perfect bite each time. There's a crunchy crust with chewy interior. My favorites are the toffee and oatmeal. Cookies are normal sized (3" diameter) and are about $1.25-1.75.  They freeze beautifully. Buy a bunch, wrap them up in foil, put it in a plastic bag and keep them in the freezer to satisfy cravings for perfect cookies. When you want one, throw one on a plate, let it come to room temperature (like 15 min) and microwave it for 10-20 seconds, depending on your preference.

They sell Strauss milk in case you wanted to take one of the few seats at the bar and eat them right there. Aside from the few seats, this place is order and go. Enjoy one while you're on your way to your next food stop.
author: Rena J.

description: Always a pit stop for when I need a sweet tooth fix! My 2 year old daughter loves the Cookies n Cream! I lovvvvve the White Chocolate and Chocolate Chip! UH-MAZE-ZING!!! My husband isn't into sweets but his favorite is anything German Chocolate...they just so happen to have that flavor cookie! Now, he's addicted! As my daughter says, "IT'S YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!!!"
author: Candy R.

description: Went out of my way to try Anthony's cookies and was not impressed- definitely just plain old cookies. Do yourself a favor and just bake your own..
author: Kathleen S.

description:
C is for cookie and cookie is for me! 

My cousin wanted to get some cookies for dessert. And all he kept raving about was, "You've got to try Anthony's Cookies!"

When we got here, it was pretty empty. So, the service here was very attentive. my cousin a whole bunch of cookies that i didn't know which one I was tasting. The only ones I remember tasting were the Cookies & Cream and German Chocolate Cake cookies. 

The cookies were full of flavor and moist. They actually tasted as they are named! I would've of tried the other flavors, but my cousin ate all the cookies! For shame. Oh well, there will be a next time for me! I just need directions from Sesame Street!
author: Jay G.

description:
I'm not a huge dessert fan. I wouldn't mind having dessert....BUT....I'm a savory food type of guy. On the other hand, if you hand me a cookie from Anthony's Cookies...I can assure you that I will not reject it and will be asking for more.

Anthony's Cookies is by far one of the best cookie shops I've ever been to. Some of you might say: "What's so special about HIS cookies?" Well first off...THEY'RE GOOD! Even after they've been cooled off from the oven...they remain chewy. Also, the flavors that they offer are unique (Cookies and Cream & Toffee Chip).

My ultimste favorite would have to be their cookies and cream. It's like a chocolate chip cookie except it has oreo cookies in place of the chips. I've had other bakeries give the cookies and cream a shot but nothing comes close to Anthony's. Chewy, moist, & filled with oreo goodness. This goes for the chocolate chip, toffee chip, & white chocolate chip. 10 out of 10 on flavor!

You really can't go wrong with their menu. Just try ine and you might be surprised at how good they are. Yeah I know they're $1.50 per cookie but they're worth every penny. And here's a plus...the owner Anthony provides great customer service. He's very polite, helpful, & always greets customers with a smile. Great service and delicious cookies? What else could you ask for (besides a glass of milk?:)
author: Ralph N.

description:
You walk in and get slapped in the face with an overwhelming aroma of fresh baked cookies. There are layers of baking sheets airing out cookies right behind the counter. I consider myself a cookie connoisseur and these are some of the best cookies I've ever bought. They taste just as if grandma made them from scratch in her kitchen.

I bought 3 cookies (chocolate chip, chocolate chip oatmeal, chocolate chip walnut) and ended up coming back later in the day for 3 more chocolate chip cookies. The cookies are on the smaller side in terms of size, but so so so good. 

Only negative is that this isn't a great place to have coffee or sit at a table to enjoy your cookies. It's a bit dark and really just serves as a dispensary for all your fresh baked cookie needs.
author: John S.

description:
I am not sure how I found Anthony's cookies, I think it was on Instagram. Anyways, I was on a mission to make the drive out to SF from fremont..  At 9 months pregnant, you better believe my husband was going to drive me haha. I am so glad we did! These cookies are delicious!!!! I'm an old fashioned chocolate chip
Cookie kind of girl.. I thought they had a variety.. I bought a few choc. Chip, a few white chocolate for the hubby.. And here I thought, who would be crazy enough to try a "cookies and Cream" cookie?? Oh wait, my 8 year old son.. But let me tell you! I had to try those as well! Those are seriously the best cookies I've ever tasted!! 


5 stars! They are pricey, but I don't mind spending $20
On cookies!!
author: angie E.

description:
Cookies and cream cookie is the best! Staff is super nice and the cookies are the best. 

The only downside is damn $1.75 per cookie? Kind of steep which is why I don't go by as much as I would like to even when I'm in the area. 

They still get 5 stars for service and quality.
author: Philip O.

description:
OH MY GOD. THESE ARE AMAZING!

I had seen these on the Postmates $4.99 list and just always wanted to order them. Finally, my co-workers gf sent them to use one day and I fell in love.

I'm a classic Chocolate Chip cookie kinda gal cause I feel like you can never go wrong. And, they were amazing. Add some Strauss milk and all is right in the world.

The following week I had them sent to a friend that was starting a new job. Everyone at his workplace loved them. 

Bottom line: Yes, they are a bit pricey for a cookie. And maybe I don't need to spend $4.99 on having it delivered to me. But isn't that was deserts are anyway? A treat? Otherwise, if I was in the mood for a nice drive to 24th or in the neighborhood, I would definitely stop by.
author: Leina K.

description:
I never leave here without at least a dozen cookies. DAMMIT

My fave: cookies & cream
The kid's fave: toffee
The husband's fave: I'm gonna guess classic chocolate chip, since this is usually the only variety left in the box by the time the kid and I get home. HAHHAHA

I'm kind of glad it's not in a space that allows for more foot traffic, because I fortunately have never encountered a huge crowd or had them run out of the cookies I wanted to get even when I came at like 4:30 pm. 

The kid frequently asks for these cookies BY NAME, and ever since I took him here, I can generally get through my grocery shopping without having to stop in the cookie aisle. Because why open a box when you can go to Anthony's? Now that's parenting done right, people. 

No it is not cheap and I'm not a snob or anything, I can get by with some break or bake from Lucky's down the street. But that's what makes these cookies a treat. 

Lately they've been baking a coffee cookie flavored with actual Four Barrel. LOVE!
author: Aivy C.

description:
Go early if you want one of their daily specials. They told me I missed the German Chocolate cookies by 7 minutes at 12pm... sigh... 

Walking around SF and holding the box a few people stopped and said "ohhh Anthony's". Tasting them didn't disappoint.  Big hit with the family.
author: Alyssa B.

description:
Small little store but surprisingly I'm never waiting in a long line.
I've been here twice and it's always worth it to get 2 dozen.
Oreo is always my fave!
Along with milk chic chip.
The toffee and more
The cookies are always so soft and chewy
Good customer service.
Gladly recommend this place
author: Brittany C.

description: Decent cookies with an extensive menu.  They even have gluten free options to show how SF they are.  Popular varieties are usually sold out by early afternoon.  Don't get too carried away with ordering,  The cookies, while small, cost a decent chunk of change!  I think its a joke when people compare Anthony's to Levain (NYC); the two aren't even on the same playing field.
author: David C.

description: Came all the way here just for cookies because I heard it was bomb. I decided to get the cookies n cream, walnut chocolate chip, and toffee. Also, I tried the oatmeal raisin which I usually don't like. They were all enjoyable, but my favorite is the toffee one. I like that they have unique flavors. The prices are pretty high for cookies, so it's something I wouldn't get regularly but it's definitely worth a try. The service was pretty good as well. They do have a small plate to sample. I have recommended this place to other people and they loved the cookies too. In the beginning, I didn't think it was a big deal but they just got better as I ate them. Overall, give it a try because they have tons of good flavors and a cookie can't really go wrong
author: Maggie W.

description: We went in for one each. Ended up with a dozen. He let us taste test before we bought. Ended up getting oatmeal raisin (I'll be dreaming about those), chocolate espresso, chocolate cinnamon (cinnamon is the finish), and of course chocolate chip. Every single one is amazing. Such a nice guy. The cookies didn't even make it home.
author: Melinda P.

description: We came back for Valentine's Day and I am addicted to these cookies so much that I bought 1 dozen. It's crazy to think that I would never spend $21 on a shirt, but for Anthony's cookies I'm practically handing over the money without hesitance. Plus the box is adorable!
author: Megan L.

description:
Mmmmm!!! Great cookies!!

I got the toffee, cookies and cream, cranberry holiday one, peanut butter, walnut, and some others but I forget.

Each cookie was good and had nice flavor.  I would prefer that some of them be chewier and not as crunchy.  

However I really enjoyed them for the most part!
author: Em F.

description: There's nothing like a fresh cookie from Anthony's to brighten the day. At $1.75ea, this is an affordable luxury. I like that they are open until 8:00PM and only wish they were open even later to support my late night cookie cravings. I had a hankering for a cookies & cream cookie and stopped here after work one day and "accidentally" left with 11 more cookies than I had originally intended :). nomnomnom. They keep a solid assortment of the classics in stock every day and mix things up with a rotating selection of their special cookies.The cookies & cream and toffee chip cookies are my favorite, but you really can't go wrong with any selection here. They also serve tea, coffee and milk to compliment your cookie eating and have some seating. The only down side about Anthony's is the ambience. The interior is a bit stark and doesn't lend itself super well to lounging for too long since they keep the temperature low to maintain cookie quality excellence.
author: Alice H.

description:
I went on a late December evening. Skies were surprisingly clear, grown ups were working and students were enjoying the winter break.

Ambiance: The place is on the street and you would probably need to pay for street parking so bring coins. The store is vibrant yet simple and clean. There is one table inside that can fit one small group.

Service: The server was on top of her orders, when 3 other groups ranging from 203 people came in she picked up the pace while still serving us in a polite manner.

Food: (Regular Chocolate Chip | Cinnamon Spice | Peanut Butter | Cookies and Cream)
In terms of flavor, the cookies and cream stood out to me. Everything else tasted just the like other cookies BUT the texture of was soft and chewy.

Overall: I CURRENTLY give this a 4.5. I am holding off on the other 1/2 a point because as delightful the cookies were, I wasn't impressed with the more simple cookies. I still need to try their milk and other unique cookies (Please stay tuned for an updated review). In summation, the customer service was pleasing, the service was fast, and the cookies memorable. If you're ever visiting San Francisco, I recommend to take a quick brean for this sweet treat.

**Tip: Buy in bulk then mix and match to sample as many flavors as you can**
author: Leland S.

description:
I'm sooo glad my friend brought me some back when he went to SF a few years cause this cookie place is soo GOOD! I would have never heard of it if he mentioned it to me. 

You have to get the COOKIES AND CREAM COOKIES! That's all I have to say it's my favorite! I usually like the double chocolate chip and the toffee one but cookies and cream is definitely the best and you can't find those cookies anywhere else!

This place is a hidden gem and I always have to come here when I'm in San Francisco.
author: Alyssa N.

description:
I'm so glad that my friend introduced me to this hidden gem in SF!

I LOVE cookies and can't believe I've never heard of this place!

It's a cute shop that serves freshly baked cookies and they also sell milk from local dairy farms.

What I got:
-Chocolate chip
-Double chocolate
-Cookies and cream
-Toffee chip
-Oatmeal raisin
-White chocolate
-Dark chocolate

They were all amazing! I have to say that my favorites were the chocolate chip and dark chocolate! So glad I bought a dozen! :D

If you're a cookie lover, come check this place out!
author: Lily Y.

description:
If you like cookies that are moist, chewy and delicious, save yourself the trouble of coming here. For a place so highly rated, you would expect something delicious, maybe even good. At $3 a cookie, you're getting a dinky cookie that's not just sub par, but greasy and flavorless. Even my boyfriend, who absolutely loves all kinds of sweets did not like this place at all. 

Have you ever eaten something where it's not even close to your expectations? Like not even maybe average?? THIS IS IT. Also, this is a prime example of an overhyped and overpriced SF place. If you must go, tamper your expectations and you might be happy like all the other reviewers here.. but I sure wasn't.
author: Venus L.

description:
Cookies & cream and Toffee. Get them!!

Those damn cookies take me to a time of childhood I never had. I seriously spend like $30 on a box of cookies every time I go here. Last time I was there I bought milk and ate there instead of just picking it up.

Seriously, so good. I'm not even a cookie person-- I know that sounds crazy but I just don't like super sweet things. I'd rather have savory than sweet, but this blew my mother effing mind. I highly recommend this place!
author: Jennie Y.

description:
Good sign: "Please keep the door closed. It helps maintain the freshness of the cookies".

BAD sign: "Due to a shortage of organic peanut butter from our distributor, we unfortunately will not have our peanut butter cookie on the menu until further notice."

BOOOOOOOOO.

Already not off to a good start, but I was still excited to try the much hyped about Cookies & Cream cookie. Unfortunately, I was not at all impressed. Sure, it tasted good...but maybe all of the hype got my expectations too high. I have definitely had much better cookies.
