The cookies here are mostly very small also, which is not necessarily a bad thing, as it makes it easier to try a variety of cookies. But they were surprisingly small.

Both their Candied Pecan Chocolate Chip and Walnut Double Chocolate Chip were better than the Cookies & Cream. The Toffee Chip was not so great though. This was one of their bigger cookies, but it was flatter and not as chewy, which is a big downside (they actually probably all contained about the same amount of batter, but the Toffee Chip was just flattened out more).

Cookies are pretty much my favorite food, so I find it hard to give a cookie shop below 3 stars, but I would not necessarily recommend this place. As long as you don't mind running the risk of seeing some bottomless men walking around with their junk hanging out, I would highly recommend instead heading over to Hot Cookie in the Castro for some amazing cookies, where they also have plenty of peanut butter. If that's a problem for you, go to Goody Goodie Cream & Sugar for some of the best Chocolate Chip Cookies.
author: Mike C.

description:
It's about $25 for 16 cookies and a small pint of milk.  

The chocolate chip was good. It was on the small side but it was crunchy around the edges but soft and chewy towards the center. 
The toffee isn't bad either. 

I thought the peanut butter one was too crumbly and slighty dry.
The walnut double chocolate was sticky, chewy and not too sweet.
Will be back to try more.
author: Heejin L.

description:
what to order: TOFFEE and cookies & cream
tip: BRING TUPPERWARE!! 

toffee cookie is SO damn good. a little on the sweeter side but duh, its dessert.

cookies & cream is good but I remembered it to be better last time. this time, toffee stole my heart.

great service, super friendly! I'm also glad they offer free water!
author: Thuy-Vy N.

description: Went here near closing time, so they were out of pretty much everything and service was cold. I did get to try the chocolate chip walnut cookie which I thought was okay but not anything to write home about. Will have to give it another try during peak hours.
author: Briget P.

description:
Oh. Em. Gee. These cookies are just so delicious!! After a quick trip out in San Bruno and South San Fran, I figured we'd try out Anthony's on the way home.

Once we turned down Valencia, I thought that maybe we were in the wrong area because there aren't too many businesses. Then we spotted the store front and found parking right in front. 

The store is really simple and small. There is one table near the window for seating, menus on the wall, and the counter is decorated with milk bottles all around. We decided to go with cookies and cream, chocolate chip, dark chocolate chip, and cinnamon spice. We each tried the chocolate chip and I immediately wanted the recipe!! 

We saved the rest for when we got home and they were still great even though they weren't fresh from the bakery. Once the last one was gone, we wished we ordered more than just 8.  :(


Definitely glad we decided to try out Anthony's!
author: Janina M.

description:
If I am in San Francisco, with time permitting, I will ALWAYS make room for Anthony's Cookies.  I had my first visit almost four years ago and have been a willing addict ever since.  Much like the other reviewers, my favorite is the cookies and cream. Moist, right amount of sweetness, and the perfect size for repeat bites, it captures the essence of what a cookie (within a cookie) should be. Call ahead first. The cookies and cream will usually run out before the end of the day.  But you can't go wrong with any of the other selections.  

I had the pleasure of meeting THE Anthony.  My girlfriend was walking out of the store.  A box of a dozen cookies and cream in her hand.  I'm circling around to park.  She's waving, smiling at me. General merriment that accompanies you once you've visited the shop.   My girlfriend trips and rolls her ankle awkwardly on the steps. Cookies go flying in every way.   I'm running out of the car.  Pandemonium on the streets.  People are screaming.  Kids are crying.  The clouds reverberate with thunder.  Hail falls from the sky.  Locusts are descending onto the sidewalk.  Anthony runs out of the store to help my girlfriend up and offers us shelter.  I ask for an ice bag and Anthony gives it to me without issue. Now girlfriend and I are chilling in the store with an ice bag on her rolled ankle and a box of cookies and cream. 

Anthony is a cool dude.  Awesome cookie lord by day.  Probably same cookie lord at night.
author: Huy D.

description:
I am still trying to get over the fact that on the day I went to Anthony's, they were out of ingredients for their toffee cookies. I took BART and walked over a mile alone in a seedy area of SF to this place so I was extremely dismayed. That didn't stop me from ordering $78 worth of cookies though.

To be fair, not all of them were for me. I did get 2 dozens for work and a few for myself. The best cookies by far were the cookies and cream. They lasted a few days too without being refrigerated. I had a cookie 3 days later and it was still moist.

The place is small but there are tables for you to sit inside. They don't make a whole lot at a time so you might want to call ahead if you want a large order. I ended up waiting about 15 minutes total before they could get all the cookies I wanted together and I pretty much cleaned them out.

The cookies are on the smaller size and they're not cheap at $1.25 each. I would say get a few to sample but don't waste too much of your money getting a whole bunch. I really didn't care for any of the other cookies aside from the cookies and cream.
author: Natalie K.

description:
The good and the bad! The good: These cookies are really good! The bad: Why are they so small? For $1.25/cookie, that's pretty expensive for such a tiny cookie! The walnut chocolate chip is pretty much a nub of a cookie! They don't even offer a discount on high-quantity purchases either: Weak!

What we swallowed (with favorite on top):

COOKIES & CREAM: Full of chocolate and creamy goodness. Thin and crispy, this is a winner!
OATMEAL WALNUT CHOCOLATE CHIP: Dinky nub but good.
WALNUT CHOCOLATE CHIP: Another dinky nub: chewy and delicious.
TOFFEE CHIP: Sweet, gooey and crispy.
CHOCOLATE CHIP: Your basic delicious chocolate chip.
CINNAMON SPICE: Cinnamony spicey goodness.
WHITE CHOCOLATE CHIP: Sweet. I was missing some nuts or something to cut the sweet. Still good.
DOUBLE CHOCOLATE CHIP: Overload of chocolate! MILK STAT!

We liked the cookies but like we said, a bit expensive. Four stars for the cookies, dock one star for the price. It was great to try but for the price for such a small cookie, I don't think we'll be back.
author: Vivian A.

description:
Everything in the reviews are true. These cookies are crazy good. I should have listened and gotten there early but I was still able to pick up some of these amazing cookies. Since I'm only in town another day, I'm pretty sure I'm going to go back and buy a box to eat by myself in a day with no shame lol 
I tried both the toffee and cookies and cream cookie. Both were delicious but my favorite was cookies and cream. I already can't wait to come back and get more 


Seriously great cookies and they're very soft which is always great.
author: Sherren L.

description:
When they sell out, they sell out! Get there early! 

Bought a couple dozen of assorted cookies for a holiday party and I can say that each one didn't disappoint.  

Baked fresh and with organic ingredients when possible. Not like I can tell the difference from organic and regular ingredients. 

Most cookies come in 2 sizes, 1 oz (1.95) & 2oz for 3.50. A little pricey is my only issue but I would definitely go back.

My favorite is the Toffee Chip followed by the White Chocolate Chip.  They also have Walnut Chip and German Chocolate which are also good. Don't forget to pick up a bag of candied pecans!!!
author: Scott L.

description: Damn good cookies. Toffee was my fav
author: Kevin N.

description: These cookies are good, but not something that I would have to absolutely have. Don't get me wrong, these cookies are solid. The thing that separates this cookie shop and others is the outstanding service. We just happened to be there when Anthony was working the front, which he claims he rarely does. He was really accommodating and made sure that we were able to taste the cookies before we purchased them. Gourmet cookies with a down to earth vibe/environment which is how I would describe this shop, which is so very rare. Would definitely come back. Make sure to visit this gem!
author: Marc S.

description:
Came here to see what all the hype was about. I love how they even sell milk to go with the cookies! It was $1.50 per cookie, and we got:

Peanut butter (5/5) - I love the texture of this. Slightly crumbly and so chock full of peanut butter taste. My favorite of the ones we got.
Cookies and cream (4/5) - didn't taste super cookies and creamy. 
Toffee chip - chocolate chips mixed in with some toffee. 
Candied pecan - brittle, caramelized texture.

Pretty yummy, but a bit expensive for a cookie!
author: Rachel L.

description:
I've been here a couple times now, and I never write reviews, but I guess it's time to start. 

The most recent time I've been here, I came because I was CRRRAAAAVVVINGGGG a cookie for the past couple weeks, and haven't had one because I was trying to be all healthy and crap. So I had a day off from work and dragged my best friends out with me to get Anthony's Cookies because I knew THESE were the ones that would fulfill my cravings the way a child's love fills a mother's heart.... What the crap am I talking about? Forget it. Here's the gist:

I LOVE ANTHONY'S COOKIES.

COOKIE COOKIE COOKIE!

ANTHONY'S COOKIES ARE DELICIOUS!

WARM, CHEWY, CRUNCHY, GOOEY, MELT-IN-YOUR-MOUTH YUMMY-- ALL IN ONE COOKIE!

Favorites are the Cookies n' Creme, Toffee Chip, and Dark Chocolate :)

Go get 'emmmmmmm!

Never had trouble finding metered parking out in front since the neighborhood isn't toooo busy, and people are usually just in and out of this place.
Not a bad idea to sit down at one of their modern-rustic picnic tables to enjoy the fresh cookies with a cool pint of milk or iced coffee.

You must try!
author: Melissa Y.

description:
I've heard so many great things about Anthony's and I've been wanting to come here for two years, but the two other times I tried to come I was either full or the store was closed. I finally had the chance to try these famous cookies on my birthday! My boyfriend brought me here because we had time to kill and I told him I've been wanting to try. He's not a big fan of sweets so we only ordered a few cookies to try. We got the cookies & cream, oatmeal chocolate chip, and original chocolate chip.

Cookies & Cream and Chocolate Chip are the ones to get. The cookies are actually pretty small and I wish they were warm, but they were still delicious. From reading previous reviews, they've raised their prices to $1.50/1.75 so don't expect super cheap prices...
author: Estelle C.

description: I just happened to walk by and try one of their gluten-free chocolate chip cookies. Very good!
author: Bree G.

description: TBH i think this has to be the best cookies in SF!!! I love sweets and Anthony's cookies DEFINITELY takes the cake! The only thing saddens me is the fact they teased me with the banana cookies, and i haven't seen em in years. Im probably the only weirdo that loves bananas but the cookies was amazing. Im a baker myself you can pass me the recipe Anthony! If your in the area Definitely check it out, If you visit SF definitely a must not far from the 24th and mission bart station. If you got kids they will love you i promise.
author: Ja'Leiya L.

description: Anthony's Cookies is a gem of SF! Toffee Chip, Coffee and good 'ol classic Chocolate Chip are delicious and are my favorites! Surprisingly, I also love the Dark Chocolate and Double Dark Chocolate Chip! This is the only spot where I'd get anything dark chocolate! Anthony's Cookies has the best balance of a crispy edge and chewy center cookie! We also had Anthony's Cookies set up at the sweets bar at my bro-in-law's wedding reception! It was a hit!!! Especially for out of towners.... They really got a San Francisco treat!
author: Christine R.

description:
I've been to Anthony's twice. I have tried:
Chocolate Chip -- 5 stars!!
Cinnamon Spice -- 5 stars!!
Cookies and Cream -- 4 stars
Peanut butter -- 5 stars (according to my hubby)
Double Chocolate with Walnuts -- 5 stars!!
Toffee Chip -- 1million stars!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

If they sold the toffee chip recipe I would pay BIG bucks to get my hands in it so I could make these amazing cookies.
author: Amanda M.

description: Prior to my trip to San Francisco I googled the best cookies in San Fran and my search brought me to Anthony's. We added Anthony's to our itinerary and boy I'm glad we did. The cookies were fresh, tender on the inside and delicately crusty on the edges. We tried cookies and cream, cinnamon spice, classic chocolate chip, and pecan chocolate chip. My suggestion is the earlier you go the more variety. I loved every taste of these cookies. Also, I LOVED supporting a black owned business. The owner Anthony was there and greeted us with a friendly smile and chat. I will never enjoy another cookie the way I enjoyed Anthony's.
author: Gee S.

description:
Really, one of the best cookies ever, and definitely worth the trip out here. Specifically talking about their cookies & cream and toffee chip. Do not leave without getting cookies & cream cookies!

On my ultimate list of cookies, this is definitely top 5!
author: Joanne Y.

description:
*For best results, please go the additional 5 minutes to Mitchell's and buy yourself a pint of vanilla ice cream.

Feeling a little under the weather, I managed to convince Mr. Dubs that the only medicine to my sickness is cookies. Not just cookies, but Anthony's cookies. Being the little sweetheart that he is (suckerr!), he agreed to take me to go get cookies. It was his brilliant idea to get some ice cream to go with it!

I love how they have strict rules on keeping the door closed to maintain freshness of the cookies. How Willy Wonka of them! Mr. Dubs and I ended up taking home 4 cookies and cream, 4 chocolate chips, 1 toffee, 1 white chocolate chip and 2 cinnamon spice. Hands down, cookies and cream rocked my world. If I could, I'd go back today and buy a whole dozen just for myself... and maybe half a dozen for Mr. Dubs. 

Do yourself a favor and head over the Anthony's cookies and treat yourself to a cookies and cream-- sure it's a bit steep at a dollar for a dinky cookie but I assure you that it will be the best dollar spent on the best cookie ever!
author: Tiffany U.

description:
Their cookies are delicious, too bad it's far from where I live. A must go to spot if you're craving for cookies around San Francisco.

Try their Cookies and Creme cookie, delicious. Would love to go back and try the other flavors they have!
author: Samantha M.

description:
I decided to get a dozen of cookies before leaving SF the next day, and I wanted to get them from Anthony's Cookies seeing all the glowing reviews on Yelp... it seemed like the SF cookie. I got a dozen of 3 flavors... chocolate chip, cookies and cream, and the cinnamon. All were very good and were served warm, fresh out of the oven! My favorite out of the 3 was the cookies and cream. I was planning to share with some friends back home but I was stingy with the cookies and cream and kept most of them to myself haha.

The cookies are regular sized but expensive... these are definitely a special occasion cookie to me. Their menu seems to change daily, but there are some default cookies like the chocolate chip and the cookies and cream. The store is kinda minimalist hipster, with Cut Copy music playing in the background. Overall, Anthony's Cookies is one cool cookie shop in the Mission District.
author: Felicia L.

description:
As an adult, my only aim in life is to be the foremost authority on reviewing cookies on Yelp. Seriously. And therefore, and only therefore, am I going to eat each and everyone of the cookies on offer at Anthony's. No other reason.

Fit starters, it's refreshing to find a place that specialises only in cookies--not an all purpose bakery, not a came shop, but only a cookie shop. And the fact that the only other thing that they sell is milk should give you a clue as to how committed they're to this mission. 

My favourite flavours? Each and every one. It is impossible to pick one. But what I'd get each and every day is the cookies and cream. Mmmm. My second favourite is the cinnamon cookie. I'm not even a big fan of cinnamon. But this one... OMG

Make your way to Mission the minute you land in SF. You'll not regret it.
author: Avadhut P.

description:
1 Toffee. 1 cookies & Creme. 1 Oatmeal Raisin. 1 Cinnamon sugar. 

1 HELLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLA memorable & pleasurable eating experience. 


J "Don't say HELLA" Y
author: Justin Y.

description:
Whoa, since when did Anthony's Cookies change their prices?! Regardless of the price hike, I still love their goodies so much and will be back. 

Ever since I moved from the Bay to SD, my girlfriend and I always make this place a priority to visit whenever we come into the city. We usually buy 2-3 dozens of cookies n cream and toffee chip so you can imagine our surprise when we heard that it was $108 for our 3 dozens. 

Unfortunately, we later discovered that we were given 2 dozens.  We were irritated and annoyed that this was the case.  I had prepared myself to bring out my b*tchy side if the manager did not accommodate us or question if we were lying. Luckily, he was extremely nice and understanding.  He did not question me whatsoever and we were able to get a refund of $36!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Best cookies I have ever had.

The cookies are on the small side, but definitely worth a dollar (if you buy six).  

My favorites have to be cookies and cream and toffee.  Anthony took an Oreo and made it into something a million times better.  The toffee is almost equally good.  Crispy edges, gooey middle.. delicious!

Seattle needs a place like this.
author: Vivian H.

description:
!!!!!!!!!!! I LOVE Anthony's cookies!!!!! I didn't regret a single calorie I was consuming when chewing on their perfectly decadent cookies. 

I came here over the holidays with Joe C and Clarice C on our way to dinner. Sadly, they were nearly sold out my the time we got there! 

Pros: (1) this place smells AMAZING 
(2) the staff is extremely friendly 
(3) lots of cookie flavors that rotate frequently 

Cons: (1) the location is a little hidden
(2) price: I think it's worth the price but some May find this place overpriced. 

I would DEFINITELY recommend Anthony's to any of the cookie monsters out there!
author: Courtney C.

description:
When this cookie shop first opened, I used to come here quite frequently for the first month i.e. several gatherings with a bunch of my favorite yelpers. 

I haven't been back in two years. And surprisingly on my return, owner-Anthony and younger brother-Marcus were there to bake and serve fresh cookies to his sweet-tooth customers. And the two still remembered me. 

Anthony still bakes some fresh and magnificent cookies. That doesn't change. 

I kind of knew that Anthony would one day serve coffee at his bakery. And he chose a good local company too: The Four Barrel Coffee Company. Nothing beats a great tasting French-pressed coffee with a 6-pack of fresh warm and gooey cookies for $8.00 ($6.00 for half-dozen and $2.00 coffee). Four Barrel: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=jA4KROtdzbof-epFHVOh0A

I bought two German Chocolate, two Chocolate Toffee Chip and two Cookie and Cream. And they were all moist, chewy and delicious. My treat: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=vgf8nsqzkouSw62XcouTAg

This is indeed one of the cleanest bakeries in the city with Health dept score: http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=MDPJcIWIHGvfIO7_mzswoQ

Now the shop accepts credit card with a $5.00 minimum purchase. 

Thanks to Anthony and Marcus for forgiving me on my absence and accepting me once again as one of his favorite customers.
author: Matt G.

description:
I was in town this past weekend for the 49ers game & I made sure to make a stop at Anthony's. My trip back home just wouldn't be complete without it. My taste buds would never forgive me. I brought a friend with me who's a self-proclaimed cookie monster & I assured him he would love the cookies. I also told him if he was smart, he would bring some back to LA to his wife. He bought a dozen. He loved the cookies & cream (who wouldn't) & also got chocolate chip & toffee chip. He & his wife liked those as well. 

I opted for 3 dozen because I planned on those being my other carry-on for my flight back to LA the next night. I went with 2 dozen cookies & cream, 6 toffee chip & 6 candied pecan. I must say, as good as the cookies & cream are... the candied pecan is slowly becoming my favorite. I just wish the cookies were bigger.

There was a sign on one of the chalkboards introducing a new COFFEE COOKIE. It described it as made with 72% dark chocolate & hand pressed coffee. It sounded delicious to me and it was new so I asked the girl behind the counter to put two coffee cookies aside in a bag separate from the 2 boxes containing the 3 dozen cookies I ordered. I asked for the boxes to be string-tied closed. 1 because it's an old school touch that I like when buying baked goods such as the Jewish bakery I go to in Fairfax District here in LA and 2 because it will ensure that I do not open it before I get home. HA! It works... The cookies stay pristine. I leave em alone. 

The problem was when I got back to my hotel that night. I noticed the separate bag for the 2 coffee cookies was missing. I feared she forgot to give them to me. I checked my receipt & I was charged for them. Not cheap $1.75 per coffee cookie... So I hoped, had my fingers crossed that they were in one of the boxes. I still didn't want to untie the string... Maybe I should have. I was headed to the Niner game the next am so there was no time to go back to Anthony's anyway. It was a morning til evening affair at the stadium... Alas, when I got home, I discovered there were no coffee cookies. I was bummed... Also was bummed for my friend Kat T. who asked me to bring her 1 coffee cookie home. She was bummed & suggested I call them.

So I called Anthony's when I got back to LA... Im usually not the complaining type but I felt the need to call & just let them know what happened so they can be more careful in the future. I spoke to Anna the business manager of Anthony's. She heard me out as I told her what happened. I told her I didn't want anyone to get in trouble. That wasn't the reason for my phone call... She was very pleasant to talk to, actually. She wanted to know what happened so she could advise her staff/front counter lead so that something like this wouldn't happen again. She asked for my email... She emailed me soon after we talked offering her sincerest apologies & thanked me for bringing the incident to their attention... They would use it to improve their service... I can tell you that Anna rectified the situation. She went beyond my expectations as far as service recovery & hearing me out. I appreciated that.

That's why these are the types of businesses I will always support... Anthony's Cookies being in my hometown & making the best damn cookies I've ever had are just icing on the cookie. Please go there... Go there now. Save me some.
author: Chuck D.

description:
I love Anothony's cookies with all my heart!! 

Ever since the first time my best bud Justina brought me here to try their cookies, I've been in love with them ever since. Not only do these cookies hold a sentimental value to me, but they're absolutely delicious. 

I've only tried 3 kinds here, which includes the cookies and cream, toffee, and a snickerdoodle type. If I can't just have the cookies and cream and toffee from here, I would be beyond happy. Crispy around the edges, chewy towards the center, and perfect all around. Another thing that I love about these cookies are that they're not made too sweet. Perfect with a cup of milk. Go #teammudbutt!

WORD OF ADVICE: Yes, the cookies and cream ones are everything people rave about but don't forget about the toffee! Also have a air sealed cookie jar handy. You'll want to keep the chewy.
author: Mike D.

description:
I have to fight myself from going to this place! I work about 10 mins away by car. There are days that in my head I'm thinking "I should go to Anthony's" but somehow fight the urge. 

Anthony has some kind of secret ingredient that tells your brain to crave his delicious cookies. 

I went in on a Friday before lunch and bought three dozen cookies for some out of town vendors that had flown in from Texas and Arizona. I was bummed that they didn't have cookies and cream but oh well. Next time! I saw Anthony in the background working but usually we'll chat it up but he was with someone in the back. All good, love this place, love the cookies!

In fact as I'm writing this I'm caving one now. You owe me a cookies and cream Anthony! Jk
author: thomas l.

description:
After having a burrito on Mission, I remembered that Anthony's was right around the corner from where I ate.  I justified dessert after a burrito by saying the burrito wasn't very big.  Later, I justified getting a bunch of cookies by saying it would help fill out my jeans in an effort to rock the skinny jean look.  Sadly, looking like a sausage in jeans is not the same as skinny jeans, but at least I had some good cookies in the process!

We got to the store and I told the guy behind the counter that I had never been there before.  He was super friendly and offered up samples of any cookie that I wanted to try.  After sampling, I got some chocolate chip, cookies-n-cream, peanut butter, and oatmeal chocolate chip cookies.

Even though everybody raves about the cookies-n-cream, I thought the stars were the chocolate chip and the peanut butter.  They were awesome! The cookies-n-cream and oatmeal chocolate chip were just meh.  I mean, I'd eat them if somebody gave them to me, and I'd enjoy the free cookies, but I wouldn't get them on my own.

Next time, I'll have to get some milk to fully enjoy the cookie experience!
author: Nadeem A.

description:
The only way this place could have less than a 5 star review is if:
1) You own Nestle Toll House and are trying to sabotage the competition. 
2)You have diabetes and are upset you can't enjoy this deliciousness.

Get here early, once they run out of a flavor, its gone!  Thank goodness I work a few blocks south on Valencia so I have a constant supply of this stuff. The staff here is super awesome and friendly.

Buy: Cookies and Cream, Oatmeal Raisin, Toffee.  You can thank me later.

I bought $30 worth of these to drop off to my family in the East Bay. On my walk/ride on BART, I had over 6 people comment about how Anthony's is the best.
author: Eric B.

description: These are super soft, super yummy cookies. My favorite is actually their cinnamon spice cookie. It is soft & chewy with a decadent spiced sugar crusting the top. A close second is their simple chocolate chip cookie, followed by their yummy cookies & cream cookie. The 1 ounce size is a perfect treat, but I definitely love the 2 ounce option. Then it's like you're eating a smaller number of cookies, right?
author: Kari G.

description:
Soooo...at first I was very skeptical about this place, because...cookies. Really? It's not that difficult to whip up a batch myself. BUT...based on the cookies and cream alone, I would be back. 

They don't offer any deals on buying in bulk...it's just priced per cookie, which I was pretty sorely disappointed by. All the cookies were pretty good, but the cookies and cream was by far my favorite because the flavor of the cookie is so unique and the texture is nice and chewy. The other cookies didn't really blow me away. The german chocolate was too coconutty for my taste. 

And the other cookies just tasted, well, like regular cookies that you might have been baked yourself with a good recipe.
author: Annie S.

description:
This is the best cookie store in the city. Some of the other hot cookie stores are good, they are just not as good as Anthony's. Here they have a daily menu that changes everyday. The cookies are usually served warm and the chocolate will melt in your mouth. 
The only thing that could be better about this place is its location. it should be right next to my house. 
I am thankful however that it is not next to my house because I would be one big fat cookie.
author: Ben M.

description:
The actual store is very neat and welcoming; I cannot forget to mention the enticing aroma!

I got the toffee chip, chocolate chip and cookies and cream. Every single one was delicious! 

Price is great too! 1.25 for 1 and they are a good size.
author: Becky W.

description:
Cookie cravings are like an epidemic for me! But not just any cookie will do to cure my ailment!  If I don't find the right cookie medication, I may turn in to a walking dead sooner than I had imagined! 

I tried a Keebler cookie and it did nothing for me! I tried a nabisco chocolate chip and it only made my epidemic speed up!
I was then told by a mystical yelper, of this magical cookie potion, Located in the land of the Mission, that there! I may find the cure that will prevent me from becoming the Cookie Monster.

The kingdom of Anthony's cookies! Is where the magical delicious cookies are located. I enter the the kingdom of Anthony and see bakers making these delicious cookies! Chocolate chip, toffee cookies, cookies n cream, peanut butter, walnut double chocolate, oatmeal chocolate cookies....the list goes on and on! The aroma of chocolate, hits my nose causing me to float in the air pulling me towards the counter. Once there, I place an order for walnut double chocolate chip and as soon as the cookie enters my mouth, I find myself in heavenly bliss from this fresh baked, moist, deliciously tasting cookie! It has cured me of Cookie Monster-itis. 

I order 5 more just to make sure I have more than enough to tame the beast within me. Thank you Anthony's cookies! Your cookies are awsome!
author: Roger P.

description: so been wanting to try these......and well they are chewy and lightly crunch at the edges but I felt they are SUPER sweet.... I understand they are cookies but I can so become a diabetic from these.
author: Trish W.

description:
Ummmmmmmmmmm...YUM.

That's all.
author: Jen E.

description:
I love Cookies and Cream Ice Cream and I love cookies. What's better than either one alone? The two of them combined into the most magnificent cookie your taste buds have ever seen! 

// FOOD // 
     + Cookies and Cream Cookie: The best cookie I've ever eaten (Aside from the chocolate chip and walnut cookie from Levain's in NYC). It may just look like a chocolate chip cookie with the chips replaced with Oreo chunks, but don't let appearances deceive you! The cookie is so much more complex than that with fine ground-up Oreo powder dispersed throughout the entire delish cookie
     +Oatmeal Chocolate: Yummy. The oatmeal adds chewiness to the cookie and the gives you the ill conceived notion you are eating something healthy ;)
     +White Chocolate Chip Cookie: A tad too sweet for me

Believe the hype. Eat the cookie.
author: Pauline P.

description:
They're amazing. Love the chocolate chip, the toffee, and the gluten free. 

These cause me to eat gluten, and it's dangerous but I don't care. So good. And their gluten-free cookies are bomb. You can't tell. I'm so picky about gluten-free stuff but their cookies are boooooomb.
author: Shaymaa M.

description:
Yes, these cookies live up to the hype and hoopla. No corners cut, just love and sweet gewdness.

Finally got to try these amazing product of Anthony's cookies Easter Sunday. Wanted to treat my cousin to some treats, so I got a few of her favorites. Oatmeal chocolate chip, white chocolate, toffee chip, chocolate chip walnut. Each cookie $1.50 each, got two of each so we can both try them.

Ever wanted to know what pure bliss with rainbows, a baby's laughter, and hugs from the Snuggle bear tastes like? Each cookie encompasses that. Every cookie had the right amount of chewiness and crunch (how is that even possible?), sweetness, and chocolate chip/cookie/nut ratio. Personally, I am picky about that filling ratio, but because the quality of the ingredients are so good and they know exactly what to put in each batch, I'm down.

Yes, lil pricey, but worth it, I promise.

Finna get some cookie monsta craves? Don't go anywhere else but here.
author: Kristine T.

description:
Came here with my girlfriend the other day, and I had NO IDEA this place existed. If I didn't know about it, I would have just walked past it.

It's a REALLY small shop with only one long table and bench to sit at. Very empty but clean. They have the list of cookies available on the wall and advertising their specials (they had a coffee cookie offered only on saturdays & sundays .. too bad I went on a friday). So I decided to try a cookies and cream cookie, and a double dark chocolate one. I wasn't disappointed with both. They were so rich and chewy in flavor. My girlfriend got a 2 oz. cookies and cream cookie and a carton of milk. The staff was super friendly in helping us out as well.. and there were free samples of cookies at the counter! Yayyy can't deny free cookies.

 Definitely coming back here if I'm in the area again!
author: Kathleen S.

description: These cookies are fine, but not worth the 5 star ecstasy people are expressing. They are thin, kind of chewy, and not especially flavorful. Very sweet. I did like the chocolate spice one. The store itself is cute and they have free samples. They sell milk to go with your cookies. Not much in the way of seating.
author: Lisa B.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place for over 2 years, ever since I was planning my wedding and contacted them to cater the dessert.  I never got a reply.

If you've had a good cookie, meaning something better than the pre-mixed supermarket kind or the actual supermarket kind, then Anthony's Cookies aren't too different from the good kinds you can get nowadays.  Cookie competition is stiff.

Why do these cookies look so damn big in pictures?  Yelpers' photos make them look like the size of my palm but in reality, they have a diameter of about 2.5".  They each cost $1.25 with the exception of some "special" ones that cost $1.50.

Now, the chocolate chip cookie was really sweet.  With a little more salt, I feel like the cookie could be more balanced.  I also had this cookie at relatively cold, room temperature because it was closer to the end of the day.  That added to the overall underwhelming feeling.

I also tried the German Chocolate cookie which I'm guessing, by it's name, should have some combination of three things: 1) chocolate, 2) coconut, and 3) pecans.  The cookie's base was chocolate bit definitely a more cake-like texture.  The coconut bits were inside but I do not remember pecans.  I wouldn't get this again because it wasn't too exciting to eat.

You can't go wrong with chocolate chip though.
author: Shannon L.

description:
It's hard to distinguish between good cookies and great cookies because most of the time cookies are pretty tasty! After eating at this place you will know what a great cookie tastes like. 

I recommend going old school and eating the chocolate chip cookie. Also sometimes they offer a discount if you buy more than a couple cookies.
author: Ashwin M.

description:
Great texture: Slightly crispy on the outside, soft & chewy on the inside.  Great flavor: Sweet without being overly sweet.  Buttery without being oily.
Good service:  The woman that helped us was friendly.

Cookies are $1.25 each or you can get 6 for $6.00.  They have a several flavors they have everyday and rotate other flavors on a daily basis.

My husband & I bought 1/2 a dozen cookies (2 Cookies & Cream, 2 Toffee Chip, a Chocolate Chip & a Walnut Chocolate Chip).  We took a bite of the Cookies & Cream and the Toffee Chip as we drove off in our car and almost turned right back around to buy more.

Anthony's Cookies are really pretty fantastic cookies.  We'll be repeat customers for sure.
author: Rose A.

description:
And here I thought I already wrote a review here! Whaaatt?!

I used to work two blocks from here several years ago and knew the owners well. If it was a stressful day, during my lunch I would grab some cookies to-go. It's a small little shop with the red door. Metered parking on this side of Valencia actually isn't that bad but I'd be sure to feed the meter because the meter-maids around here are vicious!

Flavors I've tried:
Toffee Chip
Cinnamon Spice
White Chocolate Macadamia
Peanut Butter
German Chocolate
Walnut Double Chocolate Chip
Walnut Chip
Oatmeal Cranberry
Oatmeal Chocolate Chip
Banana Walnut
Cookies n Cream

$1.25/cookie

My favorites are the Toffee Chip, Cinnamon Spice, Peanut Butter Oatmeal Chocolate Chip and Oatmeal Cranberry. Some of the cookies are fairly small (specifically the oatmeal ones). Not your Specialty's size. So this is a forewarning! But they're oh so very good. I've brought them to many family gatherings and even the uncles and aunts who don't typically eat sweets loved them. Yes, even the hoity-toity relatives too.
author: Kitty K.

description: Pretty unique spot since you hardly hear of stand alone cookie shops anymore but this place is cool. They have a bunch of flavors to choose from, along with milk if you choose. Honestly, I'd still go with Arizmendi's Mint chocolate chip cookie but if you're looking to try something else, I would recommend Anthony's.
author: Neil I.

description:
I wonder if I came in here on a bad day? The cookies that everyone raves about on here were small, dry, and a bit stale.

I came in on a Saturday at 5pm, so I can't imagine the cookies not being freshly baked that day. I ordered one of each cookie that was offered that day too so I'm fairly certain I got a good range and idea of what they have to offer.

Sorry Anthony, but I would skip this place in favor of Hot Cookie next time.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
I love me my cookies and I definitely hyped this place up since it is an entire shop that makes only cookies! The line was short and parking was free on the streets so that was a plus. They have so many flavors to choose from but I got dark chocolate chip, oatmeal chocolate chip, cookies and cream, chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, and toffee chip. I was most excited about the cookies and cream because that alone is the best flavor for desserts and it was in cookie form factor. It tastes exactly what it sounds like but nothing crazy special. My second favorite was the chocolate chip since you cant go wrong with that. It was chewy and good. I had a bite of my friends peanut butter cookie and boy, one bite was enough. It was so peanut buttery that I couldnt take any more. The other flavors I could have gone without. I would say that the cookies are average in my opinion and for $1.25 each for a thin small cookie, it is something I would try once. Nothing can ever beat my Specialty's cookies that are huge with a chocolate piece in every bite. 

**TIPS**
1) I would  get the chocolate chip and cookies and cream cookie only next time.
2) Enjoy!
author: Amy H.

description:
5/5 stars for excellent service, tasty treats, and affordable prices! 

it was my first time here, and the cashier helped me decide which cookies to buy by letting me taste a few of his favorites! I literally ate a whole cookie in tasting alone and didn't even feel guilty about it because the guy was so nice and genuinely wanted me to find the best cookie for me!

i ended up getting a variety, but the good old chocolate chip was my favorite. the cookie is also a good size, so you don't feel guilty having one. and at a $1.25 each, my wallet didn't feel too empty either!
author: Asmita J.

description: I love visiting this place not only because it's near my apartment but also because Anthony knows how to make a cookie. This place is a definite must visit when coming to San Francisco.   Cookies are a little pricey but after all they are damn good.
author: Michael H.

description:
My favorite cinnamon cookie in SF !
Love this place and the staff is very nice and smile all the time
author: Amandine I.

description: YUM. Stopped by on a rainy weekend afternoon. I was originally on a hunt for some ice cream to satisfy my sweets craving, but decided to branch out and try something new. Pros: toffee chip cookie and milk hit the spot. Cons: they were out of chocolate chips...how do you not have chocolate chips? A good number of other flavors ran out as well. I guess you need to come early! Otherwise a pretty solid stop to satisfy your sweet tooth. They seem to sell cookies in batches to go as well.
author: N G.

description:
Cookies were okay... Certainly hyped up but not terrible. Fulfilled my sweet tooth but didn't leave bragging about it. 

A tad expensive. If you want quality cookies that are fresh and the best price. Make them yourself. 

But if you are too lazy or stoned- go here.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Love this cute little place! My absolute favorite is the cookies n cream cookie, white chocolate comes trailing behind. So aside from the cookies n cream being mind blowingly delicious, I took a picture of my cookie (annoying Asian that I am LOL) and posted it on Instagram and a lot of my friends in NJ literally want me to bring them home! This particular cookie is genius and is way better than the ice cream flavor itself!

#cookiemonsterwin
author: Nicolette P.

description: These are the best cookies in all of San Francisco! Come early as they do sell out of popular flavors. Chocolate chip is my go-to and never fails me. Simply the best!
author: corina o.

description:
The cookies here are so yummy, but pricey to what I'm used to. $1.50 for 1 ounce of cookies. I don't know why I thought: "oh ok, an ounce of cookies is like 2 or 3 right? Must be mini cookies." No. It's one regular sized cookie. One regular, deliciously sized cookie. They wee soft, yet a bit of a crunch because of the white sugar they must've used. I bought the dark chocolate and a chocolate chip cookie. I closed my eyes as I are this piece of heaven, but my heart cried on how small they were. 

When I walked in, I was confused because the counter was so far from the door, I thought I had entered like through the room where they made the cookies. They have a menu on the wall and let's you know, by using check marks, what cookie are available for sale. 

I also bough an iced coffee which had a weird, almost acidic taste once I was almost done drinking it. I don't think I've experienced some thing like that before, but whatever I still downed it with a frown. 

If it was pay day or if I wanted to really treat myself, I'd come back and buy some cookies. Otherwise, this place for me is like a once every other week treat.
author: Cecilia S.

description: Anthony's is a little gem in the Mission.  My daughter loves the Cookies and Cream and the Chocolate Chip.  The cookies are perfectly crispy, chewy, and not greasy or dry.  The flavors all come together nicely and they are the perfect size so you don't overindulge and can try a few different options.  They also make a great treat for out of town guests and during the holidays.
author: Ana W.

description:
This is a 2 STAR review (but as always, I average all my ratings)

This review has NOTHING to do with the actual cookies; they were delicious as always.

So why the 2 stars?

I was ordering 2 dozen cookies made up of 2-3 of the various flavors that were on the board.  My boyfriend & I have always ordered our cookies this way & have never had a problem.  Since it was a little bit complicated with all the flavors, the cashier triple checked our order before tying off the box.  He actually caught a couple of missing cookies afterwards & gave them to me in a bag.  I really appreciated his attention to detail so I left feeling confident in my order.  When we got home & opened the box, there were only 21 cookies, that's including the 2 that were in the bag!  We figured we were missing the 3 Double dark chocolate chips; this was extra disappointing because I was really looking forward to tasting them.

Let me be very clear: I know this was a complete accident!

However, when there are so many products, there needs to be a system in place that can avoid this type of mistakes.  I think the iPad POS system is really great but if the cashier is leaving out cookies because he couldn't see the entire order all in 1 place, then maybe something different is required.
author: Karen S.

description: If you want a cookie with the perfect amount of sweetness without overdoing it with the perfect amount of softness that lets you chew it but then literally melts in your mouth.. then you gotta go to Anthony's Cookies! Highly recommended with milk. Absolute perfection yum :D A tad bit expensive for one ($1.50) but I do recommend trying just to say you've had it! It's nice to treat yourself once a while right? And these cookies will definitely be your next guilty pleasure!
author: Christine L.

description:
Are Anthony's cookies my favorite cookies that I've ever purchased?  -- easily, YES

I've been frequenting Anthony's cookies since they first opened.

Since then, I've brought friends, family, visitors from out of town...just about everyone I can think of that would appreciate a delicious cookie to this location. Everything about Anthony's is marvelous. From the simple decor lined with glass milk cans, to the fact that you can see the cookies made fresh before your very eyes, to the friendly staff that services you with a smile and wraps up your cookies with the most TLC that I've ever seen cookies receive in my life.

If I love the cookies so much then why the 4 star review and not 5 star review? Well, after being absent from the Bay Area for awhile, I was excited to be in SF for a weekend...of course making an Anthony's Cookies stop a must on my list. The cookies are now sold at a flat price -- $1.25 per cookie. There is no longer an ever so slight discount for buying a set amount of cookies.

I myself come from a small business so I know that every penny counts, but I really wish there would be some sort of reward for loyal customers. Whether it be a punch card of a stamp after spending $10, and after 5 stamps you get three free cookies...or whether it be just rewarding your loyal customers that come and buy dozens of cookies...it'd be nice to see a little give back.

(Cookies lovers that have been to SF and LA may know of a place called Diddy Reese in LA. Their cookies are deeeelicious and literally come dirt cheap -- they always have a line (rain or shine) because of this. I would love to see Anthony's Cookies with a line outside of the door.)

But in terms of cookies, you really can't beat the love and taste of Anthony's cookies.
author: Riana C.

description: Love love love this place!! My favorite cookie shop of all time! The must have is the Cookies & Cream (my favorite out of the bunch). I also like the toffee chip and oatmeal raisin but everything is delicious. If you don't believe me, go try them for yourself. Anthony sure knows how to bake some amazing, tasty cookies. Definitely worth the price ($1.25 per cookie), trust me :P
author: Melanie C.

description:
I was at the barber shop over the weekend and my barber said "Hec. Anthony's Cookies is bomb! You gotta check it out."

I rarely hear my barber toss around praise like that. He usually says it's "aight" and leaves it at that without much explanation. 

I took a drive down there yesterday and was excited to get my hands on a delicious cookie. 

Based simply on the number of Yelp reviews, I was expecting to wait in a long line that would sill out the door. Didn't happen. 

We walked in and immediately were greeted by a gentlemen behind the counter telling us "I can give you a sample of anything we have. Want to try somethin'?" We tried the cinnamon spice cookie, which was very good. The oatmeal choco chip was also very good. We decided to get a dozen and take them home for dessert.

The cookies were very good, but they were not warm. I love few things in this world more than I love a warm cookie. Maybe they can create a device to keep the cookie warm after it's baked w/o cooking it more? Or maybe they can do a better job of keeping the door closed.

I can't give this place 4 or 5 stars, but it's not b/c the cookies are terrible it's just b/c they are small and a bit expensive for a tiny cookie.
author: Hector G.

description:
I'm eating a cookie as I speak. 

Cookies and cream! Amazing. This is their most famous cookie flavor and what their known for. $1.50 per cookie. I've tried the white chocolate chip, toffee, peanut butter and their coffee one. They were all good but nothing stood out than the cookies and cream. I like their peanut butter one too, beware it crumbles! Super soft. They also have Straus Organic milk in huge glass jars for $5. Perfect combination and a very sweet surprise gentlemen *ahem*. 

One star off because some of their cookies have different sizes. I think that's a little odd. You have one big cookie and then a much smaller one for the same price? They should definitely be consistent no matter what flavor the cookie is.

They also let you sample whatever flavor you want to try, which I think is really nice.
author: Laura T.

description:
Went here a few weeks ago, but because this place is THAT good, I had to remember to leave a review.

From Houston and from word of mouth came to check out this place.

Cutest cookie shop ever. Walk in and lo and behold is Anthony himself at the register welcoming you into his place. If you wanna talk supporting good people, passion and a great business with an amazing product. Come here.
Cookies. Are. To. Die. For. 

Cookies and cream is a must. But tried so many of the cookies and they were all soo good! When I find myself in San Francisco again, I'm definitely coming back!
author: Sarah M.

description:
I love cookies that taste like they are baked from home. Most cookies out there taste very commercial, mass produced! Anthony's cookies is a small neighborhood shop with different flavors. These cookies are heaven! They taste like they just came
out of your mother's kitchen oven! The Cookies and Cream (their signature cookie)and the white chocolate chip cookies are my favorite! They are just the right size and thickness. I love chewy cookies and every time I bite into their cookie it melts in my mouth! They are generous on letting you try cookies too!
author: Maria M.

description:
The very first time I tried Anthony's was when my good friend (CM) brought some of them to our apartment two years back. My first bite was in to the cookies & cream cookie, and then the toffee chip, and then the walnut double chocolate chip, and then...well I was hooked ever since if you see where this is going!!!!

I decided to share my love for these cookies with my coworkers for one of their birthdays. I bought a dozen to share ($1.25 per cookie, no discount for a dozen order). I came in on a Sunday and unfortunately they were out of the cookies and cream! I should've known better than to come in 20 minutes before closing time. :(

But that's okay! Because the walnut double chocolate chip, the cinnamon spice, and oatmeal chocolate chip that I got were so moist, chocolate-y, and just so perfectly made!

You definitely have to come check this place out if you're in the city! It's one of the best cookie shops out there.
author: Loriel L.

description:
My girlfriend is just a tad bit crazy.

She bought $50 worth of cookies these past 2 times swinging by this place.  Sure they are soft on the inside and crispy on the outside but thats a lot of cookies to go through.  I guess its slightly justified that she shares some of them with her relatives, friends, and myself but she'll consume 5 cookies a day ONLY after restraining herself not to finish it all in one day.  Her personal favorites are the cookies and cream ones but honestly they are all pretty good.

Happy Om Nom Noms!
author: Samuel Y.

description:
Maybe I'm missing something, but I wasn't all that impressed by Anthony's cookies. Did I come at the wrong hour? It was 5:30 pm and all the cookies were cold and sitting on sheet pans behind the counter. We got a half dozen; out of the six, I liked the walnut chip the best. I don't know what the fascination is with the cookies & cream cookie. I tasted the Oreo, but no cream. 

I tried a couple of the samples, which was nice because you get to taste a quarter of a cookie when an entire cookie costs $1. It seems like if you put up a nice storefront with some fancy products like bottles of organic Strauss milk, you can charge more. The cookies were small so I didn't find any value in paying a dollar for them. I think I would rather buy a McChicken.
author: Bailey Z.

description:
These cookies are no fancy shmancy or refined bakery goods.... They are like the best homemade cookies that grandma only DREAMED of making...they are simple and without frills, total perfection. 

I love pretty much all the cookies they have but especially the oatmeal, cookies and cream and toffee....

These cookies are beautifully chewy and perfect in every way...

Only drawbacks are that they are on the small side and cost 1.50$ a piece
author: Mikaela K.

description: Ordered cookies here for a professional event. Delivery was right on time and everything worked as planed. Cookies were delicious considering that they are also reasonably priced. I would order at Anthony's again for large amount of cookies.
author: Melanie P.

description:
Bottom line at the top: bomb cookies!!
--
Came here close to closing time and they still had a pretty solid amount of choices! We got cookies and cream, toffee chip, walnut double chocolate chip, and gluten free chocolate chip--cookies and cream was definitely my favorite :)
author: Dahlia S.

description:
Meh. I tried 3 of their cookies: Cookies and cream, Toffee Crunch, and their Oatmeal chocolate chip. 

First off, I want to say these taste like any ordinary homemade cookies. So yes they are better than store bought cookies, but you could easily make your own favorite cookies at home (but yes, you would have a batch of like 2 dozen cookies you would have to eat or share). However, if these cookies aren't freshly baked/warm, then their taste/texture gets exponentially... worse.

So flavors, Their cookies and cream is definitely the best, It tastes more like the cookies part of an oreo than the cream, so it has the crunch factor, The Toffee crunch did not have the crunchy toffee that I was expecting. It was more like a flavor with bits of softish toffee mixed in? And the Oatmeal chocolate chip, tasted a bit cinnamon-y? Not quite sure, but I think I rather make my own cookies at home.
author: Mikayla L.

description:
Ugh. After seeing all the raving Yelp reviews about this place and the multiple restaurant reviews about how fantastic this place was, I was sorely disappointed. Overrated.

To be fair, Anthony's Cookies isn't bad. But is it fantastic enough for me to pay $1.25 per cookie? Eh. I got the toffee chip cookie, white chocolate cookie, and oreo cookie. They were good... but nothing super. I don't know, maybe it's because I didn't get them when they were warm from the oven? They actually struck me as on the crunchy side. They were decently soft, but not mouth melting soft. The flavor was fine, but wasn't mind blowing or anything. 

This place reminds me of Sprinkles with the special flavors coming out on special days and everything. I even tried to Diddy Reese this place by putting some ice cream on the cookies, but meh. Nothing spectacular.

tldr; okay for cookies, but don't expect anything fantastic
author: Jasmine X.

description:
Had brunch with a gf recently and she asked me if I've heard of Anthony's cookies.  I am embarrassed to say that I haven't.  Where have I been, living under a rock!?  Then again, I wonder if I concentrate my efforts on eating donuts.  Must expand my sweet tooth......

I came out buying 8 cookies.  3 dark chocolate chip, 2 oatmeal chocolate chip, 1 toffee and 2 cookies and cream.   We loved all of them, though we wouldn't have to buy the oatmeal ones again.  My next order will be heavy on the dark chocolate chip and cookies and cream!  Will have to add this to my required stops when I'm in the city!
author: Dawn D.

description: Cookies are heaven!! I just wish they didn't run out so fast! If you want the best ones go before 1pm!
author: Britt N.

description:
People rave about the cookies & cream cookies.
Whatever!! 

I am all about the toffee cookies. 

Each cookie is perfection. Slightly crispy with a little give on the outside.. You take a bite and get that first tiny crunch but the rest of the bite is chewy and soft. 

And that my friends, is how a cookie should be. 

Prior to making my own trip to Anthony's, I had only had these little bad boys twice. The second time I had these cookies was just a mere 2 days ago. 

I'll tell you something. My friend brought 2 dozen various Anthony's cookies to our Friendsgiving potluck. I only ate ONE toffee cookie. For dinner that night we had a charcuterie platter, baked Brie, prime rib (done by yours truly), bacon wrapped asparagus, smoked salmon vodka cream pasta, red wine braised oxtails, Russian potato salad... A cheesecake from Zanze's, pumpkin bundt cake..... I gained 4 pounds this damn weekend but all I thought about were Anthony's cookies. Nothing stopped me from getting these damn cookies. 

Well, Jason Statham running around shirtless on television temporarily put my cookie plans on halt but yano, it's Jason Statham. SHIRTLESS.

Still?

I beared the annoyance of driving to the Mission just for these cookies and you should too.
author: Susy C.

description:
The cookies and cream flavor is their best selling cookie and for good reason. Crushed Oreo cookies in a brown sugar cookie? How do people come up with these things. They also sell milk and other drinks, candied nuts, and give samples!

On a saturday afternoon around 3pm they sold out so be sure to come early to get your cookie fix. I also really liked the double chocolate chip because frankly, I'm addicted to chocolate.

$1.25 for a ~2.5in cookie seems a little steep but it's definitely a nice pit stop every once in a while if you're craving something sweet.
author: Audrey C.

description: After having the cravings of all cravings for a cookie, a trip to Anthony's was basically imminent when I found out that work was having an event nearby at Urban Putt.  In doing some (serious) research into the cookie situation in SF, I concluded that no matter what the circumstances were, I was determined to come here based on the reviews I had read and all of the Instagram cookie porn you could imagine. Showing up here without a game plan was ill advised though, I was overwhelmed with the delicious smell of baked butter, sugar, and flour, and I seriously contemplated buying one of everything on their chalkboard menu.  Needless to say, I curbed myself into ordering just three: Cookies and Cream (which came recommended by a co-worker who had Anthony's Cookies at her wedding), the Toffee Chip Cookie (recommended by 7x7's The Big Sweet), and a personal favorite of mine, the classic Chocolate Chip Cookie.  Out of the three, the Toffee Chip was probably my favorite, followed by a close second in the Cookies and Cream.  My husband being a huge Oreo fan absolutely loved the Cookies and Cream, and both of us agreed that if we were to eat these fresh out of the oven, it'd be heavenly and sinful all at the same time.  Call me cookie monster because I'm coming back for sure.
author: Lisa I.

description:
This is where your lust for other cookies goes to die.  

There is nothing else to say here.
author: Diane N.

description: No frills cookie spot, with a nice selection of cookies. It's a grab and go spot that also sells milk and bottled juice. Only gripe is the variation of cookie sizes. Depending on the flavor, you either get a small thick cookie or slightly larger flat cookie. Would come here more often if the cookies were all the same shape and size.
author: mary c.

description: I walked into work today, and saw these cookies sitting on the desk. My boss bought 3 different kinds, chocolate chip, toffee chip  and cookies and cream. The cookie and cream and toffee chip were OK, not that exciting to me. When I took a bite of the chocolate chip cookie, it was a party in my mouth. I love the chocolate chewy gooey feeling when I bite the cookie. I would definitely recommend this place, even though it is a little pricey.
author: MzzzK C.

description:
The "cookies and cream" are possibly some of the best cookies I've ever had in my life. Crispy exterior with a chewy center, absolutely phenomenal. I also tried the peanut butter and oatmeal cranberry which weren't as good. I didn't enjoy the more crumby, dry texture of the peanut butter as much. The oatmeal cranberries were decent but they don't quite stack up when compared to the cookies and cream.

Cookies are a bit on the small side for $1.25 each, but the cookies and cream are definitely worth the splurge. I'll be sure to stop by again if I'm ever in the area.
author: Kevin N.

description:
I love cookies and Anthony's cookies are good. But not life changing for me. They taste just like how any really good homemade cookie would taste... sweet, chewy and all around delicious.

I got the chocolate chip, cookies & cream and toffee chip (their most popular flavors). They were all pretty sweet and slightly greasy as expected but I still enjoyed them. To me, they were nothing too special. For $1.25 each, they are on the smaller side (especially compared to Diddy Riese). They have different flavors available everyday along with their daily staple flavors.

I was lucky and didn't have to wait as I walked in on a sunny Saturday afternoon. Anthony was there and said hi and the staff was friendly and helpful. It's definitely worth a try if you're in the area but I wouldn't venture all the way here just for these. But if you do end up grabbing some cookies, walk a couple blocks and enjoy them with a four barrel coffee :) Lastly, don't be afraid to ask for a sample, they will cut you a piece!
author: Andrea P.

description: I found out that Anthony's Cookies actually provides the toffee cookies at Blue Bottle in the financial district. Amazing taste at an affordable price to pair with your coffee. I definitely recommend this for all first-timers!
author: Thomas L.

description: The cookies are tiny in comparison to some other popular cookie stops but the cinnamon sugar was delicious! Fairly pricey for what you get, but it's quiet, small and relaxing usually without a line, which most bakeries in the area can't say.
author: Evan S.

description:
Cooooooookies!

$1.25 for a small cookie but it's worth it, and smaller portion = less fatty, right? Unless you get 2 or 3 or 10 more.. ha! You can choose to sample a cookie, and the staff will quickly cut it up for you. I love the Oatmeal walnut chip, and can't go wrong with chocolate chip cookie. Plus a 1/4 pint of milk :)
author: Christine C.

description:
What can I really add that hasn't been said already? Regardless, Anthony's Cookies are DELICIOUSSSS. They are a bit pricy for their size but aw man, when you bite into that cookie, you totally forget you paid 1.25 for those 4 bites.

Those four DELICIOUS GOOEY BITES THOUGH. are so good. My friend and I split a Cookies and Cream, Toffee Chip and Candied Pecan Chip.

The Verdict dundundunnnnn
-Cookies and Cream: GET IT. It's small but thick and not overly sweet or understated. I don't even usually like cookies&cream but I LOVE THIS COOKIE.
-Toffee Chip: TRY IT. It's not overly sweet like I was afraid of, and the toffee is gooey and sticky without getting stuck in your teeth. love it!
-Candied Pecan Chip: Meh. This cookie was alright. It didn't have the moistness of the other two and felt stickier than the toffee chip.

I'll be back  to try some more ;)
author: Rissa F.

description: Best cookies ever! And I am not a cookie person. My kids love the cookies and cream. Worth the cost. Nice to have for a get together or to bring to a party.
author: Pilar N.

description:
PARKING
Street parking

I have honestly tried everything on this menu. I use the live in the outer Richmond of San Francisco and would make my visits here often. I love love love their cookies! And so perfect with your milk or coffee!! Yummmm
author: Christina T.

description:
On any given Saturday, you can find these 11 angels of heaven here:

Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip***
Walnut Double Chocolate Chip
Candied Pecan Chip***
Dark Chocolate Chip***
German Chocolate ***
Peanut Butter
Toffee Chip***
Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin***
White Chocolate Chip***
Cookies & Cream***
Classic Chocolate Chip***

The starred ones were my favorite ones, but honestly, they were ALL good. I'm allergic to walnuts (still ate it) and I just generally don't particularly favor peanut butter cookies (except these). Don't order based only on what I starred here. Order EVERYTHING.

Every day they make a certain flavors. If you go to their website they'll show you what's available for that day. We came here on a Saturday and got a dozen cookies to share among friends; 1 of every flavor and 1 extra. Got the box, sat down in their small, simple, yet cozy seating area. There are 11 different flavors, 12 cookies, and about 8 people... There's no way everyone can get a cookie of every flavor for themselves! 

Solution: Nibble, nibble, pass. You know the drill! 

Every, single, bite, from every, single cookie was... heavenly! The flavors were so rich and incredibly delicious. They weren't fresh out of the oven, but the chocolate still melted in my mouth. What is this cookie miracle?! I thought I knew what a good oatmeal cookie was, until I came here. By the gods! These cookies are DIVINE! Praise Anthony for helping me see the light! I'm ready to be baptized in a fountain of milk and swear to never crave another's cookie again!!!

Try and buy just 1. I DARE you.
author: Lisa N.

description: The Cookie and Cream cookie has my heart! Although, the cookie is a bit expensive, I believe it's worth it.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
You really have to pay attention when looking for this place because it's easy to miss.  

I tried these flavors: cookies n cream, toffee chip, white chocolate, german chip, dark chocolate.  
It's good, not overly sweet, definitely taste the flavor but what's the fuss? I mean you can definitely taste the quality of the ingredients they use are good.  You can taste the flavor not just sugar unlike those big cookie companies.  I guess I had higher expectations due to the high reviews.  Or maybe I was expecting a chewy melt in your mouth like Hot Cookie or Levain Bakery from NYC.  Or maybe I just prefer those kind of cookies.  
Maybe I'll give this place another try, maybe I missed something.  Gosh I'm too nice.
author: Claire J.

description: Off tops, this is my favorite! Anthony's cookies are so heavenly that it brings happiness into my life in each bite. Cookies and cream and toffee nut are my favorite! I promised you it will not disappoint!
author: Vickie N.

description:
My sweet tooth is a demanding beast, and has been pulling me toward Anthony's Cookies ever since I found out about them. I was celebrating my birthday this past Saturday, and used the afternoon to gather up every treat in my path in preparation for a delicious night of sinful gluttony. 

I found my way over to Anthony's mid-afternoon. Parking wasn't much of an issue but I'm sure half the city was down in the Marina celebrating Fleet Week so it may have been a fluke. I was practically running down the sidewalk while my boyfriend fed the meter, but when I got to the storefront the door was locked. It was around 2PM and the sign said they closed at 5. So I jiggled the door handle a little harder because I could see a few employees and one customer milling about inside. I peered in through the glass as everyone looked at me in disgust as if I were a pathetic stray puppy begging for scraps. I'm not one to give up in these situations. If they were hoping I'd wander off to some other cookie dispensary, they were mistaken. My desire for cookies trumped my annoyance that none of the employees could bother themselves to open the door. 

About 5-10 minutes later, the customer left the store and I made my move. By this time, a few other people joined the resistance outside and we flooded in ready to get our fix. 

I ordered the much-hyped cookies and cream, a German chocolate, peanut butter, white chocolate chip, chocolate chip, and a coffee cookie for the bf. I was a little surprised at how small they were for the price, but that just meant I had more room for more cookies so I was cool with it. 

To say I was let down is an understatement. I've never met a cookie I didn't like, and that was no exception here, but they weren't really that great. My boyfriend actually took a bite of the coffee and threw the rest out, but I hate coffee myself so I can't really comment further on that. The cookies and cream was pretty good and the only one I actually finished. Everything else was a resounding Meh. They were a little too crunchy and dry for my taste - like crouton cookies. I prefer the gooier, softer, chewier kind. I could whip up cookies myself that are better than this. 

For everyone on here claiming these are the best cookies you've ever had... do you eat a lot of cookies? I just can't fathom a universe in which these are as good as it gets. And frankly I wouldn't want to live in that universe.
author: Chrissy S.

description:
HEMGEE can i just these really as good as it gets to homemade amazing cookies?! IM not even big on sweets but this place issues bad! bad for you but definitely very good too ;)
Faves are choice chip,white choice,cookies and cream
author: Nessy N.

description:
I've never been much of a milk drinker - that's why I'm so short. My grandma at a young age taught most of her grandchildren to dip Ritz crackers in coffee (it's actually very good!). When I eat Oreos, I don't dip them in milk. I tend to buy them double-stuffed, throw away half of the cookie, and much on the double cream layer atop one chocolate cookie. Recently, I discovered Golden Oreo Cookies, where I don't really have to do much of anything to them, but then I miss out on the chocolate flavor.

This is where Anthony's Cookies come in -- hands down the best cookies I've ever had. Their Cookies & Cream are so delicious and the perfect blend of soft on the inside and crispy on the outside. AND--- It is the first cookie I've had that I love drinking milk with! It also doesn't hurt that the organic milk they have at the store is really good quality.T heir packaging and bags are really cute here too and would make great presents if you're having a hard time thinking of something.

Some of the flavors I didn't appreciate as much: White Chocolate Chip (wish they had macadamian nuts and I didn't like the white chocolate so much), Oatmeal Raisin (Mother's Iced Oatmeal does it for me better) and Toffee Chip (my sister told me I should have waited a day to eat it, tastes better). Boyfriend really likes the Cinnamon Spice, but I can only have one at a time since they are a bit too on the "spice" side for me.

I used to work for Mrs. Fields where the cookies are frozen and then put in the oven and way more expensive. I will probably never patron Mrs. Fields ever again now. However, I do think Mrs. Fields Butter Toffee beats the Toffee Chip here and the Mrs. Fields Snickerdoodles are too different from the Cinnamon Spice to compare.

I think people can get very passionate about these cookies-- my sister got really upset when my brother ate her cookies and she always makes sure now I buy a separate dozen for her that no one else can have.
author: Ghia G.

description:
Ok ok ok I was skeptical, when people say better then Ms. Fields I was like wait wuttt, if you buy it at the grocery store and make it yourself it is the same as long as you stick with the brand you like. Ms Fields puuhahaha, that is not something really great, it's got to be one of those places that is hard to get, not something mainstream this is what make this place so much better

Here as most people wrote, cookies on point, chewy, soft, room temperature need to be accompanied by a venti glass of vitamin D milk hell yeah VITAMIN MILK!!!!! All the rumors are true, sadly these cookies are about standard cookie size not huge which I don't mind, We tried 10 of the cookies that were available that day every single one was a hit for me, and I don't like chocolate, so yes I am a believer. below is the break down 1 for ehh 5 for excellent

5 MF 5 -toffee chip good and sweet, 
5 dam right another 5 -cookies and cream was my favorite
4 cinnamon spice - different kinda of sweet
2 white chocolate chip - too sweet, I am usually a fan but jesus this cookie can be used as a creamer
3.5 oatmeal raisin better then grocery brand
3 oatmeal chocolate chip - not a real fan of chocolate but this was good
3 candied pecan chocolate - I would try it again
4 walnut double chocolate - I don't like chocolate but dam this is a good cookie
1 german chocolate - I will have to come back I do not recall the taste of this flavor
3 chocolate chip - like the others chewy and delicious

It helps if you don't try to quad stack these cookies and devour all in one sitting, bring a kid with you, maybe a niece or nephew or your own kid, they will greatly be appreciative until of course they crash from the sugar high. haha 

definitely a must try if you have a craving for good cookies and you are in the city

cookies **** solid 4 stars
service ***** excellent
price $
ambiance **** on slightly long table inside, neat and all wood, floors, walls, ceiling, take the cookies to go, remember to close the door to maintain the COOKIES freshness.(friggin feel like a Cookie Monster Nazi) haha again must try if you are craving cookies.
author: Clarence A.

description:
My girlfriend and I came here around 4:30 pm and there's a line inside. Apparently it's good, so the line is a good thing, I thought to myself. 

We bought two 2oz chocolate chip cookies, and let me say: I was not disappointed! The cookies were crispy on the outside, and when you bit into them they would give way to a chewy consistency. Along with the aforementioned texture, the richness of the dough, the sweetness and balance of the chocolate chip culminated a truly ideal cookie. 

Best cookie I've had thus far! Two thumbs up!
author: Kevin L.

description:
I wish I had never found out about this place.  If there is one major weakness I have, it is for cookies.  My sweet tooth is ALWAYS raging for a chewy chocolate chip cookie.  And even though I have never taken a step into Anthony's Cookies, I can say theirs is one of the best I've ever had.  They have mastered the art of the cookie to chocolate ratio, have computed the optimal level of sweetness, and have found a way to keep their cookies buttery and chewy.  There are no words.  All their chocolate chip cookies (and variants thereof) are literally perfect.  I would not change a crumb.

Instead of having the traditional wedding cake, when my best friend got married, she had a spread of desserts (e.g., cookies, cupcakes, fruit tarts, etc) from her favorite local bakeries.  Best.  Idea.  Ever.  Especially since most wedding cakes just aren't that good.  My best friend chose to have Anthony's cookies & creme and chocolate chip cookies represent her SF side and in my opinion, they were the best thing at that dessert bar!  I grabbed one of each and watched in horror as they all disappeared in less than 5 minutes.  I totally would have taken seconds had they not been so popular.

So it looks like I'll be taking a visit to the City soon to find Anthony's and get more of these scrumptious cookies.
author: Tiffany H.

description: I'm a sucker for cookies, and Anthony's is no exception to that. When in San Francisco I always try to stop by Anthony's and bring a box of cookies home. My favorite cookie here is their cookies and cream cookie. I also quite enjoy their classic chocolate chip, toffee chip and their peanut butter cookie melts in your mouth. They offer two sizes of cookies, I prefer the smaller size.
author: Kristina S.

description:
Great cookies, probably one of the best cookies I've eaten. Cookies and Cream is the all time favorite there. The price may be pretty high but it's worth to get such a tasty cookie. Just be prepared that there's not much parking so be prepared to drive around as usual which is quite common in San Francisco.

And no this isn't your ordinary Mrs.Field cookies you'd get at the mall. Trust me it's just that good!
author: Alex D.

description:
I wanted to try this place out because of all the great reviews.  Staff was really friendly, 5 stars on service.  However,  I was a little disappointed when I tried the cookies because they tasted just alright.  Nothing special.  I've had cookies from Nob Hill in Milpitas that tasted much better.  

To me, the cookies were a little too crunchy and for $1.25, on the smaller side. 
Who knows, maybe they had an off day?
author: Erlinda R.

description:
OMG! 

I ordered the cookies & cream & chocolate chip cookies. They were absolutely delicious!

Did you hear me clearly??? DELICIOUS!!
author: Court S.

description: Cookies are pretty good.  But I can't say the same about the counter staff.  Maybe it is the end of the day, she is tired, but she looked pretty unhappy.  Unhappy employees creates a unwelcome environment, just my opinion. But hey, what do I know , I am just a customer. We bought nine cookies altogether, 2 of the 2oz cookies and 7 regular sized cookies. I loved the dark chocolate chip cookies the best, too bad they didn't have peanut butter today and was told that is their Saturday only special., so for the people who likes peanut butter cookies, make sure you go on Saturday.
author: Helen W.

description: Great cookies. Not sure if it's worth the money though. $1.75 for a small cookie, it tasted great but nothing spectacular. It wasn't too sweet which was good. Would go back again and maybe try some other flavors before I decide if it's worth the hype.
author: Ingrid C.

description:
Cookie heaven right here! Perfect amount of chewiness and sweetness.  Docking a star for the price value...kind of small for $1.50 each!  

Does anybody make ice cream sandwiches with these cookies? Because you KNOW they would be da bomb!
author: Renee L.

description: First time here!!! Cookies are good. Tried the coffee cookie and the double dark chocolate cookie. Delicious! Also got a bottle of Straus Family Organic Milk :) I want to try the limited cookies that are only offered on Monday, Wednesday and Friday but sadly I came on a Saturday.
author: Janet T.

description: Ya it's a cookie alright. Had the dark chocolate chip and the oatmeal raisin, but perhaps I had to catch them fresh.
author: Raymond L.

description:
Dear Anthony,
