Just want to let you know I forgive you for ruining my diet.  Your cookies & cream are worth the extra pounds.  

Hugs and kisses, 
Maria
author: Maria S.

description: Crack cookies.. i cant believe i just spent $18 on a dozen cookies $1.75 for gluten free. But they are crack cookies!  Only wished that they had pb everyday.. the must try is toffee chip
author: Att A.

description: The BEST COOKIES ever. My husband is friends with the owner and they are very professional. These cookies are really to die for. Make your way to Valencia if you haven't tried these yet
author: Dmi R.

description: The cookies don't even look great.  They look like tiny and ordinary but they're pretty darn good! The cookies are the right amount of sweetness, crispiness, and chewiness for me.  I came around closing times so they were out of most of the cookies.  I tried the cookies and cream along with the walnut chocolate chip.  They were both good.  If I wasn't in the area, I probably wouldn't come all the way here or ask someone to bring them to me.  They're not THAT delectable. That being said, I'll take advantage of my closeness and eat way too many of these.
author: Irene C.

description: Their cookies are delicious, especially their cookies n cream ones! They always have a pretty good selection of cookies available, just have to check the boards on the wall. If you're planning on buying cookies for a special occasion, definitely recommend placing your order in advance as they sell out some times.
author: Anne K.

description:
I seem to have a justification for everything: eating, drinking, partying, drinking, shopping, partying....YOU ONLY LIVE ONCE, SO WHY NOT?

On Saturday, 5.1, after my friends and I gorged ourselves at Pizzeria Delfina and then topped it off with Bi-Rite, I still had the audacity to ask, "Do you still want Anthony's Cookies?" You see, one of my friend's had mentioned Anthony's Cookies to me several weeks back and ever since then I've been seeing FB posts about them. I guess it was a sign? Haa Haa! Anyways, it was on the way home, so we thought what the hell, let's go!

We arrived at 4 PM to a near empty store. Uh-oh, I thought....I hope they still have the Cookies and Cream left as I've heard they tend to sell out first.

FLAVORS (varies by day):
*Cookies and Cream: Everyday
*Semi Sweet Chocolate Chip: Everyday
*Walnut Chocolate Chip: Everyday
*White Chocolate Chip: Everyday
*Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin: Everyday
*Whole Wheat Oatmeal Cranberry
*Toffee Chip: Everyday
*Cinnamon Sugar: Everyday
*Double Chocolate Chip: Mon, Fri, Sat
*Peanut Butter: Tues, Wed, Thurs, Sat
*German Chocolate: Mon, Fri, Sat
*Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip: Fri, Sat, Sun
*Banana Walnut: Thurs, Sun
*Banana: Thurs, Sun

PRICES: 
*$1.25/cookie
*$6 for 6 cookies
*$11 for a dozen
*$5 for each add'l dozen

CC's accepted.

I decided to get a dozen and went w/ the following flavors:
*Cookies and Cream: Ummm, OMFG! How can a cookie be thin, crispy, soft, chewy, and gooey all at the same time?!?!? Well, it looks like Anthony has managed to do this. As you bite into the cookie, it's crisp and as you chew it, it's soft and doughy in the center. It's super buttery and there's Oreo Cream tidbits in the cookie which had a burst of creamy sweetness when you bit into it. Sooooo Goood....

*Semi Sweet Chocolate Chip: YUMMY! It has the same texture as the Cookies and Cream. Even though it was room temp, the chocolate morsels poured out like lava when I tore the cookie in half. The cookie was buttery and the chocolate morsels was decandent and added just the right amount of sweetness.  

*Toffee Chip: YUMMY! Similar to the Semi Sweet Chocolate Chip Cookie but with crispy buttery toffee tidbits through out. It was like eating a cookie version of an Almond Roca w/o the almonds. 

*Oatmeal Chocolate Chip: It was ok! This was a bulkier cookie compared to the others. There were bits of real oats which gave it a grainy texture and the chocolate chips helped balanced out the slight saltiness from the oats. 

SERVICE:
Anthony, himself was there baking his OWN cookies no less. You can really tell he's passionate about what he does. While he's manning the cookies in the back, he still has the time to genuinely greet all his customers. More independently owned busineeses need to take note on this. 

AMBIANCE/DÉCOR:  
Contemporary, yet rustic. The space itself is very clean and bright. There's ivory walls with brown and red trimmings and old milk bottles displayed throughout the side walls around the cash register/open kitchen area.

There's 2 picnic table tables where you can sit and enjoy your cookies and milk. There are no restrooms.

PARKING:
Slightly difficult street parking, although it's not as bad as around the Valencia area btw 15th and 23rd Streets. 

It's only been 3 days and I'm already trying to find an excuse to hit up "The Mission", so I can buy another dozen to take home. Since I can't use my usual justification...ummm, Cinco De Mayo celebration in The Mission anyone? LoL!
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
The cookies and cream and toffee chip are both a MUST TRY! 

The most delicious cookies ever! I know what you're probably thinking..."A cookie is a cookie. How good could it POSSIBLY be?", but trust me, I have the sweet tooth of a fat kid and have tasted many cookies. This place has some of the most well made treats I have ever gotten my hands on -- moist and chewy, not overly oily, and not overly sweet. They even sells little cartons of milk for goodness sake!!! 5 stars all the way!
author: Joanna Q.

description: I found a new place I love. I read about this place somewhere on yahoo where it was rated top 10 cookie places to try. I had it on my list to try. I was near there and decided to try it. OMG!!!! Best cookies and so fresh. I ordered lots of chocolate chip, white chocolate, toffee cookie, oat meal, cinnamon spice, walnut chip and cookies and cream and all were very very very VERY delicious.  I think my favorite one was the toffee cookie.  One annoying thing I had encountered was the day before I went I tried to order 30 cookies because I thought they might be sold out of some. I called in, no answer. I called in again at a later time, no answer. I tried at least 6 to 8 times calling no answer and voice mail was full. I tried emailing them and never heard back from them. When I showed up to see if they had got my email I was told the person that gets the emails was not there so my order didn't bother to get looked at. Something needs to change there. Have a better system where people can pre-order. Maybe have it online where people can order the cookies or at least have someone always answering the phone(s). I thought it was very rude on that part.  Don't worry---your cookies are too good to pass up. i'll be back some day!!
author: Meg O.

description: My kind of cookies. Go there with an open mind and get blown away!  fav is toffee, double chocolate and regular chocolate chip
author: Sian C.

description:
I should start by saying I'm not a big cookie person.  In fact, I tend to dislike most cookies, and after one bite, put the rest down and walk away.  I'd much rather a slice of chocolate cake any day.

That said, Anthony's Cookies actually make me want to eat cookies!!  They are flavorful, rich, not too sweet (at least, not the flavors I like), and so fresh, I can't resist!

I'm especially partial to the DOUBLE CHOCOLATE CHIP cookies and the DARK CHOCOLATE CHIP ones...but I also enjoyed the COOKIES & CREAM and WHITE CHOCOLATE CHIP varieties.  

The GERMAN CHOCOLATE cookie was interesting, but I wouldn't list it among my favorites...and I've yet to get there on one of the days when I can get a PEANUT BUTTER cookie...but I will someday, trust me!

That's the other thing:  they only offer certain flavors all the time (cookies & cream, classic chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, whole wheat oatmeal raisin, and toffee chip).  The rest of the flavors depend on the day.  I think that Wednesday is my ideal day at Anthony's, when theoretically I can get ALL the flavors I like!

The cookies aren't huge, and I think that's part of the joy.  You don't have to commit to just one flavor, and you don't have to deal with a gigantic cookie if all you want is something small.  

This store is sadly NOT WHEELCHAIR ACCESSIBLE.  It's a shame, really, but I'm pretty sure that if you require access, they'll come to the door to assist you directly.  My partner usually goes in for me, or grabs them on the way home from work.

Their store hours make me happy, as they are open until 8 pm Mon-Sat...that means that those folks who work a little later in the evening can still get a cookie or two on their way home!  

If you are a cookie lover, check this place out.  I'd imagine that Anthony's Cookies might even convert a few other folks like me (ie, not generally into cookies) to the cause!!
author: Amy L.

description: I just went here today for the first time ever and I have to say these are probably the best cookies I have ever had in my life!!! At first I was super disappointed they did not have chocolate chip cookies as one of the flavors today but now I am actually glad because it forced me to try some new flavors that I really loved!! I don't get tho this area of the city too often but these cookies are a destination for me!
author: Blaine S.

description: Cookies and cream is all I'll have to say. Love the chocolate chip cookie too, but then who doesn't. Had a family gathering today and bought  $130 worth of cookies from Anthony's Cookies and they were ALL GONE before we could even eat the main food. Everyone asked me where I got it from. It's worth the trip to San Francisco.
author: Sal T.

description:
I have a confession - I have faith that the Yelp community won't rat me out: 

I was invited as a guest to a company party a few months ago and they had an overflowing abundance of Anthony's cookies on the side...buffet style. Yes, there was an open bar. Yes, there was real food all throughout the venue. But no, I stuck to Anthony's cookies. Mr. CEO of whatever company I went for, please don't hunt me down because I actually took a cookie to-go because I was too full of what damage I had already done that night. 

These cookies becomes an addiction. Every single one is soft and chewy and a reminder to why it's hopeless to diet (especially if you live nearby). My favorites would have to be 1) cookies and creme 2) toffee chip 3) classic chocolate chip 

Ohhh such gooey melt-in-your-mouth sweet and moist delights, you're worth every penny. Buy it by the cookie(s) or by dozen(s). Heck, someone buy me the whole store.
author: Regina C.

description:
The Cookies and Creme Cookie at Anthony's is the best cookie I've ever had in my life!! 

My first visit to Anthony's was about 2 years ago, and I was greeted by Anthony himself! I remember him telling me that if the quality of his cookies start to decline, to let him know right away! Thank god that hasn't happened. The cookies made by Anthony's are like little drops of heaven. 

I would say the Cookies and Cream is the best, but the other flavors are just as mouth watering. I've also tried the toffee chip, white chocolate chip, whole wheat oatmeal raisin, and banana cookies. They're all great. I also suggest that if you plan on buying these on any kind of holiday such as valentines day or mothers day, go in early or try calling in ahead of time!
author: Elaine N.

description:
Tips:

$1.25 a cookie
$1.50 for peanut butter cookie

$5 minimum for card

-----------------------------------------

I do have to say that I was a bit disappointed that the cookies were a lot smaller than I expected. (Especially for the price you pay) Although the cookies are small I can't deny that they are darn good cookies. The cookies are perfectly baked so that the inside is nice and soft the way a cookie oughta be baked! I tried pretty much all the flavors, but my favorites are the "Cookies and Cream", "Toffee", and "Peanut Butter".

The peanut butter cookie really is worth the extra 25 cents because it's made from organic peanut butter. Be careful when eating though because the cookie is quite crumbly, but once you put it in your mouth it literally melts away because it's so soft. The taste was awesome peanut buttery-ness.

Now I'm craving me some more cookies, YUM.
author: Alice H.

description: Awesome cookies. Anthony was very helpful and friendly. My favorite was the chocolate chip.....so good. Glad to have a place like this in the neighborhood.
author: D R.

description:
Everytime I come in they are out of cookies.  Went in today at 5 and they were out of everything except two kinds.  If I was the owner I would be pissed to read this review.

Won't be coming back, sick of them not having anything.


Wonder if they even care.
author: Patty C.

description:
The ccc is good but the cookies and cream!!!! Perfection with chewiness, flavor, and sweetness. 

I don't mind the small cookies. Quality is more important than quantity and really, eating part of a big cookie today and saving some tomorrow just means that a dry cookie is waiting for you tomorrow, right?
author: Jacquee P.

description:
Can I just say, "YUMMMMMM???!!!!!"

I usually have a problem with cookies I buy from a place because they turn out to be too sweet, too processed, too something. Not these cookies, they are amazingly delicioso, and have the homemade taste. Just lovely!

I had the cookies and cream cookie and the oatmeal with cranberries. First of all, my first love is the chocolate chip cookie. I usually NEVER cheat on my love, but one bite of the cookies and cream and I was hooked! SPRUNG! Boing-Boing!

I am definitely NOT an oatmeal cookie person, especially the kinds with fruit in them, but DAYAM... It was soooo good! And I'm understating it! It was slightly soft on the inside and a burst of cinnamon came out. BOOM BOOM POW. It was damn good. 

I will sacrifice my calorie intake for these cookies anytime!
author: Sharon B.

description: Cookies are still good but have to downgrade since the prices keep going up; you can buy individual cookies now for $1.75 (they were $1.50 just a little while ago and you can see my original review they were $1 so not too long before you're playing twice as much as before!). There is no bulk discount and these are not large cookies. I give them A-Ok because not sure the value is worth it but everything is crazy expen$ive nowadays. :(
author: kiwi l.

description: Yeah, Anthony's is that good. Came in and bought every flavor they had on the board. I thought we'd try a couple here or there, or share some with friends. Wish I hadn't...we were stupid and devoured the whole box. F#ck me...will now spend the rest of the weekend trying to burning off the extra calories.
author: Zoran L.

description:
Love love love... did I say LOVE Anthony's Cookies?!  LOL
The cookies & cream are my favorite but I also like the Oatmeal & Peanut butter.  Let's be honest, I'll eat any of them!  #getinmahbelly!!! Nice & warm with some Milk (yes, I'm 12 yrs old)
author: Lynda N.

description: Anthony's Cookies are to die for. TO DIE FOR. I swear these cookies are baked in heaven! So damn good! The texture and the flavor is absolutely perfect in my book. Some of my favs are cookies n cream, chocolate chip, dark chocolate chip, candied pecan, and toffee chip. If you're looking for the best cookies you'll ever taste in your life, then do yourself a favor and go to Anthony's Cookies.
author: Janica V.

description:
I have no words to describe how epically amazing this experience was. We drove an hour out of the way for these cookies and they did not disappoint. The customer service was amazing. The owner Anthony was there and even gave us a few extra free samples. 

PERFECT!!!!!!!!!
author: John Anthony S.

description: Nothing special at all.  Their 1oz cookies were much harder than expected.  They night have well been burnt. I got the cookies n cream,  chocolate chip, and white chocolate. Chocolate Chip was very disappointing while cookies n cream is much better
author: Renashia H.

description:
So, you know that really rich girl who despite being very rich still dresses in grunge/bohemian attire? Like, despite the fact that her boyfriend is a money machine making $4,000,000 a year, and despite the fact that you need to be buzzed in through an iron gate to enter her mansion, she still wears ripped jeans, a Joan Jett t-shirt, and faded flannel? She'll still do middle-class things like bum a cigarette or borrow someone's phone. Or cry. You want to know her name? Her name is Anthony's Cookies. 

Anthony's can't deny its baking genius. It tries to downplay its quality by having such things as a comically cramped basement-level space, a blasé staff, and a 'B' from the Health Department. But their cookies are as as good as Walter White's meth, and the experience as a whole has the potential to resolve your relationship with God. People, I'm not kidding -- this place is ridiculous, off-the-charts... This place defies petty congratulation, but it is the Best Cookie I Ever Had. Not even a cookie. A... A.... warm need. The chocolate is embryonic, it's mother's milk in dough, and the nutritional employment of the cosmos. Put this place in your planner.

The only unattractive part of this place is the the conglomerate of three security cameras right above the cooling racks. A bit unnecessary, no? I don't know of many walnut cookie heists, though, if there were to be one, this would be the place to hit up. At least Big Brother wants you to know that it cares about sweets.
author: Jeri T.

description:
Sweet, buttery, moist... but with a nice crunch....

What else can you ask for in a cookie? Well... Anthony's cookies fit all this and more. Their Toffee Chip cookie is my absolute favorite. I'm usually a white chocolate kind of girl.. but Anthony's toffee chip is totally Yum!!!!

The guys are so friendly each time I go in and they use local ingredients. Big plus in my books!

Anthony's has made me relive my youth watching Sesame Street... but oh wait... I'm now the Cookie Monster when others dare to reach in my Anthony's cookie box? Get your own box people!!! And watch out for me since I'll be the blue cookie monster trying to steal your cookies.... hehehe....
author: Mei C.

description:
7x7 100 Best Things To Eat In SF Before You Die 2012

#65 Cookies and Cream Cookie at Anthony's Cookie 

Last week my sister inlaw and I decided it would be fun to cross off a few things off my 7x7 list. 

Our first trip was to Tartine for a a fresh loaf of bread. Unfortunately, when my sister went inside, the lady in front of her bought the very last one!!!

We decided that we would make most of our trip in the Mission area and head over to Anthony's Cookies to try their famous Cookies and Cream Cookie.

OMG!!!! They ran out of that as well, in fact almost half of their menu was completely out. 

We ended up taking the last two double chocolates, walnut chocolate chip and german chocolate chips.

I believe the cookies could be better than I thought simply because I was so disheartned by the failure that day, I honestly did not enjoy the cookies as much as maybe I should have?

Victory was not sweet that day!

Overall thoughts

I will be back, maybe next time lucky enough to snag me one of those delicious cookies and cream I hear so much about
author: Eddie W.

description:
Nothing has changed with the taste of the cookies since my last review...  they still are wonderful cookies.  One of my favorites in fact, especially the "cookies and cream".  I've been a raving fan of this place, telling all of my friends to come here and get some great cookies.  I bring Anthony's into my office to thank my staff for a job well done.  I still love the way the cookies taste, they are definitely five star!

Well, why the downgrade?  One thing: the price.  I've been coming to Anthony's for several years now and have seen the price steadily creep up.  First the prices increase.  Then the frequent buyer card goes away.  Finally they do away with the price breaks.  Same price per cookie ($1.25) if you're buying a half dozen, dozen, two dozen, etc.  I promised two dozen to my office and was shocked when I calculated it would be $30.  I thought about not buying them, but ended up buying anyway since I had already promised them.  Looks like the Anthony's rewards for my office will be fewer and farther between...

Anthony, many bakeries give discounts when you buy in bulk.  I can understand you raising prices but no quantity discount?  Read your recent yelp reviews- many of the folks are complaining about the price.  I love the fact that a local place (and one that just serves cookies at that) is thriving, but I'd hate to see your yelp ratings go down or have folks like me stop coming because they feel "priced out".  You've still got my favorite cookies in SF, but my docking you one star is my way to protest the price increase.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Pricey cookies given the size. They run about $1.75 per cookie (I think) with a few going for more like the double coffee cookie. They are about the size of small woman's palm. Granted loaded with butter but the flavors were ok. Tried the toffee chip - didn't really get the toffee flavor; chocolate chip - Classic but have had equally good at a bigger size; chocolate walnut something which was slightly nondescript. 

I even bought a box as a gift. I should have tried them first before I spent $21 for about 9 cookies plus the ones we consumed. 

Tried once. Probably not again.
author: Cindy W.

description:
Ho Ho Ho! These cookies feel like Christmas!

Cookies and cream is to die for.. 

I also got german chocolate.. Which had a rich deep flavor.. And walnut chocolate chip hit the spot.

You must be wonderin if I am overweight.. for the record.. Not yet! :)
author: Sumit G.

description: The cookies use to be super yummy but not the last few times we went.. Bring your old bakers back or train the new ones better!
author: Jazmine S.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE. I will ride the bus 20 minutes both ways to get these cookies. 

Grab a cookie, a carton of milk and step back into your childhood!

I give them as gifts all the time -- nothing makes people feel appreciated like fresh-baked cookies! But usually I just buy a dozen or so whenever I go so there are some left for me and my cookie monster husband. They are just so good. The traditional cookies make you want to cry because they are the very thing you remember Grandma's cookies being when you were a kid. Their crazy flavors like the coffee cookie is just the right mix of weird, and different, and still totally delicious. The vibe is cool and funky. The peeps are upbeat and awesome just like their cookies.
author: Brittany F.

description:
Cookies & cream, cinnamon spice. You're welcome. 

DELICIOSOOOO. 
Staff amazing
author: Chrissy C.

description:
ABSOLUTELY A MUST!!!!

These have to be the best cookies I have ever had, I have tasted almost every option on their menu and I have never been disappointed. I have taken dozens to many events and the guest are always WOWed. 

Its worth the price!
author: Ed S.

description:
Nothing beats the classic chocolate chip cookie here. So yummy! 

Getting cookies at Anthony's is an option I'll be considering more and more on sunny SF weekends when the line at Bi-Rite is likely way longer than I can wait for my sweet fix. 

Tried the cookies and cream cookie, but honestly didn't like it as much as the traditional chocolate chip flavor... 

If you're going to get an Oreo cookie (which I'm sure you will despite what I say about it lol) make sure you also get a plain cookie with it!
author: Neeharika B.

description: Love their cookies! My faves are the toffee cookie and the cookies and cream cookie. Their cookies are always on point! I've tried most of their cookies and have not been disappointed yet. Very clean place and offers a variety of drinks to go along with your cookies. A little pricey though.
author: MaryJane C.

description: Decent, but not worth the trip. Bought six 1 oz cookies of four different flavors for $12 and some odd change. The German chocolate was memorable but not great. The toffee cookie was the highlight, but even that wouldn't prompt me to go out of my way to go back. This would be a case of some weird Yelp-inflation. Really wanted to like this place, but would rather by 2-3 bags of Tate's or anything at Hot Cookie instead.
author: Carina F.

description: Best cookie place in SF! They're basically artisan cookies. They're fresh, and you can taste the quality. My favorite cookie is the toffee chip I wish they had later hours!
author: Kendra Z.

description: Anthony's Cookies has one of the best Cookies N Cream cookies i've ever tasted! I suggest going early to get the popular flavors. I went around 12pm and 2 customers after me the Cookies N Cream cookies were all gone for the day. I only ordered 5 cookies that day, but next time I go i'm probably going to order a dozen or two.
author: Heather R.

description:
This is my drug. Delicious cookies, baked to perfection! 

Peanut Butter - THE BEST! I love the peanuty smell that gets me every time. It has the perfect crunch from the outside, then the middle is soft and what it seems like a slight peanut butter filling. YUMMMM!

Chocolate Chip - My absolute favorite chocolate chip cookie. I remember taking my first ever bite and sinking into cookie heaven.

Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Walnut Chip - Delicious! One of my faves... I love how the chips melt with the oatmeal and walnut.

Cookies and Cream - i know this is a popular flavor but this is my less favorite. It's missing that "oreo" taste I am looking for. It just taste like sugar cookies to me.

Cinnamon Spice - Soo good! If you like cinnamon this cookie has just the right amount of spice and so soft.

White Chocolate Chip - Delicious but wish there was macadamia nuts ;)

Toffee Chip - I love toffee! This cookie is perfect.

Double Chocolate Chip - Chewy and very chocolatey... yumm!

Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip - One of my faves... I always get this one! It's a simple, perfect oatmeal cookie!

Can I also mention the amazing customer service? Most of the times I have gone here, my friend and I always get the same lady at the counter. She always has a smile on her face and is one of the friendliest workers ever!! When we walk in and see her, it makes our Anthony's experience ever better and happier! :) We get slightly sad when she's not the one helping us... she's our favorite! The cookies are sweet and so is she!
author: Aiza B.

description:
Came here midday & most of the flavors that I wanted to try were already out. For the size of the cookie, the price is pretty dang steep. None of the ones that I tried even stood out, so I don't get the hype. I've had better cookies made from scratch from friends.

The milk is really good though & has a cream top. If you return the glass jar, you get a certain amount of refund back on the milk. Good deal.
author: Crystal W.

description:
A friend and I share the same birthday.  Every year we would surprise each other with a gift and it usually ends up being a dessert of some sort.  Last year, the both of us exchanged macaroons, mine from Cocola and hers from Paulette's. 

This year, I wanted to give her cookies.  So in the morning before work, I drove all the way down to the mission and arrived 10 minutes after they opened.  Ordered a dozen cookies, extra cookies & cream because it's undeniably the best cookies ever, and went to work.

She came to my work which meant it was gift exchange time.  I grabbed my bag, walked outside, met her eyes, smiled and waved.  She had her bag in one hand, the other wide open for a hug.  we hugged, said happy birthday, and....SHOCK.  we bought each other the same thing!  1 dozen cookies for her, 1 dozen cookies for me!

it was a memorable and delightful birthday.  great minds do think alike, and have great taste in food too.
author: Linda N.

description:
I adore this place! The cookies are amazing and the workers are always so sweet! The cookies and creme cookie is my absolute favorite, I wish I could have them everyday. They are baked fresh, and I can never wait to eat them! They use to sell some at SF state, but would always run out of the cookies and creme! Always love to get some milk to go with them as well.

The store is also very nice and cute. There is usually a little line when I've gone, but not too bad. It is definitely worth the wait and pay!
author: Nisouri S.

description:
It REALLY pains me to drop Anthony's Cookies from five down to three stars.  If I were rating on cookies alone, Anthony's would easily be five stars.  But after visiting yesterday and learning of their new prices (or really, new "price," since there is only one -$1.25 a cookie - more than a 30% increase!!!! - with no quantity price breaks), three stars it is.

The only other Yelper thus far to mention this change is Lawrence T., so kudos to you!  Like Lawrence, I have been a monster Anthony's fan for years.  His cookies really couldn't be beat, and, a few years ago, at 95 cents each, plus 6 for $5 and a dozen at $9, were extremely reasonable.  Sadly, not anymore.

Yesterday I paid $8.75 for seven cookies.  Yes, that breaks down to $1.25 each.  Nope, no price break. 

I guess I've just been spoiled by the old pricing.  But to spend about the same as what I used to and receive nearly half the amount of cookies?  Sad.  Anthony, you and I used to be best buds, but it's time for us to become mere acquaintances.  I'll be seeing you...
author: Mel T.

description: I must say that I've been here three times now, and the cookies are excellent. Every time I walk into this little gem, I always feel a sense of nostalgia though for when my Mom or Grandma baked me cookies growing up.  Anthony's best cookie in my opinion is the chocolate chip. If you are lucky to get it right out of the oven (while its still hot) then you will be heaven. Its moist, rich, and the perfect size. Their Cinnamon  Spice cookies are pretty good too (though not as good as the chocolate chip). With that all said,  I do think the cookies are a little expensive, but so is everything in San Francisco. Highly recommend this place!
author: Matt L.

description:
Damn, Anthony.  You make amazing cookies!  I LOVE THEM.

The cookies & cream are by far my favorite, but I've thoroughly enjoyed every other flavor I've had here.  I love the glass milk containers that decorate the cashier area too.
author: Thi D.

description: Best when warm. Cookies are even great days later. Just pop one in the microwave for 15 seconds or back in the over on 300 for 12 minutes. Fantastic!
author: Melissa M.

description: gluten free chocolate chip cookies were bomb!! I bought 4 and the guy gave me an extra one since it was close to closing time. the cookies were very moist and I'll be coming back for more. I wanna try other flavored too.
author: Beverly C.

description:
Date & Time:  Sunday November 15, 2009 @ 3pm
Company:  Michael & Jack Waited Outside
Crowd:  Hipsters & Young Families w/ Hipster Children
Vibe:  Cozy
Decor:  Charming.  Strauss Milk Bottles & Rustic Picnic Table
Service:  Very Friendly
Imbibe:  Milk
Devour:  Toffee Chip, White Chocolate, Banana Walnut Cranberry, Walnut Chocolate Chip & Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies
Total:  $6.70
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
OMG. Cookie Monster heaven is RIGHT!!

I only spent 2 days in the city and came here twice! By the end of my SF trip we left with 3 dozen cookies. They are THAT GOOD!! WTF do they put in their cookies? Crack?!

Now when I think of SF I think of this place. Hands down a MUST GO TO when you're in the area. & even if you're not in the area it's worth your time, money, & gas to go there. Plus you don't gotta wait 30min for them [no line].

I ain't lying when I say EVERYTHING is good here. I never had a box of cookies where every single variety was delicious.

COOKIES & CREAM
TOFFEE CHIP
GHIRARDELLI WHITE CHOCOLATE
PEANUT BUTTER
author: April B.

description: The sister had chocolate chip cookies and milk delivered from here to me via Postmates - needless to say, I was so floored with the gesture that I kind of forgot to analyze my cookies. But I do remember the chocolate chip cookie standing out (think soft, chewy and warm, and not too heavy like Specialty's). Will definitely be back to try other flavors!
author: Anu P.

description:
Dayum good cookies! Slightly chewy on the inside, still warm from the oven and good choc chip to dough ratio.

So good I bought one, ate it, returned, and bought another.
author: Claire H.

description:
Got two cookies from a Postmates promotion.

Toffee chip - pretty darn yummy. I loved the caramelization (I think that's what it is??) and would definitely get it again.
Classic chocolate chip - not bad, but definitely not as good as the toffee chip.

I think I would come back and pay full price on a toffee chip (or maybe a new flavor) if I was feeling a little splurge-y ($1.50 for a small-medium cookie is definitely on the pricey side!).
author: Veronica C.

description:
4-stars for the Cookies & Cream cookies! I'm a fan and I come back for only this. Everything else is just 3-stars for ehhh, okaaay.

I like my cookies crispy on the edges, chewy throughout and Anthony's has that down. Cookies & Cream is genius. Takes a great tasting cookie dough base with that familiar cookies & cream cookie we all know and love and marries the two. Second choice goes to the Cinnamon Spice, the right consistency and seems to be more moist than your average cinnamon cookie.

For me, any of the chocolate chip flavors seems just to be a variation off your average Nestle Tollhouse recipe, sorry! Candied Pecan Chip - it's basically a chocolate chip cookie with pecans, there ain't nothin "candied" about it! Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip - all I taste is semi-sweet chocolate. Maybe it's cause I'm a milk chocolate chip cookie kinda girl, but I've eaten A LOT of cookies in my time and these don't hit the spot.

Correction, they don't hit the spot, UNLESS I'M DRUNK. Drunken munchies have me inhaling these, which doesn't say much.
author: S Y.

description:
3 words. 

Best Cookies....EVER!!

It's so good it makes me want to cry because I can't have it every day since I live in LA. :'(

Once you enter their store, you will know what I'm talking about! The smell of freshly baked cookies will have you mesmerized and you too would want to order everything on the menu! Lol

My personal favorites are their Cookies and Cream Cookies, White Chocolate, and Toffee nut.

The owner, Anthony, is a nice guy too!
author: Carla A.

description:
$1.25/cookie. Prepared to have your smell-buds stunned as soon as you open the door. It was pretty empty when I came on a Saturday afternoon - without any wait!

We tried toffee chip (my favorite mostly because of texture), cookies & cream (they said this along with toffee was most popular), german chocolate (for the german roomie), oatmeal raisin, and chocolate chip (absolutely perfect when dipped in milk).
author: Jessalyn C.

description: They weren't as moist as I expected. The cookies and cream were a bit dry and the toffee chip was crunchy. The oatmeal cookies were really moist and tasty.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
I've never been one to crave dessert. I mostly rather order a petite filet mignon over a molten lava cake if I had my way. But there's something in Anthony's Cookies that always compel me to make the travel here every time I'm in San Francisco. It must be the concept. Milk and Cookies. A nostalgic idea for a store. 

Nostalgia defined is often triggered by something reminding the individual of an event or item from their past. The resulting emotion can vary from happiness to sorrow. The term of "feeling nostalgic" is more commonly used to describe pleasurable emotions associated with and/or a longing to go back to a particular period of time. Nostalgia might be seen as a natural anti-depressant, providing motivation, or conversely, seen to worsen clinical depression insofar as it may remind one of the good times that used to be.


Me + Anthony's Cookies = Nostalgia
author: My T.

description: Best cookie in the bay!  My faves are choc chip, cookies and cream and walnut chocolate chip.
author: Ames L.

description:
Not the best cookies I've ever eaten, but still pretty darn good..I came on Sunday afternoon to an empty bakery, yay! I asked the cashier if it's cheaper if i bought a dozen and he told me it's the same prize :( I remembering reading some yelp reviews that buying by the dozen is cheaper? Oh well.. I got the toffee, double chocolate chip, cookies and cream and their original chocolate chip. My favorite of the bunch- original chocolate chip! I found most of the cookies to be kind of hard/chewy, not as fresh as i wanted it to be. From the reviews, i expected a melt in your mouth kind of cookie. Maybe going towards of the end of the day wasn't such a good idea? When i walked in, the cookies we're already made and just sitting there. Aside from all  that, decent cookies. 

Check this place out if you haven't yet, get the original chocolate chip :)
author: Shirley N.

description:
COOKIES AND CREME, I DIE. 

I tried the oatmeal, chocolate chip, cookies and creme, peanut butter, and white chocolate chip. 

Hands down - cookies and creme. 

only reason im giving this place 4 stars is the ambiance and the price. A little steep for the size of the cookie
author: Jenny F.

description:
Pricey but excellent cookies and easy parking. $1.25 for a cookie. Got a Cookies & Cream, Classic Chocolate Chip, Toffee Chip, and Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin. Anthony's Cookies has a plate of samples ready for your taste buds at the cash register. I got to try the Cookies & Cream, Classic Chocolate Chip, and Toffee Chip before purchasing, which is what persuaded me to purchase them. 

Definitely a huge fan of Anthony's Cookies and I will be returning for them in the future. Moreover, I am looking forward to trying all of their flavors. 

What I recommend:

-- Toffee Chip
author: Andrew W.

description:
4.5 stars

These are solid cookies. 

The size is just right: Not too big, not too small

Texture is perfect: Crispy on the edges, soft in the middle

Flavor is excellent: Not too sweet, quality ingredients

Price is reasonable: $1 per cookie if you buy 6+ 

Best flavor: Cookies and cream

Other Details: Credit card for $5+, the shop itself is small with only a table or 2, most people get a box of cookies to go, and service is very friendly! 

I'd definitely recommend Anthony's Cookies.
author: Patti F.

description:
The chocolate chip cookies were amazing, but when are warm gooey chocolate chip cookies NOT amazing?! Tried the oreo ones too... and was not too impressed (too sweet!). Perhaps if they were warm I would have been equally as impressed.

Beware: they will tempt you with large glass bottles of milk when you step in, go around the corner and save yourself a dollar or two and get your milk there :)
author: Jess C.

description: Delicious cookies and they even sell cartons of milk so you can fully indulge. They have a variety of flavors and a good amount of seating so you can stay and enjoy your delectable purchases! I chose the toffee chip and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend you do the same!
author: Shav S.

description: I got the cookies and cream and oatmeal raisin. The oatmeal raisin was the best one. Nice and soft. Definitely not as good as I expected though.
author: Asia F.

description:
Why is it so hard for my friends from Sactown to come to the city?

They're all busy working and making babies that's why. Either somebody is getting engaged, pregnant or working overtime. 

If they can't come to the city, then I'm bringing a city treat to them.

I was disappointed they didn't have the banana walnut cookies when I came here. But the free samples of cookies n' cream , white chocolate chip, toffee nut and chocolate chip walnut made me a happy customer. 

I bought 18 cookies which are plenty for my friends to share.  I got a little bit of everything, which include the four samples above plus whole wheat oatmeal raisin and oatmeal with cranberry. 

Friendly service, fresh baked cookies, quality ingredients and most importantly, they use real butter.  You can smell that butter even without biting into the cookie. Anthony does his cookies right. 

I caught up with a friend I haven't talked to in awhile. She was delighted to see me (and my goodies in the box, I'm sure) and exclaimed, "Hey, it's been awhile. I've been so busy. I just got engaged!"

See what I mean?
author: Janice C.

description:
If only it wasn't so expensive, and if my dark chocolate cookie wasn't so small (http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_6snwwiQscH98tiE2n2kDQ&userid=_Eu5Yq9rQxnPU-VMyfJfTA), I wouldn't have felt so shafted. (Esp when it costs extra!) 

toffee chip - no actual chips, very smooth and sweet cookie.
dark chocolate - was really tiny, sadface, but it was one of my favorites because it's the perfect chocolate chip cookie, can't say no to dark chocolate.
cinnamon spice - basically a darker in color and more balanced sweetness snickerdoodle cookie.
author: Adrienne L.

description: This is for the Cookies and Cream cookie... Sorry Oreo but you have to take a backseat to this cookie. OMG co-workers treated the office today with a box of Anthony's delicious cookies. I have never had them before so I thought "okay it's just a cookie"... I take that back. In the box was chocolate chip, oatmeal and cookies & cream. Normally I would have gone with the other two flavors (you can't go wrong with chocolate chip and oatmeal) but my gut told me don't do it and I am so happy I didn't. The cookie was chewy and moist on the inside and not overly sweet. Normally I need milk with my cookies but not with this one. Seriously OMG SO GOOD! If there was any more I would have went back for seconds and thirds. Now that I know about this place, looks like I have to drag my hubby to the city just for this.
author: Lala K.

description:
What I ate: Cookies & cream, cinnamon spice, whole wheat oatmeal walnut chip, and double chocolate chip cookies!
Visit date: June 13, 2012
First time? No.

Yes, I shared my cookies. Ok, maybe just a little bit. Oops. I can't say I crave Anthony's cookies, but when I start eating them, there is no turning back. I just keep going. But back up just a little. Before  a cookie even reaches your mouth, you enter the shop and the smell of fresh baked cookies is so rich and inviting. You come up to the cashier to order, but then there's a plate of cookie samples waiting for you. This could be good (confirm that you made the right cookie choices) or bad (confirm that you need to order more cookies). 

The cookies are moist, soft and mouth-watering. The cookies & cream was my favorite cookie before, but now that I've tried the double chocolate chip, it's a toss up! Basically, you can't go wrong with any of their cookies. No shame, go on and try as many of them as you want. They are petite cookies so you you won't feel so bad after half a dozen (or so...) of them.

Anthony's is definitely a treat ($1.25 per cookie is a tiny bit steep), but they have some unique flavors and it's cute shop with an uber friendly cookie staff. Also, the cookies travel well (took it across the country once).
author: Erin G.

description: The Cookies here are probably the best I've had. The only problem I had was the fact that they subjected me to a limited selection of choices two hours before their closing time. Also, the workers their seemed un-accomdating while blaring their rock music. Overall, good cookies!
author: Sam H.

description:
Came for the first time this past Sunday afternoon. You walk into this space with the types of cookies written on the wall and the cash register in the back. Behind it is the kitchen so you can actually see the workers baking. My boyfriend ordered an iced coffee and the cashier was friendly and put out their cream for him to add. We then ordered one of each of the following: Cookies and Cream, Oatmeal Chocolate, Dark Chocolate annnnd I forgot the last one, lol. Anyways, my boyfriend's iced coffee tasted really bland, as he had to add a lot of sugar and cream for taste. It wasn't horrible though.

The cookies though were booommb. Now I've baked and bought a plentiful amount of various cookies in my lifetime, but these are sooo good! Not crispy at all, which is what I like. It had a soft texture that was so delicious, chewy and melt in your mouth type a' way. Mmmm cookies and cream was definitely my favorite. I asked the cashier what she recommended and her two choices were cookies and cream and German chocolate. I hope to taste German chocolate next time!

Did I mention their music selection was ill?! Chill hip hop, yes very hipster, lol. I will be back for more to buy a box!

-Street Parking! Feed the meter!
-Card and Cash
-Mostly all cookies are $1.50 each, but worth it.

Fun fact: the glass milk bottles on display aren't real! Lol my boyfriend asked -__-
author: Veronica A.

description: Yes, it's $1.75 for a 1oz cookie. And yes it is a bit on the pricey side. But these are no supermarket cookies and they are freshly baked daily. Still, for the price I would expect a cookie the size of the palm of my hand. At $1.75 an oz, that translates to $28 for a pound (16 oz) of cookies.
author: W A.

description: How do you make an Oreo cookie taste better?!?!? Mind blown! Cookies and cream cookie hands down! These suckers go fast and people get pretty upset when there are none left. So just buy em by the dozen when you can!
author: Lynne L.

description:
Best cookies evaaar. (At $1.75 a cookie, they better be good! lol)

My fav was the chocolate chip.  You'll probably think Mrs. Fields is garbage compared to Anthony's Cookies.

The cookies & cream, and the white chocolate should get some honorable mentions.  

Parking is available on-street.

The restaurant only has a couple benches inside (seat capacity of around 10'ish).

Enjoy!
author: Niño M.

description:
First things first, there's a single large step you have to get up to get to the door - how is this wheelchair accessible people? So, bear that in mind and either bring a friend, or, well, don't come. And unfortunately (or fortunately, depending on how you look at it), I don't get what the big fuss is with Anthony's, because I've certainly had much tastier cookies than these. 

Dropping by with a friend sometime towards the middle of last year (good thing too, because I wasn't aware of the aforementioned step), we ended up splitting a dozen cookies, since there was a discounted price for it at the time (which, according to other Yelpers, no longer exists). I can't remember exactly what I got anymore, but it included the classic chocolate chip, several variations of oatmeal cookies, cinnamon spice, and peanut butter. And, while good, none of them blew my mind, even after toasting (of course I would).

I'd perhaps swing by again if I were in the area, but given the size and pricing now that the discount's been squashed, and the inaccessibility of the place, it's somewhat unlikely. Good thing I have a ton of friends who bake!
author: Johnny W.

description: Anthony's cookies has excellent chocolate chip walnut cookies. I love that they offer dark chocolate cookies and $1 milk cartons to enjoy with your freshly baked cookies. That is the definition of as good as it gets!
author: Judith G.

description: I live down the street and had no idea this was even here. The cookies here are the best cookies I have ever had. I love the walnut chocolate chip.
author: Kristen O.

description:
Anthony, you are a cookie monster!

We always order a box of 2 or 3 of every flavor and they never disappoint. Every time I take a bite into a cookie, I feel guilty. Not because of the chewy goodness that always tickles my sweet tooth, it's because of the neglect that I'm forcing on the other cookies. Sorry, Toffee, I'll be with you too, eventually. Oh, and you too, PB. I will make time for all of you! Hey, I can't help it! I have needs! I don't know what you call it- cookieadultry? I adore all flavors and there are too many to just name here. And of course, you're about to head over there anyways. I didn't wanna waste your time.

The sparkle from the cinnamon spice.. the swirly marble effect of the cookies and cream... the ruggedness of the whole wheat oatmeal raisin... the decadence of the german chocolate.. chunky/curvy/chewy/sweet you know where I'm going with this. In this world of cookies, one can't help but to enjoy the diversity it brings us. It's a tough world out there and sometimes, you just can't try one! Don't judge meeeee!!!! 

 I walk by my living room table and they're sitting there... calling out to me. Some type of magnetic force is pulling me towards the white box. And once again, I commit my cookieadultry. It's been a while, my little sweet thangs (:
author: Maiden D.

description: LOVE their cookies and cream cookies!  I am craving them right now so hence the review.  Though pricey, these cookies are worth the extra money and calories.  The staff is always really helpful and the place smells like heaven.  The cookies are crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  Even though I prefer warm cookies, these are amazing room temperature.  My brother likes to bring them home and heat them up haha.  Definitely go check it out if you're in SF!
author: Jasmine L.

description:
cookie monster says:
i got 99 cookies...
...cause charmaine ate one.

review #400 goes to anthony's cookies. cookies and cream just can't be beat. it has the perfect oreo cookie to anthony's cookie ratio with a chewy texture that's crisp on the outside. it's not overly sweet but packed with buttery flavor.

the toffee chip and chocolate chip are also spot on. $1.25 for one cookie, $6 for half dozen, $12 for one dozen. but i bet you can't eat just one!
author: Charmaine L.

description:
$1.25 per cookie, I think that's steep. But you get what you pay for. Cookies are normal sized and they have enough different flavors to choose from.  Definitely worth the trip if you're ever in the area. 

4 Stars instead of 5 cause this place really set a girl back into her diet.
author: Paula C.

description:
At 1160 reviews and an average of 4.5 stars, it's a pretty safe bet to say that this place is solid. 

I'm 38.5 weeks pregnant, so I'm enjoying my last week or so of being able to "eat for two" (not literally) without people looking at me like I'm nuts. I was in the neighborhood at 11:30am on a Sunday morning, and I decided that cookies were the right thing to do. 

I've had an Anthony's cookie before, but I'd never actually been to the shop. It's pretty inconspicuous; I would have strolled right by it had I not known it was where it was. It's a pretty small shop, with relatively bare walls and one long table. Not that ambiance matters when you know what tastiness lies on those cookie sheets behind the counter!

I paid $15.50 for 4 cookies n cream, 4 chocolate chip, 2 dark chocolate, 1 toffee chip, and 1 walnut chip. I remembered that the cookies were pretty small, but I had forgotten just how small, so I would say that they are a bit overpriced. But what they lack in size, they make up for in flavor and texture.

Cookies n cream: These seem to be the favorite for most reviewers. While I thought they were delicious, I was slightly underwhelmed by the texture. There was more of a crunch than I expected; I was hoping for a bit more chew. These cookies are also a little thinner than the other cookies. Don't get me wrong, I will still order these next time...I just think they could be better with a little more chew.

Chocolate chip: A cookie shop *needs* to have a solid chocolate chip. Thankfully, Anthony's does it right! Lots of quality chocolate throughout with the perfect chewiness. 

Dark chocolate: A more "adult" version of their classic chocolate chip, these are made with dark chocolate disks rather than chips. Also very good, especially for a dark chocolate fan like myself.

Toffee chip: I have been obsessed with toffees and brittles during pregnancy, so this was absolutely amazing to my tastebuds. I wish I had ordered more than one!

Walnut chip: this one was rather unremarkable. Not bad or anything...I just don't remember how I felt about it while eating it, and I only had it yesterday.

I will be back again very soon, preferably before the baby comes. I had ordered a dozen cookies, and one day later, they're all gone =(. I won't tell you how many (few, really) I shared with my partner. Oops.
author: Leigh R.

description:
I called Anthony's to place a pickup order. The call went straight to voicemail asking that I go to their website & email them, so I did. I called the next morning to ask about my email order and the guy told me, "We haven't checked it and I need a credit card with the order." I told him my call the previous day went straight to voicemail and I did what was asked. Getting nowhere, I asked if they had all of their cookies available. Long story short, I drove over and placed my order. I wanted to plate the cookies on a platter that I brought into Anthony's. The guy behind the counter told me they couldn't do that and I couldn't do it either inside their store. This made no sense as I told him I'd pay for the cookies then plate them and then buy more if needed. He wouldn't allow it. I left with nothing but an empty cookie platter. 
I drove to Draegers San Mateo. The bakery guy, Cody plated my cookies and even gave me extra doilies. He didn't seem to think it was a big deal or an odd request. And the cookies which weighed more than Anthony's 1 ounce cookies are 95 cents each.
I was an early customer of Anthony's, even followed them on Twitter and recommended them to my friend for his birthday celebration where he bought over 1,000 cookies.

You've lost my business and my referrals for refusing to help me or let me plate my cookies at one of your tables.
author: Janet P.

description:
Disclaimer: my name is also Anthony, so this will be a five-star review by default. 

The good news is that it would be anyway. This is the way cookies should be done. Fantastic variety, great prices and even better staff. Four Barrel is best bean in town and they carry it on tap. Coincidence? I think not. 

The owner is a charismatic man that will help assist you in any strenuous cookie adventure you are about to embark on. 

The only thing I need at Anthonys now is some raw milk to pound down with my cookies. 

My favorites: double chocolate, German chocolate, cookies and cream, walnut chocolate chip. 


Is it chance this place has 1100 five-star reviews? No. Go in and meet Anthony and pound some tasty cookies.
author: Anthony G.

description: Haven't been here in years, stopped by because this place used to be a one of a kind experience.  I was taken aback by the friendly , attentive service, and was very happy to see they have hot coffee, blue bottle.  The toffee cookie and the cookies and cream were always my goto, I think they have become even more delicious than ever.  It is very hard to go wrong with choices here, despite the far fetched creativity at times, the baker (Anthony I think) never let's anything get away from the impeccable standards of this establishment.  A staple of San Francisco, and California desserts.  Thanks for the cookies!!!!!
author: Jeff L.

description:
Cookies and Cream Cookie FTW!
 I like oreos, but i always wished it was soft and not so hard. Then BAM my bfs fam introduced me to these cookies! these cookies taste like oreos but are soft and chewy like cookies i love. genius! 

Anthony's cookies soft and chewy with a little crispness on the edges. Anthony himself was there making the cookies and the environment of their store was really friendly and fun! The employees were joking around with us and were very informed on the cookies and company. Anthony's cookies definitely hit the spot. I also tried their toffee, chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, cinnamon spice just as yummy as the cookies and cream.
author: Julie B.

description:
YOU!!! Cookie Monster!!! You have to, have to, have to come here if you haven't tried what REAL cookies are, Mrs. Fields doesn't even compare. 

Craving a nice, simple dessert and not in the mood for ice cream. Anthony's Cookies esp. the Cookies & Cream most delicious flavor EVER in & will be for the future centuries! This cookie tastes similar to Ben & Jerry's ice cream flavor "Cookies & Milk" if that's relevant or even close to a comparison. 

It was hilarious b/c we ordered 4 cookies. 2 for me & 2 for my girl friend. Choco Chip, Cookies & Cream, Toffee. We didn't get to try the other special cool flavors b/c we came 20 mins before closing, haha. Walked out of the shop, walked half way to the car as we were biting into our cookies, and we thought together silently, reading each other's mind..."wow, we gotta walk back now and buy a dozen!!" We sure did walk back in the quickness. The cashier, totally sweet, such a gentleman, who insisted we SAMPLE the flavors (the first time, earlier), ALL flavors that they had left, and said, "You guys are back for more huh?" HELL YEA!!! We said happily. He suggested the Oatmeal to sample, I wasn't going to try it b/c I'm not into raisins in my cookie, but WOW best Oatmeal cookie I've ever tried!! 

End of the story we ended up with a dozen 1/2 Choco Chip & 1/2 Cookies & Cream in a nice beautiful, simple box bagged up in a nice, simple bag. 

All in all a beautiful experience at Anthony's Cookies.
author: Christine F.

description:
I have been avoiding the drive to the other side of Twin Peaks to try these cookies. Lucky for me someone else did.

The cookies are soft and chewy. Like everyone else said, the cookies and cream was the best of the selection I received. 

 the chocolate chip was too sweet for my taste. Will have to try the dark chocolate in the future.

My friend does not have a sweet tooth. But, he really like these cookies.  Guess who's driving me over the hill?!
author: Debbie T.

description: I was in SF for vacation and was on the hunt for the best cookies in SF. I took über to this location and jt was easy to find. There was no line when I got there in the morning. I got the cookies and cream cookie and chocolate chip. Both were surprisingly good. The staff was super nice to me. I'd definitely recommend people to try it when they are in SF.
author: David H.

description:
Favorites: Cookies and cream & toffee chip. 
Crispy edges and chewy middles. I just wish they were warm. Anthony's is like a hidden gem in San Francisco. Never would have been here if not for my friend who loves the place as well.
author: Maggie B.

description:
Anthony's Cookies are amazing!  My son goes crazy over Cookies and Cream and my daughter loves Chocolate Chip!  The people, especially the owner Anthony are very nice and helpful!

I am always a hit when I buy Anthony's cookies for my staff!
author: Nyree M.

description: I didn't know how good these cookies were until I tried one. After one bite I had to grab an extra one to go along with my morning coffee. I'm not a huge cookie fab but these were pretty good!
author: Erik M.

description:
Cookies and cream! My favorite cookie from Anthony's by far. Actually, one of my favorite cookies in general. 

This shop is literally just a kitchen with an open space to buy your cookies. Bare bones and totally not complaining. Drop in, grab your [MANY] dozen cookies and bounce. 

I'm so addicted to these cookies. Slightly crunchy/crispy on the edges and perfectly chewy in the middle. Just how a good cookie should be!! Definitely come and try his cookies, they're amazing. And the people who work here are super nice too! Nothing pretentious at all about it.
author: Chloe Y.

description: I get the hype!  Fresh-baked cookies with different flavors.  Each cookie is $1.25/$1.50.  My favorite is the Cookies and Cream one. Each cookie was moist and packed with delicious cookie greatness.  You can really taste the love in it - definitely not your typical Chips Ahoy cookie.  Price is a little steep but worth every penny.
author: Christianne F.

description:
I've had my fair share of delicious cookies before, especially Tiff's Treats in Texas, however, these cookies are the best I've had in the bay area. 

There's a wide variety to choose from, but I'd say my favorites are cookies and cream and toffee chip. 

You HAVE to get the Strauss organic milk to drink along side the cookies. It goes down smoothly, say many of my friends who don't even like milk. 

If you are taking the Bart, be careful, as Mission District isn't the safest area. The cookies, I assure you, are worth it. 

Some tips: 
-There's usually parking right in front of the store, so don't feel you have to park too far away. 
-Get the Strauss milk. If you return it to Anthony's, you get $1.50 back!
-Ask to try a cookie if you aren't too sure whether you will like it.
-The more you buy, the cheaper it is for you. Feel free to take them home too. They still taste fresh after a couple of days.
author: Tanya A.

description:
It's good, but not mind blowing.  However, what I do like about the place is the moment you walk in and see the milk jugs and nothing on display.  Yet there is a chalk board of the cookies available and a gentleman at the counter in front of a bake cart holding all the delicious cookies.  This place is no joke.  

We tried the Toffee Cookie, Oatmeal and Chips, and one more that I suppose isn't good enough to remember.  I would say the Toffee is my favorite with its chewiness and crisp but without the oiliness.  However, the journey out here does seem like quite a long one, so long that I felt it necessary to enjoy a nice cold beer while scarfing down my cookie across the street at Pi with a stout beer.  Delicious.
author: Vincent K.

description:
I don't get it. 

Went there yesterday Sept 21 2013. Cookies and cream cookie was very good but the chocolate chip taste like a step up from the way I cook them at home. 
Yet they weren't burnt, but were cooked too long. Seem like all the cookies were like that. Pretty disappointed. Tried 3 cookies and nothing about them blew me away.. 

So average score. 
Won't recommend to people. I don't see it...
author: Nate M.

description:
Eaten cookies from this place a total of 3 times and some how I managed to come here for the first time a couple days ago. 

Cookies I've tried here: 
~Cookies and cream- super chewy. I can see why this runs out quick! 
~Classic chocolate chip- sounds just like its name! Can't ever go wrong with a classic.
~Oatmeal raisin- wasn't my favorite nor was it the worse. Pass on this for me. 
~Toffee chip- quite delist! Recommended 
~peanut butter- my personal favorite. The cookie is super crumbly/buttery that it LITERALLY melts in your mouth. Recommended! 

Tips: 
~ They bake cookies till 3pm. 
~ Toffee and cookies & cream run out extremely quick so don't come around 6 expecting dozens of each cookie available. 
~ Get milk with your cookies. I was dying of thirst after my PB cookie.
author: Anna H.

description:
Why yes, I did need to make a stop at Anthony's Cookies based on their feature on the 7x7 SF Eats list. I mean c'mon...Cookies 'n Cream Cookies?? Yes please!

I ordered a dozen to go with 8 Cookies 'n Cream and 1 each of Toffee, Chocolate Chip Walnut, White Chocolate & Oatmeal Raisin. The service was prompt & efficient and I adored the way they packaged the box all nice & pretty.

$1.25 a cookie is pretty reasonable, especially when it's $12 for a dozen. A minor negative I have is the size of the cookie itself (a bit small), but I will have to say that the Cookies 'n Cream Cookies is worth it! It was pure, chocolate-y, Oreo goodness. I'm glad I ordered 8 because they were so hard to stop eating! Next time I'll be sure to order a dozen of these babies instead ;)

(And just for good measure, these cookies stayed moist & chewy a couple of days after they were purchased. Nice job, Anthony's!)
author: Faye G.

description:
Long story short...brought my boyfriend to Anthony's cookies and he ate all "deym" cookies! lol.

While I really enjoyed Anthony's cookies & cream and toffee nut cookie, the bf thought their white chocolate chip cookie was the best. In all honesty I think they're all good. I've also tried their oatmeal, cinnamon spice, walnut chip, classic chocolate chip, and peanut butter cookie.
author: Desiree B.

description:
I'm in love ~ with Anthony's Cookies, hands down the best cookies I've had so far. They have a nice crispiness on the outside, a chewy middle and not overly sweet. I enjoyed both cookies-n-creme and toffee cookies. 

Daily, they have: 
- cookies-n-creme
- toffee chip
- classic chocolate chip
- whole wheat oatmeal raisin
- cinnamon spice
- white chocolate chip

Rotating flavors include: walnut chip, German chocolate, walnut double chocolate chip, whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip, candied pecan chip, double chocolate chip, and peanut butter. Check out their site if you want those cookies - they differ depending on the day. http://www.anthonyscookies.com/

Milk and coffee available to wash it down. If you want to take a load off, there's a picnic table and window seating...and they make a great gift.
author: Cathy K.

description:
Anthony's Cookies is still a work in progress.  When the bakery becomes fully operational we'll probably see tables and chairs to sit at and assorted beverages served to go with Anthony's outstanding cookies.  Without a doubt the door or window will probably sport a bright red "People Love Us on Yelp" decal.

Anthony comes across as a man who takes pride in his cookies, in the thirteen years of experience he has in creating these cookies and in the quality of the ingredients of his cookies.  I stopped in shortly after his store opened on Thursday morning and purchased two dozen cookies to take back to the office to share with my co-workers.  Anthony's Cookies currently offers 12 exciting flavors of cookies which are sold by the half dozen.  Here is an image of his offerings and prices as of April 2009 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=fX99YW7vxoa7hQjO2IPQoQ).  You are welcome to mix and match flavors to your desire.

The cookies are between 2-1/2 to 3 inches in diameter.  Anthony asked whether I could try a cookie in the store before I left and let him know what I thought.  I sampled a Cookies and Cream.  The edges of the still warm cookie were nice and crispy, and the interior of the cookie was nice and chewy.  I loved the contrast between the two.  The cookie was sweet without being overly sweet.  I wished I had a tall, cold glass of milk right then and there.  It would have been the perfect milk and cookies scenario.

I purchased four flavors on this visit, and I've included photos of each.

Cookies and Cream (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=nghb57S-WlCQeayzJiw4EQ) - Unique and different.  The cookies are made with crushed Oreo cookies mixed into the base cookie batter.  These were the absolute favorites.  Had I known I would have hidden these from my co-workers.

Toffee Chip (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=776m0nIU8bmU8CzpgmpkLg) - These cookies were crispier than the others.  Bits of butter toffee are melted into the cookie batter to give the cookie its excellent butter toffee flavor.

Cinnamon Sugar (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=57_GBexV9-qN8jHetM3IhQ) - The cookie had just a hint of cinnamon flavor.  These were dusted with very fine sugar crystals.  I think these would be perfect to jumpstart a lazy morning.  My co-workers agreed as they only left me half a cookie.  

Double Chocolate Chip (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/PrlH7YcQ22m9DyuWbxJjMA?select=2pHRiyQ3pwzM_0FKGeMqvw) - It's a chocolate cookie with semi-sweet chocolate chips.  I only sampled a quarter of one as my co-workers apparently loved this one also.

I'll be returning soon to pick up some cookies for myself and the family to enjoy.  As there is no store sign up yet look for the address number and the cookie flyer adhered to the window.  For now, I believe it is cash only.  Please give Anthony's Cookies a try, and show Anthony some Yelper love!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
2 words: cinnamon spice

It's so damn good and chewy! What else do I need to say that hasn't already been stated?
author: Heather R.

description: Best cookies I've ever had. Sh!ts on any other cookie off top. He need to bring back the banana cookie and stop fronting. A lot yall don't new and dont know about the banana cookie. His best cookie. All the cookies are off the hook. My favorite is that toffee and anything with chocolate in it, but that peanut butter cookie is off the hook to. Damn u can't lose.
author: Ster C.

description:
Hmmm, Anthony's cookies are definitely tasty, but they didn't rock my five-star world. 

I tried (not at once silly, ok kind of at once...)
-Cookies & Cream - not sure what's suppose to make it creamy? It taste like a really chocolaty chocolate chip cookie to me. Very good though. Would get again. 

-Cinnamon Spice - delightfully yummy! It was fluffy and like biting into a mini cloud. A tasty cloud! Great flavor. Probably the stand out cookie in my book. I will definitely be back for more. 

Oatmeal chocolate chip - my favorite cookie flavor in general so I was excited, but it's a nugget! (see picture). When I looked in the bag and saw the nugget I gasped and said, "for a $1.25"? Probably my least favorite. I won't get it again.

Chocolate chip - a good cookie, but nothing noteworthy. I would get cookies and cream or cinnamon spice over this one. 


Good things: 
-cute little storefront with one community table to munch on your cookies 
-very cold milk (or hot coffee), which is perfect to wash down your cookies 
-straightforward menu with the day's freshly baked cookies
-soft, freshly baked, chewy cookies. obvi.

Less than amusing things:
-$5 minimum on credit card usage
-no discount for ordering half a dozen
-kind of small for $1.25 per cookie


Don't get me wrong, the cookies are very good. I will be back if I'm in the neighborhood, but I still prefer Hot Cookie.
author: Shannon K.

description:
Dear Anthony,

I think you became my new best friend. if i didn't have to worry about my figure (or lack thereof..), i think i'd buy a lifetime supply from you. you seriously probably put 2 sticks of butter in each cookie to get that perfect chewiness and the right amount of softness.

my cookie of choice: cookies&cream

i think it's worth paying a little bit more for a delicious cookie that you can't get any where else (12 dollars a dozen). the toffee cooke is spectacular too. thank you Anthony, i think because of you i can finally find comfort when it's that time of the month.
author: Andy H.

description:
These are some of the best cookies I've ever had!

Sampled the toffee chip and cookies & cream, and ended up getting the classic chocolate chip. All had an amazing caramelized flavor and were crispy outside, chewy inside. I liked the chocolate chip best, but toffee chip and c&c were close behind.

I'm a bit bummed about the cookie size, compared to Specialty's cookies. However, flavor and texture are both there. I'll definitely be back.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
I went for the first time and I got Cookies & Cream, White Macadamia, Oatmeal Chocolate (because they didn't have raisin), and Peanut butter (my fave). 

The cookies are good, but they're pretty small for having to pay $1.00-1.50 per cookie. I thought that because of how they were hyped up they'd be bigger. But I love how they have a lot of flavors. I had them right before closing though so maybe I have to have them when they come straight out of the oven to give them 5 stars. 

I'm not too big a fan of sweets so the cookies and cream was just OK to me. That's probably why I liked the peanut butter the best. I don't crave them or anything like a lot of people do. Maybe I'll have to go back again to try the oatmeal raisin.
author: Jenn F.

description: I went 30 minutes before closing, so a lot of the cookie flavors were sold out.  We bought 1 of each of the remaining types - oatmeal raisin, classic chocolate chip, double chocolate chip, dark chocolate chip, and cinnamon spice.  The cookies were soft and chewy, which I loved.  My favorite was the oatmeal raisin, while my friend loved the classic chocolate chip.  I would not recommend the cinnamon spice unless you love the taste of strong spices.  I definitely plan to come back again to try the more popular flavors.
author: Cici A.

description: Pricey, but good! Cookies are $1.50/each, which is pricey in and of itself, but the cookies are not that big either. They have rotating flavors available. A check next to the flavor means its available day of. I got a dark chocolate chip cookie. Definitely sweet, but the texture was perfection. I love my cookies just a wee bit crunchy on the outer edge, and soft and chewy on the inside, and Anthony's Cookies are just that. Would be even better with milk or hot tea, rather than water. A good treat!
author: Phoebe C.

description:
Cookies and cream cookie. Cookies and cream cookie. Cookies and cream cookie.

Say that five times fast. And then, stop by and only get that one. It's amazingly good. It's like an Oreo cookie... IN A COOKIE.

The cookies ain't cheap, they're on the smaller side, and they ask customers to close the door to "lock in the freshness" blahblahblahnoonecares; all I care about is that cookies and cream cookie.

Should I say "cookie" again?

Cookie!
author: Adena B.

description:
I've been here so many times, but am surprised to not have reviewed Anthony's Cookies yet! Tucked away within the Mission district (within close proximity to the 24th St. Mission BART), the place is pretty small, with the majority of the place being the bakery where all the cookie magic happens! They have quite the selection of cookies, and a packed refrigerator with glass jars of milk. Perfect combination? Obviously!

I'm fond of their Toffee Chip and their Walnut Double Chocolate Chip. Their cookies aren't giant or lavish like many other places, but what I like is that they're really dense and packed with flavor (or loads of chocolate!). Whenever I stop by, I tend to grab a bag to go, as well as enjoy some on-site with some friends.

Definitely a place to stop by if you are in the mood for some really good cookies, or if you want a small snack on the go.
author: Kevin J.

description: There doesn't really need to be a long review for this place. All I can really say is that every cookie is delicious it just depends on what you generally like. But if you cannot decide cookies and cream is the choice for you!
author: Khanh L.

description: I came here because I was told I made cookies since 1997, but not really.  My Friends and Cousins kept raving about it so I decided to swing by before heading home to San Diego and I'd have to say you better believe the hype.  My kids went ape shhhh and couldn't relax on the way home but they crashed hard like any sugar rush would do.  Each bite is a piece of heaven although I can't still get over the fact I spent a lil over $20 for dozen .5 of cookies.  :-)
author: Anthony E.

description:
Despite the hundreds of reviews raving about the deliciousness of Anthony's, this was not quite my experience. 

We came around 5pm and they were already sold out of pretty much everything except for a few of the Oatmeal options. Minus stars for that  since I wasn't expecting their stock to be so miniscule when they open until 8pm per yelp (this may or may not be justified but it annoyed me). More minus stars for the tiny lump of cookie that cost me $1.25. Yes, the Oatmeal walnut chip I decided on out the remaining options was good, but not amazing. 

So what can be learned from my experience? Come early and expect to pay premium prices for roughly 3 bites of cookie. 

I'll probably come back just so I can try some of their more popular options, like the cookies and cream. But until then, 3 stars.
author: Natasha H.

description:
I've had these cookies before, but this was my first time actually experiencing going into the store and ordering from the selection of cookies.

They seem to be most well-known for their Cookies and Cream Cookies, which are really good and pretty unique.  I tried the following cookies as well:

-Walnut Double Chocolate Chip - okay
-Cinnamon Spice - pretty good
-Toffee Chip - very good
-Candied Pecan Chip - very good

Overall, I found the cookies to be somewhat hit-or-miss...not that that they were bad, but just somewhat average overall.  I don't think these are the best cookies out there, but they are pretty good and if you go for the Cookies and Cream, you'll be very satisfied.
author: Ken G.

description: A bit on the steep side of pricing for cookies. They do taste good, but not for the price, unfotunately.
author: Timothy L.

description:
In my husband's words: The best cookie in San Francisco. Or ever. Period.

They only make cookies, so not surprisingly, they excel at it. The cookies are moist, soft, freshly baked, just the right size and just the right price (I think I got 2 cookies for $2.5USD).

You can ask for samples, which is 1/4 of a cookie. 

Most famous flavor is cookies & cream, however I tend to like cinnamon spice, oatmeal raisin, and walnut-y ones. They're all high quality.

Store has a picnic table for you to sit and finish your cookie. They also sell milk.

If you like cookies....if you like food, you need to come here, at least once, to try it.
author: Elizabeth T.

description:
For a while I've been wondering what type of place deserves five on Yelp and then I bit into Anthony's Cookies and Cream cookie, and I instantly knew that this was what I had been searching for.  Everything about the cookies is perfect; the exterior is crunchy but not burnt, the inside is moist and chewy, while the chips are just melt in your mouth goodness.  

It's a good thing that they are a bit on the pricey side (but you absolutely get what you pay for), otherwise I'd walk out with two dozen, eat them all, and then come back for seconds.
author: Jonathan M.

description: We always have to make a stop here to buy 1-2 dozen cookies when we're visiting. We're from Southern California and always need to buy some cookies to ring home with us. We discovered Anthony's Cookies 4 1/2 years ago for the first time and always come back!!
author: Chrystal L.

description:
AMAZING AND DELICIOUS!! Every cookie is baked to perfection and all the flavors are distinct and stand out from each other. Cookies and Cream tastes exactly like Cookies and Cream. Toffee Chip tastes exactly like Toffee.

The store front is a little tricky to find. The door is really small but don't give up! It's worth walking back and forth a few times! Parking is relatively easy too as it's down near 24th St.
author: Clarice C.

description:
I'll start by saying that Anthony's cookies and cream cookies are literally the best cookies I've ever tasted. I've been a big promoter of them and have sent several friends to Anthony's over the years because I love their cookies so much.

However, today, my friend and I went into Anthony's in hopes of getting some cookies, and after waiting in line for 15 minutes and slowly getting more excited about these delectable treats, we were turned away right when we got to the register because they had just "sold out" of their last cookie.
