The strange part? Right behind him were piles and piles of delicious-looking cookies. When we asked about them, he said, "Sorry, those don't meet our quality standards and we're giving them to the homeless." When we, and others who had been waiting in line asked if we could buy the cookies, we were told no. 

I'm all about quality standards, but if you're going to give your seconds away and refuse to sell them to customers, please don't pile them up in plain view and tell us we can't have them. We left disappointed and frustrated with the service and communication.
author: Ali G.

description:
Who couldn't resist a good cookie!!!   Absolutely love their cookies n creme cookies!   I even have gotten my out of town friends craving for their cookies..  The love the German chocolate cookies!!  But learned the hard way that the German chocolate cookies are only made Thurs thru Sun!  

Definitely an SF local favorite for this native San Franciscan!!
author: Ester E.

description:
Best COOKIES EVERRRRR! 

I've only tried the cookie and cream flavor..and WOW!

this should be on your "must eat" list!

I have yet to try the other flavors..but overall...these cookies are deeeelicious!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Yes, the cookies here are pretty good and they reheat well. But, that is one expensive cookie given its size. On top of that, this place has no seating other than one community table, does not give a vibe conducive to hanging out for more than 15 minutes, sells Four Barrel coffee beans but only the Guatamala Concepcion Pixcaya.

The toffee chip was good, but incredibly sweet. The walnut chocolate chip was good too. In fact, I'm certain that all the cookies here are good because they are sooo sweet. The cookies and cream was my favorite as the subtle bitterness combated the sweetness a bit.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
These cookies are yummy! Hands down thee best chocolate chip I've ever had! 
The cookie monster in me says go try and you shall see! Yummy!
author: Marie P.

description: There are incredibly few good store bought cookies but fortunately, Anthony's is one of the few. Their chocolate chip, cookies and cream, and toffee are as good as homemade. Not the best oatmeal raisin cookies, too few raisins, overly spicy yet somehow bland. Disappointingly not sweet.
author: Roger H.

description:
YUMMM! Anthony's cookie and cream cookie is DELICIOUSSS!

How do you perfect every single (almost) of your cookie? Everyone of them was delicious. However, the only "3-star" cookie is the white chocolate chip cookie--it was on the sweeter side for my taste.
author: Jen H.

description:
I can only vouch for the Walnut chip and they were amazzzziiinnnngggg!! They had a ton of walnuts!! I could eat these cookies daily!! I wish I lived in SF :( 

I got there around noon so they had plenty of cookies!
author: Chante C.

description: These cookies are absolutely delightful! They're perfect in size, texture, taste - and the flavor combos are simple yet amazing. My favorite's the cinnamon spice and dark chocolate. Come here for a slice of happiness :)
author: Rosanna C.

description:
Anthony's cookies are by far the best cookies I've ever had. The toffee chip cookie is my favorite. Moist, chewy, and buttery, with just the right amount of salt.

You can find the cookies in many of the cafes in the Mission, but you have to visit the shop. The smell is overwhelming, and you can see the cookies being baked in the kitchen.
author: Jesse G.

description:
I love to bake! Cookies are always a guilty pleasure for me and when I heard these are the best cookies in SF, I just had to try them. Upon arriving the worker behind the counter greeted us and was very helpful. He also wasn't bad looking either.  He offered us any samples we wanted to try. I ended up getting a whole dozen to myself! I got cookies and cream, toffee, white chocolate chip, and walnut chocolate chip. The cookies were amazing, soft and don't crumble. 

Cookies and cream: BEST COOKIE ever. It's amazing, like eating an oreo, but it's mixed in with a cookie. Not so much cream but still my favorite.
Toffee: A little bit chewy but not too chewy. Toffee wasn't exactly evident in the flavor but I loved biting in the cookie knowing there's a bit of toffee in there. Usually toffee is hard, and I was expecting to bite into a hard cookie, but it was so soft just like the rest of them.
White chocolate chip: So sweet, almost too sweet to eat. White chocolate chips though do have a reputation to be sweeter than the rest.
Walnut Chocolate Chip: Smaller cookies, more dense though. I just wished that the cookie was a little bit bigger, but I did enjoy a different texture. 

The cookies were still amazing the next day. Feel free to stock up and keep these in your cookie jars. My friend even thought I baked them all myself. I wish I was able to confidently say I did, but all the credit goes to Anthony.
author: Rae Dawne G.

description:
I tip my hat off to Anthony. While I sit here and type my Yelp review, feeling like a corporate drone and uninspired on company time, I think of Anthony four years ago. He loved to bake and found a way to profit off of his hobby. With the support of his friends, who asked for nothing in return, he was able to open Anthony's Cookies. If that's not a success story that warms your heart, then I'm sorry you are so bitter. Have a cookie.

My plan for the Mission was to succumb to the ice cream pulls. My cousins intervened and instructed me to visit Anthony's Cookies instead. With a false address in mind, I walked 4 blocks down Valencia in the wrong direction. I was about to give up on Anthony's when I got a text with the correct address. The text was then followed up with a phone call. My cousins were not going to let me leave the Bay without tasting Anthony's Cookies. And now that I have tasted them, I won't let YOU leave the BAY without having one... or two... OK three!

I walked away with a dozen to bring to a dinner party. We picked cookies and cream, cinnamon spice, oatmeal cranberry, chocolate chip, toffee chip, and walnut chip. Since there was a big group of us, my friend cut them into fourths so we could try them all. Not only were these cookies the stuff dreams are made of but they leave an aftertaste of sweet memories as well. I love them and spent the whole night wishing I could have a whole cookie for myself. They are small but simple cookies made with a lot of butter, crispy on the outside, flat, and perfect in every way. The flavors are strong and I am so curious now about the organic peanut butter cookie and the banana cookie. Before Anthony's, I couldn't envision what a cookies and cream cookie would look like. It's not an Oreo. It just looks like a chocolate chip cookie but it tastes like cookies and cream. It's genius.

Now go and get your cookie on.
author: Rachel A.

description: Great cookies but go there early to get fresh ones!
author: Paras J.

description:
I'd been dying to try the Chocolate Chip Cookies @ Anthony's forever. So imagine my excitement when i finally did (at a client meeting). 
I'll have to say: they were good but by no means, the best Choc chip cookies i've ever had. I'm surprised by the rabid reviews on Yelp and 7x7. 
I did not try the Cookies & Cream, which my co-workers Swear, is amazing, so i'll reserve judgment for another day. 

But yea...i won't be driving/ cabbing/ BARTing down to the Mission anytime soon for these cookies. The ones @ Humphry (when available) are WAY better
author: Jocelyn L.

description: They put cookies into a cookie. Genius! Seriously, the cookies and cream flavor is delicious. You should totally buy a dozen, just don't do it alone because you might end up finishing it off yourself. I'm also a huge fan of the toffee cookie.
author: Stephen S.

description: Okay, anyone that compares Anthony's Cookies to Mrs. Fields is cray! Anthony makes better cookies than anyone I know (and yes, I realize I am talking like I know Anthony which I do not haha). I will admit they are a little small for the price: $1.25, but totally worth it in quality and taste. My favorite is the white chocolate chip and the cookies & cream cookie. Grab a pint of milk & you're good to go!
author: Lauren L.

description:
I ordered the Cookies & Cream cookie and the White Chocolate Chip cookie. I am thinking that the Cookies and & Cream cookie is probably the best thing they serve--probably the only thing I would get in the future.

I liked the interior design and the atmosphere of the bakery. The workers were nice and I liked the picnic table seating. I'll get a box of cookies for some reason someday.
author: Marlon T.

description: Hands down the absolute best cookies around. Run by a great and easy going owner who genuinely takes pride in what he does. You taste quality in every bite. Highly recommend the Toffie Chip.
author: Scott H.

description: I love Anthony 's! I always try to grab a few boxes when I'm in the city for the ride home or for the family & friends when we get together. I probably tried every cookie here n they are all awesome! My fav especially is toffee, oatmeal raisin and of course cookies & cream.
author: Rosalynn D.

description:
Good on ya Anthony...so good so dangerous.  I did it w/these cookies in the store, up/down valencia, on the 49 bus and even in my room behind closed doors.  If your able to indulge do it, you'd be cheating yourself otherwise.

Grabbed a bakers dozen of dealer's choice and they did not disappoint.  Toffee chip being my favorite.  Love the 50's touch in creamery milk too.  Now that you have a connection, you could/should expand a dimension and serve malts & shakes and turn that joint into a sweets and sugar high zone!
author: Clark G.

description:
The cookies and cream cookie is our favorite cookie in the world. Enough said.

Glad that the line there isn't out the door (not looking forward to when it gets to be that long...).
author: Melody T.

description:
To be as crumbly accurate as possible- 3.58 celestials would be my rating for Anthony's Cookies. 

Perhaps the high ratings and exceptionally flattering compliments received from friends and fellow cookie lovers alike set my expectations at a nonexistent bar, but for some reason, I did not enjoy the cookies as much as I thought I would. Don't get me wrong, the cookies were good and exemplifies the consistency, texture and flavor of what a cookie should be like-which is slight crispy on the outside, soft and chewy in the middle; however, nothing really wowed me. Something was missing and I can't seem to put my finger to it. I didn't even do my dancing seat wiggle like I normally do with the first bite of something friggin' good. That's how sad it was. 

The cookies and cream was my favorite. Then the German Chocolate. Toffee was too sweet for me and the usual good ole' chocolate chips was not a kicker at all. To make my day even sad, they had run out of double dark chocolate. meh. 

Setting aside all economical factors, whereby the slightly inflated cookie price of $1.25 and the smaller size was a tiny turn off, just like the pimples on a really cute guy with bad skin, I really did not jump out of my seat and say "HALLELUJAH, THE PERFECTION OF COOKIES HAVE BEEN DISCOVERED, I AM ESSENTIALLY IN COOKIE HEAVENNNN!" No.... not at all And not to be a cocky head, but I even feel like my homemade cookies were somewhat comparable, if not, better than these. 

Unless someone can point me to a "WOW" cookie, me thinks this cookie monster will continue to eat out of Tiffany's Confectionary until further notice.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
This is not Mrs. Fields Cookies.  This is Anthony's Cookies and boy oh boy do I wish they had a location in the South Bay.  I love everything about this place - the font used for the logo, the wooden bench sitting area, the milk bottle lined register area, how you can see the cookie-making process as you order, and well, the cookies!!  Here's what we ordered:

- Cookies & Cream
- Classic Chocolate Chip
- White Chocolate Chip
- Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin
- Walnut Chip
- Double Chocolate Chip

There are cookies, and there are COOKIES.  The only thing that could top these would be eating these right when they come out of the oven. 

I can't wait to go back!
author: Nathalie V.

description: I enjoyed all of the cookies I got, every flavor was delicious. Not too sweet, but flavorful. The texture was perfect. A bit crispy on the edges, and soft middles. They are still delicious after a few days too! Simple, just how I like it.
author: Lindy P.

description:
I'm writing this review because I'm sitting in my bed, allllllll the way in Louisiana, and wishing...hoping...dreaming... that I could teleport myself to Anthony's for a walnut chip cookie... or five. 

My partner in crime and I tried the walnut chip, the cinnamon spice, the dark chocolate chip, and the double chocolate chip. We also sampled the cookies & cream (their signature cookie) and the toffee while in the shoppe. 

The walnut chip was definitely my favourite. The cinnamon spice and cookies & cream were also wonderful. The dark chocolate chip, double chocolate chip, and toffee were delicious as well, just not as "up there" as the others.... IMO. 

The only thing that I can imagine making these cookies even better is if they used organic and locally sourced ingredients (and they might, but I'm too busy fantasising to do the research.) 

Go to Anthony's. Buy cookies. Be happy. :)
author: Kim D.

description:
These cookies are phenomenal. 

Chocolate chip cookies are a tell all for me and they just so happen to be my favorite type of cookie. They're crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside. Just perfect. The chocolate chips don't become all hard and brittle, they stay soft and velvety. 

The cookies and cream comes in at a close second. Plenty of oreo bits in there!

I tried the coffee cookie recently as it made it's debut at $1.75 a piece. Not bad, but not exaclty the best. It seemed to lack coffee flavor but it did have a nice texture to it. 

The oatmeal chocolate chip does not spread during the baking process and almost looks like a baby scone. There are a few other flavors that have this characteristic as well. I usually love oatmeal chocolate chip but these are just meh. Not enough to knock them down a star though. 

Can't wait to grab some more!
author: Jessica L.

description:
The most delicious cookies I have ever eaten in my life! My friend received a half dozen for her birthday and we all took a bite of each and we were hooked. We planned to make a stop at Anthony's the next day to check out the rest of the flavors and buy more. The guy that was working the counter was really nice and you can sample any of the flavors they have for the day. At $1.25 a cookie or $1.00 if you buy a half or full dozen, they're kind of expensive but it keeps you from buying too much and eating too much sugar I suppose.

Cookies and Cream was my favorite but honestly, all of them are wonderful.

Make a stop here, trust me. You CANNOT NOT try Anthony's!
author: Dan N.

description: I stopped by for a dozen cookies and the cookies were fantastic. I didn't try every single flavor but every single one that I did have was really good. It was still very chewy and delicious the next day. All in all, I would say that it's a small and expensive cookie that is worth getting if you are nearby.
author: Allison S.

description:
I am a cookie monster! Was in the mission craving some sweets and saw that this place that I've had bookmarked for awhile was near by..adventure time!

The cookies here are pretty awesome..everything we ordered was satisfying with my favorite being the cookies and cream (seems to be everyone's favorite, with good reason!).

The cookies are baked fresh and have a great texture..slightly crispy on the outside but soft and somewhat chewy on the inside. 

Cookies are kinda small in my opinion (prices are reasonable though!) so don't feel too bad if you end up ordering a bunch.  They offer delicious straus milk as well which is a bonus ;D 

The girl working there was super friendly and peaceful. They are very open with sampling whatever you're curious to try as well! The place is small but cute. Good spot to sit down and enjoy some delicious cookies with your friends.
author: Melissa C.

description:
After reading my fellow Yelpers reviews, I made it a point to come out here and see for myself.  This review only needs 3 words:  YUMMY COOKIE GOODNESS.

'Nuff said.

But here's what I got:

Cookies and cream, Chocolate chip, Cinnamon spice, and Toffee chip (which was my favorite).  So read this review, peep out the pics, then get over there and try some for yourself.  It's the holiday weekend and you deserve it!!
author: Joe M.

description:
I'm not sure why this place has such high reviews, it wasn't anything special in my opinion

For its price, comparatively, I know I have had a lot better. The cookies are small, and there specialty cookies don't evoke the flavors that their titles suggest. Also, its just personal preference, but I prefer a soft cookie as well.

All in all, it wasn't a bad cookie, just undeserving of its praise. I think you can get better cookies elsewhere
author: Gabriel M.

description: Oh my goodness !!! I love this cute small shop. I have been in SF for 10 years and this is the first time that I have stumbled upon it. The staff is super sweet like the chocolate cookie that I had which was filled with chocolate...lots of it ! I cant wait to go again.
author: Magda G.

description:
The cookies and cream cookies are the best.  My heart still lies with Uncle Biff's Cookies back in San Diego, but here in San Francisco, I'll give it to Anthony's Cookies.  

I'm a big fan of walnuts, so when I first saw Walnut Double Chocolate Chip, I chose those without having to think twice.  It took me a few more visits before I decided to venture out and try different cookies.  This time, I finally gave in and went with customer's favorite - cookies and cream.  Why the hell did it take me this long to give it a shot? .. I honestly don't know. 

The cookies and cream flavoring was perfect; not too harsh and every bite had an even taste of cookies and cream. Unlike eating an actual Oreo, the ratio is either a hit or miss; too much cookie and not enough cream, or vice versa.  

Try it out if you haven't gotten the chance!
author: Patricia T.

description:
Great service. They will give you free samples when you are deciding on what to purchase. They don't rush you, which can be a good or a bad thing. Imagine if you're the person behind the guy ordering. 

The cookies & creme cookie was absolutely delicious. 
My family loved the cookie w/ macadamia nuts & white chocolate chip. 
I think everything was was pretty good. Not anything that spectacular for the hype. It is pretty expensive. I'm sure they have to break even somehow. 
Definitely worth trying the cookies & creme cookie.
author: Andrea K.

description:
Me want cookie. 

This quaint little spot is in a slightly unsavory part of town. Truly, a destination spot. My GF and I straight up took the BART and walked a few blocks just to go here to see what all the fuss is about. 

Thankfully, they lived up to the hype. I'm telling you, these are magical..no..miraculous. Especially when they're made with top quality ingredients. Especially when they're from a successful entrepreneur and not a corporate chain. Especially, when the staff is super nice and helpful and happily give out samples.

One whiff of the fresh baked aroma, and all your troubles seem to melt away. 

My picks:

-cookies & cream
-peanut butter
-toffee chip

Although, I don't think you can go wrong with any of the flavors. Savor all the flavors. I even washed 'em down with some milk & took some to take back home to family & friends. Now if only they start to deliver...the world may very well be a happier place because of it.
author: Joy B.

description: Good cookies and cheap. Most cookie places in the city charge $3-4 not $1.50. Peanut butter cookie was chalky and was thrown out but the chocolate chip was good. Very home baked taste.
author: Danielle O.

description: Very impressed first time I stopped by, staff and owner very attentive and provided great customer service. Cookies were fresh, moist love it - cookies and cream and chocolate chip YUM!
author: Kat D.

description:
Heaven in your mouth! 

Now, lets talk cookies...

They have about 12 different types or so... I love everything about this place! They do not overproduce so make sure you get there early enough in the day to get the cookies you want! 

These cookies are like homemade cookies! Sadly I do not know which flavors we got exactly but we got six different types. The cookies and cream, toffee one, the spice one were all delicious!!! Not to mention, these cookies are not overpriced at all!

If you haven't tried Anthony's Cookies, take my yelply advice and try it!! You will be begging for more :)
author: Lana P.

description:
Come on cookies! I feel foolish even telling you to come here.  The cookies are delicious.  It can be pricy if you get carried away like I do each time I come but you can practice self control (or not) visit anyway.  

Yours very oatmeal chocolate! 

Swoon!
author: Zin M.

description:
The second best cookies I ever had in my life (sorry, my wife's are better :)).

Cheap and really really good. Hinted here by a colleague and I'll never stop thanking her.
author: Paolo I.

description:
My boss is a connoisseur of all things edible, and after lunch he was craving something sweet so we came to Anthony's. 

Two words: toffee chip. The cookies are TO DIE FOR! I will definitely be dropping by again after work some day!

PS: does anyone know why closing the door would help keep the cookies fresh? I'd like to know. :)
author: Sherry L.

description:
I had a chance to try Anthony's Cookies yesterday at a birthday party. I wish it was closer because they were sooooo good!

My favorites were the cookies n cream and the toffee chip.

Maybe it's a good thing that it's not so close because I'd be here all the time and my wallet would be empty.
author: Lena H.

description:
I haven't had Anthony's Cookies in FOREVER. Now that I'm writing about it, I'm thinking it's about time to make another visit!

Tucked away in the Mission District, Anthony's Cookies is simply THE BEST place to go for a tasty snack. I've hooked friends, family, and co-workers on it. Nothing compares! They pride themselves on high-quality and unique flavors, delivering perfection with each and every batch. It's located in a pretty tough part of town, esp. parking-wise, so if you don't live nearby, I suggest buying at least a dozen (or more) because you will definitely be wanting more!

I usually order the following:
- Cookies and Cream: I imagine this is what it tastes like when you stick an oreo in the blender. Yes.
- Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin: A classic done extremely well.
- Toffee Chip

The cookies always taste warm, fresh, and not to mention full of flavor. They actually feel "homemade" rather than mass produced!

If you're in the area or a dessert addict like me, stop by Anthony's Cookies and you won't be disappointed! Nom, nom, and nom.
author: Nicole I.

description:
I'm gaining my "freshman 15" the summer AFTER freshman year and it's all because of Anthony's Cookies. 

Well, that and my absolute lack of willpower. After months of telling everyone I knew about how much I wanted to try Anthony's, I finally got a box of a dozen cookies -- two of each flavor they had (it was a Monday). The cookies were AMAZING. My favorite is definitely cookies & cream. I loved it so much that I had to go two days later.... yeah, I know, I'm a fatty. I went back on a Wednesday and this time I got cookeis & cream (duh) and oatmeal chocolate. Both were delicious. I also tried a piece of Toffee and it was just as yummy. PLUS, the prices are great, too!

The service was wonderful; they let you try a piece of any type of cookie you want. The place SMELLS amazing. And of course I recognized Anthony (who was at the back tasting the cookies) from his picture on their Yelp page, haha.

Thanks to Anthony's, I will never be able to fully enjoy Mrs. Fields (or any other cookies) ever again... but I don't mind at all.
author: Alyssa T.

description:
Chewy crunchy ooey-gooey chocolate-y (if you please) buttery PERFECTION are what Anthony's Cookies deliver. Best cookies in town. Pair your second (or third or fourth) cookie with their signature cookies and cream cookie, wash it down with some milk, and call it your best cheat day ever.

This place is totally what Cookie Heaven tastes and looks like, with the delicious aroma of fresh baked cookies greeting you upon your entrance, to the chalkboard displaying all their tempting daily choices, down to the walls lined with Straus' Creamery Organic milk bottles.* 

* The San Francisco Mission District edition.
author: Betty W.

description:
This is my go-to spot whenever I want to buy cookies for people to say "Thanks"! My favorite cookie of all time has got to be the Toffee Chip.. yum. All the cookies are so fresh and goes perfectly with a glass of milk. I live pretty close by so I'm here quite often. Parking is never really an issue either, plenty of street metered parking. 

Mr. Anthony himself is usually here!
author: Cara N.

description:
How do I start with this review?  As mentioned in previous reviews, I may have a slight problem when it comes to food, and specifically cookies and ice cream.  I had heard about Anthony' s from some friends about how amazing their cookies are, and I decided to drive an hour to give it a try.  (Seriously, only someone with issues would drive an hour for a cookie).  

Since I had never had Anthony's and didn't know when I would be back, I figured I would get as many flavors as struck my fancy.  So what did I get?

2 cookies n cream
1 chocolate chip
1 dark chocolate chip
1 white chocolate chip
1 oatmeal raisin
1 chocolate chip oatmeal
1 double walnut chocolate chip
1 german chocolate

Oh, and also a bottle of Strauss Milk to wash it all down.  

So after making my purchase at about 1pm, I ate three at the shop.  And by the time I went to bed at 1am, I only had 1 cookies n cream cookie left..... (okay I get it, I have a problem; as with all addictions, admitting you have a problem is step 1).

Anthony's Cookies are really good and all of the cookies are on the money.  Slightly crispy outside, super soft/chewy inside with a great balance of flavor.  From the pile of sugar and butter overload, I was able to realize I liked the cookies n cream, oatmeal raisin and double walnut chocolate chip the best.  

Even though I have had better individual cookies at other spots, all of Anthony's flavors were spot on!

Thanks for the sugar and butter overload (and possibly losing another 5-10 mins off my life from this food adventure).
author: Thomas N.

description:
Yummy cookies and great customer service. I walked in unsure about which flavors to get, so the guy at the counter gave me a couple suggestions and cut a couple cookies into fourths for me to sample. 

cookies & cream is definitely a winner here
author: Eugene Z.

description:
SO GOOD.  Delicious but a tad pricy.  The staff was extremely friendly and nice.

Top picks:
Cookies & Cream
Toffee
Chocolate Chip
Oatmeal raisin

ALL good, but the first 2 were my fav.  I really wanna try to whole wheat oatmeal choco chip.  Wash down the cookies with some organic milk (watch out for the cream top plug) and bring some back for me! :)
author: Lyn C.

description: Marshall and Lily argue based on the Olive Theory, they have a successful relationship (if you don't watch How I Met Your Mother, shame on you). Similarly, my boyfriend and I believe we work well together based off our Cookie Theory. He likes the chewy part of the cookie and I like the crispy edges. Anthony's Cookies binds our love together. The edges are perfectly crispy while the insides are chewy and moist. I eat around the cookie and hand what is left to my boyfriend. Here at Anthony's, cookies are made and relationships are strengthened.
author: Cindy A.

description:
I love sweets!  I got very excited when my friend suggested going to a bakery that was all about cookies.  We got there about 15 minutes before they closed, so I was crossing my fingers that they still had a good selection left.  Luckily, they were only out of cookies that I wasn't looking forward to anyways.

Every cookie we got was delicious.  My favorite was the oatmeal chocolate chip.  I understand that not everyone is an oatmeal fan, but this cookie was the best oatmeal cookie I've ever had.  The chocolate chip, cookies and cream, dark chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, and peanut butter were the other selections that we had.  All very good.  They're all meaty cookies (I hate super flat cookies with no body), and they've got a good chew to them without being overly buttery.

Service was great.  The gal behind the register was very nice and sweet.  The store itself was pretty spacious and clean.  I guess my only gripe is the price.  The standard cookies aren't that big at all, but they're about $1.25.  If that was the price of their bigger 2 oz. cookie, I'd be more understanding.
author: Gina J.

description:
"Cookies? I'm there!"

Positives:
* Love the idea of a store that only has cookies
* They had chilled milk in tiny carton's for sale as well
* Very lunch box feel to it due to the brown paper item lists
* Service was good, and the staff well versed in what was inside their wares (I questioned them about soy due to an allergy).
* The Oatmeal/ Cranberry cookies were deliciously tasty

Negatives:
* Have itemized cookie lists, but also have a small board which lists the cookies they have THAT DAY.
* Only one communal bench which could comfortably seat 6 at most.
* Maybe I missed it but the prices weren't listed on the itemized sheets nor on the board.
* The cookies are small
...yet deliciously tasty.

I'm a little on the fence about this place as while I don't think I'd come back unless in a large group (thus why I see the singular bench as a problem) I did enjoy my experience. So, three stars for now, until I order for a party and get to partake in a big batch.
author: Meg T.

description: Yummy cookies, but pretty small and expensive. However, 2 cookies for $3 turned out to be the perfect afternoon snack. Nothing too special about their classic chocolate chip, but the cookies and cream was TASTY. Will definitely return for more cookies and cream!
author: Fran D.

description: Decent cookie, but was disappointed by the tiny size, though larger cookies elsewhere would probably cost more. It seems form the photos on here, the size depends on the flavor. I got a Walnut Double Chocolate (the double chocolate is chocolate chips and chocolate dough, thankfully no white "chocolate"). The cookie was soft, I was expecting/hoping it would be warm, but it was room temp. I also like a bit of crunch on the outside of my cookies, which this didn't have (other than the nuts). I should have gotten more flavors, though I probably won't go out of my way to make another visit.
author: Kathleen M.

description: All the cookies are fresh and tasty! it's cheaper to buy a half dozen or a dozen. The cookies are really affordable, just $1.25, and if you'd like they also sell milk!
author: Connie M.

description:
65. Cookies-and-cream cookie and milk at Anthony's Cookies

I went to Anthony's 3 months ago but they were sold out of the cookies-and-cream cookies. Damn! But I got some other cookies and they were delicious.

On a Sunday morning, I went straight to this place, so I won't risk missing out on these cookies if I came later in the day. I'm a big fan of Oreos and cookies and cream ice cream, so I was happy that they had plenty for me. I decided to get 3 cookies and cream and 3 toffee chip cookies. 

The cookies and cream cookies consisted of crushed Oreo bits mixed into the batter and you can taste the cream faintly. It was delicious. The toffee chip was good too. It was definitely crispier than the cookies and cream.

Come here for great, fresh cookies!
author: Rhoda G.

description:
HOT DAMN ANTHONY! BLESS YOUR HEART FOR THOSE COOKIES! 

Glad to know that this place is far, far and away from me because if I lived close to it, then there would be a real-life cookie monster that would make her appearance here everyday, knocking down the doors and opening the oven doors to see if the next batch was ready!
author: Linda I.

description:
Wow. 

Tasty, crunchy around the edge, chewy in the center and toffeelious! 

Anthony's toffee chip cookies are the best, and they are sold out fast! And it's runner up? The oatmeal raisin!

Not going to lie, Anthony sells the best cookies in the city.
author: Jenny K.

description: I really wanted to like this place. I had such high hopes mainly because of their reviews. I raved about it to my fiance and it disappointed. The cookies were nothing special. It wasn't quite the chewiness I hoped for. It really lacked that special something.
author: Serena F.

description:
OMG best cookies ever! 

I came here on a Tuesday afternoon around lunch time with a friend to buy some cookies for someone's birthday + get some for myself! :) 

There was plenty of metered parking at around 12ish, not too sure about later in the afternoon though. This place is small.. whoever said that it looked like it's part of an apartment is right. Decor is minimal with a huge bench to sit at but overall, the place is clean. 

Employees are so friendly! And cute too. ;) The guy who served me asked me if I wanted to try a sample and explained to me what every cookie had it in etc. After being lured into his good looks.. lol jk. I ended up buying a dozen for someone and half a dozen for myself. The employee asked me if I wanted it in a box, ribbon, in a bag too!

I ended up getting the chocolate chip, double chocolate chip, whole wheat oatmeal cranberry, cookies and cream, toffee and white chocolate chip cookies. I ended up getting two of each for my friend as well.

They are all good but my favorite is the toffee chip, white chocolate chip and cookies and cream! ESPECIALLY the cookies and cream, omg too good!

Yeah they are a bit greasy but whatever! The insides are perfectly soft and the outsides perfectly chewy! Noms I'm drooling just thinking about it. Yes, the cookies are a bit small for $1.00 but I like to think of it was paying for the quality of the cookie. You can get a frozen cookie from Mrs. Field's for a dollar and some change but those will never compare to Anthony's!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Wow these are good.

Chocolate chip and oatmeal choc chip my favorites. When I first saw the oatmeal choc chips, I really thought they looked like typical, hard, dry, homemade cookie wedges (we all know someone that bakes this version of a "cookie").  But they're amazing.

Toffee chip a little too sweet for me, but still a darn good cookie.
author: Eric B.

description:
This place is cookie heaven. A beautiful shop with beautiful cookies. The cookies are chewy but not too soft. Perfectly baked. Every kind is delicious. 

I brought some to a family party once over a year ago and my cousin has been dreaming of it since. Time to pick up a box!
author: C. Z.

description:
Yikes, Anthony's cookies are SUPER sweet. It was almost as if they had a half a spoonful of too much sugar per cookie. If you're wondering, I had the oatmeal raisin, oatmeal chocolate chip, and oatmeal cranberry (can you tell that I dig oatmeal cookies?). The oatmeal chocolate chip I expected it to be sweeter but the other two could have been toned down on the sugar. Yes, I understand the irony of buying desserts and then complaining that they're too sweet but isn't the key to a good cookie that you find the perfect balance? It's not like I never had cookies before and the three varieties that I ordered were all consistently too sugary to me. I had a hard time looking past that and tasting the natural flavors of the oatmeal, the raisin, the cranberries. 

Anyways, enough of the sugar rant. For the size (a small lump, not large flat types of cookies) and taste, I think buying a decent size cookie from Arizmendi Bakery across the street is much more worth it! I do expect to come back again though, and give it another chance by trying some of their other flavors. You know what some Yelpers say..if you're willing, gotta try it twice to make sure right?
author: Allie Y.

description:
Good place. Great service. Clean. Slightly high on the price.

This place is known for its cookies and cream cookie which is good. Tried most of the cookies and they are all good but not great in my opinion.

This place is worth trying when you are in the area but do not drive hours to come here because I do not think it's worth it.
author: Anthony N.

description: For a gourmet cookie, this was all right... maybe I'm just not a cookie person but I'd heard so many great things about Anthony's. Overhyped would be one word I'd use to describe this place. That being said... they are addicting.
author: Wesley W.

description:
Came here to try one of  the 100 Things to Try Before You Die. 

We ordered the cookie and cream (#65 on the top 100 list), toffee, and chocolate chip cookies which all came straight from the oven. The cookie and cream is to die for and had to get more to take home. The toffee is okay. The chocolate chip is also good, moist and gooey chocolate chips.  

Also had a cup of joe from Four Barrel Coffee. A pretty light coffee in appearance but packed with great aroma.
author: Kien M.

description:
Fresh cookies on a daily basis, what more can you ask for? :) Anthony's cookies is close to my house so I pop in here to grab a cookie treat when I can or get a bunch as a birthday gift. It's a small store but the cookies are delicious. The price per cookie is a little high but I think it's worth it for the convenience. 

I like to come in here and get a half dozen or dozen different cookies bagged up as a quick gift or potluck contribution. Being able to taste all the different types of cookies is a lot of fun, especially with a group of friends!
author: Stephanie A.

description:
I've been hearing so much hype about this place and it lived up to its expectations.

Ordered a dozen cookies ($11)
Cookies n Cream (6), Toffee (2), Oatmeal Chocolate Chip (2) and White Chocolate Chip (2). The Cookies n Cream and Toffee are the only ones worth getting. Well, in my opinion. Just because you can get the other flavors anywhere else. 

Seriously the best cookies in the whole entire world (as far as I know of).

Kudos to Anthony!!
author: Criselle O.

description: These are the best cookies in the world. My husband and I drive from Redwood City to San Fran every other week just for cookies. I love the Toffee, walnut chocolate chip, cookies and cream. I don't think there is a cookie I don't like. I only wish you could mail order or there were more locations.
author: E B.

description:
Damn good cookies. 

I got the toffee chip. Super moist, buttery and sweet. Really really good.

The shop itself is really cute, only has 1 table there if you want to sit down to enjoy your cookie. 

Definitely worth stopping to try out. I'm glad that I did and will be coming back in my next SF trip to try more!
author: Cindy B.

description:
This place is vastly overrated and over priced.  Cookies are decent, but are the size of a fifty-cent piece and cost $1.25 each.  I finished three cookies by the time I walked to 24th and Valencia, which is just over one block away  Each cookie only took three bites.  

The front counter girl is not very smart, since I had to repeat my three cookie order several times s l o w l y. 

I am seeing plenty of ratings inflation here!
author: Coyote B.

description: This place was pretty good. I don't think it was the worth the trek out to the Mission District but the cookies were good. My girlfriend and I shared a chocolate chip, cookies and cream, and a double chocolate chip. The way in which I listed them is probably how I would rank them in taste as well.
author: Tyler K.

description: the cookies and cream cookie is the best cookie in san francisco - and in my opinion the world! i get tired of eating cookies after one or two but i can eat a dozen of these bad boys to myself.
author: A. C.

description: Everyone I've spoken to always rave about how good the cookies are and they do have my favorite flavor, cookies & cream, so I finally decided to drop by today and get a dozen. Not disappointed at all. Mmmmm om nom nom nom. Goes good with a glass of milk.
author: Gerard Y.

description:
Step aside Specialtys cookies.... you got nothing on Anthony's Cookies.

I was literally in heaven when I ate that cookies and creme cookie. My sister had previously bought it a couple hours ago, so I just heated it up in the oven for a couple minutes to get to the crispy, chewy consistency of goodness. The white chocolate chip was okay, wish it had some macadamia nuts, but I will definitely try the other flavors soon :) Or... just get a dozen of the cookies and creme.. then starve myself after all the calories I would consume...
author: Michelle L.

description:
I went in with high expectations due to all the good reviews here on Yelp, and from the moment I smelled that cookie goodness aroma, I knew I wouldn't be disappointed. Some cookies are better tasting than others, but that's like saying something that tasted magical wasn't super magical. My personal favorite is their Cookies N Cream and their White Chocolate cookies. The Double Chocolate was good too but just wasn't as good as the other 2.

To sum it up, go here, order cookies, be amazed as it melts in your mouth. I wish the cookies were a bit larger but when they're this good, that's just a minor complaint.
author: Gajan K.

description:
Update:

Not changing my original 3-star rating, but I am however shouting out another bomb ass cookie flavor. I think it might even trump my love for the cookies and cream... Tis the ever so chewy, puffy and delicate CINNAMON SPICE. I seriously regret buying only two. Next time I'm buying the whole batch. Once again, don't judge me. 

I did try the white chocolate also, but that was just okay to me.
author: Abigail D.

description:
I really should not write a review, when he has so many already. But I will add to his greatness. Anthony's is this cute little shop and inside you just want this stupid line to move faster so you can savor your goodies. I wanted to try the cookies and cream, which was ehh in my opinion, the chocolate chip, I am sad to say that I was not impressed. I will say that I am a fan of Mrs. Fields and hers are too sweet but I think I like hers better... Don't hate on me! 

And lastly, which are never a favorite of my mine, but on yelp the pictures of the toffee looked so good. And damn it I should have gotten one more for the road! I got the apple juice which was another favorite of mine and my boyfriend got a coffee. While in line I was eyeing their excellent selections of tea. For those tea lovers he uses mighty tea and he had an interesting selection, all of which I would have loved to have tried. All in all, please come visit this place. The lines are long and worth it, so you know it is good. I would solely come for the pressed apple juice and  the toffee cookies alone!!!
author: Crystal V.

description:
If you love cookies you'll love coming here. I love the different variety of cookies here. They all taste so good and roughly inexpensive.

To be frank there's nothing super special or innovative about the cookies. They're just really well made cookies. They must be taking the mantra of what's not broke don't fix it. If you craving cookies don't go to grocery store, get some cookies form here and be delighted.

Side note: I love that there's always parking here. Because for San Francisco I hate having to drive around and around to find parking. I always find parking in front of the shop.
author: Denice D.

description:
I bake a ton and am a super dessert snob, turning my nose up at grocery store cookies well intentioned people bring to the office.  I generally don't eat packaged cookies either because by the time you've opened up the packet, you've fantasized about how amazing that cookie is going to taste when you bite into it, and it's just too sad when you bite instead into a slightly plasticky, artificial tasting thing.

Anthony's cookies, however, totally deliver.  If you imagine the most delicious cookie for hours (as ahem, some of us are wont to do), you've still forgotten some crucial element of the experience -- how your teeth break the surface with the tiniest bit of a crunch before sinking into buttery, chocolatey, caramely tenderness.  Go to Anthony's to remember every tiny secret detail of what it feels like to bite into the perfect cookie.

Anthony's does cookies -- they have cookies, and they have milk.  Each cookie is rather tiny (but perhaps all the better for the high ecstasy to bite ratio) and they're $1.25 a pop which can add up rather quickly if you want to sample all and then make sure that your favorite cookie really is your favorite.  Some flavors are regulars (choc chip, white choc chip, cookies + cream, oatmeal raisin and last but certainly not least -- toffee chip), and others rotate by day and season.
author: S Y.

description:
Yum! These cookies are a little pricey at $1.25/ea, given that they are small. But! they are super worth the splurge once in a while. :)))

** COOKIES & CREAM IS THE BEST!
Yummmmy: Chocolate chip, toffee chip, peanut butter (super crumbly!)
Okay: Walnut double chocochip (a little too sweet), oatmeal walnut chip
Disappointing: Candied pecan chip (tastes like a regular chocochip w/ dry nuts)

Five stars just for the cookies & cream;  can't wait to come back for more!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
COOKIES AND MILK!!!!!????? YES.

The 4 flavors I tried and the order in which I liked them:
1. Cookies n cream
2. Toffee chip
3. Cinnamon spice
4. White chocolate chip

Definitely get some milk for the cookies :)
author: Liz W.

description: HEAVEN ON EARTH!!! Just finished 3 cookies and I just want to go back, as do the friends I'm with. New mandatory stop whenever I'm in SF. Don't sleep in on it - we went at 2:30 and a majority of their options were gone-they were still amazing though!
author: Michael K.

description:
I ordered a chocolate chip cookie and the reduced fat Straus milk (in a milk jug!). For some reason, I thought it just said cookie and milk on the 7x7 list. But, no... I was supposed to order the cookies-and-cream cookie and a carton of milk. Whatever, I'm still crossing it off. The chocolate chip cookie was soooooo good, that I have a pretty good sense of how the cookies-and-cream one would taste like! And, the carton of milk was something I could buy anywhere.

Anyway, moving on. The chocolate chip cookie was tiny for $1.25. Maybe, I should have bought more for cheaper. But, I just wanted to taste it. As everyone else below me said... Yummers! It was the perfect chocolate chip cookie. Well almost perfect--I wish it were bigger. It was perfectly crisp on the outside and so gooey and full of chocolaty goodness on the inside. The cookie comes to you very warm, too!

I'm glad I ordered the Straus milk... I used to like milk, then stopped liking it when I started drinking soy or almond milk. When I tried to drink milk again, I just couldn't cause it tasted gross to me. So... I was worried about trying the Straus milk, especially since I had to buy the jug, which was pretty big and $5. When I tried it, I was pleasantly surprised at how creamy and delicious it tasted. It was certainly different from the milk I used to buy at the grocery store. This is probably the most amazing milk I've tasted. It was like cream. I highly suggest trying it at least once, especially with the warm cookie.

ALSO, the people working there are super friendly!
author: Vera W.

description:
Looking at the pictures on Yelp was a huge mistake because it caused me to have the biggest cravings for cookies ever! I persuaded my bf to drive me there on a Saturday afternoon :)

Anthony's Cookies is a cute little shop that we accidentally missed while driving by due to a big truck parked right ouside the entrance. The store itself is very spacious and simple. Right when you enter you can see the area where the cookies are madein the kitchen behind the counter and register. I ended up getting 2 white chocolate, 2 oatmeal and 2 cookies n cream. No Anthony but the service was excellent and the cookies were a good treat for the both of us.
author: M W.

description:
Let me start out by saying, I LOVE cookies, they are by far my favorite sweet treat. I must also follow that up by saying, i rarely eat them. 
In keeping with the clean eating lifestyle i have adopted, i don't eat many processed foods, or sugary treats. 

So. when i do, the sweets better be AMAZING! 
Anthony's cookies are by far the best cookies EVER. They actually taste homemade, and not like bakery cookies. 

I appreciate that the people working the counter offered to let us taste any cookie we wanted to, and as many as we wanted. 

We ended up buying: 1 regular chocolate chip cookie, ( the true test of any cookie maker) 
1 toffee chip (because reviewers raved about them) 
1 oatmeal chocolate chip 
1 cookies 'n' cream, (these made the "must eat in SF" list) 
1 cinnamon sugar. 

My guy and I split each cookie, and we loved them all. I was also impressed that two days later the cookies still tasted fresh. 
( I can't eat a lot of sugar at once, so we had to spread the consumption out.) 

As for the people bitching about the size...REALLY? Have we grown so accustomed to gargantuan, 1000 calorie cookies that we expect all cookies to be that size? 

Anthony's cookies are the size a cookie should be. They're the size i make mine when i bake. 

It's now the one time of the year i will be baking my own cookies, but later in the year I will be back when i have a cookie craving.
author: Amanda G.

description:
I am easily swayed by what other people say/recommend, that's why I'm on Yelp CONSTANTLY reading about places I need to try :). 

Again we were in the area, so I made sure to make it a point to stop here on my way home. Such a random place to be on Valencia, away from all the cool and hip happening other places. I actually passed it b/c I didn't know what I was looking for. Scored a parking space right in front, probably b/c it was only 11:30AM. lol. As we stepped out of the car there was no wonderful smell of cookies wafting through the air but once you open that door, COOKIE HEAVEN. You know, that smell of baking. YUM!

Walked in and noticed the "menu" flavors on the left wall but was called over by the nice female behind the counter noting TODAY's flavors on the board on the counter. 

We ordered a dozen:
3 cookies n cream
3 candied pecan w choco chips
3 whole wheat oatmeal raisin

and then I was stuck with what the last 3 would be and asked the lady behind the counter. She recommended the double chocolate chip or the cinnamon sugar. My mom not being a chocolate fan said to go with the cinnamon sugar.

so 3 cinnamon sugar.

$11. not bad. They aren't huge cookies but they are yummy. And way better than Mrs Fields. Hands down.

My faves of the bunch the cookies n cream and candied pecan choco chip. The cinnamon sugar had too much cinnamon in it and then oatmeal raisin could have used some cinnamon in it. But that won't sway me from making a cookie stop again. A nice light crunch around the edges and nice and chewy in the middle. Just how I like em.

Just as good as homemade, maybe in some cases if not better. I can't wait to go back and try some of the others... and of course get more cookies n cream. YUM!
author: Dina V.

description: Where have you been all my life!!! I've been to SF 2 times in the last month just for the cookies. The past weekend I spent over $100 on cookies.. that is how amazing they are.. All the cookies are perfection but my absolute favorite would have to be the cookie and cream and the toffee.... They tend to sell out before closing time so try to go earlier in the day or call in advance.
author: Nancy N.

description:
I wasn't much of a cookie person until I found Anthony's Cookies 2-3 years ago.
So this review is long over due. The best chocolate chip cookie!
author: Missy W.

description:
The third stop on the 7x7 tour. 

Cute little cookie shop with samples! Easter themed purple font on the packaging was a nice touch. 

Plus, we even got to catch a glimpse of Anthony running out to move his car because some old dude was threatening to have it towed. 

I asked the cashier (who somehow knew we were going off the 7x7 list) if he had any vegan-friendly options because I wanted to get a half dozen cookies for my sister (a vegan)as she's moved to SF for work and we were in the neighborhood and decided to visit her and have lunch. They said they didn't have them yet but would have them soon which is good. Especially in SF.

When we got in, they had samples, which even though they were out there for awhile, were still moist in the middle and great tasting and was a pre-cursor to how fantastic these cookies would be. 

Because we were getting a dozen ($13) for ourselves and half dozen for my sister, I decided to go with six flavors and double up and then get an extra semi-sweet chocolate with walnuts. 

My favorites ended up being the semi-sweet chocolate with walnuts and the cookies and cream. But, then again, all of the cookies were really delicious and I love my cookies. 

They're a little on the smaller side but are packed with flavor, a great light and crispy texture, and a moist center which made for some of the best cookies I've ever had and definitely worth the visit. Oh yeah, my sister loved the cookies too!
author: Matthew T.

description:
I decided it was in my best interest to try a chocolate chip cookie tour of San Francisco and Anthony's was recently my third stop.  Now I'm just glad it is such a far trip because it guarantees I won't consume a dozen a day.

A friend and I stopped in to share a few cookies.  We tried the whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip, cookies and cream, chocolate chip, and candied pecan chip.  The chocolate chip was soft in the center and divine.  But my real favorite was the whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip.  I was so glad that they didn't sully it with nuts because it was amazing on its own.  

The shop is cute and simple.  There is a sign on the door asking customers to close it and keep in the amazing scent of their cookies.  After sitting there for a bit I completely understand what they meant about the aroma, it is intoxicating.  I'll admit that $1.25 a pop is a bit much as the cookies are rather small, but it is definitely worth it to treat yourself every once in a while.

If I find myself in this part of the city again I'll definitely stop in.  The only problem is finding some self control so I don't devour a half dozen on my own...
author: Michelle K.

description:
Obviously, the cookies. Cookies n cream to be exact. 
Then the CS (in particular, the guy working on 5/26/12) was outstanding-sampling, bakers dozen, smiles, thorough responses...

win.
author: mark s.

description:
Best cookies around.  If you are lucky and walk in on a day when they have peanut butter cookies, be sure to get some!  They melt in your mouth like no other cookie before.  Plus they have extremely friendly staff.

Friends from out of town always asks me to buy them some when I visit.
author: Jimmy L.

description: Grab your cookies early because they can sell out! The cookie flavors are modern and nothing too farfetched. I purchased a dozen for 18 bucks. Chocolate chip, toffee chip, white chocolate chip, cookies n cream. Cookies and cream were my favorite. I recommend this place if you're a cookie buff.
author: Valerie D.

description: I love cookies.  I eat a lot of cookies. These are some of the best cookies Ive ever eaten.  They aren't cheap at $1.75 for a one ounce cookie, but they are totally worth it.  Their cookies and cream cookie is not to be missed, so tasty and very unique flavor.
author: Monica R.

description:
I am not normally a sweets or cookie lover. (There's nothing wrong with me.  Don't Judge.)  Antony's Cookies...OMG.  I'm not sure what they put in the cookies.  Crack.  Awesomeness.  Cookies N Cream and any of the Oatmeal ones are the best.  Cookies are a bit small for $1.25 but they are worth the splurge.  

If a non-sweets or cookie lover can love the cookies, then you can too.
author: Shirley T.

description:
I am not a huge cookie fan, but l love indulging at Anthony's Cookies. I must say they are addicting and so so good. The chocolate walnut is my fave. I always come in to get cookies for friends and family, it's a great gift to give to someone plus I always get a little something for myself. Wink wink. 
Would give all stars but sometimes they run out of my fave...but overall no complaints
author: Lulu R.

description:
Anthony's has an abundance of flavors to suit every palate...chocolate chip, toffee chip, white chocolate chip, peanut butter, cookies and cream, etc.  The chocolate chip with walnuts are my favorite; I won't even tell you how many of those I can eat in one sitting.  Not all of the flavors are available everyday, so check out their website ahead of time if you're jonesing for something in particular.

This is the place to go if you need to pass off cookies as homemade: they're that good.  And your secret's safe with me.
author: Joanna L.

description:
Anthony's Cookies are the best cookies I have had in the city, screw Mrs. Fields!  The cookies here are soft not exactly soft baked, they do have a crunch but they are still great nonetheless. My personal favorites are cookies and cream, toffee chip, cinnamon sugar.

If you want an amazing cookie, come here and support a great local business not old Mrs. Field. =]
author: Jayne A.

description:
I sampled half a dozen and my favorites were chocolate chip and toffee chip.  Cinnamon is good too if you like a pretty potent cinnamon flavor. The cookies I had were definitely freshly baked with a crisp exterior and were soft and chewy.  However, I kinda felt like the cookies were too soft with too much of a raw texture.  I saved some cookies for later and although the cookies were still nice and chewy, they lost that crispy exterior.  

I'm not very fond of the shop interior, particularly because of the single table with benches that would seem uncomfortable to sit at with a nonstop line hovering right next to you.  $1.25 per cookie is a bit much for me but I hope to return and try their peanut butter cookie which really was the only flavor I wanted to try but wasn't available the day I dropped by.
author: Maya S.

description:
A bakery dedicated to just cookies? HEAVEN! 
Sure I have been to bakeries where they serve specialty cookies and a bunch of other baked goods, but Anthony's Cookies is strictly JUST cookies. These cookies aren't like any other cookie. They are simply the best of the best. 

This place was on my bookmarks list and I am so glad I was able to try it. I got 1/2 a dozen cookies for $6. There were quite a lot of flavors to choose from. I went with 3 Cookies & Cream, 1 Walnut Chocolate Chip, 1 German Chocolate, and 1 Toffee Chip. Honestly, all of them were delicious, but my favorite was the Cookies & Cream. This cookie had what looked like bits of oreo in it...not sure though. Whatever it was it made the cookie. 

The cookies are crispy and crunchy on the outside but after you bite into it, the cookies are so smooth and moist. They are freshly baked on the daily. They look burnt and not that appetizing, but trust me the taste will blow your mind away! (Okay im exaggerating...but really best cookies I have ever had). I probably could've eaten the whole bag of cookies in one sitting because I have such a huge sweet tooth, but I shared! 

The good thing about this place is that they offer you samples of any cookie you would like to try. The guy working there is really friendly and accommodating.
author: Katrina T.

description:
We came here a few weeks ago from the south bay and we battled parking on Saturday and ended up walking .7 miles, one way, to make it to Anthony's Cookies only to be met by the following sign "Due to an unforeseen delay with our construction, we will temporarily be closed until further notice. We sincerely apologize and appreciate your patience during this time." It was pretty sad that they didn't bother putting this up on their website or Yelp - we were pretty disappointed. 

Nevertheless, we decided to call this weekend to see if Anthony's had reopened, and to our delight they had, so we went down there on a Sunday and had much better luck with parking.  We ordered the chocolate chip walnut and the cookies n' cream cookies.  They're affordably priced (95 cents each) and freshly made (though not warm), crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. I wasn't impressed by the chocolate chip walnut - I like my version using Nestle's recipe better (I'm not kidding) and thought the cookies n' cream was better and innovative. 

Bottom line, I'm glad we tried Anthony's cookies but don't think it's deserving of all the hype.
author: H T.

description:
For some reason, these cookies are not as delicious as I remembered it to be. Maybe my palate has adapted to all the local sweets that the city provides. For some reason I recall Anthony's cookies being a lot more chewier.

This time around I wasn't as impressed. But don't get me wrong, the cookies are still good...just not as I remembered it to be. 

Overall thoughts : Good price for a sweet treat. They offer many varieties, so that's always a plus. I will definitely swing by anytime I'm in the area to try their other flavors.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Because of the rating I was expecting hot and fresh cookies. I quickly became a sad panda when I realized I got a cold stale cookies & cream and a toffee cookie. I drove 20 mins in the rain to try this place and I'm definitely disappointed. I recommend calling first to see if they are making fresh cookies that day. Boooo.
author: Michelle G.

description:
UH, I dont' get it.


Tried some cookies from here and I definitely don't see why the rating is so high.  I got a half dozen cookies and it was $7.  SEVEN DOLLARS!  At  $1.25 a cookie, I expect a sizable treat, but the chocolate chip here is only slightly larger than a chips ahoy cookie.  Taste is, honestly, just OK.  If you know how to bake, you're way better off making your own cookies because THE PRICE AIN'T RIGHT.
author: Katrina V.

description: This place is temporarily closed on Tuesdays! There was no notice that on the website and when I called in earlier also no mention. The only way you would have known is if you did what I did and fought through an hour of downtown traffic only to be greeted with a sign. I suggest that management at least update their website or voicemail.
author: Rosalyn D.

description:
Hands down my favorite place for cookies

Cookies and cream

And toffee chip 


my all time favorite!!!!!! A must get!!! 
Get at least a dozen every time I come here Bc they go by fast. 

And don't forget to ask to sample.. They will let u sample all if u wanted to.
author: Sally Y.

description:
My very dear friends threw my husband and I our very first baby shower this past Saturday.   My friends put so much thought and work into making it perfect and even had a milk and cookies bar in addition to the candy bar.  

I mentioned that I would bring the cookies since I didn't want them to have to worry about another thing.   I found Anthony's cookies on Yelp and loved the flavors they had featured on their site so I knew these cookies would be a hit. 

I stopped by early on Saturday morning to pick up a total of 3 dozen cookies for the milk and cookies bar for our baby shower.  Each dozen was priced at $11 which isn't bad.   I ordered a dozen cookies and cream, chocolate chip and half a dozen each of oatmeal and toffee chip. 

The cookies and cream were so good!  I didn't get to try the chocolate chip cookies but everyone was raving about them at the party. 

Love the cookies and service.  Will definitely return.
author: Christine P.

description: OMG! BEST.COOKIES. EVER!! Love their cookies and cream, toffee and their chocolate chip cookies. I'm sure the other flavors are as good but whenever I go there, the cookies and cream, toffee and chocolate chips are the only ones I get. This place is a must try if you're in the SF area. Hopefully they'll open other stores outside of SF!
author: Sadie B.

description:
How was I so stupid not to get the cookies and cream when I was supposed to! Ahhh! Does it still count on the scavenger list if I didn't? Can we say based on a technicality that I can just cross of it off my list, or do I need to venture back there one day? I guess I'll just return one day. The cookies I did get were WOW. They really did learn to perfect their cookie-making-ability. The cookies are perfect on the outside. They look crunchy and crisp. They're cooked evenly on the outside, each part has a perfect crisp. But then you think it's just like a crunchy cookie - not the case. With the first bite, it's soft! It's a soft/chewy cookie. It's moist on the inside. I definitely taste the butter, and i love the chocolate chips they used. I got the chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin and toffee chocolate. All yums! 

Now I don't know if these cookies are as great as the one's from Momofuku Milk bar in NYC. Those cookies had layers in their flavor.
author: Vanessa K.

description: Toffee and white chocolate chip are not daily cookies!  Last time I went, they only had toffee available in the gluten free version and the white chocolate chip in the bigger version.  So disappointed since those are the only two I really like!
author: Tina L.

description: I never thought I'd become the type of person to Yelp about cookies, but, here I am. Anthony's cookies are stupid good. No, you can't make 'em this good and, yes, they are better than the cookies at Tartine.
author: Will F.

description:
To eat or not to eat? That is the question. 

Going on a food journey is so tempting in so many ways, so I'll let you decide if the small portions here is a good or bad thing. Each cookie is $1.25, or $6 for half a dozen. They're tiny, Chips Ahoy sized cookies, but sooooooooo wonderfully delicious.

I ordered the candied pecan chocolate chip here, and gob
author: Jeanette S.

description:
I didn't want to believe it, so I tried it... And... Well...

THESE COOKIES ARE BOMB AS F$&%!!!! 

Thanks, Anthony!
author: Janine S.

description:
Cookies and Milk.  cookies and milk.

If you are in the mood for cookies, this is the place to be. 

It's true to it's name.  The cookies are a good size, but not huge.  I can usually eat 3 of these delicious cookies with a glass of milk.

There usually is a daily selection of 10 types of cookies to satisfy all your cravings.   A sunny spot near the window offers a chance to watch the people walking.

Once you are filled up with cookies, head down to 22nd and Valencia for some Ritual coffee
author: Tony T.

description: Awesome peanut butter cookies!!!  Only available on Fridays and Saturdays though. Beware of a possible long wait - I was only 3rd in line, but the people in front of me ordered boxes of cookies, which made for a decent wait for my 1 cookie order.
author: Julia C.

description:
SHUT UP with these cookies! I can't deal with how good they are. I. Cannot. Deal. 

They're so good it's depressing because you know that nothing else you eat will ever be as good - especially if you are eating the cookies 'n' cream one.

Once I brought some to my mom and pretended like I made them with the KitchenAid standing mixer she gave me (shh). She was very impressed and told me I should open my own bakery. If only she knew the truth!
author: Rebecca P.

description: This is the worst place. Below average cookies with very little in-shop selection. The cookies are flat and lack flavor. They are not warm either.
author: Anissha V.

description:
I was sold on Anthony's when we walked in there was NOTHING but milk containers and a wooden bench in the whole place. The people are nice and the fact that Anthony is a real person and is there every day made me feel warm and fuzzy.

As for the cookies, the choco pecan was really solid, but the others (cranberry oatmeal, whole wheat choco chip, toffee) were just OK for home-made cookies - a  little dry and a more crispy than chewy/moist.

Also, these are "normal" sized cookies at $1.25 a pop - if you are used to gluttonous American giant flying saucer cookies, look elsewhere.
author: Snuffles B.

description: I am a cookie lover. Who ever knows me knows I love my cookies. A family friend introduced me to this little cookie heaven. And i love all the cookies here. Everything is always so delicious!!! My boyfriend knows my weakness so he loves to bring me these cookies when I'm mad.
author: Yasuko R.

description:
Best cookies I've ever had. The toffee and cookies and cream are especially exceptional because they're a little bit different. 

I love going to the store and being enveloped by the amazing warm cookie smell! But you can also order them off of Postmates.
author: Jessica D.

description:
I hadn't even heard of this place but after picking up my boogerfriend's little sister, we just so happened to pass by and she really wanted cookies. I really thought the cookies were expensive for the price of each cookie, but HOLY BALLS, they're totally worth it.

Much better than Famous Amos and Mrs. Field's (no offense). But parking is a biaaaatch.
author: Shilo B.

description: Cookies'n Cream Cookies? nuff said. GET THAT SHI*T. Worth the price!
author: Nicholas D.

description:
Very small store but had tons of different cookies! I tried some samples while waiting and it was yummy. Cookies and creams , classic chocolate chips are great!
You can eat there if you like but not much space. Take out is probably best. 
They do serve drinks as well.
author: Akiko I.

description: THIS PLACE DOESN'T JUST HAVE GREAT COOKIES THEY HAVE GREAT EMPLOYEES!!! Promise every time I go into this place the employees are always very nice. ANTHONY IS AMAZING!!! One day while grabbing cookies with my daughter Anthony was there helping in the back. My daughter noticed him and wanted an autograph. He quickly stopped what he was doing and wrote a short note with his signature. That was very sweet of him and my daughter make sure she tells everyone about this great experience.
author: Iamher T.

description: THEIR COOKIES ARE SOOOOOO GOOD! :) 10/5 stars if I could make my own rating!!!! Trust me when I say nothing can beat these fresh baked cookies!
author: Ann F.

description:
If you are going to eat cookies-- do it right. Go to Anthony's.

Fresh. Wholesome (which means that you can pronounce the ingredients NOT that you should only eat cookies and nothing else). Old fashioned flavors (oatmeal ) new unexplored flavors (german chocolate).

My suggestion: go in, but one flavor of each. Talk a walk and enjoy the cookies. Then go back in and get 25 more. Bring them to your friends that are having a sad day. A cookie always helps.

Worth the drive to the mission if you do it that way.
author: Dani K.

description: A couple years ago I bought $100 worth of cookies for my daughter's Middle School Picnic. The cookies were a big hit. My only complaint is that they charged me ten cents for the bag.
author: Jon D.

description:
Amazing texture. Chewy and perfectly dense.
The best cookies by far.
author: Heidi L.

description:
We stopped by for some cookies.  They were cookies.  Nothing special.  They weren't especially fresh, but everything we had was pretty yummy.  The cookies and creme was the best tasting ones we tried. 

All 6 varieties we tried were very very sweet, even with coffee and milk, respectively.  I didn't find anything here that would differentiate from any other cookies, and I would probably even prefer eating a mall cookie from Mrs. Fields.  Not bad, but unless I was in the neighborhood, just okay.
author: Jeff Y.

description:
6 stars for the cookies themselves, 2 stars for the price increase. I can sort of understand $1.25 a cookie if you're buying a single, but when buying 1-2 dozen at a time, there should be SOME sort of quantity price break.

When we started going to Anthony's, we paid $12/doz. Now it's $15 total, at $1.25 each. Guess we'll just be going less.
author: Barron C.

description:
"I'll be thinking about you every night and every day... cause in my heart I know that never should've let you go..." -Hi-Five

I sing that song to myself from the moment I leave Anthony's Cookies.  The cookies & cream and the toffee cookies are THE bomb dot com backslash your life will not be the same after.  This establishment warrants stretchy pants for a week... Enough said.
author: Melanie T.

description:
you think Mrs. Fields is good? You're missing out on ANTHONY's!!

BEST FRICKIN COOKIES EVER MADE.  

I'm determined to try all the flavors!  I am DEFINITELY COMING BACK!
author: Steph L.

description:
Oh god I really love this place. Because I have no sense of portion control, the cookies seemed a bit small, but that's what makes them have the homemade feel. They're a bit pricey, so I would just use the money to buy the oreo and toffee cookies only if you're not feeling too adventurous. 

I bought a dozen (1/2 oreo, 1/2 toffee) for 2 people before heading on a trip to Sac. They were gone when we got there. Just saying. 

The shop is also small, don't miss it :)
author: Jen Y.

description: Whenever I am in the Mission/Valencia area, Anthony's cookies is a must have. I love their oreo, white chocolate chip and toffee cookies. These three flavors are soft, chewy and flavorful. They can be a bit sweet, so make sure to get some milk or coffee to accompany them with. I don't really like their harder cookies like the chocolate oatmeal, coffee, and pecan because they are way too crunchy for me and don't have that "Anthony's feel". The prices are a bit high for the size of the cookies, but if you have a sweet tooth you will find yourself craving for these bad boys!
author: Joy N.

description:
A friend was telling me about her favorite cookie bakery, Anthony's Cookies, in the city (or was it ever?), and a Wednesday afternoon seemed as good a time as any to pay it a visit. With an enthusiastic 4.5 stars on Yelp over a span of nearly 900 reviews and a shoutout on 77s Big Eat, it was a fail safe way to inject some productivity into my midweek.

At $1.25 a pop, these aren't your typical, cheapy grocery store dozen you can pick up at your local Safeway bakery. But wow, these cookies are good - and I might even go so far to say they're the best I've ever had (and I've had many cookies in my lifetime). With the right ratio of crispy edges to chewy centers, it took all of 5 minutes to decimate the 4 poor cookies (Cookies & Cream, Oatmeal Raisin, Toffee Nut, White Chocolate) who had the misfortune to be selected by me.

The Cookies & Cream cookie, #65 on 7x7's Big Eat 2012 list, was expectedly a perfect blend of cookie and more cookie, but my personal favorite was the Toffee Chip. It may be a tad sweet for those who can't handle sugar overload, but to my sweet tooth, it was perfect - just enough sweetness to maintain a manageable sugar high.

Though I only tried four, I'll certainly be back to sample all other offerings. I most definitely don't think you can go wrong with any flavor scrawled onto their chalkboard menu.
author: Priscilla W.

description: Every time I go to the city I have to stop at Anthony's. Best cookies I have ever tasted. I especially love the Toffee Chip and White Chocolate. No other cookie comes close to Anthony's.
author: Melvin J.

description:
I know it's just a cookie and all, but does it get any better than this? If so, don't keep it to yourself, please share.

When it comes to cookies, sign me up, I'm in. A friend actually assured me that this was the best place for cookies in the city. He hyped them up so much that I was almost sure I'd be disappointed. I mean I've had enough solid cookies to know that it's hard to blow me away. 

The cookies & cream blew me away. I almost wanted to dance. The cookies are all soft with just the perfect amount of chewy. With each bite you know that this is what a cookie should taste like. Flavors are complex, wondering how they managed to get them to taste like this, but simple and familiar at the same time. 

My favorites are cookies & cream, Toffee Chip, Candied Pecan Chip, Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip, and Cinnamon Spice.

The cookies are wow, but I would take away half a star for the price. $1.25/cookie is affordable and fair, but if you get more than 10, it can get pricey. I wish they had some package deal discount for larger orders.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Cookies that are so thin and light but filling due to high-quality ingredients is how Anthony's Cookies have made it to the top of the best cookies I've ever bought, made, ate, wolfed down, etc. While they're a little out in the boonies of the Mission, it's well worth the walk to seek out the vast menu of absolute deliciousness. 

Hands down my favorite was the white chocolate chip. If you're a fan of white chocolate you'll never go back to another--especially those with macadamia nuts in them (WHY do they have to mess up perfectly good desserts with nuts?) And if you're not a fan, it doesn't matter, you're going to end up a fan their white chocolate chip. Although I know what they're famous for is the cookies and cream cookie, I can't help but continue to rave about this equally deserving classic. 

My second recommendation...if pressed...would be the german chocolate. Or the double chocolate chip. To tell the truth, maybe I couldn't even tell the difference between the two but if your taste buds weep for the taste of chocolate like mine do, you'll love both of these. 

Check out their website for the daily flavors; it's a very simple and aesthetically pleasing site to navigate which complements the feel and ambiance of the shop. You walk in and there's no messing around. There's only one little table on the side, a counter with napkins and whatever things you need to complete the devouring and a big menu to stare at and be indecisive. 

Danger: the workers are so friendly. And by friendly I mean they'll break off pieces of whatever cookie you want to sample and place it in front of you. By the time you're done you've most likely eaten three whole cookies and you haven't ordered yet. A true gem and awesome business that knows they're the cookie boss.
author: Emiko T.

description: Great cookies. They're really soft and taste awesome. You have to try their cookies n cream. The staff is really nice.
author: Donilon A.

description:
WHOLE WHEAT OATMEAL WALNUT CHIP = MY NEW FAVORITE!

It's small for a cookie but packs a delicious punch of flavor.

Their classic chocolate chip cookies are bomb too. Basic. Simple. Still one of the Best!
author: Andrew C.

description: I do remember now, after entering this place today, that my friend took me here before so I could try their cookies.  Back then, I wasn't able to take note of this establishment and as such could not recall the exact name of this place, but now I see that it was Anthony's Cookies.
