For some reason I've been craving cookies lately, so that is why I decided to come here and I'm sure glad that I did:-)  The employee who rang up my order was so sweet and the cookies from here are just very good and nostalgic - they are not that incredibly sweet so that is definitely a plus and I like the consistency of it.  I ordered the Cookies & Cream, Chocolate Chip and the White Chocolate Chip. . . delicious;-)
author: Kahanalei M.

description: If you don't know this about me already, I don't like chocolate. Because of this, I wasn't sure how good the cookies were going to be since most people I know get the cookies with the chocolate in them. When I went, I ordered the cinnamon spice and the oatmeal raisin. These cookies were great!! They were very soft and fluffy. When I got my cookies, they were also really warm. The only thing is that these cookies are not your normal size cookies. They were a bit smaller than I expected. I will definitely be back for more.
author: Breniel L.

description: Incredible indulgence! This is the perfect place to get cookies for holidays, desert, or if you're a guest at someone's house don't go empty handed! They even have a gluten free menu that my sister would appreciate! I'm a sucker for the  'cookies and cream' omg amazing. Your only Mistake will be buying just one!
author: Carmen H.

description: I'm an occasional SF tourist and I always try to stop by here before going back to LA. My faves are their pecan, toffee, and cookies n cream cookies. The coffee cookie is a little strong, but you can always try before you buy.
author: Aurea A.

description:
My cousin hyped this place so much so after arriving in San Francisco, this was our first stop.

There were a vast array of flavors.  My favorites were the cookies and cream, toffee, and german chocolate.  The flavors are very original and the cookies were super fresh, a bit crispy on the outside but soft in the inside.  Perfection!!! 

The cashier was very helpful and gave us different samples to try to help us make our decision.  I usually am a huge fan of white chocolate mac cookies but this one was way too sweet.  I also tried the peanut butter which I was totally not a fan of.  

Overall, I would definitely come back and wish there was a place like this in OC.
author: Christina P.

description:
Here are the following I tried:
Toffee chips: this was good nice and chew.
German chocolate: my favorite one, perfect balance of coconut and chocolate.
Peanutbutter: I was expecting a chew cookie but it was more like a cake with a blob of peanutbutter in the middle. It was interesting but I didn't like the cake texture, it fell apart after a bite. 
Cookies and cream : I like this one, cleaver flavor yummy.
Candy pecan: if you like means then you will like this, I liked it, just enough nuts and chewy.
Whole wheat oatmeal raisen: Mmm.. my 2nd favorite, great texture and just good. 
They were good but not the best cookies I've ever had. I kinda like specialty's cookies better, sorry.
author: Karen T.

description:
So I decided to go here... Thanks to Cherlynn and Jeanette's reviews and probably a few more from my peers...

Lets cut to the chase, while I was still undecided from finding a place to eat on a Friday I decided to grab some stuff for the house to go. While I was trying to find this place on the map, I actually found that I was on the opposite side of the street.

At first it seems that there is nobody here.. but then you see someone at the counter and a couple workers in the back baking. There was a gal this Friday that I did see and I had told her it was my first time being in here. I decided to come here on a whim due to the fact that I saw it at the bottom page of the yelp site. Before I went I wanted to do some decision making before I got there. 

What to expect / What did I get? :

- Friday ( the top 5 from the baked everyday list) 4 each

- Periodic table of cookies:

    Cinnamon Spice - 4 each

    Pecan Toffee Chip - 4 each

Total cookies I can has: 24 cookies

- Farm Organic milk 1 bottle


Okay... so when I got there the place was empty at first but I did get myself to deciding on what to get. Soon after... there were a few people that came in just as soon as I stepped in to order that flash 2 dozen. Then I decided to get the Organic milk that I seen from the pictures to try. Note that I only had 3 out of the 24 that I has + The milk....

The gal that was helping me get my bakes told me that if it was my first time trying this milk that you would have to shake it since the fat content was plugged at the top. She was right.. but I had to open the bottle cause I didn't think that the cream part would mix well.. it got kinda messy from there D:

you guys might think that... "Hey this milk is old!" or "Hey!! Why is it chunky at the top?" Duh, its not like the regular milk that you see at the grocery. I had taken the red cap type (its usually associated with Vit D or whole milk) which is apparently whole milk. I think this type of milk is the one that they boil/steam for coffee & cappuccino's also that thickness from the milk has a bit of that sour cream taste which I didn't mind really but did balance out when you were eating these cookies. 

Normally I don't go out for sweets but I like to has my cookies every now and then.

These cookies won't disappoint at all. I recommend this for any of you guys venturing to this area. Yes feed your addiction and stop self hunger.

Have a good eat and good hunting guys!! :3
author: Xeirhen V.

description:
I wasn't very impressed with Anthony's cookies. I agree with Coyote's review that this place is overrated and overpriced. There's a place called Tiffany's Treats back in Texas that I feel is better than Anthonys.  The cookie sizes are not very big especially for the price. I had toffee, cookies and cream and cinnamon spice. Out of the 3, I liked the cinnamon spice. I didn't taste much of the toffee in the cookie making me a bit disappointed. 

In the end, it didn't really satisfy my sweet tooth.
author: Jeena L.

description: Super cute place! Best cookies I've ever had! Great taste, flavor selection is amazing!
author: Aaron O.

description: Man oh man. I saw the reviews and just had to try this place and it didn't disappoint one bit. Cookies start at $1.50 each. Got the chocolate chip cookie and an oatmeal one and both were deeeelicious. They ran out of their toffee cookies, so didn't get to try that, but I'm sure it would have been another fave of mine. If you like crunchy cookies, check this place out!
author: Ed H.

description:
If these cookies don't alter your mood, perception, or being for the better then your next step might be to visit the local hemp dispensary and try their space cakes.

Anthony's Cookies is the medicine for your sickness. If the wifey is ever mad at me, which is rarely because I'm such an awesome husband, then I know picking up some Toffee and White Choco Chip cookies will level the playing field so we can discuss any problems in an amicable manner. Thank you Dr. Anthony.
author: Steve H.

description:
Father, forgive me, I have sinned. I bought a dozen of Anthony's sinful cookies... and they were awesome.

Can't believe SF didn't have another store like this before... JUST cookies. FRESH BAKED COOKIES with 10+ kinds everyday. 

My faves:
- Toffee chip - delicious to the last morsel, esp if you like toffee. Perfect, not too much toffee, not to little
- White choc chip - loved every bite, esp for you white choc fans
- Walnut choc chip - really fresh walnuts, yum... esp for the nut fans

My least favorite was cinnamon sugar. Just too much cinnamon for me but others might like it. 

Hint: Get their daily cookie schedule as they have 8 regular kinds and 6 that rotate on different days.

Bottom line: Actually, Father, forget it... I'm going to get another dozen.
author: Jim C.

description:
I bought cookies & cream, chocolate chip, toffee chip, walnut chip, oatmeal chip. They all have consistent texture and I can taste the premium ingredients. 

Cookies & Cream- A new cookie and a new favorite. It's like an Oreo walk into an oven and decided to join the freshly baked cookie party.

Chocolate Chip- It's nothing new, but it's done very well.

Toffee Chip- This was my favorite because the toffee made the cookie extra crunchy and gave it a candy flavor. 

Walnut Chip & Oatmeal Chip- This cookie had too much flavored ingredients and not enough cookie. It was too crowded with walnuts/chips and old fashioned oats/chips.  

The purchase process was a bit slow and inefficient.
author: Antoine T.

description:
How have I not written a review for this place? In my opinion this is the best cookie in the city.

All of the cookies are fresh, delicious, soft, buttery, and well worth the $1.25 price tag. My favorites are the toffee, cookies and cream, and the classic chocolate chip. the one cookie i haven't had a chance to try yet is the peanut butter because they only sell it on certain days, but you can't really go wrong with any of the flavors, they are all delicious. I highly recommend going if you haven't!
author: Kimberly F.

description:
I randomly looked up "oatmeal" in Yelp today and Anthony's Cookies came up. I went and bought a dozen shortly after. 

My loverman worked from home today because his neck is all in pain. He messed it up while carrying my fatass across the parking lot after Red Robins. Haha. I decided a dozen cookies would be the perfect pick me up knowing he loves cookies. 

I bribed my friends with cookies if they drove me here since we were hanging out anyways. One wrong turn and an illegal U-turn later, we arrived at Anthony's Cookies. 

It looked closed from the outside and once we went inside, we still thought they were closed. Its a kind of creepy establishment at night. Its a fairly long room with a lighted kitchen and nobody else was in there but us. Haha. It did not look like they sold cookies. 

The cashier working there told my friend she looked familiar and they ended up knowing each other from a concert. He was super nice and was very helpful with what cookies we should get. He let us sample a bunch and said his favorite was the white chocolate one which also happened to be my best friends favorite and then later my lovermans favorite. They had 11 cookie options today (monday) so I got a dozen, one of each, and the 12th one being the white chocolate cookie. At one point he threw away one of the cookies in the box saying they have very high standards for their cookies. My best friend and I later joked that they probably do it all the time just so it looks like they have high standards but instead their trash can is just a bucket of cookies all the employees devour later. Haha. 

Met my loverman at Bi-Rite Creamery for some sugar overload. He was unappreciative just as I knew he would be and he will probably soon forget the occurrence in a matter of days. Someone remind me why I bother to do nice things for him? 

The three of us ate the entire box in the span of four hours. The last two standing were the weird banana "cookies." They were more like muffin tops and not very tasty. One had nuts and some other stuff in it and the other was just plain banana. 

I was excited to try the whole wheat oatmeal cranberry but it was super dense and not as good as I hoped it to be. My favorite was the German Chocolate and the Cookies and Cream. My loverman only likes chewy soft cookies and these were right up his alley. 

My best friend bought a pack of toffee cookies from Bi-Rite Creamery and they were terrible compared to Anthony's. I seriously took two bites and put it down. They even looked bad. 

Less than $10 for a dozen. For the sake of my food baby, I hope I am never in vicinity of Anthony's cookies.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Its really annoying to call just 5 minutes before walking in to a staff of 4 people with zero customers and not one of them could answer the phone, just disappointing. Your cookies are limited, having someone pick up the one to save people from driving over is very important.
author: Arlette P.

description: Best cookies in SF! If you like soft, chewy cookies, this is definitely the best place for them. The cookies and cream cookies are a MUST-TRY! Although I've tried most of their cookies (toffee chip is my next favorite), the cookies and cream flavor is by far the tastiest and most popular. Each cookie is about $1.25 each, but I usually get a dozen for $15 every time I go here. Trust me, after you take a bite of one cookie, you'll want 11 more!
author: Cristina L.

description: Today was a great day for cookies! It was my first time at Anthony's taken there by an awesome friend of mine. Not only were the cookies awesome but my foxy looking dog and I met Anthony while we were waiting outside! Hes such a great guy and is now a dog fan which is even better! Great cookies anthony! we will be back!!
author: Dee N.

description: Cookies are amazing! I had the best oatmeal raisin cookie ever. Cookies are small for the price range. That's the only reason for the 4 stars. Other than that it is legit.
author: Samir A.

description: Who spends $75 on cookies in 4 days.  I do!!! Im still surprised I kept wanting to come back.  The cookies were amazing!  I brought two dozen on my trip home for my family to try.  I believe I tried everything.  I kept buying for my family who let me stay at their house and I bought some for my sister-in-law's family as well.  Everyone loved it!  I introduced these cookies to people who live in the area but they don't go into the city that often.  Staff is friendly and cookies are delicious!  Amazing amazing amazing!!
author: Chrissie O.

description:
I'm really surprised by how different my opinion of Anthony's is from so many others. We got a 1/2 dozen including the cookies n cream, oatmeal raisin, toffee, and German chocolate. The flavors were muted; I kept waiting for the full flavor to kick in but it never did. I feel kind of ridiculous assessing cookies so stringently since pretty much anything laden in sugar is delicious but Anthony's somehow missed the mark on something as simple as a cookie.

I tried Hot Cookie in the Castro district a little later and those were incredible!!
author: Thuy B.

description: Cookies and cream cookies! That is all :D
author: David K.

description:
For flavor alone, I would give anthony's 5 stars.  when you factor in value, i'd have to knock em down to 4.  the cookies here are delicious and freshly baked, but a little pricey for how small the cookies are.

i tried the cinnamon spice, chocolate chip, cookies and cream, white chocolate chip, and toffee chip.  i loved them all (with cookies and cream as my favorite), i just wish they werent so expensive.
author: Lisa C.

description:
I decided to try this place because of the rave reviews. I've tried a few of their cookies: cookie and cream, oatmeal, toffee, chocolate chip, and white chocolate chip. The cookies were amazing; they are pretty small cookies unlike ones from Ms. Fields. Nonetheless, they were all delicious but the oatmeal. The texture and taste of the cookie except the oatmeal was fabulous. The cookie and cream tasted more like a pastry than a cookie and it was not overly sweet. The toffee was wonder but I did not notice much of a toffee favor, but I enjoyed it regardless. The chocolate chip I will actually pass on the next time I visit, it was a little too sweet for my.
Now that oatmeal cookie was unlike the rest. It was overly sweet and the textures were off. You have been warned; try at your own risk.
author: Diana L.

description: These are very good cookies and moist, however, the larger ones tend to be on the more $$ side. Also, maybe it's just that I don't have cookies that often, but I could tell that the ones I had had a lot of sugar, since my teeth felt funny afterward, as if they were telling me, 'sugar overload!'. However, they taste great so that's all that should really matter, right? Also conveniently located near 24th street station BART.
author: a f.

description:
Craving cookies & cream right now. Nuff said. This is gonna be on my list of places to go every time I'm in SF. On my most recent visit, we planned a whole afternoon around Anthony's haha crazy?! I think not. COOKIES & CREAM always and forever. The other cookies that I've had (chocolate chip & cinnamon spice) were good but not as craveable as the the cookies & cream. Plus I always feel like I can just make some good choco chip cookies. Cookies & cream is defs out of my repertoire. Perfect consistence of crispy outside and soft chewy center. My only sadness is that they're 1.25 each. Damn, gonna have to make more money to support my cookie addiction.

Do yourself a favor--go to Anthony's and buy 4 cookies & cream cookies. Eat 3 and save one for me!!
author: Susan D.

description:
This place lives up to its hype. I ordered a dozen this past weekend for a family gathering and was only able to try half of the whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip and man, it was delicious. It was crunchy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. I wished I tried the cookies & creme, but I was too late..=( 

It was so good that I wanted more, I went back the next day! I ordered a few to take home for myself to enjoy! =P I had the toffee chip and that was yummy as well. I have 4 more to eat..can't wait to savor them the next few days....me cookie monster! =P
author: James L.

description: I'm craving the chocolate chip cookie. I usually have Anthony's cookies in mind whenever a cookie craving pops up. They have the perfect crunch and chewy ratio. I also like all the other varieties and the oreo cookies are popular.
author: Peachie Y.

description:
we came and got 

cookies and cream
chocolate chip
german chocolate

i thought the cookies were ok, too sweet for me.
author: Char Y.

description: cookeys 11/10 i couldnt finish all of them coz they 2 damn sweet n filling ;-(
author: Sophie Z.

description:
Two more reasons to love Anthony's Cookies (as if we needed 'em):
 
1)  Their newest cookie flavor:  PEANUT BUTTER.
 
2)  The "handsome young man" perfectly described Diane's P.'s yelp. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz/anthonys-cookies-san-francisco-2#hrid:2ilXxo42OtLbsizNvQIAAw

I am in LOVE with them both.
author: Amy C.

description: The cashier put in a broken piece of cookie in my bag that was only 2/3 of its size. The size of the cookie is tiny to begin with. Really? I paid $1.75 for this cookie, I should get a whole piece of cookie if I'm charged so much. Just because customers can't see you putting the cookies in the bags does not mean you can rip them off. Take your money elsewhere.
author: Kate S.

description:
Ok, so i'm not really a fan of sweets, but i do find myself coming here quite often. 

Their Cookies N Cream cookie is what people always mention when the name Anthony's Cookies come up, and i do agree, its really good. However, you have GOT TO try the toffee one. OMG. SO GOOD! like i said, i'm not a big fan of sweet, and an even less fan of toffee...but apparently, i'm a regular at this place... *shrugs* 

You definitely have to try it, if for no other reason, just so that you can say "Oh, Anthony's Cookies? yeah...i've had them before..." haha
author: Linh P.

description:
Delicious! But...

I don't know about Cookies N' Cream being the winner at this shop. I absolutely loved the Toffee Chip and the Cinnamon Spice just hit the spot.

Love that they also sell Strauss milk bottles and perfect pint sized milk cartons to drink while I enjoyed half their menu of cookies.
author: Tammy C.

description:
YUM-O. 
I love cookies, it probably one of my favorite type of dessert (perfect for any snack-time and brings back such great memories of childhood). 

This place smells delicious when you walk in, you can see the kitchen and where all the cookies are made. You can usually see Anthony there working and baking cookies. 

Favorites: 
Cookie and cream: if you love oreos, then you will love this one. It's a hybrid of a oreo and a chocolate chip cookie, moist and you can actually taste the cookie and cream. 
Chocolate chip cookie: Very chocolate-y and perfect balance of cookie and chocolate 
Peanut butter: Must eat instantly! It will crumble and break apart once you put it into the bag. Because it's made with organic peanut butter, its super delicate. Not a fan of peanut butter and they only serve it on a few days. 
Oatmeal cookie: not a fan, its very small and just taste too much like granola 
Toffee: very good, if you like toffee, this has a prefect balance of it, not too over powering either since toffee can make the cookie too sweet. 


I suggest getting milk with it, cookies and milk; cannot go wrong!
author: Amy L.

description: Amazing cookies and Anthony is a genuinely, genuinely nice guy.  He was a regular customer at the retail store I used to work at and always so friendly, polite, patient and appreciative.  I always knew him as Anthony, but I never knew until after leaving that job that he was THIS ANTHONY. Goes to show you how humble he is.  Support his business!! All of the cookies are great but my favorite is cookies and cream because I've never tasted anything like it! (:
author: Allie B.

description:
I'm not really sure what took me so long to give Anthony's a try, but when I finally did, I made sure I got a good sample of their deliciousness.

Here's what I tried: 
Cookies and Cream - hands down, the best flavor
Chocolate Chip - solid 
Toffee Chip - delicious, another one of my favorites 
Cinnamon Spice - unique with a nice kick of spiciness 
Peanut Butter - very tasty
Walnut Double Chocolate Chip - good, but not my favorite of the bunch

The texture of the cookies here are spot on.  It's extremely rare to find places that can master a recipe that yields a cookie with just the right amount of crispiness on the outside with a chewy and moist center.  They've got this down to a science, because every cookie I tried had this consistency in texture.  

All the flavors I tried were good, but the one that stood out was the cookies and cream.  In fact, this one blew my mind.  I could not stop eating it, and wished I had gotten a dozen of just his flavor.  Although not quite as memorable as the cookies and cream, the other flavors were still solid.  They're all made with the perfect amount of sweetness and butteriness.

$1.25 a cookie or $1.00 for 6 or more.  The cookies are about 2.5" in diameter.  I think the size is perfect, but to pay $1.25 is a little steep for one cookie.

Overall, I can't give it any less than 5 stars for the cookies and cream and for making some of the best cookies I've had in the Bay Area.
author: Lori K.

description:
So lucky for me, I suppose, I have never really had much of a sweet tooth.  For me, I generally tend to gravitate more towards salty or tangy snacks as my weakness... think chips and salsa, beef jerky, bacon; and in my earlier years skittles, sour patch kids, and airheads.

But for some reason, unbeknownst to me, I have always had a weakness for chocolate chip cookies and.... warm brownies with ice cream on it.  So naturally when visiting, I saw this place, saw the reviews, and could not resist.  Unfortunately they were out of the standard chocolate chip, so I had a cross section of all their other cookies that were available...  i THINK if I recall correctly, they were:

-Cinnamon Spice
-Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip
-Toffee Chip
-German Chocolate
-Walnut Double Chocolate Chip

I can' t give you the play by play because I have forgotten, but I can say the German Chocolate was really good, and in general they were all tasty - Cinnamon was not my favorite, but that's probably just because I'm partial to chocolate chip variety cookies.  I want to say the wheat one was a stand-out as well.

I also figured I'd try the overpriced organic milk straight from the cow's nipple, just because you aren't going to find that type of stuff in Texas.... it tasted like regular whole milk, so I would forego that.

As many others have mentioned, these cookies are small... about the size you would get out of a home-made batter (maybe 2.0 - 2.5 inches in diameter) so you are paying a good bit for what you get.  

Bottom line: very good cookies but not spectacular... still can't beat JD's Chippery in Dallas.
author: Mark W.

description:
I love Anthony's Cookies! My sister found out about this place from Yelp so we decided to try and have loved it ever since. The storefront is very small so it's easy to pass up when driving, so keep a watchful eye. Inside the shop is very plain, no fuss. The cookies are wonderful and they always have a great selection. I love the chocolate chip and the walnut chocolate chip cookies the best.

The only slightly negative thing I would say is that the cookies seem a tad overpriced, especially considering how small they are. In comparison to Mrs. Field's for example, they are the same price but about half the size, however, they taste much better IMO.

Overall, I think the cookies are wonderful and a real treat. I like the fact that Anthony's Cookies is a local business, not a chain, so it's always nice to support those types of businesses. I love finding little gems like these through word of mouth or Yelp.
author: Ashley F.

description:
After hearing about Anthony's Cookies and reading the reviews on yelp I finally went to try it. 

The size of the cookie are on the small side and they are really pricy. I wasn't a fan of the cookies and cream cookie though. That seems to be the one everyone recommends. Love love their toffee chip cookies! Thats the one that I recommend. I've been craving them for the longest time that I might need to get my fix sometime this week. 

Parking is pretty hard since it's street parking and since is SF its always hard to find parking. They let you sample cookie while you're there too.
author: Ashleyann D.

description: This place is so overpriced, it is sick.  A tiny cookie for like $2!  They recently raised their prices.  Not worth it.
author: Jo M.

description: Making cookies the new cupcake for San Francisco!
author: David S.

description:
If you go to a potluck and see Anthony's Cookies on the table - move fast.

If someone gives your Anthony's cookies as a kind gesture or thank you - be honored. Be very honored.

Anthony's makes cookies the way they're supposed to be made. They taste fresh. They taste moist. They taste like nostalgia. 

Anthony's - tastes so good - that you can't help but taste and feel the love.
author: Jessica T.

description:
The cookies are so good here.  My favorite is Cookie and Cream.  The cookie here is thin, soft and chewy but not overly sweet.

I can't wait to go back for more!!!
author: Liza T.

description: WOW.  I just had 3 different kinds of cookies from Anthony's and they were all phenomenal.  Our building got us cookies today and there was an assortment of all different types.  I loved the one with oreos in it (a cookie made out of cookies...).  I'm not sure how much they cost or anything about the shop itself, but the cookies were great.  I would highly recommend stopping by for a cookie or four.
author: Ty C.

description:
I'm more of an ice cream lover, but everyone keeps raving about this place, so I had to see for myself what the fuss was all about. 

The store is located on Valencia, so parking is not that great (street parking). Anthony's cookies is quiet and simple inside containing only a long table with benches, so this is more of a buy your cookie-and-go kind of place.

When I last purchased from here, they were selling cookies for $1.25/piece. 

I have tried these flavors: cookies n cream, toffee chip, white chocolate, and red velvet. I have to admit the cookies are pretty good, and my favorites are white chocolate and toffee chip. What I love about these cookies is the soft center. However, I thought the edges were a little too crunchy for my taste, but it's not a deal breaker.

Overall, if you are craving a really good cookies, then I suggest you come here and try out their different flavors.
author: Trysha J.

description:
COOOOOOOOKIES!

With daily flavors of:
*Cookies and cream
*Chocolate chip
Cinnamon Spice
*White chocolate chip
Whole wheat oatmeal raisin
*Toffee Chip

And periodic flavors of:
Walnut chip
Whole wheat oatmeal walnut chip
*Double chocolate chip
Peanut butter
German chocolate
Candied pecan chip
*Walnut double chocolate chip
Whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip
(*recommended)

I love cookies. Not your Chips Ahoy kind or whatever comes packaged at your local grocery store, but fresh baked ones. The experience starts when you enter with the sign on the front door reminding everyone to close the door to keep the freshness of the cookies lining the trays behind the counter. Then they list the day's selections on a board to the left. Employees are more than happy to supply a sample of any cookie if you're a bit undecided. That's already on top of the cookies they have cut into quarters for sampling. Ordering is the hardest part, with my own indecision being the problem. Before you know it, the box of dozen cookies are devoured and you're left pondering what sort of an excuse you can use to find your way back

Parking: not too bad
Wait time: none
Health score: 96
author: Dennis L.

description: I am so proud of this young man that I cant put it into words.  Over 12 years ago I was a mattress salesman on ocean ave in sf.  Anthony would visit me with his "home-made"cookies that were fantastic, bought them every chance. So many years later, I walk into this place on Valencia called "anthonys". cookies off the hook. When I came back the second time and saw this young man behind the counter, I put 2&2 together and flipped out. Anthony I am so happy for you, god bless.
author: Ken M.

description:
I made a trip to SF to specifically come here and was happy I did! Anthony's is located a short walk from 24th Street Bart. 
There were only 2 customers inside when I arrived so I didn't have to wait very long. I was thinking of just ordering half a dozen but once I saw the assortment I decided to get a full dozen!
My favorite cookie is the Cookies and Cream cookie....let me just say...OMG! One of the best cookies I have ever had, the flavors are amazing and the cookie melts in your mouth- I can't describe the flavor but its definitely a must have if you come here. The other flavors I got like White chocolate chip, chocolate chip, peanut butter, spiced cinnamon were also good but the Cookies and Cream flavor was definitely my favorite. 
Prices here are reasonable, $1.25 ea or $16/dozen and you get a nice little box.
Its recommended to eat the cookies the first day but they will last for a few days (but will taste the BEST on the first).
Would definitely recommend to try if you are in the area!
author: Miss H K.

description:
best cookies ever. seriously. and i bake really really good cookies.
and i'm willing to pay for these. 

that's gotta mean something....
author: Aletheia W.

description: So the cookies have gone up thirty cents since my last visit. It's still worth it. They're not the biggest cookies but they're packed full of flavor and the texture is perfect. They have a couple of cookies that go for a little more, ~$1.75, but they're worth it. The peanut butter cookie is really small but it melts in your mouth. It's quality over quantity with Anthony's Cookies. I wish they'd have more locations.
author: Michael H.

description: Some pretty tasty cookies! Got a bunch of chocolate chip cookies for the kids. They were devoured. Great soft texture which I love. I'm glad they are a little pricey because I would have bought out the entire store otherwise =)
author: Jocelyn J.

description:
I think I found my favorite new cookie shop!

I usually prefer the sugary, buttery, 2-inch thick, heart attack-inducing cookies you'd find at a place like Specialty's, but the cookies at Anthony's have quickly become my favorite.

I ordered a dozen cookies for $9.25. Each cookie is about 4'' wide and 1/3 of an inch thick--big enough for one cookie to satisfy your cookie craving, yet small enough to not feel terrible about eating 2 or 3 (or in my case, 6). Here's a quick rundown of what I ordered and what I thought about each cookie:

Cinnamon Sugar: My favorite! I'm a chocoholic so I was surprised that my favorite cookies of the bunch were all of the non-chocolate flavors. However, I loved the crispy on the outside/chewy on the inside texture of this cookie and thought it had just the right amount of sweetness.

Toffee Chip: My second favorite! The toffee pieces were gooey and tasty and the rest of the cookie was great too.

Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chip: Nothing you wouldn't already expect from a chocolate chip cookie, but still very delicious!

Walnut Chocolate Chip: Identical to the semi-sweet chocolate chip, but with tasty walnuts throughout.

Banana: Tasted more like the top of a banana muffin than an actual cookie, but I loved this one too!

Cookies and Cream: Anthony Cookie's signature flavor. I expected greatness, but found the cookie to be a bit bland. I couldn't really taste the cookie pieces and overall found it difficult to sense a distinct flavor to the cookie. The only miss of the bunch.

Overall, I give the cookies at Anthony's 4.5 stars. However, I'll definitely round up to 5 stars for Anthony's outstanding service. Immediately upon entering the store, Anthony greeted me and gave me a very warm welcome. The rest of the staff was also super friendly (and were even generous enough to give me a free cookie for my first visit!). And at $1 per cookie, $5 per half dozen, and $9.25 per dozen, prices are reasonable. 

Just be sure to order more than you think you want. I guarantee you'll inhale these bad boys in seconds.

Thanks Anthony! I'll definitely be back for more.
author: Joseph F.

description: who knew cookies can be so good! the toffee chip, cookies n cream, omg i can eat these all day! I def want to come here any chance i get. A little expensive for a cookie $1.25 but hell, they're so good i don't mind lol
author: Irma R.

description:
Delicious cookies!!! I had the Oatmeal Walnut Chocolate Chip Cookies and the Double Chocolate Chip Cookies and they were to die for. The Oatmeal Walnut had the right balance of nut, oatmeal, and chocolate chip with a baby hint of cinnamon. It was soooooo good!!! The Double Chocolate Chip was not too chocolatey very scrumptious cause the chocolate chip chunks were really big and just melted in my mouth with every bite! I may have a new problem and may need to try and forget where this place is. Hoping amnesia kicks in...but I still have 3 cookies left so I'll enjoy them while I got em'

As for the service, it was just as good as the cookies :)  The girl who was working the register was putting together a giant order of cookies like 10 bags worth and she immediately came over to help me with a to go menu which is on this website and showed me the chalkboard with the cookies of the day. I wanted four of each kind of cookie but may have held up three fingers and said four who knows...I still got cookies and for the correct price so no worries there. 

This place is another gem in the Mission :)
author: Vanessa C.

description:
Admittedly, I have been uninspired to review any place lately. And honestly, what more can really be said about Anthony's Cookies?

They are chewy with a subtle crisp on the outside - PERFECT. They have a little extra sweetness without being too saccharine, which is perfect for a sugar-lover like myself.  They feel so homemade. But homemade in the way you WISH you knew how to make it at home. Plus, they are priced perfectly for you to get a whole bunch and take with you to share. Though, I find it hard to believe you'll be willing to share once you take a bite. I chose quite a few cookies but then ended up choosing one more. Since they arent priced individually, the man at the counter said the extra cookie was on the house! I insisted on paying, but he wasn't having it. How generous and sweet is that?!?! I was happy with all of the cookies - loved their creative flavors like cookies and cream. And the toffee really lives up to its reputation, it was article-worthy. Literally.

But let me tell you what truly stands testament to the deliciousness that is Anthony's Cookies. Upon driving up the street to find a parking spot (in the mission, no less!), I found what looked like a painted curb outside of the auto body shop next door. A little skeptical, I parked and went outside to get a closer look at the scraggly curb. As soon as I looked up, a police car was parked in the middle of the street for another issue (not me thankfully!). As they were walking, I asked if where I was parking was legal. One policeman looked at the curb and asked if I was going to the auto body shop or the cookie shop. I proudly told him "Cookies!" He then said. "if you are getting cookies, go ahead it looks fine to me!" After finishing up my order, the two policemen walked in to order some themselves. Speechless.

Oh Anthony's Cookies, your extremely kind staff and delicious cookies even make the police nice. You are not just scrumptious, you are magic! Does this work with CHP? Because, if only we could just gather a dozen and talk about this speeding ticket from Coalinga...
author: Stella C.

description:
Wow.  We definitely loved Anthony's Cookies!  While all we tried were wonderful, our favorites were:  toffee, cookie's and cream, and white chocolate chip.

Will return before departing SF!
author: Doug C.

description:
Bought 3 dozen today. $36. Will be enjoying maybe 4 and gifting and giving the rest. Their Cookies'n'Cream should go into a Cookie Hall-of-Fame but so should many of their others. 

Their service is impeccable, they take their time with you and ensure you're only leave with cookies you're going to fall in love with..over..and..over again. They treat their cookies like precious cakes. They wrap it all pretty in your box with string. Lots of love in those cookies.

Shout out to whoever was at the front today, I think it was John, and of course Chris! Yall are awesome!

Cookies'n'Cream.4.Ever.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Best Cookies I ever had! I love the cookies from this place and it never disappoints! Fresh baked cookies made from scratch is always good!

Toffee and White Chocolate are best but all are good!
author: Elliot T.

description:
This place has cookies and milk, what more do you want?  The cookies are moist and taste fresh.   I liked the toffee chip a lot.  The semi sweet was much more than semi good.  Yeah those pretty much rocked.  The banana walnut wasn't as moist, but had good banana flavor.  

Anthony's super welcoming ways and non-cookie man looks made me suspicous, but I gots to say thanks to my sista for making sure we stopped by here and shared a half dozen.
author: David O.

description:
Three words.. Cookies and cream! 

Visited this place for the first time today after the Folsom food festival and fell in love.  I also tried cinnamon spice and whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip.  They were all heavenly, delectable and so fresh! Not to mention, addicting! Can't wait to come back.  The bakery is also very nice and chic.
author: Daisy D.

description: Anthony's cookies is a little cookie shop located in the mission area. Their prices were okay, about $1 per cookie. I recommend their cookies n' cream, toffee, banana bread, and chocolate chip cookies. :) Enjoy!
author: Kristine K.

description:
I love the smell of fresh baked cookies, especially when they are from Anthony's...yum yum!

Anthony and his staff are always so friendly and welcoming!  Every time I walk in, they greet me with a smile and offers me a sample!  In fact, when I went in yesterday, Anthony was just telling me how much he values his customers and how they are reaching their 1-year mark soon, good for them! 

Not only are the cookies baked fresh, they take a lot of pride in each batch that they make.  If one of their semi-sweet looks like there is not enough chocolate chips, they will throw it out.  That's what I call great quality control! :)

I can never get enough of the Cookies & Cream or Toffee Chip, two of my all-time favorite flavors, followed by the Semi-Sweet.  I am so glad that they offer all 3 flavors every day of week; I swear I can buy boxes and boxes of these yummy goodness!  They are always so moist and chewy, delish!

To top it off, each cookie is less than $1 a pop, how can everyone complain about that, especially in SF?!?  Great job Anthony's, keep up the good work!
author: Janetto L.

description:
Cookies are delicious, have never had a bad cookie here before. Cookies and Cream by far my favorite, like a orgasmic Oreo treat that melts in your mouth. 

Prices keep me from coming back too often. Per cookie you pay what you probably would at Mrs. Fields but with half the portions. Half the portions means you want to buy more, and then the prices add up quickly. 

Parking in the area can also be a total trainwreck. Either I've gotten lucky with street parking or I've had to circle around for around 10 minutes before finding a spot I barely fit in. 

Due to the location and prices, I would say Anthony's, as good as they are, should be considered an occasional trip rather than a daily one. All the more reason to splurge a bit when you do go though.
author: Alfred D.

description:
Pretty good, not great. These cookies are very small but are only $1.25 each so pricing seems fair. The thing I really didn't like is that you can't actually see the cookies...they are on baking trays behind the counter and I'm sure they would show you if you asked, but we are visual eaters so we want to see what we are picking!

The double chocolate walnut, cinnamon spice and peanut butter were good (none great) and the toffee chip was too sweet for my taste (everyone else seems to rave about it though).

Unless we are right around the corner, I don't see myself making a trip over there just for their cookies.
author: Megan N.

description:
I love me cookies...CHOMP CHOMP CHOMP...They're my happy food when I find a $10 bill in my pocket, my comfort food when I open my credit card bill, my concentration food when I need to reach a deadline at work, my "hanging out with my girls in front of the TV" treat when we want to eat like men without the men being there of course food

So...discovering Anthony's cookies near my neck of the woods was a surprising delight because of my alliance with the great cookie god & my love affair for it

And the lineup was.....

*Cookies & Cream
*Banana
*Toffee Chip
*Double Chocolate Chip
*Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chip
*Ghirardelli White Chocolate Chip
*Double Chocolate Chip with walnuts

All the cookies I've sampled were crunchy which is great but wished they would've been on the moist & bigger side. But for $.79 per cookie...you can't beat the price compared to those $2.95 cookies nowadays. I know to order these Faves next time... Cookies & Cream, Toffee Chip & Ghirardelli White Chocolate Chip...and I'm not going to order just one either  ; )

Don't forget to say hi to Anthony, the owner of the store... he came up to us & shook our hands but I couldn't reach out to him in time with a request for an autograph on one of my cookies. SERVICE pretty much stood out & that's a plus

Until the next cookie venture....peace out, my cookie god
author: Charmian D.

description: These are the best cookies in the Bay!!..The Cookies and cream will make u scream. So crisp on the outside and moist inside. The flavor is PureHeaven..honorable mention: Chocolate chip w/nuts!!..but all of them super YUMMY!!
author: Jayla B.

description:
I went to the grand opening today with Helene K. and Matt G. (Joe Cool, aka Fro-yo Boy) and waited in line for a free cookie.  Marcus recognized Matt G. (is Matt G. already a regular?).  What a crazy scene!  I was afraid they would run out of cookies!  Anthony was there in his open kitchen furiously baking cookies.  

The inside of the shop smelled incredible (mmm, fresh baked cookies) and the chocolate covered walls were covered with pictures of butter and other ingredients.  I didn't see any tables or chairs, but maybe they took them out for the grand opening or they haven't arrived yet.  They also had a lovely display of Straus milk bottles - but no milk for sale.  It's hard to eat cookies without milk.

By the time we made it to the front of the line, they were out of quite a few varieties of cookies.  It's $5 for 6 cookies.  

* Toffee chip:  This was still quite warm (fresh out of the oven), a medium sized cookie, very buttery. The texture was just right - slightly crispy on the edges and soft in the center.  It didn't have any visible toffee chunks.  I think the toffee flavor could be stronger and I'd also prefer to have something crunchy in the batter for  contrast.  It could use a little more salt too (it's a bit too sweet).  
* Double chocolate:  Plenty of chocolate flavor with melty chocolate chips.  
* Cookies and cream: Had bits of Oreo cookies, quite soft in the center.  I think it could use a little more crunch.  

They have 14 types of cookies, nothing too exotic but more along the lines of classic cookies.  I like my cookies a bit thicker and with more textural contrast but I do think Anthony's makes quality cookies (made with quality ingredients).  

Cash only.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Overall I was happy with the quality of the cookies.  Although I'm an adventurous eater and wanted to try the more unique flavors, I bought the chocolate chip cookie (which we all know the taste of) for the purpose having some sort of base line to compare with other stores' cookies.  I also bought the cookies & cream cookie.

The flavor of each cookie is what one would expect.  However, I was very happy to taste a layer of flavors that changed within one bite.  I couldn't pin if it was a special, particular flavored extract, but it tasted divine and I noted it in both the chocolate chip and cookies & cream.  The texture of the cookies is soft and chewy.  The size is on the smaller side.  If I want to gift-give special cookies, I would come back here.
author: Yolanda V.

description:
Really debated whether to go with 3 or 4 stars on this, but I had to go with 4 because 1) I really don't know any other cookie place to put in the same class to compare to Anthony's and 2) they have some pretty unique cookies.

I do love a good cookie, and this place has good cookies. A little crispy outside and gooey inside. My personal preference is for the crispy, but it gives a little bit for everything for that person that likes both.

The cookies & cream cookie was great, and very unique. Not quite what I was expecting, but good. Chocolate chip was pretty amazing, and might be my favorite cookie. The toffee, oatmeal raisin, and oatmeal chocolate chip were all tasty. The organic milk was an adventure, shaking as hard as I could to dislodge the clump of cream/butter at the top. Made for a good time and an interesting scene.

I've had some homemade from-scratch cookies before that can compare, but I will admit, if you're going to buy a cookie, there isn't a better place.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Congratulations to Anthony's for a seemingly very successful Grand Opening yesterday (April 25, 2009, 1-3pm). I showed up around 1 or so and met up with Lolia S. right at the same time. Shortly thereafter, Matt G. stumbled upon the two of us, and the Holy Sweets Trinity was formed. The line was pretty long when we arrived, but it was much longer after we finally got our cookies. 

Each person in line was granted one free cookie for the Grand Opening special, which was more than I had expected (I was expecting maybe crumbles of cookies at most, I don't know why). The wait wasn't too long, considering, when I was in sight of the front counter, I could see Anthony and others rushing around in the back baking up more batches of cookies for the crowds. 

In terms of the store itself, it's still of course very new. There's only a small sign posted in the window so far, but the interior is decorated rather nicely with beautiful photos of ingredients. The front counter area is lined with milk bottles and a makeshift menu is handwritten on the left wall in permanent marker. They have an Odwalla cooler to the right, and looks like they will soon serve coffee and tea as well.

There are currently twelve flavors available:

1. Cookies and Cream
2. Semi-sweet Chocolate Chip
3. White Chocolate Chip
4. Cinnamon Sugar
5. Toffee Chip
6. Double Chocolate Chip
7. Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin
8. Whole Wheat Oatmeal Cranberry
9. Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip
10. Walnut Chocolate Chip
11. Banana
12. Banana Walnut

According to Matt G., one cookie costs $1, so buying in bulk is a better deal. I decided to go with a half-dozen for $5; for my free sample, I chose the Cinnamon Sugar, which was so warm and fresh. The taste of the cinnamon was very distinct in the cookie, and the texture was chewy, but not doughy. 

For the half-dozen, I went with three Cookies & Cream and three Banana. I'm not sure if they ended up giving me the Banana Walnut instead, though, but it didn't matter to me. The Banana/Banana Walnut cookie was very bread-like, almost like Banana Bread. The Cookies & Cream screamed its namesake upon first bite--really, it's amazing that Anthony has concocted this mix. Very unique and original; will probably make the ice cream lovers forget  about the flavor and convert to the cookie. 

The size of the cookies are average (to me): not as big as those cookies you'd find at a convenience store, but not bite-sized either. The Banana varieties are slightly smaller than the other flavors, probably due to the banana/bread consistency. Overall, I like a cookie shop with out-of-the-ordinary flavors yet also promoting some relatively healthy options (i.e., the whole wheat varieties).

Service was amiable and efficient, considering how busy they were in preparing more cookies and trying to get the line moving along quickly as well. I rather enjoyed my experience there, and I hope to be back soon again (perhaps I need to make a point to head over to the Mission more often anyway). For the time being, cash only, but with the popularity already booming for the shop, I wouldn't be surprised when they start accepting cards as well.

As a final note--Anthony's has already earned a Yelp sticker; quite fast! Keep up the buzz.
author: Helene K.

description:
Went here twice this past week and it's a must if you have a sweet tooth!

Pros
+ COOKIES AND CREAM a must try when coming out here, best cookie hands down.
+ Freshest cookies I've had besides mom's of course!
+ Crispy on the outside nice and soft towards the center of the cookie goodness.

Cons
- A little pricey for some cookies but you get what you pay for EXCELLENT tasting cookies!
author: Matthew B.

description: The cookies are definitely YUM.  I tried the Cookie and Cream, Toffee, and White Chocolate.  They were all delicious, not too sweet, soft.  However, I couldn't really differentiate the flavors.  For $1.25, the size of the cookie is just too small, but I would still buy again.
author: Karen L.

description: Anthony is a great guy.  He's the perfect example of the American dream come true.  Anthony makes an awesomely chewy buttery cookie.  The cookies and creme is clearly the best but the question is what is second?  In my opinion, the toffee chip and white chocolate are great runner ups.  Not a fan of the peanut butter or oatmeal but that's personal preference.  Another bit of advice, don't get 30 cookies to eat by yourself over a week.  The cookies don't have preservatives and don't keep well.  Better to get a bit at a time and enjoy these cookies fresh.
author: Christian W.

description: I consider myself somewhat of a peanut butter cookie connoisseur. After living in New York City for five years I appreciate even more the West Coast's indulgence of peanut butter cookies. But I still know a good peanut butter cookie when I taste one and the these guys make the best one around.
author: Alena B.

description:
Cookies, you say?? I'M THERE!

Anthony's Cookies serve the most delightful cookies EVER. As soon as you step foot into the bakery, you can smell the butter goodness. They're like Girl Scout Cookies... but better! I ordered all of the following:

2 x Cookies and Cream
1 x Classic Chocolate Chip
1 x Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin 
1 x Toffee

I wish I ordered more, or they should at least offer some sort of cookie package deals. $1.25 per cookie isn't bad, but it can be pricey when you want to buy more than 5 cookies. I want to eventually try all their flavors. All the cookies I tried were just sooo darn good. I will definitely come back for more baked goods!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Sooooooooooo good! I wasn't too fond of the banana - it was like eating a slightly hardened and flatted slice of banana bread, so it didn't feel like a cookie to me. But everything else was great! Slightly crispy outside, chewy inside, not too sweet - I could eat them like chips ... actually, I did. Great, hard-working guys there too.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: I love the cookies here despite the price and the size. My favorite would be the toffee which reminds me of the discontinued Mrs. Fields cookie, but better. The cookies and cream is pretty good too. If you are feeling like spending a bit more, try the Straus milk with the cream top.
author: Audrey M.

description: German Chocolate.. OMG, and the Cookies and Cream is still good! Great service as always!
author: Richard C.

description:
Yum Yum Yum!! Bought a box of these for a party, and they were gone within minutes.  The cookies and cream cookie is unique, the chocolate chip cookies are tasty, the walnut chocolate chip cookies are out of this world, and the toffee chip cookies are insanely good!  The service was great, and they offer to sample any and as many of the cookies as you desire.

Only problem is the cost!  A little too pricy per cookie!
author: Rita W.

description:
It's always a good sign when the owner is actually there in the premises making and baking his own product!! Just walking in Anthony's Cookies shop and the smell of freshly baked cookies hits home. 

This being my first time here, I randomly pick 5 flavors. Classic chocolate chip, whole wheat oatmeal raisin, toffee chip, peanut butter and double chocolate chip for a total of 20. OK, I cheated before I got home and sample 2, toffee chip is awesome with a right amount of sweetness and moist not dry nor crumbly. The Whole wheat oatmeal raisin was surprisingly the best oatmeal raisin I had in a very long time and the whole wheat just make it justify to order more. Hopefully the rest of the cookies will make to my office tomorrow morning!
author: Wolfy W.

description:
CASH ONLY!  I had a better experience at Anthony's Cookies today Sun 6/7/09.  No line when I went.  They hired a cashier so now there's 3 people working there.

I got a walnut chocolate chip cookie for .85c

It wasn't warm, but it tasted ok.  Not enough walnuts for me.

Still, I'll recommend it if you're in the area.
author: Ann L.

description:
Cookies & Cream cookie... YUM.

Service was very friendly.  The girl working the counter/register was really patient as I hmmed and hawed over which flavors to purchase.  I bought a dozen for my parents to try.  VERDICT: they thought all the flavors were yummy, but that I could make the same (or better) myself at home.  Win for me? 

At $1.25/cookie, it would definitely be easier on my wallet.  Nice place to bring visitors to, but if you have the time, it's probably more worth it to just bake your own.

PS - They accept Visa/Mastercard for purchases over $5.
author: Susanna W.

description:
Yum!  We purchased a 1/2 dozen cookie sampler - oatmeal raisin, white chocolate, oreo, choco chip, cinnamon sugar, and toffee chip.

I gave S.B. the blind taste test and realized his palate is shit.  Here was his conclusion:

white chocolate = oatmeal
oreo = oatmeal
toffee = oatmeal
oatmeal = cinnamon
cinnamon = cinnamon
choco chip = choco chip

I was like uh duh, what's up with your taste buds?  He said, you didn't give me an opportunity to clear my palate between each tasting!  I said, uh, your first guess was oatmeal for a white chocolate chip cookie...! 

It's ok, I still love him.  I also love the cookies, 6 for $6 ain't cheap, but they were fresh out of the oven and sometimes you just gotta splurge for the sake of enjoyment.
author: Burrito M.

description: This place makes my guilty pleasure ,these cookies are made with sole careful balance of dough and heaven .a bit pricy but worth it
author: Keith A.

description:
These are probably one of the best, if not the best, cookies I've ever had.  Their cookies & cream cookie is my absolute favorite.  Give me some ice-cold milk and I'm set. 

Do yourself a favor and try Anthony's Cookies.
author: Delbert A.

description: I'm never in this area but since I was really close by to Anthony's Cookies, I decided to stop by. Finding parking sucks in the area but luckily, I found parking. I got half a dozen cookies which is $6 and if you wanted a dozen it's $12. The guy helping me out was really sweet. Kinda bummed that they didn't have the banana cookie.  I  ended up getting the white chocolate chip, walnut double chocolate chip, cinnamon spice, and cookies and cream. My favorite was the cinnamon spice probably cause I like anything cinnamon but the white chocolate chip was good too (my overall favorite cookie lol). I really love how the cookies are not too sweet  cause the ones from Mrs. Fields are really sweet.
author: Janice V.

description:
Believe the hype. I LOVE Anthony's and I count my blessings that I won't walk by it often enough that I gain 50 cookie pounds, since it's down on Valencia and 25th. A once in a while treat/gift is perfect.

Both Marcus and Anthony were super friendly and really know how to run a store. Love that they have milk all ready to go, and can't WAIT till they have tables for me to enjoy my cookies and milk.

Like Frances, my husband said the toffee wasn't toffee-ish enough, but I thought all the cookies were awesome. The classic walnut chocolate chip being my favorite. I need to try the Oatmeal with raisin and cranberry because that's the one they most heartily recommended, and I trust the cookie guys.
author: Nikki M.

description:
I love how this place is so close to the 24th street BART stop.  It means that only a 5 minute BART ride and a 5 minute walk separate me from the goodness that is toffee chip and cookies and cream. 

Individual cookies are 95 cents, half a dozen is $5.  
I stopped by on a Friday evening (around 6) and they still had six flavors to choose from.

EDIT: Cookies are now $1.25 and half a dozen is $6.
author: Jenn C.

description: Came here two days in a row because I enjoyed the cookies that much! I've sampled all the flavors and honestly can say they are all delicious but the toffee one is my favorite by a landslide. The shop itself is small and unassuming but is functional and serves it's sole purpose....dishing up the most awesome cookies ever!! I'm real particular about my cookies, I like them to be just a tad crispy on the outside with a chewy center. Anthony has perfected this recipe of cookie. I met the owner himself today and he was extremely friendly and takes the quality control of his bakery very seriously.
author: Derrek O.

description:
Some of the best cookies in the city (though my gf disagrees), your best route is ordering a half dozen or a dozen (1 dollar per cookie). Its worth it, especially since you're not going to order only 1 or 2 cookies

Cinnamon Cookie - like a spicy snickerdoodle, very cinnamony, and very delicious. The first thing I thought of was pairing this cookie with the Horchata Ice Cream at Mr. and Mrs. Miscellaneous. This would create some sort of amazingly awesome cookie sandwich that Will Ferrell would describe as SCRUMPTRELESCENT. Still, a good cookie on its own and a great recommendation by the cashier.

Chocolate Chip - Stock cookie, well done. Melty chocolate chip, and a good doughy cookie.

Oatmeal Chocolate Chip - the guiltless cookie. It tastes a bit grainy as oatmeal normally does, but it definitely doesnt taste like cardboard. Its still moist and the texture is nice and chewy. The chocolate chip  is a nice touch as opposed to raisins. Ungh, raisins. Very good cookie.

Cookies and Cream - Their crown cookie. Obviously very amazing. Very chocolatey, but not very creamy. This cookie is ridiculously good. My gf may not agree, but this is the crack of cookies. Man, im drooling thinking of these cookies, and this would be great paired with ice cream from your favorite purveyor. 

Walnut Double Chocolate - the brownie of cookies. Tons of chocolate, I'm meh about walnuts but I wanted to at least try them, and since Janette likes walnuts, I ordered 2 because I don't like sharing desserts. Amazingly good.

I really think the secret to their cookies is cake flour. Try it for yourself. Nevertheless, they use quality ingredients, and I will definitely be back. These cookies rate right about at the same level as Tea Cake Bakeshop cookies to me at least.
author: Marc T.

description:
OK, I have no idea how a cookie shop in San Francisco does little more than produce those round shaped delicacies so loved by the American "cutesy food" culture receives nearly 1000 reviews! The most famous eateries in Austin, Texas (the second most tech-saavy town, and a foodie one, at that) only boast ~800!

Anyway.... I feel like you can get something artisanally baked anywhere that serves coffee not having "Bean" or "Bucks" in its name. That being said, I love checking out all of the locally produced baked goods, even if it does make me a little poorer for having performed this duty as a Yelper.

Anthony's whole wheat oatmeal raisin was pretty awesome. A little too tough, with a touch of chewiness, but ultimately a well-textured cookie. A smidgen too sweet, but the hint of oatmeal gave a good flavor.

They are cheaper than most, at $1.25 a pop, but I got them from a local vendor, and they were right at $2! Coffee joints make a killing. Go directly to the source.
author: Solomon W.

description:
Cookie are so good!!!!!!Soft+Chewy+not too sweet ~~GOOOOOOOOOOD

My favor are Toffee Chip and Cookies and Cream!
better go try some if you haven't been Anthony's Cookie!
He DOES make the BEST cookie~~~~!
author: Joyce W.

description:
Hands down the best cookies in da bay ! 

I loveeee the way their cookies tastes it's so gooodd. I love how the edge of the cookie is crispy and then it gets soft inside . It just melts in your mouth ! It has everything I like in a cookie. Their popular flavor is the cookies n' cream , but I'm not a big fan of that one. I really like their original chocolate chips, cinnamon, white chocolate, walnut chocolate chip ,and a few others I can't remember. They were all really good ! I wished they made them bigger. Their prices are a bit pricey for a cookie that are not really big. The shop is a bit hard to spot too. Better be on the look-out when you're trying to find it !
author: Lucy C.

description:
Anthony's cooking is a solid place to grab a warm cookie and I'm giving it a 4-star because of the location (it is just a few blocks away from where I live) and for the price point (which is very low at $1.25 a piece).

I've stopped by today and while my cookie wasn't warm as the batch was probably done a few hours ago, looking at other review, I'm sure my experience can always get better. I like their schedule and I should definitely stop by more often. 

I've tried the cinnamon spice and oatmeal raisin cookies and I liked both.
author: Cedric L.

description: Anthony's Cookies manages to make the perfect cookie.  As many other reviewers have noted, they are crisp on the outside and soft on the inside.  How they achieve this, I don't know but it's dreamy.  After eating an Anthony's cookie all others will seem subpar and will no longer tempt you.  How can you go back to mediocre after tasting perfection?  It will be a disappointment every time.  Of the cookies, I recommend cookies n' cream the most.  A cookie made out of oreo cookie chunks?  What's this?  But it works.  You can soft cookie with crispy oreo bits and melted creaminess.  Nom nom....I recommend you get yourself a half dozen of these and sequester yourself away until they're finished.  You definitely won't want to share and you definitely won't be able to stop eating them until they're gone.
author: Jean K.

description:
Why did I only find out about this place a couple of weeks ago? Not your problem, I know.. Anyway, this place deserves 5 red gleaming, shiny stars because of its great customer service and its cookies. 

When I first saw this place on yelp, I thought: "Genius. Who wouldn't try to start their own business with this type of food?" The only competitor out there is Mrs. Fields but its a commercial, chain place. My bf and I decided to venture out here after enjoying some chowder in SF and it wasn't that hard to find. When we walked in, there were 4 people in line and the long table was occupied by people enjoying their cookies. I was already impressed by all the positive reviews that I knew I wanted to buy a dozen cookies. Here are my thoughts:

Toffee: Yes
Cookies and Cream: YES
Cinnamon Sugar: yeah, kinda
Chocolate Chip: Yaaa
White Chocolate: Mmm yes

I like this place a lot. The owner was very accomodating and the woman at the register was efficient. I was excited to try this place out and it didn't let me down. Visit this cookie spot when you can. It's a must.

*** The next day when my dozen had been greedily eaten by the cookie monster (me), my bf bought a pack of tollhouse cookies to bake. I baked em and took a bite. They tasted like CRAP! Damn you Anthony's cookies! You set the bar to the heavens.
author: V U.

description:
Wow, that's all I really have to say about this place. I pride myself in knowing about all the amazing gems that the SF food scene has to offer, but I had no idea about Anthony's cookies. 

My co-workers, knowing how bougie I am, don't dare bring me "goodies" from Safeway after I refused to eat them for another co-workers bday. Well, Im sure glad they took note, because they decided to bring me the delectable treats of Anthony's Cookies instead, and boy was I grateful. Everything about these cookies were awesome...chewy, gooey, crispy crunchy melt in your mouth. To top it off, they brought a pint of Secret Breakfast from Humphry Slocombe and we enjoyed office made ice cream cookie sandos...thank you!

If you haven't been to Anthony's Cookies, stop what you're doing now, and go get some, you won't regret it.
author: David M.

description:
I am not a huge cookie fan but this place deserves 5 stars!! Think about it. A cookie place with 700 reviews? Good steakhouses don't even get that many!

DEFINITELY get the cookies and cream cookie. How do I explain how it tastes? Hmmm. It bought me back to a time when I was a kid where I used to dip my oreos into milk. Tastes JUST like it. HEAVEN. One cookie just isn't enough, so get like half a dozen :)
author: Rosie W.

description: My boyfriend, recently moving to NY, is begging that I send him these cookies (really, it's becoming a daily request). The cookies and cream cookie is excellent and I am salivating just writing this. All of the others that I've had (which I think up to now would be most of them...) are excellent. I was slightly disappointed in the toffee chip cookie because that would usually be a definite go to, and just didn't meet the great expectations of the others. The staff is really kind, albeit slow. Definitely worth checking out, unless you have to send it to your significant other... kidding.
author: Katie C.

description:
If you are going to eat cookies-- do it right. Go to Anthony's.

Fresh. Wholesome. Old fashioned flavors and new unexplored flavors too. you can't help  but fall in love with these cookies.

my fav is the cookies and cream

seriously the best
author: Andrew Y.

description: Stopped by on a whim, happened to be walking by.  Grabbed a double chocolate cookie. Nicely made, but wasn't blown away like the rest of the reviewers.  Was certainly above average, but for the price I expected more in flavor or size. Won't go out of my way to revisit the place.
author: John F.

description: Excellent cookies. Lots of dark chocolate and coffee flavors for those that don't like it too sweet. Super friendly staff
author: Khalid N.

description:
I wish there were an Anthony's Cookies where I live in southern california. I first had an Anthony's cookie two years ago at Four Barrel Coffee where they are also sold. It was the best chocolate chip cookie I ever had so I asked the barista where it was from and vowed to visit Anthony's on my next SF visit. 

So two years later, I walked like 20 blocks to go to their location. Unfortunately I got there 20 minutes before closing and they ran out of choco chip and double choco chip. I only like classic flavors. I got four cookies and cream which are very, very good but sweet. And the $1.25 price tag is worth it. It is a privilege to eat such good cookies.

I just wish they didn't run out of chocolate chip. Make extras?
author: Sarah A.

description:
I was completely enthralled by the photos of Anthony's Cookies. They are among the best cookie photos I've ever seen. So I finally got myself over to the store.

The inside of Anthony's is a little lackluster and nondescript. But that's okay because you are there for the cookies! My friend advised me to ask what just came out of the oven (BEST ADVICE EVER). It was the Cookies & Cream. They are fantastic and met and exceeded my expectations - doubly so because they were warm. 

I also got:
Chocolate Chip - good (but Cookies & Cream blows it away)
Cinnamon Sugar - good
Cranberry Oatmeal - really good
White Chocolate Chip - too sweet for me

They no longer offer a deal on a half-dozen or dozen cookies. HUGE BUMMER. It's just $1.25 a cookie no matter how many you get. Also, I think I stared at the photos too long and expected a larger cookie. The actual cookies seemed much smaller, but pretty comparable to the price. 

I was a tad disappointed that I didn't love all the cookies, and that they no longer do a dozen/half-dozen pricing. I might come back if I'm in the neighborhood - definitely for the Cookies & Cream and to try some of the other flavors.
author: Veronica H.

description:
Absolutely delicious cookies!! I had the toffee and oatmeal raisin cookies and they were by far one of the best cookies I have ever experienced. On top of that, I was lucky being able to park right in front of this place! 

The only thing I don't like is the fact that the price of each cookie is too expensive. $1.25 for a cookie is too much and it's not a very big cookie too. Hence the 4 star review
author: Stephen W.

description: I love love cookies  and Anthony's didnt disappoint.  They didnt have peanut butter the day my friends and I went so I was a bit sad about that but they had a wide array of other cookies that we indulged in.  We got the cookies and cream, chocolate chip, oatmeal, white chocolate, spice cookie, toffee, ...i think that was it.  The cookies were delicious, cookies and cream was yummy, crispy on the outside and soft on the inside!
author: Di L.

description:
Saw the cookies and cream cookie on 7X7 and decided to bring my mom here when she was in town. It's expensive, but definitely worth it. I got the toffee, chocolate chip, and cookies and cream.

The cookies and cream was delicious as expected. I read reviews that downplayed the chocolate chip cookie, but it was AMAZING. Literally, perfect ratio of chocolate to cookie, perfect crunchiness to softness in the middle. I will definitely be back here and will be bringing all my friends!
author: Erica W.

description:
I love this place! With all the trendy rage going on over cupcakes a homemade cookie store? PURE GENIUS!

My Absolute favorites are the cookies and cream and the oatmeal chocolate chip cookie. I like the toffee chip one too.
(Keep in mind weekend and weekdays they only serve certain selections)

But yes, love love love! There is nothing more to say except maybe eat your heart out cookie monster!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I let Mingus R. have this since he lives right upstairs and all and he should get to be the one to review Anthony's Cookies first; after all, he introduced me to Anthony before the shop opened, and saved me cookies from the pre-opening batch.  Some day, my time will come and I'll have a first review for a place as good as this. 

Anyhow...

The first thing that came to mind when I smelled (let alone took a bite of) Anthony's Cookies & Cream cookie was: MMMMMMMMMMMMM. The second word, upon taking my first bite, was probably something unintelligible, so we'll skip that, but the next one was "Tongueasmic." I kinda wondered if my man was jealous seeing the expression on my face after that first bite. Because...well...you know what I mean. Apparently, says Mingus R., I am the inventor of the "MMMMM Face." 

The people make the place for me, and Anthony, the friendliest owner of a business I have met in a LOOONG time, makes Anthony's Cookies the five star establishment it is. And this is all before he even had his Grand Opening, which is on April 25th, by the by. Check your guilt at the door and have fun looking at others' MMMMM Faces. 


Ah, I think I just got a photo exhibit idea!
author: Yakamoz S.

description: Omg their cookies and cream cookie is the best! Thin and crunchy while semi soft. But the cookies arent big or thick to cost $1.25 for each cookie.
author: Ella A.

description:
Cookies, done right?

I came for the cookies and cream cookie as suggested by 7x7. It was mid afternoon. The cookie was really good. Not too old (perhaps they bake throughout the day), not overly sugary, not overly flavored, just a solid cookie with a hint of cookies and cream flavor. I was able to sample two others and they were really good too. Based off of this, I imagine all of their cookies are great. Now I just have to come earlier for the mind-blowing freshly-baked experience.
author: Rahil P.

description:
Are You rAdy?? Okay so here WE goooooooal......

Cookies! we all love cookies.  Who doesn't like stuffing their face with some baked goods? Why are baked goods so damn good? thats another whole conversation but-  This is how it went down on my first visit.... 

So after a pretty good intense workout at the gym I roll by to Anthony's on 25th and Valencia. Been planning to go for the last few weeks just didn't have the time or just forgot about it during the course of the day.  Anywho, I'm at the gym and thinking, okay so I'm going to roll down to Anthony's for sure today then Safeway.... after sticking to the plan I walk into Anthony's and made it simple for myself... 

I tells the the nice young lady that greets me, It's my first time here on the recommendations of friends that have been here previously...so the conversation continues to the young lady:   I dunno what I want but I want a dozen cookies and I'd like you to pick and choose for me, I'm confident in your taste.   

Boom, easy a dozen cookies purchased.   I really dont know every specific flavors of the cookies that she selected and I really don't care... they were all pretty good.  Nice crisp shell on the outside and yummy on the inside.   I'm pretty sure I'll be back whenever I get the urge for cookies after the gym and what not.   

all in all, good cookie spot.    Buy a random dozen or more and share with your family and friends, they will be happy.    boooooom
author: marcus o.

description:
How can you not love this place?

Anthony's Cookies are quite possibly elite. Simply taking a whiff from walking in is soothing enough to lure you in to make a purchase! I'm not even a sweet tooth, but if there's one sweet fix I can't live without, it'd be this.

It's a small shop in the Mission, easy to miss if you're driving by. Nothing but a long table inside, but you're most likely not going to eat there since they only serve cookies. It's about $15 for a dozen, $1.25/ea, which is overpriced, but for the quality of the product, it is acceptable. The cookies are freshly baked and they have floating flavors that only appear on specific days of the week. I've tried Chocolate Chip, Toffee Chip, Cookies & Cream, Peanut Butter and Cinnamon Spice. My personal favorites are Toffee Chip and Cookies & Cream--I'd eat an entire dozen if I had the option. Can't say I'm a fan of Peanut Butter, though.

Anyway, the cookies are amazing. They're crispy on the outside, then become soft and chewy the closer you get to the middle. It's perfect.

Anthony's does it right!
author: Mike M.

description: Their cookies are definitely worth a try, especially their Walnut Double Chocolate Chip and Cookies & Cream (my favorites) but I wouldn't personally go out of my way for them, unless I'm in the area. They were good but I wasn't amazed and they're quite pricey. I'm totally content with my Mrs. Fields, honestly.
author: Glecie C.

description:
Thee best cookies!
As a kid who grew up in a bakery, I know cookies, cakes and pastries.  All kinds!
Anthony's cookies have something special going on.  Maybe it's the sprinkles of twinkly magic in each cookie that makes you smile when you take a nibble.  
I've been going to Anthony's since I read an article about him defying the odds to start his own business and being successful.  He'd be in there baking meticulously.  Once he told me he wants every cookie to be perfect.  And they are!
My fav is cookies n cream, but the menu changes daily with classics like peanut butter and chocolate chip and also new flavors too.
What ultimately sets these apart are the flavor and texture.  Moist and gooey inside, only slightly crispy outside.  It's a perfect balance.
Great job, Anthony!  A new SF classic!
author: Pablo R.

description:
I think I can add Anthony's Cookies & Cream cookie to the list of things I want in my coffin when I get buried. It will be between a burrito from Taqueria Castillo and a Chicken banh mi from Siagon Sandwiches.  

The cookie will light a crispy on the outside and nice and chewy on the inside.  It was literally like a chocolate chip cookie without the chips, replaced with Oreo crumbs.  It was just amazing.  I think the best thing about his cookies are that they're not too sweet . You can actually appreciate the flavor of the cookie instead of getting a sugar bomb in your mouth. 

I also got the chocolate chip, toffee, and whole wheat oatmeal cranberry cookies.  My second favorite are the whole wheat cranberry.  I am a huge fan of cranberries in baking.  They just add so much tart flavor...so yummy.  There were discernible bits of oatmeal (which adds awesome texture) and the whole wheat cookie dough adds extra oomph to the chewiness.  

There aren't a lot of seats, so you may wanna take these yummy yum yums.  I'm totally going again.  See you there (most likely with crumbs all over my shirt)!
author: Lisa X.

description: If your aunt makes cookies like these, you better be fat and happy, because these cookies be yankin'
author: Jesse S.

description:
When in comes to cravings, I am definitely a salty person and not a sweet tooth.  And in fact, I don't really even like cookies - but I can honestly say that the cookies and cream cookie from Anthony's is the best cookie I have ever had.
