The first thing you are going to have to get your head around is the fact that this cookie is kind of a cannibal.  That's right, it is a cookie that has bits of oreos inside of it.  Its as though a delicious Anthony's cookie ate a big ol' pile of oreos and then jumped into the oven.  The result: a perfect cookie that is crisp on the outside and delightfully soft in the middle with tasty chunks of oreos in the middle.  

Anthony's has a variety of cookie flavors that rotate depending on the day.  I also enjoy the toffee chip cookies, but don't kid yourself because the cookies and cream is the best and at least half of your order should be comprised of these.  Anthony's also supplies cookie dough to some other restaurants around town, so if you are ever at Mixt Greens (in the FiDi) know that they too sell delicious Anthony's cookies.
author: Dana H.

description: Just cookies. Nothing extraordinary, but consistent, which is good. I will hit this place probably once or twice a month.
author: Anthony W.

description:
After a great meal at Brenda's French Soul Food, I had to get some cookies for my two-year old daughter. So what's better than a 7x7 recommended Cookies & Cream cookies from Anthony's Cookies. My daughter loves cookies, any cookies, she probably would have loved a regular old Oreo Cookie but hay she deserves it, plus I can check it off my 7x7 list YAH! 

I personally out grown cookies a long time ago, but after tasting Anthony's Cookies' Cookies & Cream it really brought back some great childhood memories. Also there is nothing better than sharing a freshly baked cookies and a glass of milk with your daughter during a cold winter day. 

The Cookie's & Cream really were delicious as well as the White Chocolate Chips and Walnut Chips. They're not very big like Mrs Fields Cookies, but I personally like them small (I actually like them really small so I can just pop them into my mouth). 

If this was my daughter's review it would be a 20 star (since that's the highest she can count to), but I got to tone it down and stay with a 4. I'm a fan.
author: Mel B.

description:
This review has been long overdue, for what I consider to be easily some of the best cookies in all the land. 

Anthony- you're a genius.

Without drooling all over this review, let me highly recommend the 'Cookies and Cream' cookie flavor. This flavor alone could end wars(or start them). While enjoying a 'cookies and cream' cookie, I have gone missing several times. My mind disappears, my speech shuts down, my complete and utter existence focuses squarely on the cookie at hand. It is so, damn, good. 

I haven't quite figured out the recipe- but i'm sure of this... Extra butter, extra sugar, and extra lard have to be main ingredients to make this cookies so incredibly delicious. Anyone who DOESN'T like these cookies should have their taste buds examined immediately.
author: Greg G.

description: One of the vendors for my agency brought in a dozen cookies and cream. I am not a HUGE cookie fan, but these were so delicious. If you are going through a break up, had a rough day at work, have kids, are single, are married, don't have a job, or you just love cookies, you NEED.
author: Jazmyn W.

description:
When you walk in, one gets the impression that Anthony's does cookies right. You can order three things: cookies, milk, and coffee. If there are only three things on the menu, and the business has been around for years, it must be good. (Think In-N-Out.)

I have five different cookie flavors, and all were moist in the middle and firm on the sides. The menu changes daily, so check it out in advance.
author: Michael C.

description: Hands down to the best cookie i have tasted. Bought a couple of dozen to bring back to san diego. Crunchy yet chewy. A little pricey at $1.50 per regular cookie but worth every penny. Staff super friendly. Lots of selection and cute location. Ice coffee was bitter for me but it complimented the sweetness of the cookie. Ill be back for more my next visit to san francisco.
author: Lieann A.

description:
Damn!!! These are some freakin awesome cookies! I have no idea how they manage to make a simple thing sooooooo delicious. I love the cookies & cream one... and the chocolate chip... and the white chocolate chip... and the double chocolate chip... heck I love them all! These cookies are best paired with milk... cold milk to be precise. 

You're welcome!
author: Mark C.

description: Sweet, soft and moist, warm and chewy, delicious cookies, pure and simple.  I really liked every single cookie I've tried -- chocolate chip, oatmeal chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, cinnamon spice, and cookies n' cream.  When you have gourmet cupcakes going for about $3+ a pop these days, why not stop here instead and get a gourmet cookie for $1.  Glad I don't live within walking distance of here otherwise I'd have to do P90x two times a day.
author: Erich D.

description: The best chock chip combos in the City hands down.
author: Chris D.

description: Not great. The cookies were kind of dry and tasteless. Peanut butter was good but the rest were kind of similar to eating a slab of cardboard. Also it was very expensive. $3 for a small cookie and $1.75 I think for a tiny cookie. Not worth it and I'm really not sure why there are so many good reviews.
author: El G.

description:
YUMMY!!!!!

I ordered 3 dozen cookies and they took the order with so much detail. Almost annoying detailed haha. BUT it was because they did not want to miss any details in the order. 

The cookies are so good!!! Our group loved all the cookies! My fav was the cookies and cream. Oh my! 

Definitely need to come back!!!!
author: Mai H.

description:
Friendly service and great variety of interesting and tasty flavors.

With that being said, if I'm paying top dollar for a cookie, it needs to be the best damn cookie I've ever had. Does everyone forget that a cookie or most baked goods taste the best right out of the oven. I don't want a cookie that's been sitting on racks for who knows how long. I mean even Ms. Fields can grasp the concept of having a hot cookie when you order it.
author: Austin N.

description:
DAMNNN....i didn't think it was possible, but ANTHONY'S COOKIES are no freakin joke. I was a little dissapointed when i walked in and didn't see any cookies on display, but little did I know that they take them right off the baking trays! How they get these cookies so soft, chewy, with just the right consistency is beyond me but GOOD JOB ANTHONY!!! 

Good thing they aren't open anywhere near my work or else I'd be in BIG TROUBLE!! 

TIP: try the toffee chip, cookies & cream, & oatmeal chocolate. THEY WERE ALL DELICIOUS!
author: Kristen C.

description:
I just ordered a whole box of cookies for a baby shower and I was totally impressed by Anthony's cookies.  The cookies are really great and totally unpretentious.  My favorites were the peanut butter, the oatmeal raisin, the chocolate chip and the white chocolate chip.  

The store is clean, the staff kind,  and the service is on target.  We ordered the cookies  in-store and pre-paid, then picked up the box the following Saturday.  Everything went smoothly, the order was ready and perfectly assembled. 

Thank you Anthony's Cookies, everyone loved these little morsels of amazing.
author: Elle M.

description:
Hands-down the BEST cookies in the city. Perfect amount of sweetness and moistness, right amount of crispiness and chewiness... perfection in a cookie!

I come here about once a month (if not more), and here are my MUST-HAVES:
- Cookies & Cream: MY ABSOLUTE FAVORITE. Cookie within a cookie? GENIUS. Mmmm, every bite is packed full of flavor. My friend who doesn't normally like Cookies & Cream still loved this cookie.
- Chocolate Chip: A classic cookie done right. Each bite makes you want more and more! The bf is a chocolate chip connoisseur, and this is his fave in the city.
- Toffee Chocolate Chip: Yum! Perfect balance between toffee & chocolate. 

Other cookies that I've had:
- Cinnamon Sugar: Pretty tasty, great texture. But it has more of a cinnamon/gingersnap type flavor rather than being snickerdoodle-like.
- German Chocolate: I liked this a lot! The chocolate isn't overly sweet but still enough to satisfy a chocolate craving. But for some reason, I swear these cookies are always smaller than the others. 
- Oatmeal Raisin & Oatmeal Cranberry: These aren't my favorite here. Out of all their cookies, I feel like these are the most dry. I prefer the oatmeal cranberry cookie at Hot Cookie. 

Prices are very reasonable... it's pretty much $1/cookie if you buy at least a 1/2 dozen. They're not the hugest cookies, but for the quality, it's well worth it. Plan on eating at least 2-3 cookies in one sitting, if not more.

LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Free samples! Businesses give them out to reel us in. Anthony's did just that.

I tried a few of their flavors, and I like Cookies and Cream and Greman Choco the most.  They're everything you want in a cookie - perfect softness/firmness and a flavor that is sweet but not overwhelming.  The milk that you can buy comes in a good ol' fashion jar and has that cream top.  Interesting, to say the least.

If you return the jar, you get $1.50 back! Which you can ask for in quarters to pay for that metered parking...
author: Theodore C.

description: The cookies here melt in your mouth, they are so delicious. My 5 year old son no longer likes packaged cookies,  because he wants to go to Anthony's or  the 'cookie store'. I just bought some of their gluten-free chocolate cookies for my mother-in-law who was visiting from South Carolina and she loved them as well. The toffee chip and the walnut chip are my favorites.
author: April C.

description:
Anthony's Cookies are the best cookies I have ever had in my life.  I don't say this lightly.  I just read another review that said they could find these kind of cookies anywhere.  What?  Are you joking?  Where?  I have never found cookies this incredible.  Not even in my Grandmother's kitchen as a child.  Grandmother's Tollhouse chocolate cookies pale in stark comparison.  Anthony's Cookies may have gone up in price but, I still think they're worth every penny.  And Anthony knows they're worth every penny as well.  It's a small cookie business in the middle of a recession.  Of course he's going to raise the price of his cookies.  He's got to do something to keep his business open.

Anthony's Cookies+milk=Joy
author: Niki Y.

description: By far the best cookies I've had in the city! The white chocolate chip was my absolute favorite-- perfectly moist and soft. The staff here is really friendly while the inside decor is nice and simple and CLEAN!
author: Priyam D.

description:
I went to Anthony's today with my mom to pick up 3 dozen cookies that I pre-ordered yesterday.  By the way, the pre-order process went very smoothly over the phone and they were very detailed... Anyway, we were helped by Chris who was extremely helpful and very nice.  The guys baking cookies in the back were happy also and I think one of them was Anthony himself!  I'm definitely still impressed by their customer service and quality of their cookies so I just had to write another review.  

P.S. Chris looked hella familiar and I think he's in the movie, La Mission!!  If you haven't seen it and you are an SF native, you need to watch it!  It stars a bunch of people who are from here and features a lot of landmarks so it's pretty damn cool.
author: Michelle H.

description: Love the cookies here! Their cookies are chewy and flavorful. Their most popular flavor is the cookies and cream and is a must try. I recently visited here again and found out that they released a new coffee flavored cookie. It has 72% dark chocolate and has Four Barrel coffee. If you are into bold chocolatey flavors, you should try this one out.
author: Frances V.

description: I bought a Dz cookies. I love the toffee chip and cookies&cream, It's really good! The cookies are crisp outside but chewy inside. I also hav classic chocolate and white choc chip. I should of got2dz
author: EmmettsGuRL C.

description:
I feel bad for saying this since it seems there are a lot of fans out there but I felt these cookies are good but not great. I bake a lot and have a huge sweet tooth so I was super excited when a friend told me about this place but the cookies just didn't hit the spot for me. 

I agree $1.25 is a bit steep for the size though on the other hand I like that their cookies are small since I don't like over sized treats. 

The cinnamon spice cookies are very light and airy and a great combination of chocolate and cinnamon - kind of reminds me of a chocolate snickerdoodle

German chocolate cookie were meh. It was kind of lacking the intense chocolate flavor I expect it to have. 

I won't completely write off this place yet as the one flavor I wanted to try - Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip - was sold out!
author: Amy N.

description: I'm not a dessert person.  I never order dessert - I don't hate it, I just don't love it.  A friend told me about this place and I came here just to give it a try.  These are some of the best cookies I've had - but I'm not that great of a judge.  But I always stop by here when I'm in town and bring back at least 2 dozen cookies to San Diego.  Needless to say, I'm super popular in SD.
author: Michele S.

description:
i don't think cookies can get any better than this.  Try their cookies and cream and you will know that you have been missing out all your life.  I screamed like a little girl who got their first barbie doll as I took my first bite in front of the cashier with the free sample they gave before buying one.  I wasn't even embarrassed as the worker laughed at me like "you cookie noob" as I yelled out THIS IS THE BEST COOKIE I"VE EVER HAD, WOAH!!!!

But the workers weren't shocked as what i've done is probably common in their store as first timers of Anthony's Cookies bite into their most beloved cookies and cream cookie.  

you can easily miss it as you walk by this store...it's very hole in the wall...but you don't want to miss this in your life.  i had it when it wasn't even hot and this cookie has nothing but HOTNESS all over it.
author: Jang David K.

description:
Such a nondescript place ... would never have known about it had it not been for Yelp.

Seriously, you can do no wrong with whatever cookie you order.  But you can do even more right by ordering the cinnamon spice or the cookies and cream!  Others I tried that were also yummy were the whole wheat oatmeal raisin, the toffee chip and the white chocolate chip, each of which deserves its own oohs and aahs.  All the cookies are moist and chewy, even hours after you buy them.

Cookies are on the small side (esp. the oatmeal raisin) and can add up at $1.25 each ($6.00 for a half dozen).

Really friendly service is an added bonus!
author: F. P.

description:
3.5 stars. 

After working non stop for hours on a Sunday, I decided to give myself a bit of a treat. Sweets are my weak spot, and after a rainy Saturday, I wanted to end my Sunday with some cookies, milk, and a movie. So I ran to the muni at the risk of tripping and falling and breaking my bones, camera, and laptop - all for a heavily touted cookies and cream cookie. 

Result? 

Good cookie, awesome service. 

You can smell the cookies 50 feet away from the store. The flavors are extensive - cookies and cream, oatmeal raspberry, chocolate chip, banana nut, white chocolate chip, toffee chip...many more. The service is amazing as they let me try about 5 different samples before I settled on two flavors - Cookies n' cream and chocolate chip (and the latter was a toss up between this and the toffee chip). The cookies are really good and flavorful, but a little underwhelming for all the hype attached to it. Maybe it was because they weren't right out of the oven and probably were sitting there for a little bit. 

Regardless, definitely great cookies, but try to get them right when they're out of the oven for probably the best experience possible. 

And have it with milk. An absolute must. And fortunately they sell that here as well!
author: Aditi R.

description: This place has the best cookies I have ever had hands down! The place is super cute and they always have cold milk ready. The cookies and cream is so yummy same with the toffee and oatmeal. The cookies are all thick and moist tasting like they just came out of the oven. I am so sad I live in San Jose and this place is so far for me. PLEASE open one here!! I have yet to find cookies anywhere that are half as good.. even at some of the best bakeries in San Jose. Next time I will have to get a dozen. For being such a popular spot they are also priced really cheap too!
author: Heather O.

description: I've never been here before but my cousin has and shared his cookies! I instantly fell in love with the first bite and have become obsessed. I tried toffee chip and cookies & cream. Now all I gotta do is just go there for myself :)
author: Shar A.

description:
I love these cookies so much I drove to SF 3 times one week to buy them!

If you come here and want to bring some back to the east bay for me: Toffee Chip and Cookies and Cream are my absolute faves. Make sure you bring milk with them though. :)
author: Theresa L.

description:
You walk in and the decor is sparse.  That's how you know it's going to be good, because they spent their time and effort crafting a delectable treat for you to eat, not in picking out the trendiest chair from the latest Pottery Barn magazine.  You're here for the cookies, not the gimmicks.

The cookies don't disappoint...you can sample them fresh!  I sampled the cookies and cream cookie, and all I wanted was more.  Yum!
author: Kay D.

description: Amazing home made cookies. $1 each and worth all 100 pennies. Cookies and cream and chocolate chip were my fav. I got the peanut butter, oatmeal and toffee chip as well. All were excellent. Highly recommend. I wish I didn't live so far away. I'd be knocking down doors to get some cookies!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
best oatmeal chocolate chip cookies EVER!
Had them at my wedding last year and guests still ask about it.  Family members in LA ask us to bring some down when we visit. It's a bit pricey, but so worth it! They taste like love and home.
YUM!
author: Mi M.

description:
I'd pay double for these cookies. Everyone here is always very friendly and although I hate sounding like a cover letter, very detail oriented. 

Anytime I hint at having a bad day, this is where my boyfriend goes to bring home a beautiful box of Anthony's cookies and turn everything around. My favorites are the Toffee Chip and Cookies & Cream.

I'm probably not very far from having to wear elastic waist jeans every day but it's so worth it.
author: Aubrey O.

description: The best cookies ever!! Gah I turn into the cookie monster every time I come here. Eat all the cookies! But seriously, each of these cookies is a cookie from heaven. My favorites are the cookies N cream and the toffee chip. You MUST try this place if you're in SF. It might be hard to find parking though.
author: Stefanie K.

description:
Oh Anthony. I really , really, really wanted to like you. 

I came here this past Sunday with my boyfriend around 4pm. They didn't have all the flavors available but still had a great selection to chose from. We decided to get half a dozen for $6. We chose 2 chocolate chip, 1 double walnut chocolate, 1 toffee chip, 1 candied pecan, and 1 oatmeal raisin. 

They were SO SMALL. I would compare their size to a chip ahoy cookie. In the pictures from yelpers, they looked huge. For $1.25 a pop (separately), I'd expect more. The chocolate chip cookies were borderline burnt. Surprisingly they still served it to us (I didn't realized it until we got home). All of the flavors were good, but none of them stood out as "Gourmet". My sisters husband is a huge chocolate chip cookie fan and I let him taste it. He said it tasted like the ones nestle tollhouse makes. 

I am a big baker and I've made a lot of different types of cookies. I believe that I would of been better off making my own cookies with my $6. Sorry Anthony. I won't be coming back.
author: Linda W.

description:
Best tasting cookies i've ever had in SF! No joke! 

I definitely recommend the cookies and cream cookie here. I swear it's one of the best cookies i've ever had in my life. You truly are missing out if you never tried any of the cookies here in Anthony's Cookies
author: Matt G.

description: The cookies here are really good.  They have the perfect texture of a cookie, soft and chewy but a little crisp on the edges.  We've tried just about every flavor here and every single one of them is good.  My favorites are the cookies and cream, toffee chip, cinnamon sugar and chocolate chip with nuts.  We make it a point to stop by here whenever we are in the city.
author: Gordon C.

description:
(holds up tomato shield)

I wanted to like these cookies so bad.  First, they're quite pricy for the size. $1.25 per cookie, or $6 for half a dozen (bumps it down to $1 a cookie).  For the classic chocolate chip, think Keebler Soft Batch Chocolate chip cookie size.  And for the other flavors like walnut chip or candied pecan chip, think Mrs. Fields nibblers but a bit wider and chubbier.

I felt like my cookies were a bit overcooked (super dark), and a tad too oily.  There was nothing extraordinary about the marriage of ingredients and overall I felt the taste was borderline tollhouse-esque.  (yes, I went there.)

I'm pissed cuz I wanted to brag about this place, I wanted to become it's new best friend- but, 1 less customer won't hurt Anthony and his cookies.  They're well established now, and satisfy the sweet tooth of many San Franciscans (and beyond).
author: Rho T.

description:
THE perfect cookie - right out of the oven goodness - crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside.
I had the cookies and cream cookie which tasted like an oreo on crack!

I also got to sample the cinnamon sugar cookie which was just like any other snickerdoodle I've had. 

My coworker wanted to get a bottle of milk, but I don't think they had the smaller sizes anymore, so she had to skip. The milk comes in cute glass bottles resembling the ones that they show on old tv shows where the milkman hand delivers them. Cute and vintage.

The only problem I have is that I wish the cookies were bigger in size. When I got my cookie, I thought it was extremely tiny for the price I paid for it.
author: Julia K.

description:
My go-to place for awesome cookies. It will not disappoint. Everyone likes their cookies differently but for me, the best kinds are crispy & crunchy on the edges and chewy in the center. And for my oatmeal kind of cookies, I like them thick and chewy. Anthony makes the best kinds!

I always get the toffee and cookies & cream. 

The banana ones are wonderful too but they only make it on certain days

The oatmeal & cranberries & nuts are also very good.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I am not sure what the hype is about. I have a friend who can make better cookies.  They are quite expensive for such a small cookie.

Don't get me wrong. They are good, but just not that impressed. I also have tried many of their flavors and this review is not based on just one cookie.  That would be unfair, in my opnion. So I had their house favorite, cookies and cream and yes, it's good, but a bit too sweet for my taste.  Their choc. chip one and that was good too, but nothing extraordinary.
author: AhLin C.

description:
Hello Cookies!!

These are some of the most innovative cookies I have ever eaten. For those who know me, I dream of cookies. I LOVE cookies. I'm also very picky when it comes to texture, flavor, and creativity. This place rocks!

I love the cookies n' cream cookie. Genius! It is a cookie with a cookie. Why didn't I think of that? 

You can't go wrong with any of the selection. Yes the cookies can be on the pricier side but they are worth every penny.
author: Molly T.

description: The best. I share this Bay Area gem whenever I can. Friendly and kind service...If you want an instant good day, come to Anthony's!
author: Terri A.

description:
These are deliciously sweet and moist cookies.  One of my favorite cookie spots in SF.  In fact, I bought boxes of them to give last Christmas to people and secretly wished I could keep them all and eat them all to myself.

They are all very good, but some of my favorites are the toffee chip, german chocolate, and cookies and cream.  Even their classic chocolate is great!

When you have a chocolate chip cookie hankering - this is the place to go!
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
I came here for the first time during the summer after finding out that they have this cookie joint in the city, i must have been blind all these years

I came in what seem to be a slow hour on a sunday and there was no one in there but us. The guy at the counter was really nice and gave us samples of the cookies. I ended up getting one of each just to try all of them, which ended up being 8 of them. 

Their cookies are really good. Def one of a kind. 
But one hint: you gotta eat them fresh. Once they're a day or two old, they just aren't the same
author: Kenny L.

description:
I love this place. I love, love LOVE this place.

Yes, you might think they're _just_ cookies. Anyone can make cookies. But Anthony's cookies are more than that. They're a warm, buttery, moist, delectable slice of heaven. 

I'm drooling right now as I think about their german chocolate cookies (my fave from their menu). SO GOOD!
author: Elaine C.

description:
-1 star for tonight's experience:

Ummmm... It's 6:30pm. Store closes at 8:00pm. I walk in and I'm told that they only have 1 oatmeal cookie and 1 peanut butter cookie left. 2 cookies left at 6:30. Again, store closes at 8:00pm. I asked if they could make any more. Was told "sorry, NO." 

I mean, I appreciate that she said sorry but, really, how could you not make any more cookies when you don't close for another 1 1/2 hours?? REALLY? I remember about 2 years ago, my husband and I walked into the store about 30 minutes before closing. The owner, Anthony, happened to be there. We asked if it was too late and he said "no." He was so kind about it too.   

So bummed.
author: Linda I.

description:
Delicious cookies! Not too crisp, not too chewy. Really just a perfect cookie, and he has a nice variety of flavors. They were all out of the Cookies 'n Cream but apparently that is the winner!
Nice staff too :)
author: Shirin M.

description:
Tried 1 cookies and cream and 2 chocolate chocolate walnut.  Cookies were really tiny (less than 3 inches in diameter), but delicious -  chewy/crunchy texture, fresh quality ingredients.  Love the fact that they sell Strauss Creamery milk in glass bottles too.  Service was attentive and friendly.

Prices, however, are high for what you get which is why I probably wouldn't indulge too often...too bad since they do have an extensive cookie menu.
author: A O.

description:
I'm not going to lie: I haven't really been to other cookie shops in SF. That being said, I don't know if I need to. Anthony's Cookies is omfgdelicious. I think the first time I went I got a half dozen cookies: two chocolate chip, two cinnamon spice, one whole wheat oatmeal cranberry, and one cookies and cream. I *intended* to save some for my boyfriend. I ended up devouring both cinnamon spice cookies and a chocolate chip about 30 seconds after leaving the shop. (Pro tip: Get a little pint of milk before you leave. You'll need it.) Luckily I had enough self-control to save him the other three. Needless to say, they were gone shortly after he got home.

Anyways, the point is: Anthony's Cookies are always soft and melty and wonderful and taste like childhood. You won't regret going there (or going back again, and again, and again.)
author: Meredith D.

description:
Nothing really to write home about . We drove for about an hour thru downtown traffic to get there in a not so great neighborhood.  The owner saw us but didn't greet us.  The other worker was nice enough.  The cookies, though, were nothing great and like others said, they're overpriced.  If you've experienced The Cravory in San Diego, there's no need to go to Anthony's.  Actually, my chocolate chip cookies are better than these.

P.S.-after all that driving, there was no restroom on the premises nor anywhere nearby.
Bring money for parking too.
author: Lori S.

description: Really yummy cookies. Don't be fooled by the way they look. Tried the toffee, choc chip, cinnamon spice, cookies and cream, and oatmeal choc chip. All were soft on the inside with perfectly crunchy edges and very delicious. Not too sweet either. They lose a star for the cookies not being consistent sizes. The oatmeal ones were tiny!
author: J R.

description:
My oh my.. 

Even when I can not be there I'm thinking of you..
Without your perfect cookies, what would I do?
A better baker I'll never find..
Without Anthony's i'd be outta my mind..

Cookie's and cream and chocolate chips
A satisfied smile on my lips..
One dozen, two dozen, three dozen, four,
There's nothing I've ever wanted more.!
author: Lisa H.

description: Love this place. My favourite is the Cookies and Creme cookie. Pretty friendly staff. All their cookies are good, with a chewy texture that's unbeatable. I wish I could bake my cookies like these! It's a good thing they're in SF, because that prevents me from going every week.
author: Soo Jung R.

description: I'm not a big cookie fan, but this place has got to be my new favorite.  We ordered a half dozen (2 of each of the cookies and cream, double chocolate chip, and peanut butter).  The hubby and I really liked the cookies and cream but the rest were just as good.  They're a bit on the pricier side ($1.25/cookie or $6 for a half dozen) but it's definitely a must eat when you're in the area!
author: Kat G.

description:
I first tried Anthony's cookies when a coworker brought some to work to share and I had my first taste of their cookies and cream cookie. Ever since then I've been excited to try fresh versions of their cookies from the store itself, but was a little disappointed by the quality of them today...even though the service and staff were spot on.

I ended up buying a dozen to bring home and share. Pricey stuff @ $1/cookie... :(
author: Cheri D.

description:
Okay...I am going against the general consensus of this place, don't kill me.

I found the cookies here on the greasy side, and I am just not a fan of greasy cookies.  They're on the thinner and smaller side of most cookies offered at bakeries.  I tried a few different varieties and they didn't stand out for me.  Could be that I am an avid baker so am more picky??  Meh...
author: Sunny W.

description:
I'd give you more stars if you had bigger cookies.

But I can't give you less stars because your small-ish cookies are, indeed, quite delicious. And you do, generously, give samples.

But at the price of about $1 a cookie for half a dozen at $6.... this is one expensive small cookie.

Bonus: They have nice people who box cookies for you.

Candied pecan and cookies n cream -I WILL NEVER FORGET!
author: Charles L.

description:
I put a whole cookie in my mouth. 

And continued to repeat. 

That is how good these cookies are.
author: Anna C.

description: Sorry! Overrated! I came here near closing time at the insistence of a few friends who knew I was in the city. I got the cookies and cream cookie and chocolate chocolate chip. Cookies and cream did indeed taste like an Oreo... but maybe because it was at the end of the day...? It was a little stale and just tasted like a greased up Oreo mixed with another (vanilla) cookie. The chocolate chocolate cookie was also kinda stale and not as chocolaty as I hoped (Mrs. Fields comes to mind). PLUS, they were actually kinda small! I'll be okay if I never come back.
author: Becky K.

description: Unfortunately, I've never stepped foot inside Anthony's Cookies.  I've just had the pleasure of having them brought & given to me. :)  I've tried the chocolate chip, cookies 'n cream & toffee chip cookies.  The cookies 'n cream & toffee chip have hands down made me a fan.  The chocolate chip was good also, but it was just average to me.  If I'm in the area, I'd definitely drop in to grab some cookies.  These cookies still taste great the next day.  They don't get hard and stay moist.
author: Sheila M.

description: I wanted to check out Hot Cookie, but after seeing Janice C's photo of their naughty cookies, i picked the more family friendly cookie haven and was super pleased to experience Anthony's cookies! After all, they had the 5 star stamp of approval from both Patty and Janice, and raves from Lolia and Genevieve, that i HAD to make a stop! The smell of butter/sugar is intoxicating in the best way and i got myself a walnut chocolate chip and a semi chocolate chip cookie. Both were super good and moist and best of all- very chocolately! I look forward to one day trying the banana walnut!
author: Michelle T.

description:
Amazing Cookies - Horrible Customer Service...

I went to Anthony's for the first time on July 31st to pick up cookies for a birthday party. The store was nice and I was excited b/c there were only 3 customers in line. My excitement soon turned to frustration when it took 30 minutes to make an order. 

There were three people working and two of them might as well of stayed home for the day. One was in the back washing the same plastic tub the entire time and the other was moving cookies back and forth on a couple trays - completely worthless. 

To top it all off, they offer a stamp card where you get a free half dozen cookies when you buy six half dozen. I bought 7 dozen cookies - so I should have received 14 stamps and a free dozen. Nope - the girl at the counter said that it was only one stamp per transaction. 

What?!!! I thought she was joking. She said that they made a mistake on the card and needed to reprint them. Has the owner of this business never been anywhere else where they have similar cards? Is he/she afraid of losing the $1 that it costs to make 6 cookies?

I should have had her ring up 14 different transactions, but after 30 minutes I was just ready to get out of there. By the time I left the line was out the door.

I spent over $80 on cookies and will never go back. 

What a waste!
author: Rufus M.

description:
Wowza!  These are some terrific cookies!  I didn't even know their store was in my hood.  Trouble!

I've had these cookies at work a few times on people's birthdays.  They are just somehow way better than all the other cookies that exist.  I really like the "cookies and cream" cookie and the chocolate chip.

I think I'll buy cookies from here for someone's birthday soon.
author: Ivan L.

description:
Anthony's Cookies is everything you want from a Cookie place and more!

Every year my coworkers and I organize gift delivery for all the tenants in our building during the holidays. Our tenants consist of mostly medical professionals, so we do our best to go above and beyond in terms of the gift (What do you give to the people who already have everything kind ). While brainstorming what to do for the gift this year, our new boss recommended Anthony's Cookies. We had done cookies in years past, but hadn't recieved much praise from them so we decided to try Anthony's out as a new vendor. 

Saying we recieved "praise" is like saying recieving the Nobel Peace Prize is "cool". We were FLOODED with compliments from our tenants. 

Keep in mind, Anthony's Cookies is a small local SF company who we then asked to make 230 dozen boxes. That's 2,760 cookies. That would be a monumental undertaking for any bakery to create, much less a company as small as Anthony's. This is where Anthony's went above and beyond our expectations.

They didn't just make the cookies a week before we delivered them so they'd have enough time. They made them that morning. The cookies were still warm when we delivered them to the tenants (after of course, Anthony's had to make two different deliveries to get all these cookies to us). We've never gotten such positive feedback from our tenants and couldn't be happier with how Anthony's went above and beyond to make this event so memorable. We just hope they'll be willing to put up with creating another 2,760 cookies next year! :) 



Case and point: We delivered the cookies to the tenants on November 16th. I had forgotten to post this review on Yelp, and was only reminded today (3 weeks later) when yet another tenant stopped by our office to ask us what the name of the Cookie place was because his wife had some and was so impressed that the tenant is taking his wife there later. 3 weeks later, and we're still recieving standing ovations. Thank you Anthony's Cookies! You guys were AMAZING!
author: Chad M.

description:
So I have been hearing about this place for their bomb cookies and I got pretty excited to try it. BUT the cookies are just like every other cookie! It is nice that they have different flavors like cookies n creme, toffee chip, and oatmeal walnut chocolate chip (to name some) but they taste like every other cookie. I can find cookies that are more satisfying than Anthony's cookies.

Other than the over hyped shop. The price of the cookies are overpriced for a really small cookie. $1.25 per cookie, $6 for half dozen, $12 for a dozen (there is no deal between half and full dozen!!) I did not actually measure a cookie, but I'd say the average cookie is around 2 inches in diameter and thin as well. 

So I tried this place and I do not think I will return.
author: Shirley M.

description:
I got my cookies and cream in a zip lock bag from a friend who's been raving about Anthony's Cookies. 

And that's how my addiction started. 

The cookie was probably a day old but yet it still tasted so yummy. The cookie was soft with bits of oreo and the sweetness of the cream was perfect, not overwhelming at all. Every bite of that cookie had a perfect blend of the cookie and the sweetness. 

It's "I'm heading there right after work" good.
author: Christina W.

description: Best cookies I have ever had. And I have had MANY. I came all the way from the Eat Bay just to visit this place! Well worth the drive.
author: Candice P.

description:
Sooooo average. Hence big time disappointment.  I don't understand the high rating?!  It tasted like grocery store bakery cookies.  I even asked them if they use high quality ingredients and the guy that works there just said no, everything's from costco. 

don't get it
author: YW T.

description:
Likes: delicious

Dislikes: good luck finding parking
author: Karen M.

description: Like a few others, I am mystified by all the hype of this place. Hubby and I did a Mission District food crawl and decided to try this place out. We were waiting in line for a LONG time, as it seemed only one person was working the counter and she was filling a large order and we were all just hanging around waiting. On the plus side, while we were waiting, a guy filled up the sample tray with cookies pieces. Hubby and I both sampled a bite of Cookies & Cream, and then a bite of Toffee Chip cookie. Both cookies were hard and too chewy, and they both tasted exactly the same. What's the point of having different varieties if they all taste the same? We were totally unimpressed and promptly left without purchasing anything. Neither of us wanted to waste the calories on lack luster cookies.
author: Goldi J.

description: These cookies are great! Kinda pricey and smaller than most gourmet cookies but very good.  i love the cookies and creme my BF is a fan of the PB.
author: Caroline T.

description: Small cookies for the price. Good, but won't be visiting them again since there are so many bakeries and places with bigger and better cookies. Sorry.
author: Misha Z.

description:
Here's the deal.

Cookies are my ultimate weakness, especially those of the chocolate chip variety. I like them warm, soft, and just short of divine.

I FINALLY made my way to Anthony's Cookies, and was delighted to find Anthony himself working in the shop, cheerfully greeting customers with the most genuine of smiles in all of HipsterMission. 

The verdict: Truth be told, the prices are a little steep for what you get (don't even bother purchasing a single cookie!) But they ARE delicious, and best enjoyed when sharing with a group of friends - just make sure to sample several flavors!
author: Sam S.

description: Nomnomnomnomnom, I love cooooooookies! And what not better way to induldge these yummy treats from a local cookie bakery! I wish there was an Anthony's Cookies in other locations because I never go anywhere near here but if I want Anthony's Cookies really bad, I will go here and I have done that. My favorite is the chocolate chip cookies and cookies and cream, my bf loves their cinnamon cookies. Gah, I wish I can have some right now but too far. Meh.
author: Jessica R.

description:
It's a good thing I don't live near this place. Otherwise, all my fruit-and-veggie hard work would go down the drain. The customer service is friendly and fast, although the last few times I've been here it hasn't been very crowded.
I tried the chocolate chip - delicious. Nothing else to say. The white chocolate chip - mmmmm good (I actually prefer no macadamia nuts, so this hit the spot). The oatmeal chocolate chip - pretty good, but I think this is one of those smaller, rounder cookies, so don't be surprised when you look in your bag. Yes, at 1.25 per cookie, it is a bit expensive, but unless you're stopping by here every day, it's not a big price to pay for a good-quality cookie.

Note: The last time I was here (4/25) they were not serving the peanut-butter cookies. Just a note to all you peanut-butter-lovin' yelpers.
author: Nadia A.

description:
This place is the bomb!!! Been here multiple times and every time the cookies taste delicious. I stopped by today to get my favorites-cookies and creme and toffee. So delicious and it was still a little warm from the oven. 

Best cookie place in town!
author: Smiley H.

description:
BEST COOKIES IN THE BAY .
My older brother took me here over the summer and I've been a fiend ever since. When something as contained as a cookie (preferably white chocolate chip, cookies n' cream , toffee crunch , and cinnamon sugar, yes AND) has the ability to alter your sour mood to the most elated person on the planet, that says something. I swear they lace the things. Only $6 for a dozen and just a block away from 24th/Mission BART? Hell yes.
author: Nichole N.

description:
I've never been a fan of sweets, but when the time comes to bring your friends or coworkers a pick me up treat.. this is the go to spot.
So far i've ordered the 
-cookies and cream
-pecan chocolate
-white chocolate
-classic chocolate chip

and 10/10 peeps have loved it! 
I wud consider this more on the thin, chewier type of cookie. So if you're into the thick crunchy kind, you may not like their cookies! 

$12 for  dozen by the way
author: Linda C.

description:
A delicious place for cookies!!! They have milk too and benches to sit on, and cool posters of cookie materials to look at. 

I like the cookies'n'cream, toffee, and German chocolate. Each cookie is about $1.25 and I think half a dozen is $6. DEFINITELY WORTH. 

om nom cookies.
author: Connie C.

description:
Most ridiculously amazing chewy chunky goodness.  Kind of like pokemon - gotta catch em all! Errr, i mean try em all...the vanilla, chocolate, extra chocolate, oatmeal, fudge, pecan, and other ridiculousnesss. mmmmmm i want like half a dozen of them right now.

its really good this place isn't closer to my house or id turn into one BIG boy.
author: E-dough R.

description: These are the best cookies I have had, ever. A very specialized menu -- only cookies, milk, coffee -- seems to keep this place focused on making them the best. When you walk by, you smell the cookies -- do they pump out the smell to drive traffic to the building -- try their double chocolate cookie, or their organic peanut butter. All have been good, and all are priced at $1.25 a cookie. Get a small bottle of milk and eat them while they are still soft and warm.
author: Darren K.

description:
So far, the best cookies in town. It will not let you down. 

Killer Dish: Cookies & Cream
author: Wayne Z.

description:
Omnomnomnom. The cookie monster must have been the original nom-er. And it makes sense. Get yourself a pile of Anthony's cookies and you might notice your own eyes going a little crossed and blue hair sprouting from your body and you try to cram each one of these delightful little cookies in your mouth at once.

But you've got to remember to slow down. Listen to the crunch as you take a bite. Feel the ooey gooey texture against your tongue as you begin to chew. Yes, these cookies are both crunchy and chewy. Its flawless execution really.

Ohhh and the samples. They will fill you with samples and then you get to buy cookies to take home and enjoy later. And they will STILL be crunchy and chewy then!
author: Leah H.

description:
We came here right after we ate a huge meal at Brenda's French Soul Food. We just wanted to keep crossing off places from our SF bucket list.

We came about 15 minutes before closing so the ovens were turned off about 45 minutes before we got there. Luckily they still had their whole menu. The ones I got to try were the cookies & cream, classic chocolate chip, and toffee chip. And we were sure to buy the liter of milk. Honestly, I was way too full to completely enjoy the cookies. But we still had leftovers and I tried them later on that night and I fell in love with these cookies and they were kinda old and cold. I will need to come back when they are fresh out of the oven and have them with a glass of whole milk.
author: Brent C.

description:
I just want to say that not only are Anthony's Cookies the BEST COOKIES but the people who work there really go above and beyond the call to be helpful and accomodating.

Thank you for making my daughter's 13th Birthday a very sweet one!
author: J R.

description:
I make cookies, you make cookies but how come Anthony's Cookies are different?

Perfectly moist but not too fluffy like the soft cookies I usually made. Not too sweet and never hurt your pocket since it's $1.25 each or $6/ half dozen.

Have a cup of milk and do yourself a favor, try the cookies-and-cream cookie.... yum.... and of course, a dozen to bring home for sharing with others.

ps: the place isn't that crowded on weekdays late noon. So a book and warm temperature will be perfect for your day at Anthony's Cookies
author: Cliff T.

description: My friend and I went here with high hopes of these delicious-looking, moist, chewy, fresh cookies as described by other reviews and seemingly revealed in the photos. Unfortunately our purchase did not at all live  up to these expectations. In fact it fell completely disappointingly flat. We got the dark chocolate jumbo cookie and the white chocolate jumbo cookie. Both were greasy, flavorless, and way too sweet. All I could taste was sugar and the texture was not fresh at all. Frankly, I've had better cookies at mall stands. Furthermore, the fun flavors such as coffee and cinnamon spice appear only to be on weekends, so if you come early in the week you are probably out of luck. For the high price ($3.00 for an average size '2oz' cookie and $1.50 for a teeny cookie), I recommend searching out Tartine, a yummy Latin bakery, or some ice cream or pie nearby.
author: Laura E.

description:
Heard about Anthony's Cookies through word of mouth and when I had my first cookie I couldn't believe a cookie could taste that good! I actually don't know of any other cookie places in the city, but it wouldn't matter because this place sets the standard. Need a gift for someone? Forget shopping and just grab a box of cookies. 

If you ever get to talk to Anthony, he's a really cool, nice guy that loves what he does and it shows.
author: Arnold N.

description:
I walked in today, and the man behind the counter was 
a true gentleman...I wish I would have taken his name. 
He was so attentive and genuinely kind.

Classic chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, cinnamon spice, 
double chocolate chip... yuuuuuuummmmm.

They have perfected the degree of softness on the inside 
of the cookies, and somehow made them taste as though 
they were sent directly down from Heaven. 

Hands down the best cookies I have ever consumed. Ever.
author: S. M.

description:
The best cookies I have ever had in my life!!!  There is some magic spice that gives them a unique (in a very good way!) taste.  

When I was there the clerk was extremely attentive to a batch in the oven--as soon as it dinged he interrupted what he was doing and removed the cookies from the oven.  Now that I've eaten a few I completely understand because the cookies are at the perfect level of "doneness".
author: Sharon B.

description:
people people people....

stop all this crazy talk about the toffee chip and the cookies and cream, the BEST cookie here is (far and away) the peanut butter. This is no flat cookie with the normal crosshatch fork marks, NOOOO, this baby is about an inch high ball of puffy, short-bready, peanutty H-E-A-V-E-N.  

ya ya, all the cookies are really (really) good  -  and reasonably priced (the same prices of Mrs Fields circa 1980 - averaging about $1 a piece depending on the quantity you purchase), but trust me, get at least 2 peanut butter, one for you and one one for your best friend.  After you eat the first one, you may say "screw my best friend, he can have the toffee chip, I'm eating the other PB one too"
author: Amy W.

description: Cookies & Cream cookies are wonderful! Service was great & the little area in the back where they make the cookies is really cute. I thank my friend for taking me & my BF to this place to try Anthony's cookies.
author: Jocelyn C.

description: Friendly staff. Not too sweet. Very much like home baked cookies deliciousness wise.
author: Glessie C.

description:
"No, you can't have any f*ckin jellybeans!" - Jeff Portnoy

To quote Jack Black from the horribly offensive 2008 box office hit, Tropic Thunder, is the perfect way to describe my frighteningly intense love for Anthony's Cookies.

Having finally discovered them [no thanks Wendy!] after reading loads of hunger evoking Yelp reviews [and damn you too Yelp], I finally made my trek into the Mish, otherwise known as Hipster Territory. 

The quaint store front did nothing to reveal Anthony's little hidden treasures within, and with each step I took, the fresh baked cookie aroma seemed  to be on the verge of attack.

Cookies and Cream, Cinnamon Sugar, Toffee Chip, Double Chocolate Chip Cookie, Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chips, Ghiradelli White Chocolate Chip, Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin with Chocolate Chip, Peanut Butter, and the list goes on.

The daily rotating menu causes quite a stir if you have a beloved choice but as an Anthony's Cookies virgin, I had no qualms about choosing a favorite.

Wendy and I shared the $6 for 6 cookies.

Cookies and Cream embodies all elements needed to fulfill the "perfect cookie" highly coveted title.  Freshly baked and still warm, the thin unassuming cookie is encapsulated by the crunchy outer layer yet the inside is filled with the soft gooey and chewy center.  The sweet cookie dough encompasses tiny Oreo cream in every bite and it's teeming full of that rich, butter taste.

Toffee Chip was a welcome mistake. I originally ordered the Semi Sweet Chocolate Chip, instead I was presented with the honey colored cookie filled with rich, toffee chip bits.  Sweet but not overly sugary, this cookie passed my test.

Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip was more solid than the rest.  It's body mass was of a thicker variety and it was grainier than I would have liked but nonetheless, I still enjoyed it.

Now hands off my jellybeans!
author: Lisa W.

description:
Tis the season to be kind and honest... thank God the TSA guys were super cool.  My departure time was delayed due to the rain in the city.  SO I took my time at the airport restaurant by my gate.  I was probably gone for over an hour when I realized the box of Anthony's cookies that I had planned to give was not with me.  I was too worried about getting a table outside the restaurant because I had my dog with me.  Well the pain in my head was returning... I waited ~ 30min in line for those cookies. Anthony was there and was so nice... apologizing for the long wait.
AND now the thought of not having it at my parents house nauseated me. But I remembered the TSA security people were so friendly when checking out my dog... so I raced back there... and thankfully they had it still there waiting for me to come back for it!
When my father took the last bite of cookie, he asked... are there any more?  When he was told he ate the last one, he immeditately suggested that we get more... thinking that I had bought the cookies at a local store by them.  When my mother told him I brought it all the way from home, he was shocked and sad... because he agreed with me... that they are the best cookies... nothing even comes close!
author: Myra M.

description:
Like BUTTAH! 

I love anthony's cookies- they are so full of butter but so gooood! I always play the "if there's parking I will stop" game. Unfortunately for my gut, I always find parking RIGHT IN FRONT! 

My fave is the semisweet chocolate chip- it's perfection!
author: Valerie A.

description:
I AM A COOOOOOKIE MONSTER and this is MY HEAVEN! The most amazing unique flavors in the form of moist soft nice round cookies. Wonderful, absolutely WONDERFUL! 

Cookies Tried + Comments:
Peanut Butter - Small and thick, not that great
Oatmeal Cranberry - Interesting, tasty, great combination
Oatmeal Raisin - Classic made right
Cookies and Cream - THE BEST period,  must try for any person ever
White Chocolate Chip - Hearty but smooth with the white chocolate
Toffee Chip - Unique and tasty
Cinnamon Spice - Could have been better

Pros:
- Amazing Tastes
- Unique Flavors
- Moist and soft coookies
- Nice Decor
- Friendly Staff

Cons:
- A little pricey, but SO WORTH IT

Overall - MUST TRY, if I lived in the Mission, I would probably get a dozen of Anthony's every week.
author: Kevin L.

description:
Forget about Specialty's Cookies, Mrs. Fields, anything else, Anthony's Cookies are totally awesome, they're money I swear.

I can remember my first Anthony's Cookies, it was at a work function and all I could think was man, I wish I could eat like twenty of these right now because they were so good, but I couldn't because all my coworkers would scorn at my glutinous ways.
author: Terrine B.

description: Wow!! Amazing cookies!! Cookies and cream are my favorite but I heard great things about the German Chocolate. They only have them on specific days... not wednesday. Will come back when I visit SF again!! Bringing home 1 box wasnt enough.
author: Chris A.

description:
Tasty cookies - crispy on the outside and soft on the inside.

Better to come here earlier in the day when there's more cookies available.  I got here an hour before closing on a Sunday afternoon and my favorite cookie - toffee chip was sold out.
author: Joycelyn L.

description: Cookies were great. A little pricey for the size but full of flavor! Try the toffee chocolate chip cookie. Usually they will let you try one if you ask, but really they are all good. Nice idea if you are going to a house party and you want to bring something!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Dooooooooooooode!

Get there early, these things sell like hot cakes!!  Or, ummm, hot cookies rather!! Haha.  

We got there right before closing, and out of the 20 different kinds of cookies they started out with at the beginning of the day... they only had about 5 or 6 flavors left.

We bought a dozen cookies that consisted of (in order from most tasty to least):

Cinnamon Sugar
Toffee
Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip
Banana Walnut
Banana

UNBELIEVABLE texture and taste!  And the price is right too!  A dozen for $11!  Such a sweet deal for such sweet little morsels ;)  We really should have probably bought two dozen, they all were gone within a few hours!  I was seriously having one of those "This is my last bite... Okay, for real, THIS is my last bite... OKAY!  Last one!" moments.
author: Miyako L.

description: These are so good. Can't stop eating them!
author: Logan N.

description:
#65-Cookies and Cream cookie and a carton of milk

(we also ordered Chocolate chip, Toffee Chip, Oatmeal Raspberry, German Chocolate and Candied Pecan)

2 of each flavor, all were really good.  Cookies and Cream cookie was very good and of course its nothing more than the a crushed oreo cookie inside a very delicate cookie dough.  

All cookies were a hit! Most of them are the size of a basic cookie you'd get anywhere else but this being a specialty spot, the size of the cookies couldve jus been little bigger with the price to match.  half a dozen cookies for $6/dozen for $12 is a bit much..

Regardless, i'll be back for more..since the other ones i didnt try we're gone when i got back home hahahaaa
author: Max-Adam A.

description:
Let me preface this review by saying that I am on a diet.  Why?  Because I am going to Hawaii with the parentals (http://hellodadandmom.wordpress.com/) in 5 weeks, and I need to get my fatass back into bikini-worthy shape.  This is the sole motivator for me to watch what I eat and walk my dog an extra block every night.

Then my darn coworker walked in this morning with a box of freshly baked, still-warm-from-the-oven cookies from Anthony's Cookies.  DARN YOU.

So of course I had to have one.  And then another one.  And then a third one.  AND I HAD NO GUILT BECAUSE THEY WERE SO DELICIOUS.

I didn't want to look in the box too carefully, because I wanted to be surprised, and I also just wanted to get the whole process over with because I didn't want to change my mind halfway through deciding which cookie I wanted.  From what I tasted, I could tell that I was eating:

a) The semi-sweet chocolate chip cookie.
b) The cookies and cream.
c) The semi-sweet chocolate chip with walnuts (my favorite).

Their cookies are skinnier, but they hold together really well (aka not one of those super soft ones that fall apart the instant you pick one up).  They're buttery, dense, and crispy on the edges (my FAVORITE).  Entirely too delicious.

Excuse me, but I need to go run an extra 45 miles now.
author: Tori S.

description: The cookies n cream and toffee cookies are the very best! I don't think I've ever had cookies that taste better.  I have to say my least favorite cookie is the chocolate chip, which is a staple. Besides a lack-luster chocolate chip, the service is always so slow. Every employee I have had an interaction with is very friendly and nice, but move with ZERO sense of urgency when the line is stretching across the store. I have actually left on many occasions because I just didn't have the time to wait in a line that wasn't moving when I had other places to be.  Chop chop!
author: Natalia K.

description:
I was lucky enough to try Anthony's cookies as part of the Scharffenberger Bakery Crawl event for food bloggers. Anthony's Cookies is located in an out of way location, yet people flock to his shop because his cookies are that good. 

I must say, his cookies are freshly baked to perfection! Moist not chewy. I bought 3 toffee chips and 3 cookies n cream for $6. That's a $1 a cookie! Cheaper than Mrs. Field's and way better! When I got home, my hubby ate all but 2 cookies. Gee, thanks!

I'll have to make a trip back to get a dozen next time.
author: Fanny S.

description: $36 for 2 dozen cookies?!? The cookies and cream were worth it, but not the chocolate chip. The minimalist interior was remarkable.
author: Alan V.

description:
Love these cookies but did anyone else out there get overcharged on Saturday 12/1? I got charged $61 for 23 cookies. I didn't even notice it until tonight when I looked at my online statement.

I have to update this and let you know that there was a weird glitch with their system that night.  Anna the manager refunded me the correct amount and sent me a gift card.  They were so nice and provided such great customer service while they were trying to figure out what happened.  

Anthony and staff, you guys really know how to make the best cookies ever and you know how to treat your customers.  It all makes for an excellent business!!!
author: cacao r.

description:
Ok here's how the cookie crumbles. Taste test results:

I liked: wheat oatmeal cranberry, chocolate oatmeal, and so so on the toffee chip

Hubby liked: banana walnut, chocolate oatmeal, chocolate chip, and candied pecan chocolate

Neither of us liked: cookies & cream (but Anthony's tells me it's their most popular flavor...)

In summary, both of us liked: chocolate oatmeal

UPDATE: MOST RECENTLY, WE TRIED GERMAN CHOCOLATE - IT'S EXCELLENT! Double chocolate walnut is also good (better when it's cold). Again tried the choc chip and didn't like it.
author: Marina N.

description: The cookies and cream cookie was tasty, but overall the cookies were rather small.  The confusing thing about ordering is that there are two separate cookie lists.  One list is of all the flavors, but that doesn't mean you can order from it...you have to look for the list that states the available cookies for that day.
author: Lisa H.

description:
okay. i'm genuinely and sincerely pissed at how damn good these cookies are. I've been complimented on my high threshold of  self-control. Where has that gone? out the damn door now. sigh..

these cookies are the freaking best! they have crispy edges, chewy center, and it's a perfect balance of sweetness and doughyness. They are the demise of the fit and the self-controlled, ie me. They are the friend to skinny bitches who don't need to work out.

sigh. i hate life. i'm gonna go work out.

see you guys @ the gym

ps. i hate skinny bitches.
pps. does anybody know the nutritional value to these edible devil devices?
author: Alex C.

description:
Cookies and Cream cookie.
Who would've known that mashing up another cookie and melding it into a 'normal' cookie would bear such a delicious Cookenstein?

Either way, it should be on the list of 101 things to try before you die, since you're probably going to get to the afterlife wondering why everyone else is just a little bit more satisfied than you are.

BUT- don't put it in the microwave, it turns into a strange bready consistency, one of which I don't approve.
author: Winè C.

description:
This is the place you want to come to for the best cookie ever made. It's complete perfection. I ordered one of every kind and I'm not sorry I did! The Toffee chip, which was to die for, and the Oatmeal Cranberry are my favorite. 

I wish there was an Anthony's Cookies in Miami. We really need one. 

The guys at the counter were awesome as well. Very friendly staff. They gave us some free samples to try before we bought cookies but , I had already ordered one of each. I took 2 dozen home for a friend who would not stop raving about these cookies. 

I shall never doubt him again on dessert. These cookies were just fantastic. 

They also sell milk too for those cookies!
author: Donna W.

description:
ANTHONY IS THE MAN!!

I met Anthony of Anthony's Cookies at a Chinese Restaurant one day and we started talking.  He mentioned to me that he just opened up a cookie shop on Valencia and told me to stop by.  Few days later I came in to visit.  This guy has a great memory, because we were already on first name basis! 

His cookies are like crack:  ADDICTING!  His cookies change everyday.  Cookies are made fresh daily throughout the day.  I usually order a dozen at a time when I come over.  One dozen for me and another dozen or two for the family and friends.  All I gotta say is baking cookies is not a science.  But when it comes to Anthony's Cookies, they're the best!
author: Raymond S.

description:
The cookies are pretty delicious, I bought some as a gift and some for myself.  

My favorites are the cookies and cream and toffee  I ended up eating 7 for myself in a day.  I came right when they opened around 10am on a Friday, and they didn't have a peanut butter or any of the oatmeals available yet.  Anthony offered me a free cookie for being unprepared.  Cute place, great service, good cookies.
author: Jerry W.

description: I don't get it. They were good but I just don't see what makes these cookies stand out. My hubs is a cookie monster. He eats cookies and milk every single night before bed. I thought it would be a nice treat to take him here. Like me, he just wasn't that impressed. Maybe this place has been too hyped? Maybe I went on an off day? We tried the classic chocolate chip, German chocolate, cookies and crème, peanut butter, toffee chip, and dark chocolate & walnut. They even started to taste the same after a while. Maybe I'll try again so I can write a good update.
author: Nicole H.

description:
I always got Anthony's Cookies at Atlas where they're twice the size and twice the price. They said I'm gonna be blown away by these directly from the shop since the ones in the shop have more flavor than their wholesale production. I already thought the wholesale ones were delish, but they proved they can outdo themselves. 

They kept feeding me samples, enough samples to finish a whole cookie. Got myself half a dozen cookies in flavors that aren't sold at Atlas. By mid afternoon my lunch pretty much consisted of a whole lot of buttery cookies with just the right amount of crunchiness and chewiness (with the exception of the peanut butter one which crumbled apart way too easily). 

Would I make another lunch entirely out of Anthony's Cookies? Yes, without a doubt.
author: Victoria N.

description: Hands down the best cookies I have ever had in my entire life.  My plan is always to get just 1-2, but I walk out with a box, never fails! The chocolate chip is amazing and a must, but every flavor I have tried has been to die for.  I've met Anthony a couple times and he's been busy working away in the back making sure every batch is perfect. The staff is so nice and I love going in there.  If you know you are going to order a dozen or more, call ahead and they will make sure they will have what you want ready and fresh!! I apologize for any cookies addictions that occur after you take your first bite.
author: Melinda M.

description:
Love Love LOVE Anthony.. and his **coooooookiiiieeeeeesssss** imagine all this in a cookie monster voice lol

Cookies & Cream + Toffee Chip = Cookie Heaven!

http://tinyurl.com/2dm94kk

I am so glad that my random research on Yelp has led me to this delicious haven! Since my trip in Jan and my trip now... I have been over 4x! I don't even live up in SF! I often dream, drool, and think about Anthony's Cookies.  It's Mrs. Fields gone wild! 

They bake fresh cookies daily and you will usually find Anthony working hard in the background bringing us great cookies! My favorite are any that come out of the oven piping hot as they are still soft and just melt in your mouth good! His cookie dough base is absolutely delicious! After all, it is about the consistency of the cookie!

Even if they are cooled off, they still have that moist chewy bite that I love about cookies.  Here's a tip if you love melted fresh cookies like I do: Go home and lightly nuke it in the oven.  Mmmm goodness! They last for a great amount of time and still maintain the great texture.  It's like a drug that I need daily.  Only picked up a 1/2 dozen for each of us today.. will be back within 2 days for more! 

I am only here for barely 10 days and will go 2x... If I had a car, I'd drive over every day to catch them fresh from the oven!
author: Kat L.

description:
At first glance, the storefront doesn't appear to be anything out of the ordinary.  The space itself is very minimalist, featuring one long table and a window seat, a row of glass milk bottles on display, and an open kitchen.

The cookies are thin and perfectly crisp on the outside, chewy and melty on the inside.  And you really can't go wrong using all-natural ingredients from right here in San Francisco.

The White Chocolate Chip and the Toffee Chip were definitely the sweetest of the bunch. The White Chocolate Chip has big chunks of chocolate and the Cinnamon Sugar definitely has more cinnamon than sugar, slightly reminiscent of a mild ginger snap.  Whole Wheat Oatmeal Chocolate Chip has a nice texture to it, chewy, but not dense like most oatmeal cookies I've tried.  Cookies and Cream is our favorite, hands down.  A cross between a Chocolate Chip and an Oreo cookie, it's quite an innovative combo.  It goes especially well with a glass of Straus Creamery milk, which is some damn good milk, chunks of cream and all.
author: Anne A.

description:
Nothing really special in my opinion :\
I wanted to like this place. I ordered half a dozen of cinnamon sugar, white chocolate chip, oatmeal, oatmeal and choc chip, and choc chip. They're too sweet and I could barely even finish one. I ended up bringing them to work for my coworkers to finish.
author: Lily Z.

description: Had a major cookie craving and came across Anthony's. 1/2 a dozen of cookies and cream, toffee, white chocolate, and cinnamon spice cookies later ... we were completely satisfied and on a sugar high! This spot is worth trekking from the Presidio to get to. And was cute inside, the large table was already taken by another group so we took it to go.
author: Cathy B.

description:
tried the dark chocolate cookie
pricey for the size and nothing special.
yeah, in the middle is soft but it's just normal.
not impress.
however, the counter girl had the best smile I've seen all day so I will give it a 3 stars.
author: Rina C.

description:
I have to thank Anthony in person for making white chocolate chip cooks WITHOUT nuts!!!!    This will be one of the staples in my heaven when I die.

Yesterday a certain someone spoiled me with this treat.  Thank you, CP :)
author: Athena S.

description:
Soft chewy center...butter...butter. melty chocolate chips..butter. slap me and give me another. 

I'm built to seek and fall in love with the interesting, avant-garde, and risky over the traditional, tried and true. So when the chocolate chip cookie won my heart over the others that I tried, I was a little surprised. There are few things in life that take me to pleasure town like that of a damn good chocolate chip cookie. well done, anthony..if that's even your real name.

+5 stars for rocking my world. -1 star for $$$.
author: Lily L.

description:
I'm a dessert enthusiast, so after skimming these reviews I went in with some very high expectations.  

Didn't quite live up to it.

Definitely not bad cookies.  I actually quite like the texture - these are thinner cookies, and slightly crisp on the outside, but soft on the inside.  Not particularly chewy, but chewy cookies are obtainable everywhere so this was a nice change.  However, I found them far too sweet!  As such, I don't consider them to be rave-worthy.

Per my request, the girl working the register very helpfully pulled out a toffee cookie and an oatmeal cranberry cookie and cut it into 4 squares to sample.  I tried both but found them to be too sweet, however at that point I felt bad making her do all that, and ended up buying the cranberry.  

Cookies are $1.25 each.
author: Vi N.

description:
LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!!

I've been here plenty of times & it's DELICIOUS every time! It's located on Valencia St. Kinda busy street, so sometimes you just have to be lucky with parking. I've been pretty lucky..if there's no parking in front, I find parking around the corner.

My FAVE is the COOKIES & CREAM!! Especially when they're hot...OMG! Idk what it is about it, but it's SOOOO GOOD!! It tastes even better if you have milk..YUMMM! If you're a chocolate person (& even if you're not, haha), you DEFINITELY need to get this! 

Another one I like is the Toffee one. It's actually pretty good. If I want something other than Cookies & Cream, this is my next go-to cookie. Worth a try!

You can totally sample the cookies. They're really nice about that :) 

Half a dozen for $6.00. A dozen for $11.00. Kinda pricy for cookies, but for COOKIES & CREAM, it's worth it! :) 

I'm sad that they don't do the stamp card anymore :( Booooooo. 

But I'm definitely still coming here! Can't wait for my next visit! :D
author: Jessica A.

description: My wonderful sister bought me a bag of cookies when I visited her. There was cookies & cream cookies, chocolate chip & white chocolate chip cookies. They were all good. I especially loved the cookies & cream cookie because i've never seen/heard of that variety anywhere else. Very unique to Anthony's. I ate all 5 cookies during my visit of 3 days. Talk about a fatty I am!
author: Leslie P.

description: This place is dangerously close to my house and on the weekends they have my favorite:  candied pecan chocolate chip.
author: Naomi A.

description:
Best.Cookies.Ever.

Do you ever walk by the Mrs. Field's shop in the mall and find the smell intoxicating and then you give in and get a cookie (or a bag of those little ones) and they're good but just not as good as the SMELL? Well Anthony's absolutely live up to the smell (hmm, that sounds weird).

Super perky cute kids working the shop with oodles of fresh cookies (like seriously fresh, I watched them take some out of the oven) for sale, went with the semi-sweet chocolate chip, toffee chip and cinnamon sugar and they all blew my mind.

Little pieces of baked heaven. Amen.
author: Christine K.

description:
I love cookies! Probably the best cookie in SF. Unfortunately the last time I came here they only had 3 types available due to the Fathers Day madness but the toffee was amazing and the whole wheat oatmeal raisin was even good (even though I don't like oatmeal raisin).

I also had an Anthony's cookie when I ate at Kasa since they sell them there. It was a Cookies n Cream. Oreo cookie pieces within a cookie...amazing. 

You can tell they take pride and diligence in the quality of their cookie. Yes, Specialty's is bigger and they are good too but size doesn't matter, right???
author: David C.

description: Such tasty cookies. The perfect balance of crunchy and soft. My favorite cookie is the oreo cookie chocolate chip cookie. These are phenomenal and will be at my birthday party :)
author: Tina F.

description:
Wow! Make a cookie that tastes amazing (I am pretty sure they put weed or crack in it), not too big (Specialties), not too expensive ($3)... for $1 when you buy 6 or more... DO IT!!! get a dozen.  It is amazing.  The original chocolate chip is my fav.  Cookies and Cream is sensational.  Pecan chocolate chip is great (and I don't like nuts in my cookies).

Stop reading and go get your cookie on!  Btw, they do close at 7 or 8 pm so good luck.

If you have suggestions for Donuts with weed or crack in it, pls holla back.
author: Frank M.

description:
Entering Anthony's Cookies, you feel as if you are looking through the eyes of Cookie Monster if he died and went to Heaven. Sheets and sheets of cookies just waiting to be demolished...nom nom nom!!!! 

And these aren't just any type of cookies, these are  Anthony's Cookies, the oepidomy, the creme de la creme of all cookie's ever made; cookies that are so amazing, if Anthony and Mrs. Fields had a cookie bake-off, I would place all my ginger snaps on Anthony taking the win, that's how amazing this place is...in fact don't go here! You'll be doing yourself a favor since once you do, everything will seem sub-par or decent at best, well for the most part, (Mrs. Fields, I won't deny your snickerdoodles are quite epic). 

Top 3 Cookies:

3) White Chocolate Macadamia - Always a winner in my book

2) Chocolate Chip - Chewy, chocolately, ahh-mazing!

1) Cookies and Cream Cookie - Oreo cookies mashed up in cookie batter does not even do justice how Zelda-ly  epic this cookie is!

So bottom line, for an awesome meal in the Mission, head to la Taqueria for crispy tacos and walk a couple blocks and grab a dozen cookies for yourself...ONE EPIC MEAL!
author: Joel V.

description: We love cookies, but I gotta say this place was terrible. We were expecting a good cookie after reading all of the positive reviews and what we got was worse than a mediocre store bought cookie. We got the german chocolate, chocolate chip, toffee chip, and cookies and cream. None of them were very good. They were dry, cold, small, and very expensive.  On a positive note, there was nobody in line so we didn't have to wait. Don't waist your time or money--if you're looking for a delicious treat, go to Mitchels's ice cream in Bernal Heights, the neighborhood right next to the Mission.
author: Alex N.

description: Delightful freshly baked little morsels, though I'm not sure what all the hype was/is about. Don't get me wrong, the cookies are wonderful and fresh but not amazing.
author: Shawn C.

description:
I looooooove this place. I can honestly say I been eating Anthony's cookies since he was selling them out his trunk! My boyfriend brought them home from the barber shop and it was a wrap after I ate my first Cookies -n-Cream cookie.
Anthony's is shit'n on Mrs. Fields..LOL
author: Natalie G.

description:
Anthony's cookies are by far the best cookies I've ever had. Cookies n' cream all the way! 

Anyone who has nerve to compare these to the likes of mrs. Fields cookies must have no taste buds because any true cookie lover could taste the difference! 

the price is super reasonable. what I love about this place is that even though they are well known on yelp they don't jack up their prices like I've seen other places do. this place knows what people want and expect and they take much pride in it. 

The store is simple. They have a park table inside so you could enjoy your treat. Grab a cup of milk and enjoy! but I guarantee that one cookie will not be enough so just get the half dozen!!! Trust me! These are still awesome overnight too!
author: Judy P.

description:
Now THIS is what a cookie should taste like. After hearing about this place from some people I stopped in on my way home from work and got 3 kinds of cookies for a $1.25 each. I bit into the candied pecan cookie and immediately said "OH YEAH!" and devoured the rest of it in about a minute. 

Eating anthony's cookies brings me back to an idealized childhood where every cookie came out of the over tasting just like this. But in actuality, most of the cookies didn't even make it in the oven because we were stuffing our faces with cookie dough. 

I wish I had found out about this place sooner but it's probably best that i haven't been eating a dozen cookies per sitting.
author: Jesse M.

description: My God.  If I was having a bad day, a rainy day, a congratulatory "yay me" day, or if any of my dearest favorite people were having one of these days, I'd get Anthony's cookies for the situation at hand.  COOKIE!!!!  They are soft, moist, delicious cookies that are a step above the rest, no matter what flavor.  The cookies and cream cookie, with oreo pieces inside, is the best one in my opinion.  The chocolate chip and the cinnamon spice are a tie for second place.  They are slightly expensive, which is good, so I won't eat a dozen in one sitting.  Don't ever leave San Francisco without trying these cookies!
author: Terry K.

description:
Dear Jesus,
