Please go to the owner of Anthony's in his sleep and tell him to open a store in DC. And tell him to never run out of Cookies-n-creme cookies ever again. 

Amen.
author: Joe S.

description: Omg all cookies should taste like this so you never feel like you wasted calories.  My favorite flavors are cookies and cream, toffee chip and candied pecans.
author: Wakako U.

description:
COOKIE HEAVEN!!! 

Absolutely delicious cookies. My top three are as follows:  
1) Toffee Chip: sweet goodness that melts in your mouth!
2) Cookies N Cream: deliciousness that is so full of flavor!
3) Banana: does NOT have nuts (yay!) and is like a bread/cookie hybrid thing. so good.
People that say that a dollar is too much for these cookies? negative; a) you live in sf and everything is pricey so get over it. aaaand b) so worth it and a dollar is not bad at all!! 

also, they have milk for dippin' because you can't have cookies w/o milk!
customer service is great and a good, clean shop.  so after gettin' a bomb cheesesteak at Phat Philly, walk two blocks down for dessert at Anthony's!  :-)
author: Sam C.

description:
I walked into Anthony's cookies only expecting to buy one or two cookies to satisfy my sweet tooth but I left with half a dozen. If you are a cookie monster, the cookies may cost you a bit at 1.25 each, $6 for half a dozen, $11 for a full dozen, but it is definitely worth it as a treat every so often.

Not only are there awesome cookies, but you can get samples of these awesome cookies too! I tried Toffee Chip, Cookies and Cream, and Oatmeal Cranberry. Thinking about these cookies make me want to drool...  the Cookies and Cream was just right, and the Oatmeal Cranberry was a nice change from oatmeal raise, which they also have, but the Toffee Chip was a little on the sweeter side.

It is really hard to eat just one. It took a lot of self control for me to not eat all the cookies I bought, always nicer to share.
author: Angela T.

description:
Small little place, hard to catch from the outside. I think they need a bigger banner from the outside to be more eye catching. You would think it was an apartment if you were walking by. The inside is pretty neat. I love the glass bottles of milks up they have for for decoration, and the smell would just make you want to dive in right away after you get them.

On the menu they had so many flavors, but it all depended on what they had for the day, and what they had remaining. I wanted to try every flavor they had but me and my friends got there around 7pm, and there were only around 6 flavors left. We got 3 cookies and cremes, 3 white chocolate, 3 toffee, and oatmeal cranberry. They were all good but my favorite were the cookies and creme (must try). The oatmeal cranberry were very small, was not worth a dollar even for taste.

The service was quick and the girl behind the counter was pretty cute. I don't really get desert but this place is definitely a place to go to. Great experience but probably not coming back because I'm just not into spending money on cookies personally.
author: Hui L.

description:
Unlike a lot of places I have tried based on Yelp, this place DOES live up to the hype. It has instantly become one of my top places to get cookies from. It's actual a 3 way tie between My sister, Denicas and Antony's.

Since this place has been reviewed so many times I will keep it short and just list my two favorites.

1. Chocolate chip - Small, chocolaty yet not too sweet.
2. Cookies and Cream -  No joke, this reminds me of cookies and cream ice cream.
author: Jeff P.

description:
Some of the best cookies I have ever had. Been there many times and never had a bad one yet. 
I love the semi sweet chocolate chips and the German Chocolate is yummy. The hard thing is choosing which one to get. I usually end up with a dozen.
author: Leigh S.

description:
Anthony's Cookies is ridiculous. I have a love/hate relationship with this place.  Love the cookies and hate myself for gorging on them.  They have the old standby, chocolate chip which was very solid, but the show stoppers are the cinnamon sugar and the cookies and cream.  All the cookies have great soft, but not too doughy texture, but the flavors in those two flavors are something else.  they must have sprinkled cookie crack in them.  I used to think Dancing Deer's molasses clove cookies were great but they've been blown out of the water.  2 cookies + a glass of milk is the perfect dessert after a nice meal.  

Our kind friends have brought us Anthony's cookies the last two times we've seen them so the next time we head up to SF, we're gonna visit the cookie Mecca for ourselves.

 For all those haters who complain about the $1.25 price tag, take your chubby fingers over to Ms Fields and go pay .99 for a mediocre chocolate chip cookie.
author: Rob Y.

description: I've had Anthony's Cookies a few times and they're consistently good. The cookies have a nice crispy edge with a soft chewy middle. I've had chocolate chip, oatmeal, and chocolate chip with walnuts. I like the regular chocolate chip the most. I wish the cookies were a little bigger, but at least it's something you won't feel guilty eating!
author: Alice J.

description:
Anthony, your cookies are THEE EFFING BEST.

I was able to have some of your cookies via my cousin David who brought some over for a get together last friday.  The Cookies and Cream cookie and the German Chocolate were some of the best cookies I've ever had, no lie.  Crisp on the outside and super chewy on the inside (that's what she said). What is your secret? Of course you're not gonna tell me cause then if you did I would open up Ray's Cookies and be your main competitor.

Damn your cookies are hella good bruh
author: Ray R.

description: Small cookies, but who cares? It's about the well balanced buttery flavored goodness. The infamous toffee chip was pretty good and it would definitely be in my dozen cookie box whenever I make a trip. However, the candied pecan cookies, cookies and cream, and a semi sweet chocolate chip cookie are amongst the included ones.
author: stacy k.

description:
Chewy on the inside, crispy on the edges. Basically, the perfect cookie.
It's a store dedicated to cookies and milk. It can't get any better than that. I got a dozen of cookies and cream, chocolate chip walnut, oatmeal raisin/craisin, toffee nut, and white chocolate. All were perfect and stayed that way until they slowly disappeared two days later. Pair this with a bottle of whole Straus milk and call it an afternoon.
author: Jen T.

description:
I've tried ALL my life to perfect my chocolate cookie recipe, and I have YET to come NEAR to Anthony's. I am SO happy that I came in to visit.

Me, my husband and my daughter drove all the way from Vacaville after visiting family, to try this place out. Only to find, that it was closed for renovations. But we met Anthony outside and he was the SWEETEST person I have ever met. He was apologetic and very sincere. I told him we drove from far away to try this place out in hopes to order some for a future baptism party. He gave me a list of flavors and was extremely friendly. 

From that meeting alone, I made it a point to come back.

Fast forward a month or so later and we finally were able to try it out. The girl that was working (I'm sorry I didn't get your name, but she was Asian) was VERY nice. I hope Anthony knows he has a wonderful group of employees working for him. I bought 2 dozen and divided them among cookies and cream, toffee, white chocolate and chocolate chip. THEY WERE HEAVEN!

Even a few days later they were STILL good. The test of a fine, FINE cookie. 

On top of having good products, the ownership and employees make it easier to come back and spend money. I will HAPPILY keep you in business, knowing that you all are so kind and your cookies are AMAZING!!!

Thank you, THANK YOU THANK YOU!! We will soon be putting in an order soon for my daughter's baptism:):)
author: RoseMichelle M.

description: Sinfully good. The cookies are slightly crisp on the outside and chewy on the inside. They are freshly baked, and you can see them resting on the racks. We picked up six and they were all very good. Cookies and cream and the chocolate chip were my faves!
author: Cindy T.

description:
Thanks to my cousin purchasing 2 dozen batches of goodness, I tried 1 day old "Cookies and Cream" cookies today and it was still soft, moist, not too sweet and amazingly sweet-tooth satisfying! I'm a huge cookie lover fan, but cookies from Anthony's probably top off as my current fav at the moment!

They sell for $1 a cookie, but after you try one, you'll fall into the hype too! I can't wait to go to the store myself and try their other selection, esp. the toffee chip cookie!
author: Cathe T.

description:
In the interest of science, I sampled a half dozen cookies from Anthony's to see how they compare to my dear Hot Cookie.

BACKGROUND: Anthony's has a rotating cookie chart, and that day I tried: cinnamon sugar, oatmeal cranberry, oatmeal chocolate chip, peanut butter and two pecan chocolate chips (I actually split the 6 with someone else and there was overlap -- I like pecans so I wasn't complaining).

EXPERIMENT: One at a time, I put the cookies in my mouth. Surprisingly, these smallish cookies where hotter than any cookie that I have received from Hot Cookie. Cheaper, too. The cinnamon sugar cookie was incredibly soft and buttery (delicious!). Everything else was as good as can be expected for fresh cookies and not too crunchy on the bottom. The peanut butter cookie was a little crumbly, and could have been softer.

ANALYSIS: I really like the consistency of Hot Cookie better -- both in that I know they will always have pecan chip in stock and that their cookies are a little more dense, heartier. I know I'd never have the forethought to check the cookie chart, and I'd be disappointed that they didn't have the one I wanted in stock. If they could somehow combine the hot butteryness of Anthony's with the large, thick treats from Hot Cookie I'd probably get diabetes.  

CONCLUSION: I just really like cookies, and wanted an excuse to eat so many :(
author: Jennifer B.

description:
I love Anthony.  He's awesome.  He's usually there, in the back, mixing up the dough; he always smiles; and he's appreciative at everyone's warm reception of his business.

The cookies are good -- very good, even -- and expensive.  Truth be told, I make a better semi-sweet chocolate chip but who has the time?  My favorite chocolate chip is at Teacake, though only at the Burlingame outpost (Emeryville and Lafayette aren't as good).  Anthony's is more consistent.

It's a great option for sweet delights in the Mission.
author: SalsaBoy S.

description:
Anthony's COOKIES AND CREAM makes me wanna slap Mrs. Fields on the face and give Anthony a love tap on the ass.

You can taste the love for real.
author: Angela W.

description:
Everybody knows about this place already, but I'll make this quick and simple. 

Some of the best cookies I've ever had. I've been waiting months to try this since I was in school. It was sure worth the wait.

Even though it wasn't fresh out of the oven, the taste and texture was amazing. I got the toffee chip and cookies & cream. The toffee chip was just perfect. Not an overpowering toffee flavor. It was soft but not crumbly - just the way I like my cookies. Now onto my favorite. The famous cookies & cream. You can see the chunks of oreo looking cookies within the cookies. It was soft and just melts down once you take a bite of it. It really tasted almost like cookies and cream ice cream, but luke warm. Who would have though of putting cookies WITHIN a cookie? Genius. 

This will not be the last time I come here. They are a bit pricey for what you get, but definitely a must try in the city. I can't wait to try a warm cookies & cream.
author: robin w.

description:
I've been coming to this place since they opened, and I love them! their toffee chip, white chocolate chip, peanut butter, and cookies and cream cookies are my favorites. 

I'm always in a good mood when I'm getting Anthony's cookies!
author: Rose L.

description:
Simply amazing.  The cookies are perfectly baked, delicious and the staff are so welcoming.  It's a simple set up: one large table with benches, a fridge with cold milk and a board with the daily cookie list.  

What sealed the deal?  Although there was no lactose-free milk for sale, the cashier gave us cups of Silk milk usually used for coffee FOR FREE!

Gonna make it a required stop in SF every trip!
author: Chelsey V.

description:
Good cookies, but not great. I've tried almost every kind (except the banana walnut! Still holding out for that one), and none struck me as particularly amazing. Maybe the only exception is their cookies n cream! Pretty novel and is probably the only type I'll get in the future. 

For their rather small size, the cookies are pretty pricey at $1.25 a cookie, I believe its $12 if you order a dozen. Either way, they're quite small for $1/cookie, compared to other bakeries. They also seem to be a little on the oily side for my taste.

I love the interior though. As soon as you stroll in, the warm cookie aroma hits you and there's a picnic bench inside for you to stop and snack on a cookie (or two or three) before you're on your way. I also hear that the organic half gallon milk is some pretty good milk! And it comes in a glass jug too... I just want the jug haha.
author: Janey L.

description:
I want to go here every day.  I love the:

toffee cookies.
walnut chip
candied pecan chip

chocolate chip, oatmeal chocolate chip, german chocolate, etc... all are slight variations of the same cookie. At least I think so.  You can get just one and its like you had them all:)
author: Torrey R.

description:
Ugh this stuff is good. It's pretty expensive for cookies but if you just imagine that its pure bliss, then it's relatively cheap. In other words, if pure bliss had a flavor, it would be the cookies and cream cookie from this place. The toffee chip is fantastic as well. The white chocolate is good but it wasn't my favorite. 

I would never get sick of these cookies. Never ever ever.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I went to get a "cookies and cream" cookie for 7x7's Big Eat 2011. 

The best thing about Anthony's Cookies is that they allow you to taste the cookies before you buy them. The woman at the counter allowed me to sample to my heart's content before deciding on my dozen. It was like Costco except without all the weird samples for nutritional supplements, super spicy beef jerky, and crap like that. 

I got an assortment of the cookies and cream, toffee, and double chocolate. They were all rich and chewy. Juuuust how I like them. They even maintained their moisture the next day. 

They were great cookies. They weren't the best cookies I've ever had, however. The cookies and cream was just a really good sugar cookie with oreos in it. Simple, and nothing mind blowing. I actually preferred the toffee. The double chocolate also gets a big thumbs up, mostly just for being DOUBLE CHOCOLATE. That kind of thing can't be bad. 

I also want to give props for having really cute glass bottles of milk in the fridge. It rounds out the cookies nicely and makes for an adorable gift.
author: Kristen B.

description:
Ok...ok...my bro will laugh his heart out when he reads this review...he would even grin at me and say "i told you so".

I love the Toffee Chip...thanks to my Tb for bringing me some for lunch today.

I am a convert...;-)
author: Malou C.

description:
Sorry Girl Scouts, Anthony's Cookies is getting my business this year.  I'll just mail you a check for support, cause there's no way that I'm going to eat a cookie with a long shelf life, after eating the real deal.

I love Anthony's Cookies.  There's nothing better than a fresh made cookie from quality ingredients, to quench a sugar craving.  The cookies are very tasty and enjoyable.  I love just eating a part of the cookie and savoring it slowly, eating the rest of it later.  However, I live with a husband and baby, so when I try to save the cookie(s) it ends up disappearing.  
I'm a big fan of the 6-pack of cookies, so you can try one of each and sample the different flavors.  The cookies last a couple days and still taste fresh and moist.
author: michele g.

description:
I'd read about Anthony's in the Chronicle a while back, and finally had a chance to try these cookies on Wednesday. At first, I was a little apprehensive about these cookies--I mean would they live up to all the hype? But wow, they did not disappoint--these were some of the best cookies I've ever had! (No offense, Mom!)

Now I prefer my cookies soft and gooey--nearly raw, honestly--and as they packed up my cookies, they looked a little hard. But never judge a book by its cover--one bite and I found a soft cookie inside. This was a nice touch--a crisp exterior that gave way to the soft center. 

I ordered a half dozen (for $5 they're a steal!), sampling a variety of different flavors. Cinnamon sugar was by far my favorite--it had a nice, bold cinnamon flavor since the cookie was *baked* with cinnamon, not just dipped in cinnamon powder before baking as is so often the case at other bakeries. The other flavors--cookies and cream, peanut butter, toffee chip, to name a few--didn't disappoint. 

I'll definitely be back next time I'm up in the city--though honestly, I'll be hard-pressed to stop at a half-dozen next time!
author: Raul N.

description: best cookie being sold in bay area. they even offer gluten free for those of you with allergic reactions. id come back for sure. parking is sometimes tough to find. bought a box for mi lady for vday. she totally gave it up after a few bites. lol jk. the cookies and cream cookie is 'slap ur momma' good. dont actually slap ur mom though k? unless she needed a back to reality slap. have a good day yelpers.
author: Young N.

description:
Best Cookies Ever. 

I don't want to mess around... these cookies are amazing. If you're willing to pay $1 for a cookie, you will not regret it! My favorites are cookies and cream, toffee chip and you can't go wrong with chocolate chip (solo or with candied walnuts/pecans)

Anthony is super nice too!
author: Abbey S.

description:
I try to only allow myself desserts on the weekends in my neverending attempts to be healthy. This doesn't always work out when I am up studying late and suddenly have late night cravings for donuts.  However, it was a gorgeous Sunday afternoon in SF and my friend and I felt it was the right time to walk the 10 blocks to Anthony's and finally try these delectable morsels.

I ordered a dozen so I could sample all the flavors. The cookies are made just the way I like them, soft, chewy, practically raw, not too many chocolate chips in the chocolate chip cookies, lots of crushed up oatmeal in the oatmeal cookies (the cranberry oatmeal was my favorite).  I also loved the cinnamon sugar - it wasn't your typical sugar cookie covered with cinnamon and sugar.  No, this was an actual spice cookie with a little sugar sprinkled on top.  Anthony does cookies right.  

The other plus, they serve good coffee (Four Barrel) and good milk (Strauss Family Creamery - you know the milk is good when it comes from a glass bottle).  Perfect complements to a perfectly good cookie.
author: Joanne L.

description:
omg. OMG. OMFG. I came the day Anthony's Cookies were serving 2 free cookies per customer. I got the Cookies and Cream and Toffee, and oh boy are they just delightful. The perfect crispy edge with a warm gooey middle. 

The inside is so cute. Definitely keeping it simple. He has humble beginnings since at one point Anthony was selling cookies out of his car while he was a starving student at SF State. I love the milk bottles, and the really simple menu. 

They run on the smaller size, but a dozen will cost you less than $1 per cookie. And it goes perfectly with milk. I got the Strauss Creamery brand just to drink out of a cool looking glass milk bottle. Be sure to return it for $1.50 credit for a recycling deposit. 

I will be sure to come back and try more.
author: Alyson C.

description:
Great cookies.  What more can I say?  I'll tell you what more.

The cookies while delicious always seem to be darker than I'd like.  They look like they are almost burnt.  They're not, no hint of it when you eat one just plain deliciousness.  Purely a visual thing, though I've never tasted a lighter colored cookie from there in a side by side comparison so maybe it would be even delicious-y-er.

Good prices very friendly service.  If the first bite with my eyes didn't tell me this cookie is burnt they'd get 5 stars.
author: Max Jonathan S.

description:
After hearing SO much about this place, then reading all my fellow yelpers rant and rave about it, I just had to try Anthony's! 

I was finally able to come in and pick up a dozen---some semi-sweet chocolate chip, toffee nut and chocolate chip w/ walnuts.  Now I must be honest, these cookies are definitely yummy... But unfortunately not out of this world like I thought they would be. They are, however, the PERFECT texture, so if you can't manage to bake some yourself, def come here and give these a try. Also, I was hoping to try other specific flavors but they sold out (probably because I came too late). I will update/revise once I have tried the cookies and cream, banana walnut and oatmeal chocolate chip cookies. For now, I'd have to say the cookies are a little over-priced since they kind of taste like fresh baked Mrs. Field's, maybe just a notch higher. =/

(Next day review...)
OK Now I just had to give these cookies an extra star b/c the day after buying them, they are still as perfect as when I bought them... And I don't even have to warm them up to have them melt in my mouth. I shall be back for those other flavors, and then maybe I can give it that last star! =)
author: Dijonne M.

description:
OMG.. I love cookies.. but i LOOOOOOVE these cookies.. it's soOOoOo good.. I bought:

White Chocolate 
Semi Sweet
Toffee
Double Chocolate
Cookies and Cream

it was $17 for 2 DOZEN!!! so cheap.. soOooO good... i'm going to come here OVER AND OVER :)
author: Kristina L.

description: The best gluten free chocolate chips cookies. You won't even know or care that they're gluten free.
author: Ms. G.

description:
If you like cookies, this would be the place to go.  As soon as you walk in, the smell will have you hooked and hypnotized.  
These cookies are warm and chewy and packed with great flavor!
And if you think the cookies are great, the service is even better.
author: Alejandro G.

description:
STOP IT. 
I was doing really good. 
Then, one day, totally by accident, I ordered one tiny measly toffee cookie at Four Barrel which was the gateway cookie to a world of trouble. 
I kept coming up with more and more reasons to be in the hipster filled mission.
Oops- I slipped and fell into the door of four barrel again only to find that they were constantly sold out of the toffee love bites. 
Finally one day I bit the bullet, and crossed one of my personal boundries..speaking to a hipster, in order to find out the source of the Toffee heaven. (He was nice by the way, didn't even try to school me on the origin of toffee or anything)
He says Anthonys as I racing out the door.
In a HOT minute, seriously fastest 20 blocks in my life, I found God... Well, not God but Gods cookies of choice, obvi.

PS. Cookies & Creme cookies are even better than the toffee ones, yeah I said that. I'll fight you to defend that cookies honour.
author: Rhubarb M.

description:
My friend and I walked into Anthony's. Not too impressive appearance-wise, however the worker at the register was really friendly. We had trouble deciding what to get so the worker offered us samples for any of the cookies. She cut them into fourths for us to sample! I sampled the toffee nut cookie and the cookies and cream cookie.

I wasn't too crazy about the cookies but since we made a trip to SF and planned out our route to hit Anthony's, I knew I had to get something. I went with the toffee nut and saved it for later.

The next day, I ate it and it was rather delicious! They're thin cookies, crispy on the outside and soft and chewy on the inside. It's just the way I like it! I felt like it just melted in my mouth.

While I would love to try more of their other varieties, I wouldn't go out of my way to have another of these. Definitely worth a try though!
author: Emily T.

description: Cookies were great, but I wish there was more seating!  I like all of the creative flavors, though :)  Definitely head and shoulders above your typical Mrs. Fields.
author: S L.

description: The cookies are delicious!! My only gripe is the location. For me, Mission District is not the most convenient place to get to and there isn't any parking but very difficult street parking. Other than that, these cookies are worth it!
author: Melissa G.

description:
3.5 stars

All the flavors are delicious! I wish they would follow Specialties' tradition of serving cookies warm out of the oven, but perhaps I just haven't gone at the right time. The cookies have a decent bite: lightly crusty on the outside, and yummy chewiness on the inside. If only they were fatter morsels, and morsels they are (sadly)!
author: Nicole L.

description: Cookies and cream! That's all you need to know, and maybe a glass of organic milk.
author: Elisa M.

description:
EDIT: I'm not sure if they do the bulk discounts. It sounds like they may according to recent reviews, but the last time I went, the girl behind the counter said they didn't, so be aware of that point in reading below review. 

I'm disappointed in Anthony's and let me explain why. 

I've been to Anthonys more times than I can count with my fingers, and I've been a huge fan of their cookies since they first opened several year ago. Anthony was a very friendly guy who was always behind the counter when I visited. I always raved about this place to coworkers and friends, as I'm huge on well made cookies, which aren't easy to find. While Anthony's cookies are probably some of my favorite, I don't think I will be going back to Anthony's anymore for the simple reason of value/price. 

When I first went to Anthony's (I think it was about 2-3 years ago when they first opened), their cookies were well under a dollar, and the larger the quantity, the better the deal. However, every next time I've gone in, prices seem to go up, either per cookie or the bulk discounts got worse.  I've kept buying because I love cookies. However, yesterday was probably the last 3 cookies I'll probably ever buy there unless something changes. Cookies are now $1.25, and they no longer have any bulk discounts. Buy 6 cookies, and it will come out to 7.50 at 1.25 each. 

I understand that raw material prices and maybe even rent may have gone up, so I can understand having to raise prices since they first opened, but $1.25 for a tiny little cookie and no incentive to buy more just doesn't make sense to me (and it seems the bulk discounts going away is a recent thing according to reviews). Also, I'm all for giving people a chance, but I would say every other time (or even more) I visit, the person behind the counter makes me feel rather uncomfortable. 

I'd give 5 stars for taste, but minus two stars for above reason. I'd drop it even more, but I just can't do that since I've been a fan purely on taste. Anthony, I'm sure you have a lot of fans already, but you've just lost one.
author: Lawrence T.

description: OMG! How can anyone not love these cookies? I had a party this past weekend and someone brought these cookies. DANGER!!!! These cookies are too good to let any of them not be eaten immediately! Yummy!!!!! I tried at least 6 different cookies and ALL of them were beyond good. Try these cookies if you have not already.
author: Denise L.

description:
Damn good cookies. 

+: Plenty of different "flavors" to choose from. You will have a few favorites. 

-: Kinda expensive for cookies, but I guess it makes it a good deterrent. 

How do I make cookies like these?
author: Tammy T.

description: this place is amazing. cookies are crispy on the outside & gooey on the inside, even at the end of the day. Can't ask for much more than that!
author: Allie V.

description: The chocolate chip walnut is FANTASTIC. Altough it's a little pricey I cannot wait to go back!
author: Priscilla M.

description:
I'm not a local and heard about Anthony's Cookies all the way in Los Angeles. If news travels that far, then it definitely is a 'must-try.' I came in with three other friends, all first-timers, so we were definitely checking everything out. They have their list of traditional flavored cookies on the wall, along with prices, and the list of flavors for that day. Three of us decided we were buying a dozen each (no sharing of Anthony's Cookies...and you'll understand why after tasting them) for a bargain of $12. Six dollars for half a dozen and $1.70 for singles. Not bad for prices. 

We got to the register where a nice (and not bad looking hehe) guy helped us. I'm big on customer service and boy...this guy gave us quality customer service. He was patient as each of us told him our specific wants, telling us where and why he was placing this cookie on top of the other, nicely tying a string around our boxes, offering us samples...and doing all of this with a line growing behind us (I checked three times and started to get worried people would start getting annoyed). 

As for the taste of these cookies...OH...MY...GOD. If you like chewy AND crispy...these cookies are for you. Each cookie is what my friends and I say...DERRICIOUS! Even the cinnamon spice, which I wasn't that interested in, surprised me. My favorite overall...cookies n cream. Mmmm mmm MMMMMM! I still had my cookies left over two days after and they were still chewy like as if I bought them the day of. So definitely stop by...you won't regret it.
author: Emily D.

description:
my sweet tooth controls me.
I love cookies.
I especially love anthony's cookies.

Don't skimp, and get one of everything.  Then pour yourself a tall glass of something (probably milk.... whole milk while your at it) and go to town.

You shan't be disappointed.
author: Felix W.

description:
I am in love.  Truly madly in love...with toffee chip cookies!

Tip of the day:  the price per cookie drops very quickly the more and more cookies you buy at one time.
author: Jen C.

description:
Stopped by here yesterday and so glad we did! I love how you can have samples of whatever you want! Definitely helps when there are so many flavors to choose from! 

I ended up getting a dozen for my family, and then my bf and I got another half dozen for ourselves. =) I'm a sucker for chocolate chip, so I had to get a couple of those.  However, the cookies n cream cookie was yummy too! I can't wait to have mine with a glass of milk! Talk about a guilty pleasure!

My bf loved their german chocolate chip.  We also shared a toffee chip which wasn't bad either.

All the cookies are baked perfectly- there's just enough chewiness to each bite. I can't wait to try all the other flavors we picked out!! 

Sometimes I really wish I lived in SF!
author: Connie C.

description: YUMMY!! Cookies and cream is the best flavor! Best cookies in the Bay Area!
author: Pammy L.

description:
This place is very simple.  Their menu consists of various flavored  cookies (banana walnut, chocolate chip, cookies and cream...the list goes on and on) and milk.  That's pretty much it.  But it's totally okay because the cookies are delicious!

I had the chocolcate chip.  Freshly baked and CHEWY-- just how I like it.  

The milk they sell was so good.  I am not a milk person--never was.  But the milk was very sweet and creamy-- and LOWFAT... how do they do it?

Great place to go if you are craving HOMEMADE tasting cookies!  Though they taste much better than any I've ever "home made".
author: Joanne N.

description: I've never actually been here, but my classmate Adrian K. always brings us some cookies when we get together for study sessions. They're AMAZING. Best cookies ever. My favorite is the cookies and cream. They also keep really well - they stay yummy for at least a few days. I'm not sure if they'd keep longer because I ate all of them up pretty quickly.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Thank you to Four Barrel Coffee for having Anthony's Cookies in their pastry case on a coffee run about 3 months ago!  One bite of the Chocolate Chip floored me to a point I almost dropped my mocha.  After hearing from them that Anthony's was on the opposite end of Valencia, I paid them a visit and was greeted with a warm welcome from Anthony himself.  Having four options at Four Barrels is one thing, but having more than 14 flavors at his bakery is overwhelming for people with sweet tooths. 

You can't really go wrong with any of the flavors, but my personal favorites are:
German Chocolate Chip*  (Hands down favorite!)
Semi-Sweet Chocolate Chip
Toffee Chip
Cookies N Creme (cookie within a cookie)
Peanut Butter*
White Chocolate Chip

*only on select days
author: Jason A.

description: I was inspired to check out Anthony's Cookies from an article I saw in 7x7. I love the fact that he sort of fell into this career and he is running with it at full speed. The cookies were great and I love the simplicity of the store. We were able to meet Anthony and he was more than happy to talk with us and was super friendly despite the line and probably millions of orders he was doing the day before Christmas Eve.
author: Alisa V.

description:
I finally went back. My dad was in town, and he has a massive sweet tooth. Since I told him I was treating him to some of the best cookies around he let me choose. My dad loves chocolate!

We got chocolate chip walnut, cookies n cream and toffee chip and my dad stunned me by proclaiming the toffee one as the best cookie he's ever had! I loved all three flavors, but he loved the toffee chip one so much he ate mine too even though I had already taken a bite.

My mom will be jealous if she ever reads my reviews!
author: Sara A.

description:
Holy Moly these cookies are the bomb diggity ding dongy dong! Oh, grab a bottle of milk to go, and it takes these cookies to the next level. Granted, Anthony does not make the milk, but they make a great addition to those bad boys! I love anything peanut butter, but I think the white chocolate is my favorite. Man, I could eat a dozen of these myself, thank God my wife is is around to keep them out of reach. 
These cookies are are on the 7 x 7 Big Eat list for a reason. It's because they are AWESOME! Get your butt to the Mission and get some cookies already!
author: Miguel V.

description:
I am maintaining a significant weight loss. One of the pleasures that had to go permanently was baking. If you're one of those lucky people who can make cookies without eating a cup of dough first, you won't understand this new rule. If you are, you will be able to understand what a blessing Anthony's Cookies has been to me. 

For a start, their cookies are the best! Fresh, soft, crispy, and for the waist-minded, small. There are a diversity of flavors in addition to the classic chocolate chip (I love the toffee nut)... be sure to check the website for the baking schedule because not everything is available every day. 

I love to drop by here on my splurge days. Best of all, the walk burns off the 3 cookies I buy.
author: Alex N.

description: Really, Super awesome cookies! I'm normally not the biggest fan of cookies but, I really, truly honestly love sweets! These cookies just hit the spot, like they've brought tears of joy to my eyes! They're perfect in every aspect. Also, I've met the owner, Anthony on my second visit and he's a super awesome and personable guy. He's also very gracious as well! I highly recommend these cookies since, they're simply the best and the staff are really awesome! Hoorah for great cookies!
author: Jean Luke C.

description:
great toffee cookie, very good oatmeal.  chocolate chip has a nice melty effect.  chocolate oatmeal was not as good as the rest.  i like that none of the cookies are crispy, they are all rich and soft.

they have a great sampling policy.  you can try a generous portion of anything.
author: Di Yin L.

description:
Anthony, you beautiful man. If I saw you that day, I'd personally thank you for establishing this wonderful place.

First off, I hate sweets 95% of the time. Yeah, go figure. I hate when things are super sweet. I always have to constantly drink water and it burns my throat... haha. But that wonderful Saturday I really wanted cookies and so did the homies, so we decided on making the trip to Anthony's.

My boyfriend and I stood in line and decided to get a half dozen:  3 chocolate chip for him, 2 cookies & cream & 1 toffee chip for me. We were quickly served with a smile and sat down.

Here's my boyfriend's theory, "If the standard is amazing, this place is too." 

He's not a big fan of baked goods either, but I never seen him down chocolate chip cookies that quick. Neither did I expect to absolutely fall in love with these cookies. They're not even hot but they're melty on the inside? Still have a crunch on the outside but chewy on the inside? What in the world! Did I mention that it's the perfect amount of sweetness? Not too sweet, and not too bland. This is like the A-Team of cookies. 

Definitely check this place out! 5 stars.
author: Krissel A.

description:
My gf is a chocolate chip cookie MONSTER, yet she loves the Cookies and Cream cookies here. But this review is not about her tastes. 

Randomly driving around the city, we walked in here out of pure cookie haze cravings. I really wanted to try their oatmeal raisin cookies, because, well, OATMEAL RAISIN ROCKS!

Let me tell you something! That cookie blew me away, I make some pretty darn good oatmeal raisin cookies, but man did theirs blow mine outta the water. Def a place to get your cookie cravings demolished, but expect to have withdrawals as you will want to come by here everyday to get your cookie on!
author: Eric A.

description:
Had my first experience with these cookies today and I have to say they are probably the best cookies I've had in a while. Tried the macadamia nut and cookies and cream.

I definitely recommend. Might not be a bad idea to take a box over to bi-rite and try the combination of the cookie and ice-cream.
author: Emmanuel P.

description:
Anthony's Cookies are awesome, love love the new dark chocolate cookies they've added (Dark chocolate chip and Double Dark Chocolate Chip) to the menu. The cookies are consistently delicious, fresh, crispy yet soft, the perfect size (so that I end up eating 6 in one sitting). 

I've brought Anthony's Cookies to work for meetings, to baby showers, birthday celebrations, to my girlfriends when they need a special treat, I've even flown home to the midwest with a box to share with my parents, and everyone ALWAYS raves about them. They're not too sweet, the fresh flavors of the ingredients come through with each bite.

In addition to the delicious cookies, what really stands out for me is the OUTSTANDING customer service. Anthony really pours his heart into the business and he cares a lot about his customers. No matter how popular the business has gotten, Anthony is always still right there, in the kitchen, with his bakers, baking away, helping out and talking with his customers. He's humble, sincere and all heart.

Okay my favorites are:
*Peanut Butter (its like eating a spoonful of peanut butter straight from the jar, so amazing)
*Walnut chocolate chip (I've seriously eaten 4 within a 15 minute period without blinking an eye)
*Double Dark Chocolate chip (such an indulgence)
author: Nicole K.

description:
My alter ego most definitely has to be the Cookie Monster. I love all types of cookies from Mrs. Fields to Chewy Chips Ahoy (in the microwave for 15 seconds) to a number of different bakeries everywhere i visit. When given the opportunity to visit Anthony's Cookies by my friend Jeremy, I jumped at the chance. Before getting there he said that he did not want to over hype the cookie and let the cookie speak for itself, so I really went in there very skeptical. 

I love eating my cookies with a glass of cold milk, but unfortunately they ran out of milk. Instantly I thought of the negative feedback I can write on here. How is a Cookie Shop going to run out of milk? 

After tasting the Peanut Butter cookie, I had an out of body experience that felt very much euphoric. I have never personally have tried drugs before but I would like to think that this is the feeling that crack addicts MUST have. We ordered 24 cookies and finished them all in a day and now we are going back to order 24 more. Anthony, who was in the shop baking himself, has successfully unleashed the cookie monster. 

To get a 5 star rating after not having milk in stock is more then a 5 star rating. This is a must go for all cookie lovers. ALL of their cookies taste as if the Virgin Mary was baking cookies herself in the oven in the sky, while the cookies are delivered by angels falling form heaven. The staff is great, the store is nice and clean and they will forever recieve a visit from me when I am in this area. 

Anthony, when I get married, I will send my wife to get baking lessons from you. You truly are a saint.
author: allen p.

description: UPDATE 6 JULY 10: cookies are now $1.25 each (up from 95 cents). This is actually enough of a price increase for me to consider NOT coming here anymore. Cookies are still tasty, but I'm cheap!
author: Allison P.

description:
If you want a chewy, soft, warm cookie this is the place to go.  

Cookies and Cream is my favorite!!!!

Cookies prices range $6 dollars for half dozen or $1.15 each.
author: Angela W.

description:
I have not tried a cookie from Anthony that I don't like. When I go in I just tell em to give me assorted & surprise me. These cookies are always always so tasty. Wouldn't buy cookies anywhere else. 

simply AMAZING =)
author: Janai F.

description:
Hands down the best cookies I ever had! 

My faves! 
Toffee Chip
Cookies N Creme 
White Chocolate Chip
author: Arlynn A.

description:
Yesterday afternoon, my cousin was telling about a bomb cookie place in the city.  I was like, okay cool..."another" place to check out in the city, which I probably will never get to since I'm rarely in the city.  But, she tells me she's bringing a couple dozen cookies to a family party that night, okay cool, things are looking good!

Get to the party and she walks in with a plain white cake box.  I don't know what it was but our other cousins instantly said, "Is that from Anthony's?" while they're trying to attack the box.  By the time I got to the box, there were only a few left, I got a chocolate chip and toffee chip.

The cookies didn't look fab by any means, almost a little small compared to Mrs. Fields but one bite into the choco chip...soooo delish!  I savored every little nibble of that cookie until I realized, I still had the toffee chip!   I took a bite into that, oh double snap...talk about a simple yet awesome cookie!  I can't explain it but, it was unlike any other toffee cookie I've ever had.

My cousin said they were a $1.25 a pop or $11.00 for a dozen.  I think that's pretty worth it for a great cookie.  (Eff you "Hot Cookie"...selling cookies by the pound!)

So FML...Anthony's Cookies is just one more reason for me to drive into the city....unless I just whine at my cousins. ;)
author: Nick D.

description:
Oreo cookies inside of a baked cookie?! You had me at hello. 

Damn. So I came here after I went to Ike's and what a way to finish off a mini foodie day in the city. The staff, anthony was there!, was super friendly and smiled the whole time. The cashier took my order, got my cookies, boxed it up, and even put string around the box since i was stuffing it in my backpack. 

Food: I ordered 6 cookies and cream, 3 whole wait oatmeal raisin, and 3 white chocolate. All were delicious! When I say WERE, its because I already ate them all. LOL! 2 dozen for me next time!

Misc: They dont serve all flavors all the time. Call in and ask before hand. There is a bike stand right outside the door. Everyone is super nice! Prices include tax. They have a picnic bench inside so you can enjoy your cookies!
author: AJ d.

description: I hate to be the odd woman out, but I did not consider these cookies to be a 5 star quality. I was here on a Saturday around 3 and my fellow sweets lover companion and I waited for 15 minutes to grab some cookies. 15 minutes was a long time considering there were only 3 people in line ahead of us. Next, the prices. The cookies are $1.25 each and they are small. We tried the German chocolate cake, cookies & cream, cinnamon spice, and a peanut butter. Honestly, none of them left me thinking "Hell yes!" The cinnamon spice was pretty good, but the others were alright. The German chocolate was actually a bit bland. I would not deter others from coming here as I can tell by the high ratings this place gets, other sweet toothed people seem to love it, but I have had better (i.e. Gregorie's in Oakland and SF Baking Company on Powell).
author: Kim S.

description:
I got to meet Anthony at a wedding I attended a while back and must say that he's a pretty cool guy. What makes him even better are the cookies he bakes. His cookies were the most delicious wedding favors! The cookies were so good that I couldn't help but eat other people's cookies at my table and at other tables around me. 

Hmm.. I think I need to feed my Anthony's Cookies fix right about... NOW!!
author: Raquel T.

description:
The cookies and cream cookie lives up to its name. Also had the chocolate chip, chocolate whip and walnut, and their version of the snickerdoodle, the cinnamon spice, all equally good and worth trying. I prefer my cookies chewy in the middle and crunchy around the edges. Anthony's are all-around chewy cookies but I still loved them. 

Also I think it's so cute how they sell their milk in those old-fashion glass jars that milkmen used to deliver.

Be sure to check the website to see what flavors are offered since they change day-to-day. 

++ They sell bags of Blue Bottle Coffee here. Cool.
author: Annie L.

description:
Omg this place is cookie monster heaven.

Their flavors are interesting, great customer service, cute little bakery... I really liked it. :D I got a box of a dozen for my family's barbeque, and my boyfriend and I ended up eating 6 of them XD THEY WERE SOOOO GOOD.

When I bit into the white chocolate chip cookie, at first I thought "hmm this tastes kind of like a costco cookie," but when I took the time to savor the DOUGH more than the white chocolate chips, I realized that I was sorely mistaken. The dough is amazing, soft, chewy, homemade, delicious, and everything I could ever want in a cookie. Way better than costco.

The bf is a total cookie lover, and he said the cookies were really good. :D Now I know what I'm gonna buy him when he gets mad at me~
author: Jade R.

description: Part of me feels like I shouldn't even write a review. There should be no hesitation about trying the cookies at Anthony's. Hands down, THE BEST cookies I have ever had. Aside from my grandma's of course. The line can be long at times, but if you go during the week, there doesn't seem to be super long lines. The parking sucks here, but that is to be expected considering it's in the Mission. The service is awesome. The cookies that are absolutely to die for are: cookies and cream, toffee chip, white chocolate chip, chocolate chip, walnut chip, candied pecan chip...... why am I rambling on? Try all of them!! They're all fantastically baked to perfection!!
author: Lauren D.

description: 5 stars for delicious, rich, fresh cookies and super sweet staff. Asked what their "top 3" cookies were and they suggested cookies and cream, chocolate chip and toffee chip. Def did not disappoint. Cookies are small, and $1.25 each. Yikes. But I suppose it's the cost to use high quality ingredients, pay high SF rent/mortgage and treat your staff well. Understood. I probably will not buy them for myself again, but in the future if anyone needs to pay me back, I will ask them for payments in Anthony's Cookies. Thank you.
author: Lisa H.

description:
Struggled with the decision between 3.5 stars and 4 and decided not to be such a tight ass with the last 1/2 star.  Why's that?  Cause they are excellent cookies, made with love and with quality ingredients.  The service is always cheerful and the counterperson is always willing to pluck a cookie off of the baking rack and chop it up for tasting.  They are not giant cookies, rather a perfect snack-size.  The selections vary daily and since they're fresh, quantity varies though quality is always consistent.

Of course it was much easier to avoid eating random cookies on any random day I might be walking down Valencia before I noticed this tiny shop - but that's hardly their fault.  You can say it's my fault you're eating more cookies now that you're aware it exists :(  

Here's what you have to tell yourself:  you're gonna hit every secondhand/boutique clothing shop from 25th street to 17th and that's going to be about 1 mile, which might burn around 110 calories which is like... erm, let's call that 1/2 a cookie!  
Mkay.  If you think strictly in those terms, you're lost to the idea of allowing yourself one of life's little surprise treats!  But at the very least it's a pleasant fiction in which you can believe in and employ to get that cookie itch scratched without the simple joy being diluted with guilt.  You know what I mean.

Oatmeal anything - yum.
Cookies and cream - yumm!
Semi-sweet chocolate - yummm!  

I could go on like this but I'll spare you frothing at the mouth.
author: Ben S.

description:
milk and cookies are one of my favorite desserts or comforts after a rough day. So when i saw Anthony's on my top 100 list I was happy to try them out and venture to the mission to find them. After my first bite about an hour ago - I knew I'd want more and will take the trip again even if it's not on any of my to-do lists. The place is cute and simple. They have the menu on the wall with all of their optoins, but on the counter theres a small one with what they have available at that moment. Two of the flavors I was excited to try was banana and also the toffee chip, neither of which they had, no big deal we'll just come to try them another time. 
So here's the breakdown of what we did get to try so far...
Peanut butter - hum, kinda small and no tell tale signs of a normal peanut butter cookie, you know the criss-cross fork marks? Anyways, it was tasty but would probably be a 4 star in my book. 
Cookies and cream - Excellent. It's a totally new taste for me and i really liked it. Glad we got 6 of them, will get to have some tomorrow too :)
Cinnamon and sugar - another excellent one. More cinnamonie than a snickerdoodle, but thats the closest to compare it to. I really liked it, it soaked up milk very quickly but didn't become soggy. 
semi-sweet chocolate chip - still in the box - will update tomorrow once weve tried it
oatmeal cranberry - i usually adore oatmeal cookies - preferrable for breakfast with come hot cafe-con-leche. And this was a good one. But it was a bit too crunchy for my taste. Not as soft as the other flavors.
white chocolate chip - same story as the other choc chip, guess we werent in the chocolate chip mode today
author: Audrey V.

description: There's no doubt that these are great cookies. The right balance between crunchy and chewy. Definitely has that homemade goodness. I had the cookies and cream [7x7], semi-sweet chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, and the chocolate chip with walnuts. All of them dangerously delicious. I must say though, I have had cookies before that have dropped me to my knees in tears, thus only the 4-stars.
author: Mike T.

description:
zOmg!what?toffee chip, walnut chip, cookies n cream, and peanut butter cookies?!?!?

Got my first taste of this delish, melt in your mouth cookies a few months back when my friend came back from frisco. One bite and I was hooked!I couldn't help myself but devour the half dozen cookies I received in 2 days! I knew I had to go back next trip up north!Finally!we were up north over the holiday. My future sis in law (Joy B., whose reviews are the biznezz on evrything!) and I went Christmas Eve. Luckily, we made it in time before they closed and each got a dozen cookies of our liking! 

These cookies are ahhhhhmazing! Fresh, warm, and uber soft! They have their daily choices of cookies such as toffee chip, cookies n cream, etc. Each day they have their special cookies for the day like walnut chip on Mondays and peanut butter on Thursdays. Check out the board in store to see what cookies are available. Besides the yummy in my tummy but not to my thighs cookies, staff in this place is awesome, super nice, and patient!!

Of course before coming back to LA we had to get out fix one more time! The bfs favs are cookies n cream, which he made me get a dozen for himself!LOL

I wish Anthony's Cookies had a store in LA!
author: joanie g.

description:
The store is clean, cute & quaint, but the location is quite hidden.  The store front sign doesn't really help distinguish what type of store it is.  If it wasn't for the 7x7 list, I would never have discovered this yummy place on my own.  

The cookies taste awesome and are very fairly priced.  A half dozen cookies are $5, so you can sample most of the flavors they have available.  I've tried bits & pieces of the cookies & cream (recommended on the 7x7), toffee, white chocolate, whole wheat chocolate-chip, and banana.  They are all sooooo good and it would be so easy to overdose on these cookies, especially with a nice tall glass of milk, if I didn't practice some self-control.  My favorites are the toffee and whole wheat choco-chip: soft, chewy, and delish!!! 

The cashier was very friendly, and even very enthusiastic about their cookies.  It's refreshing that he took pride in their quality & that they are always baked fresh!  The next time I crave for cookies I am going straight back to Anthony's!!!! :)
author: Joy A.

description:
Ok so a little expensive for cookies, but worth every dollar. These cookies are AMAZING. I personally love the toffee ones. 

My friend Ben is usually the one who makes the drive over the city to get these, he has me hooked.
author: Jenn B.

description:
Oh Anthony, YOU are my guilty pleasure, oh yes you are...

I heard about this place from a random facebook page my friend sent to me about two years ago. I remember the very first time I went there, there stood Anthony, with a god-like ethereal glow. Not only he can make great cookies, but he is a sweetheart as well (IS he single? should I ask!?). 

Love the simplicity of this store. Clean, easy to read menu on the wall, and assortment of perfect sized milk cartons, and they also have Four Barrel Coffee. I try to go when the kids are still in school (which is about a block down) so I can have a peaceful nom session with my non-fat milk as I sit on the picnic bench. I LOVE that picnic bench. Makes my cookie eating experience so much more worth it I tell ya. I feel like a kid on a picnic (albeit the fact I am indoors).

Some may think $1.25 for a cookie smaller than the palm of your hands is a bit much, but DAMN I am more than willing to pay $11 for a dozen cookies than $2.99 for a 30 pack of Chips Ahoy ANY DAY. The taste is night and day, try it and the next time you find yourself wandering in the Nabisco aisle at your local supermarket you'll see yourself turning your nose up, whip your hair and catwalk away.

My favorite: Cookies & Cream. SRSLY. 

if you like chewy, fresh, and moist cookies, look no further. Anthony has got you covered.
author: Chiaki N.

description:
Yes please.  I love the cookies, and I think they're pretty reasonably priced, two dozen for around $20.  

These aren't Newmans Own where you go home sit down and shove the whole box in your mouth. 

 Anthony's cookies are best eaten 1 or 2 at a time.  Try eating a double chocolate and a peanut butter cooky at the same time.  HEAVEN.  

My top pics:
Cookies and Cream
Oatmeal Rasin ** (double stars on this one)
and plane ol choco chipy
author: Princess T.

description:
so these cookies are awesome. like pure awesomeness. it seriously deserves every accolade it has, though I do hope that someday they can add vegan cookies to the menu as well. 

i had the cookies and cream, which tasted like a little piece of heaven (who knew there was a cookies and cream COOKIE?); the oatmeal walnut chip, which was so flavorful and what you imagine a good oatmeal walnut chip cookie would taste like (we've all had the ones that laste like cardboard); and the dark chocolate chip, which has bittersweet undertones that make it an unsung hero. seriously, after i finished the cookies, i was so depressed because i wanted more. 

i'm actually glad the cookies are on the smaller side - they make you appreciate and savor every bite even more. 

prices are pretty cheap compared to most other specialty bakery stores - $1.25/cookie + a $1.50 surcharge on the entire order (for the milk jars or something). 

the store itself smells so incredible, and the staff is super friendly. 

i will recommend this place to everyone! and i'm definitely heading back there soon - so many more flavors to try, and old flavors to enjoy! :)
author: Julia H.

description: Anthony's is my gold standard for cookies-- a soft, moist, chewy center and a perfectly crisp shell; the taste of quality ingredients. That combination in a thick cookie creates an incredibly satisfying mouth feel (that's what she said). Ignore that I'm a child and go get an Anthony's.
author: Diana Y.

description:
I saw some of friends coming here so I thought to give it a try. I'm not that big of a sweets fan anymore but did end up getting 1/2 dozen as part of a surprise for my boyfriend and I must say, the cookies are a bit small and flat, but they have great flavor complete w/ a chewy center. My honey loved them.

Might I add, the service is excellent and superb and I rarely say that. The guy who helped me was sooo nice, I felt obliged to tip him $2 and didn't regret it. If you're ever in the neighborhood, you definitely need to give this place a try. You'll be happy you did.
author: Julie L.

description:
"These cookies are DIVINE!"

My sister exclaimed as she sprayed cookie crumbs all over the car while she attempted to simultaneously stuff three cookies in her mouth while extolling the virtue of these heavenly baked goods.  

I had heard so much about Anthony's Cookies that when my cookie monster sister came into town I just had to have her try them since I think most cookies are just fine (I mean they're no donuts) so we purchased four cookies for testing purposes and here are our findings:

* Chocolate Chip Walnut: AMAZING! Said in a sing-song voice while picturing angels. This is what earned them the divine. 

* Toffee Chip: DELICIOUS! A little flat but still really good. 

* Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin: Yummy but whole wheat has no place in cookies. We're eating a freaking cookie so don't try to sneak any whole wheat in there. 

* Cinnamon Sugar Cookie: Mmmmm was really good but it was kind of a trick because it was a molasses cookie. 

My sister keeps asking when we're going by here again. 

Is Anthony's Cookies by your house? No.
Is Anthony's Coookies by your office? No. 
Is Anthony's Cookies by where we are going to dinner? No. 
Is Anthony's Cookies on the way to the airport? No. 

She's turned into a cookie fiend! Thanks to Anthony's Cookies I'm going to have to take my sister to the Mission for a couple of hits before she goes back to Seattle.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Man I always thought subway cookies were the greatest thing on earth. Then I tried cookies from Anthony's and now I have this whole new appreciation for the art of baking cookies. All this place has done is spoil me. The cookies and cream cookie was off da chain! They have many other choices like toffee, macadamia, and peanut butter but the cookies and cream were my personal favorite.

The only bad thing is that I gotta make the trek back and try all these other assorted cookie flavors! Give this place a try if you want to treat yourself. You deserve it.
author: Dave N.

description:
Most delicious cookie I've eaten in a long time.

Size is just big enough to be filling but not so large as to make me hate myself.

A+++++ would eat again.
author: dominic d.

description: I was introduced to these awesome cookies by my coworker who bought 2 dozens of them to work to share. I chose the peanut butter one and OMG these cookies are the best cookies I've ever taste in my life!!! Those that know me knows that I have a sweet tooth and I LOVE cookies! I immediately looked it up on yelp and told my boyfriend that night that we MUST go to this place in SF!! :)
author: Julisa L.

description:
Great cookies!!! I discovered this place when I lived in the Mission and I was dating this guy that played basketball with Anthony. What makes its so great not only because the cookies are amazing,but the fact that you can smell them a block away.

One afternoon,I was taking scroll through the mission with this guy I used to date and I tell him I need something sweet and I that I want to go to La Copa Loco(My favorite gelato place in the city). He looks at me and says why don't we get some cookies? My response: "Umm...no I want gelato, if I wanted to cookies I'd just make them." This whole time I fail to notice that we are walking away from the gelato spot and half to Anthony's Cookies.

As we are walking he is telling me about Anthony and how I really should support black business in the city since they are so very few of them,all of his points very valid,still I wanted gelato but then I smelled the delightful aroma of cookies!! We got there I was introduced to Anthony,whom is a really cool and very humble. 

Now for the cookies. I'm a huge chocolate lover but some recommended that I try to the cookies and cream cookie and now I thank them for that suggestion. The cookies seem to always be warm whenever I go in there to get to order some. They are moist and delicious and extremely affordable. 

Highly recommend this spot. Anthony keep up the great work!!
author: Nia W.

description:
By far the best cookies I've ever had on planet Earth. Personal favorites include Toffee, Chocolate Chip and Cookies 'N Cream.

Bring a dozen or two to a party and blow some minds. 

Anthony's Cookies is proof that god loves us and wants us to be happy.
author: Ethan B.

description:
I decided to venture out in my area in search of some cookies to satisfy my sweet tooth. Upon searching in yelp, I came across Anthony's. After reading the reviews, I decided to try the cookie's and Cream cookie myself. 

The shop is quaint and cute. I got the cookies and cream, cinnamon spice and a regular chocolate chip cookie.The cookies are just the right softness and as I bit into the first bite, I knew that I was going to finish the cookies before I got home. 

Yep. I finished them before I got home which was a 5 minute walk.
author: Sophie S.

description:
+ adorable glass jars of milk for purchase

+ nice variety of cookie flavors each day (around 6 to 9)

+ you get to see the ovens and everything...I love exhibition kitchens!

Now on to the cookies themselves.  I tried the cinnamon sugar (very good, extra cinnamony which I like), chocolate chip (eh, it was good but not THAT good, I wouldn't get it again but it's not like I spit it out or anything...def ate every last crumb)...and last but certainly not least....the cookies & cream!!  Seriously, it was the best cookie I've ever had.  It had normal dough (like in a chocolate chip cookie) but instead of chocolate chips it had oreo cookie powder blended inside.  

Heaven in my mouth.
author: Bunny R.

description:
When cookies are your one and only thing and your name is not Mrs. Field's, you've got to be pretty confident about your cookies to make a shop that sells no other goodies.

RIGHTFULLY SO BECAUSE THESE COOKIES ARE PRETTY BOMB. 
Toffee + Cookies and Cream Cookie, check it.

However, one thing that bothers me: they have these stamp card things where if you buy a half dozen, you get a stamp and blah blah blah, but I go in and I buy like two dozen every time but I only get one stamp. ONE STAMP. EVERY TIME. Shouldn't I get 4 stamps? I'm not about to ask them for three additional stamps, I got some pride in me...but still, it's the principle!
author: Tiffany N.

description: Anthony's has a smattering of cool flavors like Candied Pecan, Dark Chocolate Chip, and German Chocolate (which are awesome).  To me the best cookies here are the standard flagship favorites chocolate chip and peanut butter.  Amazing cookies, awesome service and old school milk cartons like the cafeteria lady used to give me ;)
author: Josh B.

description: Best cookie and cream flavored cookies that I have ever tried!!!!! I buy them 20 at a time and have been here 3 times on my 5 day trip to San Fran. (It is not in my area) Make sure you close that door upon entering. It smells heavenly. =]
author: Adrina W.

description: You wouldn't expect to find a place like Anthony;s in this eck of the woods, but their cookies are great.  Good selection but I am a fan of the cookies and cream.....
author: King L.

description:
I got a dozen cookies and brought them back to Albuquerque. I gave my friend a peanut butter one without telling him anything about Anthony's. He took 2 bites and I asked him how he liked it, he said, "THAT is a really good cookie". Later he said, "That's in the top 5 cookies I've ever had". 

As for my opinion, those whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip cookies should be used to get information out of terror suspects. Waterboarding? Totally stupid idea. Interrogation? Useless. I suspect giving them an Anthony's cookie with the promise of more Anthony's cookies and they would be cookie dough in your hands. 

I was absolutely in love with the fact that the the people baking and selling the cookies were young, hot, super nice guys. It was the icing on the cookie.
author: Kim B.

description:
Cookie!!!  Anthony (whoever that is) sure knows how to make 'em!! :)

The place is sort of out of the way, but I'd make a special trip just to get some more!  The inside is really adorable!  The kitchen/employee area is lined with glass milk bottles!
I was sort of disappointed that they didn't have all their cookie flavors available..I had wanted to try the banana walnut cookie.  It's OK though cause what I did end up getting was fantastic!! :D

Walnut chocolate chip YUM
Cinnamon YUM

It's pricey and they have some sort of frequent buyer card thing, but I had no idea what the guy was talking about when he was explaining how it worked o.O
author: Kei H.

description:
The cookies in Anthony's Cookies are absolutely delicious. Let's get that out of the way first. The problem is, it takes so long to get served in here, I've had to quit trying to get them.

The service is mind-numbingly slow and you get the feeling the people at the counter have never actually received any training. I thought at first that I just happened to be going on off days... But every day is an off day if there's one or more people in front of you (seriously - having one person in front of you can create a ten minute wait). 

Example: when someone asks for a sample, the person at the counter obliges, but rather than then serving the next person in line while the people doing the sampling are making a decision and having a discussion, the person at the counter just always stands there and gawps at the people doing the sampling, while a long line forms behind them. I have seen this occur more than once. 

Also, when you finally do get to the front, they move so slow, it still takes unfeasibly long to get anything. 

I'm sad to say it, but the only time I'll even entertain the idea of going to Anthony's now is if I look through the window on my way home and see absolutely no-one in there. The cookies cease to be a joy when the service is so snail-paced.
author: Rae A.

description:
I had Anthony's cookies right after indulging in some Bi-Rite ice cream! 

mmmmmm...better than sex.

I'm such a little slut for tasty desserts, I would let Bi-Rite and Anthony use and abuse my mouth alll dammmnn dayyyy
author: Alvin T.

description:
Hands Down the Best Cookies in the Bay Area! 

I tried them all and you seriously can't go wrong. They are melt in your mouth delicious. Nothing makes a bad day end happier than with a box of cookies from Anthony's. 

Favorites:

1. Cookies and Cream Cookie
2. Toffee 
3. Double Chocolate 

Go Find Your Cookie!
author: Spencer W.

description: Best cookie in SF, and perhaps anywhere. Little small (so less guilt eating one!) but perfectly constructed balance of chocolate, dough, and sweetness. Recommend going there and trying them fresh with some milk.
author: Rohit G.

description: Hmmm, where shall I start with this review... I know, with the cookies size! Let me just say that the cookies here are EXTREMELY TINY! I am one of those people who like their cookies bigger than the size of two quarters. I have to say, I was pretty darn disappointed. Now for the taste - they were on the sweeter side but I really enjoyed the variety. The menu includes many different kind of flavors which is always a plus! If you do decide I go here, you must try the Cookies and Cream cookie!! It is an absolute must because it's SO UNIQUE! I can't really say much about he other flavors because they didn't made that much of an impression to me. Over all I would recommend this place  only for the experience. I wouldn't exactly come back unless I was craving cookies.
author: Susie N.

description: The best cookies ever/ I usually get the warmest cookies i can get my hands on. My son and I make frequent trips here.
author: amit s.

description:
On my 7X7 Mission, after reading that you can buy Anthony's Cookies at the Real Foods in the Marina I went on my merry way and popped over to Real Foods.

The Cookies and Cream cookie was awesome, super moist and tasted like an oreo post milk-dunk. I will definitely be back to try the semi-sweet chocolate chip and have myself another few Cookies and Cream cookies... yum!
author: Sarah A.

description:
I'm hanging out at my cousin's house & her husband (big ups cuzin!) comes home with a smallish white box. This is a burger & fries kinda guy so I was curious to see what he had in the dainty little box that is pretty much reserved for bakeries. He tells me they are from Anthony's Cookies on Valencia, which I've never heard of. He's generous enough to let me try a few & I'm thinking, "HOMYGAWD, am I in trouble. These badboys are GUUUD." I had the toffee chip (I'm telling you, I love toffee & I love these cookies) and a semi sweet chocolate chip. I am a milk chocolate cookie kind of girl all the way, but the semi sweet was so rich & sweet, it was enough to make me turn my back on milk chocolate (at least for a few minutes.) 

 These are the kind of cookies I wish every cookie was like: chewy, sweet & the perfect size. I've never set foot in Anthony's & I haven't had another one of his cookies since that first time a few months ago, but I wouldn't mind (like, at all) if one of those little white boxes magically appeared at my cousin's house again *hint hint guys*
author: Fancypants X.

description: BANGIN' COOKIES!  Love the Cookies and Cream cookies! Definitely a must try! They even have a gluten-free menu now! Make sure to check out their cookie schedule card because they sometimes have some seasonal flavors only made on certain days!
author: Heidi S.

description:
Everyone and their mom has rightfully been raving about this adorable indie cookie spot (with milk for sale and jugs as decor) on a less-trafficked spot of Valencia. We made a point to visit one day before making dinner (yeah, I know, what appetite?).

At the end of the day, Anthony was the last man standing (joking about how the boss never knows where anything is) and he couldn't have been nicer. He treated us to some warm, delicious samples of his homemade cookies, and we left with a half-dozen (should have gotten more) assortment. The cookies-and-cream cookie is still my favorite, and the toffee and cinnamon sugar were close behind.

I will definitely be back.
author: Tara R.

description:
So I've walked by this place several times already and I've never gone in. It's only a block and a half from where I live and never botheedr to go in even though I've thought about checking this place out. I figured it's another cookie joint, but then again, you don't find many cookie joints in the City...at least not in my 'hood. I finally went in over a week ago....NYE to be exact. I needed to satisfy my pms-cravings and wanted to indulge in one last thing before the new year, so I settled on cookies =). Good choice 'cuz these, by far, are the best cookies I've eaten. And here I thought Mrs. Field's cookies were yummy. Anthony's cookies are slightly smaller and $$ for the size, but they are just delish!!!

I bought three different kinds. They're $1.25 a cookie and I didn't want to buy a lot in case I didn't like them....;-). I settled on the cookies n' cream (popular one according to Yelp), the toffee chip, and the candied pecan chocolate chip. I ate half the toffee chip when I got home and put the rest away. Okay, I hid them from myself, but  I couldn't resist and ate the other half of the toffee chip and half of the candied pecan with choc. chip. and saved the cookies n' cream and half of the candied pecan to eat the next day. Surprisingly enough, I resisted 'til the next day. I had to. Anthony's was going to be closed from Jan 1-8, so I knew I wouldn't be able to go back for more cookies for another week!!! Just as well, 'cuz I know I would've been stopping by this place on my way home from BART every evening =). These cookies are irresistible. Crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. Texture is perfect!! 

Oh, if you buy six, they're $6, and $12 for a dozen. Worth buying six or more than just one, two, or three. You just have to be able to resist eating them all in one sitting =D. Menu changes daily (I believe), but the popular ones, like the cookies n' cream, are always on the daily menu. Now I have to go back and go down the list of cookies to try. Hmmm...if I buy six, then I can eat one a day....yeah right!! =D
author: Neni E.

description: These cookies are heaven. They have a wonderful texture that is perfectly chewy and crunchy. I thought I made good cookies, but these cookies define what it means to be a cookie! My roommate loves to bring home Anthony's Cookies to share, and they are always highly enjoyable and gone in a matter of minutes. Anthony's has a lot of great flavors of cookies and I have not found one that I do not like. YUM!
author: Marieke V.

description:
Dear Anthony,

Your cookies make me break every diet promise I have made myself since the beginning of the New Year.  I buy not one, not two, but as many as I can of your delectable morsels.  Walnut chocolate chip for when I feel traditional, Oatmeal raisin for my granola side and cookies and cream for my inner child.
I diligently pack them away in the kitchen and get into bed, resolved to save some for the morning.  After half an hour of tossing and turning I realize your cookies are keeping me from sleep.
I then wake, zombie walk to the kitchen and ingest said cookies, allowing for the most peaceful of rests.
Thanks a lot Anthony ;)
author: Sheila Y.

description:
The cookies here are infinitely excellent. Crispy on the outside and chewy in the middle. They taste like they're fresh out of the oven even after they cool down. I don't know how Anthony does it but he's a cookie genius. I went there last night and told Anthony it was my first time there. He gave me a few extra cookies to make sure I got to try all the best ones -- nice!

World-beating cookies and friendly people making them. You can't not love Anthony's Cookies.
author: Aaron V.

description: After All the comments about  Anthony's cookie, I finally went to try. I thought it was soso. Not as good as what I expected. It was alilttle too sweet.
author: Doro C.

description: I had the cookies and cream cookie and well I have to say it was good but I have had better. Don't get me wrong it's a good cookie but I am not sure why it is on 7 by 7's list. The cookie did have the crunchy outside and chewy middle which was really yummy. I preferred the toffee chip cookie.
author: Eve C.

description:
I am not much for sweets as eats, but these cookies are the exception.

My 4 favs are Oatmeal Raisin with or without the chocolate chips,  Toffee Chip, Double Chocolate with Walnuts and Cookies and Creme.

YUMMY!!!
author: Lisa M.

description:
Anthony's Cookies are just okay. JUST OKAY.  There--I said it--at the risk of becoming a pariah on Yelp.

They are just okay but they are GOOD.  How could that be?  Because my tongue did not do ballet moves or somersault upon my first bite of the cookies or second or third.  Because I did not hear the loud symphony of Yelpers' rave reviews. They are  more of soft whispers and comforting like your grandma's soothing voice. Unfair to expect the above, right?  But that's what over-hype does to a Yelper.  Your mind plays tricks on you until you get your first bite.

Anthony's cookies are fresh and sweet. Nothing more than the other cookies I've had. And believe me, I've had many.  Some of Anthony's cookies were moist but not all.  I bit each cookie to taste each one like the COOKIE MONSTER that I am.  Then I've lost track of the taste despite drinking coffee in between.  

I spent my lunch time taking the BART to Anthony's storefront cookie house.  I almost missed it.  It's cute, rustic and cozy. You place your order at the counter.

There are 12 different cookies on the menu. I had:
1. 2 cookies and cream
2. Toffee Chip
3.  White Chocolate Chip (My favorite so far.  Creamy and moist.)
4. Whole Wheat Oatmeal Cranberry
5. Double Chocolate Chip with Walnuts

$5 for 1/2 a dozen

So, why 4 Stars but not 3 or 5? 
1. Because Anthony's cookies are good and they deserve 4 Stars.
2. Because they are fresh.
3. Because they are reasonably-priced.
4. Because Anthony and his staff are very nice.
4. Because they are MADE WITH LOVE and Anthony was generous enough to share that love.

Yes, I'm a fan but I refuse to give in to the over-hype by rating it more that I think it deserved. I like  Anthony's Cookies for what they are:  good, fresh cookies made by a local guy. 

I will continue to support him.
author: Leah E.

description:
I popped in here on a whim after a tiring but fun excursion to Bernal Heights Park. I thought that they might be closed, but when I tried the door, it opened. The workers were all clearly in the process of shutting down, but as I tentatively walked in, someone approached the cash register and told me what the remaining cookie options were. I got a cinnamon sugar...it was wonderful. Chewy, soft, crunchy all at once. The friendly and welcoming service made the experience even better.

I'm desperate to try the toffee chip. Why do I not live the Mission already?
author: Ada T.

description:
There is no need to write a long diatribe extolling the virtues of their cookies...

I can sum it up like this.

Fucking wow.

...oh, and The Man Himself, Anthony, delivered my cookies.
