Anthony...with your cookies and your personality...you will go very far indeed.  

Top notch sir.

Fucking wow.
author: Chris D.

description:
I'm hopping on Amanda B's bandwagon.  This place was phenomenal. 

My brother came to visit me from the East Coast and requested that we try this place on our "sweets tour" of the Mission district.  This was by far the highlight for me of our tour, and I think it was for him, too.

Each cookie we tried was delectably good....the perfect combination of sweet and gooey.  They were fresh, hot, delicious, and awesome when paired with the milk that they sell there.  In fact, these cookies' freshness lasted for several days afterward.  I tried the chocolate chip, toffee, cookies and cream, and white chocolate chip, and was pleased with the combination of ingredients in each.

Cookies and milk.  A simple concept, yes, but very, very well executed.  I will definitely be back again for more.....
author: Nina B.

description:
we ordered three dozen cookies for our wedding and they were also a hit.  hmmm does that mean we didn't order enough desserts?  since most of them were gone?

the ordering process is relatively easy.  i ordered cookies based on the day of the week.  emailed about questions.  then placed an order over the phone.
author: claudia y.

description:
Thank you Anthony! These are seriously the best cookies I've ever had. 

Yesterday I had the most intense craving for cookies. I plugged cookies in my iphone, it led me to Anthony's, I bought two cookies and cream cookies with a carton of milk. Craving satisfied....so satisfied. And while in line, I tried like a cookie and a half's worth of samples. So many wonderful flavors. Double chocolate is the one I'm going for next.

Man I want a cookie right now....
author: Francisco L.

description:
I'm all for sweet treats, but I have to admit, I 'm not the biggest fan of cookies. I don't think that $1.25 per cookie is worth it, but these cookies were some of the best I've ever had. That's not saying much either since my cookie experiences are limited to Mrs. Field's and Chips Ahoy. I bought half a dozen, thinking that I should have some variety. 

My order consisted of: 2 Cookies & Cream, 1 Classic Chocolate Chip, 1 White Chocolate Chip, 2 Toffee Chip. I knew my dad would want some so I got some of the same cookies. My favorite would have to be the cookies and cream. It was soft and a bit chewy, which is how I prefer cookies, and when you add that cookies and cream flavor...AWESOME. I liked all of the cookies honestly, but this place isn't in my area so I don't think I would go out of my way to come back. Yet, I still would recommend this place to anyone who hasn't been here.
author: Lauren L.

description: Anthony's Cookies is the spot to get your favorite cookie. The beauty about this place is,   if you asks for a sample,  you will receive it!!!   The cookies are so good that you can literally eat them by the dozen.
author: Akilah D.

description:
My brother recommended Anthony's Cookie to me because his son loves the Chocolate Chip Cookie... I picked up a few and was curious about the Cookies and Cream one... I tried my first cookie before Thanksgiving and throughout the holidays have been bringing them to several holiday parties!

The Cookies and Cream is by far one of zeeeee best!

I will say that I called the day I planned to purchase 5 dozen cookies and the person I spoke with said no problem they would have enough and I would not have to pre-order over the phone. When I got there the same person I spoke with on the phone did say that he couldn't give me all the ones I wanted cause he needed to keep a variety for other walk ins.  I reminded him that I called in advance and he stated it was not necessary to pre-order.

In any case, I still got my 5 actually 6 dozen ... But maybe for anyone ordering that much in quantity might need to pre-order over the phone.

All in all - I still adore their cookies! 

Did I mention that you must try the Cookies and Cream?
author: Caroline C.

description:
The last stop on a restaurant crawl (as opposed to a bar crawl), the smell of Anthony's Cookies was intoxicating as my friends and I stepped through the door.  As we were walking toward Anthony's (a group of five of us, mind you), we noticed a guy eye us and then hurriedly step into the store.  I guess he wanted to beat us to getting to those cookies!!

I wish I could say that my favorite was cookies-and-cream, but unfortunately I don't eat chocolate (;_;), so I was unable to try that particular item on The List, but I WILL say that the cinnamon sugar cookie, straight from the oven, is a soft, melt-in-your-mouth piece of heaven.  Even when your stomach is filled past capacity with seven other restaurants' worth of food, there's always room for one of Anthony's cookie.  I also had the whole wheat oatmeal cranberry cookie (I have a pic of it here: http://pineapplebread.wordpress.com/2010/05/25/the-list-an-8-restaurant-marathon-through-the-mission/).  Yummaay!

If this is the type of cookie that cookie monster eats, then . . . Look out, cookie monster, I'm coming after your job!
author: Jeanne Y.

description:
Why waste your time reading a long review when you could be standing in line at Anthony's?
 
The Cookies and Cream cookie is just plain AWESOME!
author: PukaShell s.

description:
The handsome young man who helps Anthony out at the cash register made me blush this weekend.  His eyes were so intense and his smile was so charming, I couldn't help but get flushed in the face...all the while the SO was standing next to me!  Even though the SO was totally oblivious to the entire situation, I felt guilty...

Sorta.

But I felt even more guilty for devouring the three cookies I bought in a matter of seconds.  Cookies and cream, banana walnut, and semi-sweet chocolate chip (listed in order of preference).  The cookies and cream cookie was by far my favorite of the three.  The banana walnut was a fun cakey cookie to eat, and I've had better chocolate chip cookies in my days.  The cookies were warm and fresh out of the oven, it was hard to resist from eating them all in one sitting.

I also loved how they enthusiastically greeted each customer who entered the store.  I'd definitely be back, just without the SO next time.  Just kidding...

Sorta.
author: Diane L.

description:
So, last night at the SF Symphony Opening Gala at SF City hall.... LITERALLY.... I mean literally...I tasted a little bit of Heaven in my mouth!!! You know the kind that you just want time to S--L---O-O-O-O-O-W, way down so that you can savor each ingredient and stretch the deliciousness out in your mouth?!?!?! Or the kind that you can keep da party going by tasting it again in your stomach like dogs do with their food.....RIiiiiight??  Yep, dat's the one!  

As you know, i'm not a dessert junkie...this place is T...D...F (ta die for) PEOPLES!!!   This wonderful woman from Anthony's cookies dropped off some cookies at our booth and seriously, folks...it had a savory-delicious-buttery-yumminess that just DIDN'T QUIT!!! 

She gave us another batch...and yet another...and hullo...I really tried to save them to snap a picture for yall...but seriously, I'm not ashamed that I dun ate 'em all up, even those crumbs!!! 

Oh, please believe...After posting this, i'm headed that way for some more of heaven's best!  Hullo!  Who knew little drops of heaven was sittin in our own SF after all?!?!  My request for Heaven??  Please have Anthony's cookies up there!!!!

1. Oreo Cookie
2. Toffee Chip
3. Chocolate Chip
4. Oatmeal

GO!  EAT! SMILE! BE JOLLY!  and eat a Cookies N Creme fer me! Holla!!!
author: Stephanie W.

description:
These cookies are simply amazing. I came here on 4.25.10 and ordered 14 cookies, yes 14, not 1 dozen because it was their anniversary, so they were giving out 2 free ones per person. The cookies are so soft and chewy that they melt in your mouth. I tried the cookies n cream, semi sweet-chocolate and white chocolate. These were all wonderfully delicious. I want to come back and try the other ones.

If you are keeping track, the other 11 cookies I gave away to my friends in So Cal. After 3 days of purchasing them, my friends said it was still deliciously soft and chewy. That how good Anthony's Cookies is. Go pick up you box NOW!
author: Marcus L.

description:
Best cookies I've had in a really long time!! And trust me, I have to have my cookie fix multiple times a week..

After having lunch in the city with my boyfriend, he was playing with a new 'yelp' application for his iPhone when we decided to search for nearby treats.

We found anthony's cookies rated highest an decided to check out the hype.  A cute new cookie shop with 2 friendly people behind the register.  The cashier was very friendly and easy to talk to, while the baker- Anthony was friendly as well, making sure to great us even though he is busy making the delicious cookies. 

We got a dozen cookies (3 double chocolate, 3 banana, 3 cookies n cream, 3 white chocolate macadamia).  We waited for a new batch of the double chocolate cookies to finish and the employees made sure to check in and make sure we were ok waiting.. We got the cookies and he even threw in a couple of toffee cookies for waiting/ my boyfriends bday!

Best cookies ever- perfect texture, GREAT price.  My favorite no doubt is the double chocolate with toffee as a close second place. My boyfriend enjoyed the cookies and cream most.

Will definately visit again!!
author: HeyPammy A.

description: Hands down the best cookies I've ever had in my life.
author: L R.

description:
Pretty impossible not to love this place. Maybe I'm just a sucker for the nostalgia of fresh baked cookies and milk, but I have to love a place that's bold enough to only sell these two things. This isn't Anthony's Bakery. Or Anthony's Sweets. This man sells cookies, so I knew they'd be damn good.

And they are. The flavor you go with really doesn't matter--it's all about the overall cookie execution. Thin enough that they aren't too doughy, but still rich and buttery with the perfect texture. And then there's Anthony himself. He was in the kitchen baking when we came by and encouraged us to sample anything we wanted. He seemed like an awesome guy who pretty much has life figured out. 

While I certainly can't say the same myself, I walked out of there with a half dozen cookies so things are looking pretty good for now.
author: Leah Y.

description: I'm obsessed with Anthony's Cookies and wholeheartedly believe that they make the BEST cookies in the world. Try the toffee chip and be prepared to have your life changed forever... :)
author: Em A.

description: Cookies were good. They were soft and fresh. Just wish they were a little bit bigger. I got the chocolate chip, cookies & cream, toffee chip, white chocolate chip and double chocolate chip. I will be back but probably won't go out of my way to get there.
author: Ayana K.

description:
Smell of lucsious sweetness emanated around the sidewalk right outside Anthony's.  I scurried off the bike and took my place in line next to all cookie lovers.  B asks what do you want?  I reply, a dozen, one of each please!  Did he really think I'd leave with anything less.

It's a simple space, bright and open.  Love how you can see the trays of piping hot cookies come right out of the oven.  My faves were Cookies and Cream, and Toffee Chip.  Everything was really great though.  Warm, chewy, great ingredients, chunks of chocolate that leave dark splotches on the corner of your mouth.  Now that's $9.25 well spent!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
to DROOL for.  literally.  i think I've actually started salivating the second that i stepped into this cute little cookie shop.

to prove how wonderful these cookies are, we came here last night to get a dozen cookies and while we were waiting, 2 little kids ran in as fast as they could so they could have a taste of these delightful cookies.  they literally broke through the door and almost slammed into the front waiting area screaming "SAMPLES SAMPLES, CHOCOLATE CHIP, TOFFEE CRUNCH, ANYTHING!!!"  So cute because you know what?  that's EXACTLY what was going through my head except I sometimes have to act like an adult...haha

We got 4 chocolate chip, 2 toffee crunch, 2 walnut chocolate chip and 2 cranberry walnut...  even the MOST healthy of the cookies were SO yummy.  I also enjoy the cookies n creme which should be on your to try list.  actually, they should ALL be on your to try list.  It was our host/hostess' first time trying Anthony's and the two of them alone ate half a dozen in one seating!  AMAZING.

Don't be fooled by the plain front door.  You walk in and the smells of freshly baked cookies and the taste to your tongue... YOU'VE STOPPED READING CUZ YOU'RE ON THE WAY THERE RIGHT NOW AREN'T YOU???
author: Sandy L.

description:
These are by far the best cookies I've ever eaten in my life. Anthony's Cookies makes Mrs. Fields look like McDonald's compared to Polker's burgers. Often times you will catch Anthony himself busy working in the back baking up his cookies. And he won't hesitate to greet you if he catches a break from his busy work. If he's not at the counter and working the register instead, he makes sure that you personally inspect the cookies as he places them in the box to make sure they are to your liking. The cookies are always fresh, soft, and never too sweet. 

My personal favorites: Semi-sweet chocolate chip, cookies / cream, and peanut butter. But you gotta go on Thursdays to get peanut butter.
author: Eric L.

description:
If you like soft and fresh cookies, you have got to come here! I heard about these cookes from a co-worker and realized that I live a block away so after work yesterday I decided to walk over and see what the fuss was about.  

The workers were both really friendly.  When I told them it was my first time they insisted on giving me samples of whatever cookie I wanted.  

I have to say, their cookies n'cream cookie is delicious but the one I love is the chocolate chip with walnuts.  Even though it might look smaller than other cookies, it is loaded with walnuts and chocolate chips.  It is definitely my favorite cookie.

I also really like how their packaging is so nice which makes it perfect to bring to parties or for small gifts.  

I am definitely going to be coming here for more cookies!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Anthony's cookies are such sweet little treats!  

I got a half dozen for 5 bucks: 2 semi sweet chcolate, 1 white chocolate, 1 sugar cinnamon, and 1 toffee.

I only had the semi sweet chcoclate...it was BOMBTASTICALLY deelishus!

Nice and slightly crispy on the outside, and soft and gooey on the inside!  The chips were melted perfectly!  It helped the cookie was a tad warm.  The flavors reminded me of a slightly crispy yellow cake with chocolate frosting.  

Is that odd?

I gave the rest of the cookies to my friend, so I don't know what the other flavors tasted like, but I'm sure they were tasty as well.

I'm having the rest of my chocolate cookie with tartine's buttery croissant, and let me tell you, there can be no better combination of buttery, choclatey goodness in each and every bite!

I regret not gettting more cookies...and sharing them with my friend!
author: Rachel N.

description: This place is super cool, tucked away; would have never known it was there, until the smells waft pass your face. The cookie is the perfect flavor and texture. I tried a few, but opted for the cookies and cream. The owner is super nice and engaging. The samples are plentiful and addictive. I will be a frequenter forshizzle.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I nearly cried with jealousy when I saw AC's huge, sprawling kitchen. But I felt better after eating four dozen cookies-and-cream cookies. 

I also dig the milk bottle decor. I derive amusement from the people who ask "hey can I buy this bottle of milk? Is it still good? HAR HAR HAR"

The first time I met Anthony was in 2007 on a street corner in Oakland, at a tableclothed booth piled with boxes of those fine, fine cookies. This man is truly living the dream, capturing the hearts and bellies of San Francisco along the way.
author: Kat A.

description:
Anthony and his cookies are in my neighborhood, so I walk past all the time - and every time I do I think, "God damn I love cookies."

So why haven't I tried them? I'm trying to eat healthier? I'm in a hurry? I'm too lazy or impatient to wait in line for a couple of minutes? These have all been true at one time or another - but last night on my way to a friend's birthday dinner the planets finally aligned and I stepped in to get my pal a dozen cookies. It may have been Friday night, but people were still lining up for these fresh baked goodies - which my friend loved. In fact, I was so sold on my friend's response to the cookies that I went back to Anthony's today to finally try them for myself - my friend is right - these are really good cookies.
author: J F.

description:
Scrumptious.  Mom 'n Pop. Tops.

Anthony's is one of those anomalies that is easily identifiable as heavenly and sinful at the same time.

While the austere shop is still a work in progress (zero furniture and decor), the wafting scents and sincere kindness spills out onto lucky Valencia St.  

These cookies are baked to perfection: always fresh, melt in your mouth, soft, and as decadent as a humble chocolate chip cookie can be.  Devouring a CCC upon purchase will undoubtedly leave you with chocolate and a smile all over your face.

From a cookie connoisseur, this is baking at it's finest.
author: Jane L.

description: Was surprised to see the jump in prices.  $1.25 for a small cookie way over priced.  I'm not saying they're not good.  Just way overpriced.  Looks like I'll come a lot less often.
author: Henri W.

description:
One of my all-time favorite things is baking cookies. I'll admit that I'm a cookie snob and super picky about discovering cookies that "wow" me. In all my years I can only think of 4 cookies that were amazingly delectable.  Anthony's cookies & cream cookie "wow'd" me. Simple and delicious!! 
p.s. (kind of in a sketchy neighborhood...) but let's be honest, I'd jump over fire and smuggle diamonds for Leonardo Dicaprio for one of these cookies.
author: Lisa P.

description:
My staff and I are daily visitors of Anthony's since our office is just around the corner. We eat waaay to many of these cookies and put on the pounds to prove it!They are addictive! 

I have taken a dozen too dinner parties and they are always a hit. I would recommend bringing a dozen or two to your holiday parties. 

Cookies: 
Favorites: 
Cookies and Cream - A cookie within a cookie...brilliant! 
Toffee - OMG! So good. This cookie is really rich and delicious. 
Banana Walnut - These cookies are HUGE--they're like little cupcakes. 
Whatever Anthony reccomends
Whatever is fresh out the oven -  mmmm...warm cookies

Least Favorite: 
Haven't had a cookie that i didn't like. 

Staff: 
Anthony is almost always there--you appreciate a business owner who puts in the time to make sure quality is at it's finest. The rest of the staff is pretty new, but they are all friendly and are budding cookie connoisseurs. 

Go get a box of cookies--you'll love them!
author: David C.

description:
My goal while out in the Bay Area was to eat as many different types of food as possible and to sample the best that San Francisco had to offer. I saw the great reviews Anthony's scored on Yelp, so I decided to put in a quick stop after making a trip to Bi-Rite to satisfy my girlfriend's craving for their ice cream. The store itself is very simple - there's not much before you get to the cashier, and behind that you see rows of cookies and ovens. But boy, does it smell good. I got 6 cookies, but I seriously wish I had gotten more. The cookies aren't that large - I'd probably but them at the same size as silver dollar pancakes - but they are incredibly doughy and chewy. The chocolate chip cookies practically melted in my mouth; the store does a great job of keeping their cookies on tap warm. Other cookies that were particularly good were the cinnamon/snickerdoodle cookies, as well as the peanut butter cookies (which didn't hit you over the head with the PB as most of them do).

The cashier was nonchalant about ringing us up in a deadpan manner (he quoted my tally in pennies), but I can't complain - I went to get my sugar fix, and they more than satisfied it. I promised to only eat 2 cookies after I left and save the rest, but I had devoured them all by the time I got back to the hotel. Nom nom indeed.
author: Asuka N.

description:
If you like eating half-baked cookies, then Anthony's is the place to go. Maybe I'm biased, because I bake and sell my cookies on occasion (and it also doesn't help that my ego is a bit inflated after my "Famous" Toffee Chocolate Chip Walnut cookie won 2nd place at SF Food Wars), so comparing Anthony's Toffee Chocolate, really is no comparison at all. 

I did buy a variety of cookies for tasting, and out of the half dozen that I purchased (Cookies n Cream, Oatmeal Chocolate, Peanut Butter, (2) Toffee Chocolate & Candied Praline) only two stood out the most, Oatmeal Chocolate and Candied Praline. Those two flavors were good because they had texture to them. The Peanut Butter was too crumbly, Cookies n Cream, Toffee Chocolate were flat, although one good thing about those were the crispy edges, which I love in some cookies. I did taste test the Cinnamon Sugar but it was disappointing... that's all I'm going to say about that one. 

Why would I have Anthony's cookie again? 1) if I can't find Sweet Constructions anywhere, and 2) it's still better than store bought packaged cookies
author: Tara d.

description: I consider myself a bit of a cookie aficionado as they're one of my favorite things to bake often.  So I was excited to see that Anthony's Cookies had a big variety of flavors, although most of them seemed pretty mainstream.  The cookies have a homemade look to them (a good thing), but I found them kind of pricey, especially if you want to try several different flavors.  I was surprised that they don't have a "buy a dozen deal" or something like that.  Overall, the cookies were delicious, super tender, and flavorful, but I didn't find them to be especially unique or special.  Maybe I'm just spoiled because I feel like can bake similar quality cookies myself.
author: Sirinda S.

description: Purchased a dozen cookies. Cookies were soft and chewy. Loved the cookies and cream. Everything else was just okay. Staff is extremely friendly. They let you sample the cookies too!
author: Sophia B.

description: I was surprised to have my expectations exceeded. I like cookies fine, but they're never one of my top choices in a bakery or for dessert in general. But these were phenomenal (of course, it helped that they were still warm and (for the one with chocolate chips) gooey, but even the next day they were still delicious). Cookies and cream was actually my least favorite, but chocolate chip was perfect. I had assumed "cinnamon sugar" was going to be snickerdoodle, but no, it was a real, full-blown, cinnamon cookie. Wonderful.
author: Lisa K.

description: YUM YUM YUM!! The cookies are delish. My fave is the cookies n cream. I think the cookies are a little over priced. $1.25 each for a not so big cookie. They should have a special deal for a dozen cookies.
author: Jo S.

description: Whenever I'm in the neighborhood, I HAVE to come here, no exceptions. Sometimes I try to tell myself I'll only buy 6 cookies, but honestly I come out with a box of a dozen more often than not lol. Half will consist of my favorite, the cookies&cream, the other 6 will be toffee and whatever else my heart desires that day. Perfect chewy texture...the cookies here never disappoint!!
author: Caralisa L.

description:
Upon receiving Joe F.'s message about his visit to Anthony's Cookies, I jumped on his offer to pick me up a few of the well raved about cookies. Of course, the first thing I do is hop on yelp to see which cookies were the most recommended--I opted for the cookies n cream and the oatmeal and cranberry.

I ran over to his place after work to try these sweet morsels. I thought cookies n cream and oatmeal and cranberry was alright, but I got to taste some of the other ones Joe ordered. I enjoyed the toffee chip and the banana cookie. The toffee had just the right amount of sweetness to it--it wasnt overwhelming or anything. The banana was fresh and light.

Too bad I didnt get to try them while they were still warm, but they were still good! I'd recommend this place if you're into the home-made cookie type.
author: Rena Y.

description:
after ordering cinnamon sugar, oatmeal choco, toffee chip, and cookies and cream just four of the many flavors of cookies this shop has I am CONVINCED that you cannot go wrong with ANYTHING that is ordered. The folks who I had a picnic with agreed. Really good cookies. Really really good cookies. 

11$ a dozen too? Not bad at all. My wallet loves it too.

Hey Anthony: what's your secret? Hook a sista up.

And the girl who served me was super friendly. Added plus.
author: Geralyn Y.

description:
After reading all the mouth-drooling reviews about Anthony's cookies..I just had to check it out for myself!

Hopped off bart at 24th street and took a 2 block stroll over...

Luckily it was late afternoon, so there was only 1 person in front of me...Anthony was manning the front alone and greeted me as I came in...he was too too nice!

I grabbed half a dozen

1 - cookies n cream
3 - choco chip
1 - banana
1 - cinnamon sugar

I scarfed down a chocolate chip and it was heavenly :)
The cinnamon sugar was delish and I took an itty bitty piece of the banana...they were ALL delicious!! I didn't want to seem like such a fat ass so I shoved the cookies in my purse to share w/ the bf later! 

$5 for half a dozen was not bad and that coupled with great customer service from Anthony himself cannot be beat!

I'll definitely be back!
author: Jade B.

description: The cookies here are chewy with just a little bit of crunch on the outside.  There's a lot of butter in each cookie, which is what makes them so delicious!  I recommend the cookies n cream.  They aren't large cookies, so at ~$1 each it is a bit pricey, but Anthony gets 4 stars for generously giving out not just 1, but 2 free cookies to each customer today, for the shop's 1-year anniversary!
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Dear Cookies n' Cream Cookie from Anthony's,
I am pretty sure you should be illegal.....that being said...I am madly in love with you. Warm and Yummy with your little pieces of oreo type chocolate cookie pieces in you. YUM YUM YUM!
You are unlike any cookie I have ever met. While I wish we could see more of you, it is good for my health that we are not in the same neighborhood. 
I look forward to our next encounter.
-k
author: Kelle K.

description:
I know a tasty cookie when I taste a tasty cookie! And Anthony has them alright!
I love that their cookie makes a party in my mouth, comes out straight from the oven meaning, FRESH! and they are to die for! I wish I always have a few before I go to bed. Yummmy cookies and soy milk :)

I LOVE THEIR OATMEAL RAISIN! Like the cookie monster, I want more!
author: Lianne D.

description:
I guess the lesson is don't come at the end of the day. They'll be out of all the good ones, and the ones they'll have left aren't that good. I''m not saying I don't belive they have good cookies, but the banana one was fairly bland and unevenly cooked.

95cents also seems a bit high.
author: Mark A.

description: So I got the cookies almost a week ago and still had some in a zip lock bag and..... they're still moist in the center and kind of lost the crispy outer edge. But they still smelled like fresh baked cookies!
author: Annie D.

description:
Just follow the smell.  The storefront isn't much to look at, but venture in and you'll soon be greeted by a couple of sweethearts behind the counter, including Anthony, baking away.

I'm not a huge cookie fan, but there's something about these.  I've had them fresh out of the oven and a couple days old.  Either way, the cookies are delectable--crisp on the outside, perfectly moist on the inside, sugary sweet, with that homemade touch.  My favorite flavor is whichever cookie I'm eating at the moment.

Just when I think I'm sick of them, I take another bite into one of his cookies and fall in love all over again.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
The best cookies in the city!

They're small but packed full of flavor.  Crispy on the outside, soft on the inside.  Not greasy at all.  A high quality baked cookie.

Try the German chocolate!
author: MTBer I.

description:
Went into Anthony's tonight and got a dozen of his amazing cookies. As always, Anthony greeted me with a smile and a question about what he needed to do to dress as stylishly as me. He was obviously kidding around since I have no fashion sense at all (and since we all know an Anthony's T-Shirt is way more stylish anyway), but I appreciated his good humor and flattery. 

In short:
Anthony =  great guy
Anthony's cookies = out of control delicious.

Add some Straus Milk in those glass jars, and you have an amazing small business that everyone should support!
author: Charlie H.

description:
My friend and I had to stop by because I have been dying to try their cookies and we happened to be in the area. Keep your eyes peeled since you can walk right past and not notice it. It's tucked in between some apartment buildings and it's on the left-hand side if you are coming from 24th St. 

We arrived right before they closed and the staff was in great spirits. They were all dancing around the open kitchen to some hip-hop. haha Fun times! I loved the glass milk bottles lining the walls but it definitely needed some seating since it felt really empty. We decided to order a walnut chocolate chip and double chocolate chip to share but the guy working ended up throwing in a banana and another double chocolate chip free of charge! I think they are supposed to be around 85 cent to $1 each.

All of them were SO GOOD! Perfectly sized at about 2.5" in diameter, thin, and chewy in texture. I really enjoyed the banana one since it tasted like banana bread in cookie form. The walnut chocolate chip was semi-sweet with fresh, crunchy walnuts. The double chocolate chip was oozing of chocolate...mmm! A glass of cold milk would have been amazing too but luckily they weren't too sweet and we were able to manage.

My experience here was definitely memorable and I can't wait to come back soon! Thanks Anthony!
author: Karen Y.

description: Had the Chocolate Chip, Oreo and Double Walnut Choco Chip. The Oreo was alright, not a fan, but my brother loved it. The other two are yummy.
author: Vika K.

description:
1 word WOW!

A big thanks to my coworker for bringing these cookies in to the office... After hearing about them on 106kmel I kept talking about how I needed to try them.. So to shut me up she headed over there to buy sonme for us!

The only ones i was able to get my hands on were the Cookes and cream flavored cookies. Which were sooo good! I will def. Make the trip down there for those cookies alone!
author: Nette A.

description:
Today(Saturday1/10/15)@4;40 and waited in line for over 20 minutes. There was only 1 server and she was new. People in front of me where asking for coffee( which she
said she was out of) and cookie selection that they were marked on the board as being in stock and told they were out of them. During my wait I observed as many 
people coming in and deciding not to wait in line as were in line. About 5 minutes till I
got waited on a lady came in from the back with a large cup of coffee and stayed
in the back area talking to the two baker's chatting and laughing. I asked her if she
could wait on us in line. She said she couldn't as she was there to train the other
server and went back to chatting and laughing with the bakery's. What a joke! Anthony,I have been a customer of yours since the second day of you being open. 
You need to put a camera in there to see what  is going on when your not there.
The product is excellent, but the service today was AWFUL!!!!!
author: Peter F.

description: Best cookies i have ever had even after 2 days well worth it. all he flavors are good
author: Justin I.

description:
::GENERAL::
These are good cookies.  They are not "blow you away" good, but they are "correct" good.  IMO, this is a good thing.  They are not overly sweet or fancy.  Just really well made, tasty cookies, for a decent price.  They are still clearly working out their flow so don't expect all cookie types to be available, but then what is ready is hot and fresh... :)  Love what they are doing here and I hope they go the distance.

::CRISPY n SOFT::
Love that the cookies are crispy on the outside and soft enough in the middle... as it should be.  :)  Though, the banana cookies are more cake like, and shaped like a mini-volcano (which works well and is tasty).

::STAFF::
So friendly!  

::OTHER::
Water is Fiji, so good but more pricey than necessary.  Saw the rows of Straus milk on the boarders of the room... assume you can order some but didn't check.  :)
author: Dan M.

description:
It's 11:30pm on a Saturday night and I got the munchies. What's this sitting on my counter? An unopened box of Anthony's Cookies from this afternoon? Well if you insist.

I told myself, I just have one. Three cookies later and I'm having post-cookie guilt. But they were good, so it was worth it.

Cinnamon Sugar = not your average Cinnamon Sugar. This cookie is actually brown, so you know it's packed with flavor. Not just some sugar cookie tossed in cinnamon sugar. So moist and chewy. 

White Chocolate Chip = my favorite. They did this cookie right. Moist, chewy and just perfect.

Toffee Chip = Toffee goodness. 

Anthony's Cookies are how cookies should be done. A dozen for $11 is very affordable. These cookies are great to bring to a party, give as a gift, spoil your coworkers or eat yourself into a coma. I'll do the latter.
author: Joshua C.

description:
A shop, on Valencia, that only makes cookies.  Daring?  You bet.  But equally fantastic, and if anyone can pull it off and make a hugely successful business out of it, it's Anthony.  This guy has more charisma and enthusiasm than a pile of puppies.
The shop itself is totally basic - a big open entry area, a counter to order at, and a bunch of space for baking in the back.  (I hope they add something to that entry area - small tables maybe?  A stereotypical Mission photo booth for your fresh-warm-cookie face?)

The cookies are not basic.  They're rich, complex, and varied!  Not too crispy, not too soft; pretty damn close to perfect really.  My favorites are the 2 banana varieties (like banana bread in cookie form - genius!), the whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip (duh), the double chocolate, and the cookies n cream, which is intriguingly meta.  A friend commented that it was also sort of disturbingly cannibalistic, but I'm ok with that.

I recommend not waiting until the end of the day - demand has been outweighing supply, and there might not be much left!

My only question - why nothing with peanut butter?  Hopefully they're still perfecting one...
author: Don H.

description:
Many thanks to Bonnie L for reviewing this place. I never would have found it on my own. 

Walking by this store, you WILL miss it.. There is no signage, no tables inside, just a big empty space in front, and a few folding chairs. They only thing in the window is a single page menu. Don't let the lack of tables, chairs and signs scare you away. 

You walk in and see a counter way in the distance. A very friendly person behind the counter will get what you need. He does mostly by the half dozen. Being new at this place and undecided, I apologize to the people behind he waiting while I made my choices. But one person said it's no bother because it smells so good in there. And it does! 

I bought some for a friend, and some for me since I was there. I bought some of everything. Just a quick run down ... Oatmeal with Cranberry, Toffee, Choco chip with nuts, Cookies and creme, double choco chip ... 

I was able to get a whole toffee cookie, and bites of the rest before they were gone. That's all I got ONE whole cookie, and small bites of the rest. Some people in the house don't like nuts. That didn't stop them from eating everything in sight. The only thing left now is the string to close the box. The box is in the recycle bin. 

GO NOW! But bring cash. But Anthony tells me that he should be set up for credit and debit cards next week.
author: Michael M.

description: It took me a long time and at last I tried the cookies here and let me tell you FABULOUS!!!  I have a gut feeling I will be visiting again shortly.
author: Dennis K.

description: One word: AMAZING! Cookies are definitely made with love and freshly baked. Got the "Cookies n' Cream", "Toffee Chip", and the "Oatmeal Raisin". All were equally Heavenly in my mouth. Only perk was that they were smaller than from what I had been lookin at from other Yelper's pictures. I guess looks can be deceiving. Either way, awesome cookies, but would love them to be bigger size for the money we're paying. :)
author: Bria S.

description:
It's on the down low but you should know. It's inconspicuous. You could walk right by it and not know that delicious cookies were awaiting you though I'm not sure how you could miss that delightful scent of freshly baked mouth orgasms. I will take the BART from the Embarcadero to 24th Street Mission during my lunch break just to enjoy these babies. Specialty's is no match for Anthony's, I'm not spending another dime there! My favorites so far are the Banana and Cookies 'n' Cream. I would definitely like these on my death bedside. The Banana cookie is just like having Banana cake in cookie form. It's a bit more moist than Banana nut bread. The Cookies 'n' Cream, I can't describe, just eat the damn thing.

$5 for 6 cookies, I might have to step it up a notch next time I go and get the dozen. As soon as I got back to work, I inhaled 3 cookies.

Anthony go 'head, dust your shoulders off (but dust them away from the cookies). Specialty's, suck it!
author: Tatiana D.

description:
I didn't get the chance to meet Anthony, but I did get the chance to meet his fabulous whole wheat oatmeal chocolate cookie. If he is anywhere near as good as this cookie, he's a good, good man.

Love the milk bottle decor.

Thought the only pricing options were half a dozen for $5. At least for today, got one for $0.85. A. Steal.

They were out of the infamous cookies and cream cookie. I will so be back.
author: Jason B.

description:
My favorite place for the perfect cookies!! The toffee ones are to die for, and so are the Cookies and Cream!  

This place has now ruined me, cause when I have a cookies anywhere else... I have to compare it to Anthony's cookies and it makes me sad they're not as good, lol!  

The staff are always friendly, and Anthony is very personable and knows how to make amazing cookie creations.  I've definitely spread the word about this spot to all my friends.  Try it out and I bet you'll do the same!
author: Jamie G.

description: $15.00 per dozen is unquestionably pricey for cookies. If there was ever a cookie out there worth this exorbitant cost, however, it would be that made by Anthony & Co. The cookies n' cream cookie is on the 7x7 Big Eat list, and it is fantastic, but I think there are probably 4-5 varieties which I like better than that one. I'm not even sure which varieties those are because I usually just have them whip me up an assorted duzz (or 18-pack if I'm flush with disposable cookie cash), but I routinely have my mind blown a handful of times per box. Trust these wise cookie mavens, and treat yourself, right now, to some TLC (Tony's 'licious cookies).
author: Trav W.

description:
Z.
O.
M.
G.

Dem some DAMN GOOD cookies!  Crispy on the edges, chewy and slightly gooey in the center.  This is what all cookies should aspire to be. Hell, this is what I aspire to be when I grow up.  One day perhaps, one day...
author: Gary L.

description:
For 'better than yo momma makes' (Sorry Mom) cookies in the Mission..this is the place to be.

Anthony is continually making some darn good cookies. If you like thin, crispy on the outside and chewy in the center...look no further. Stop by and get my favs: Toffee Chip, Cookies' n Cream and of course the all worldly classic Semi-Sweet Chocolaty Chip! 

Either get a few for yourself to indulge or box it up with a dozen or more for the compadres!
author: Dave S.

description:
I LOVE the cookies here!  While cookies like their semi-sweet chocolate chip, whole wheat chocolate chip, and cinnamon sugar are all really good, the TOFFEE CHIP is absolutely amazing and keeps me coming back for more!

Anthony is also super-friendly.

We love this place!!
author: Marcus L.

description:
So delicious!  Top marks for an intimate little bakery that does one thing really well - COOKIES!  I like that they offer the classics in addition to some with a slight twist.

I bought six flavors, each totally delicious!  
- semi sweet chocolate chip: delicious! chips were still gooey
- cookies and cream: unexpectedly my favorite! it's a flatter cookie with good chewiness and good crisp on the outside...essentially a regular cookie with oreo cookie bits
- cinnamon sugar: second favorite!  much tastier than expected, less like a snickerdoodle, more like a light molasses cookie
- peanut butter: tasty, but could be chewier
- white chocolate: can't go wrong!
- oatmeal cranberry: a wonderful twist on a traditional cookie - yum!

Two thumbs up!  :D  I just wish it was closer to my house...
author: Fontane L.

description:
There are only two cookies I compare to everyone else's, the venerable Toll House, made from scratch, and Debra Specials, from Mrs. Fields' bakery. Butter is key, and without it, you've sacrificed flavor, aroma, and texture, all of which separates packaged goods from fresh made. Walking into Anthony's, I was reminded of the year I spent selling fine pastries and cakes at Choice's in the Crocker Center Galleria, and the shelf life of baked goods, which is three days (it's the butter), and should therefor be enjoyed immediately. When given a choice between fresh, and plastic wrapped, why would anyone choose what could easily last for months outside?

I noticed Anthony's because it took over the store next to what used to be Lord Martine and Bradford Noble's workshop, and it was tagged on Facebook. I'm also always pleased to see new boutique stores on Valencia Street. Anthony's is not exactly a boutique, no shelves full of cute cookie tins, no window display, in fact, no fancy anything, just a counter, a board with flavors and prices, a cooler with drinks, and a long view of three guys making cookies, by the batch. And yes, you're going to have to wait for my favorite, the Chocolate Chip with walnuts.

If you hate Toll House cookies, it's probably because you used Crisco instead of butter, your pans were too thin, your oven could not maintain the proper temperature, or you weren't paying enough attention, which means they came out either stiff, burned, or both. If you love them properly, the chips come out crunchy on the outside, melted inside, and the cookie is crisp, buttery, and golden brown, all the way through. But to me, it's the walnuts that make or break it (apologies to those with allergies). I shell, peel, and toast mine before adding them in, and I believe Anthony does too, because his rendition of this classic treat has won me over.

Sad to say, I haven't as yet confirmed this, because the bakers are either too busy, or too distracted, for a friendly chat. Perhaps this will change with time, but given the spare room, it was like waiting for your little bundle of joy at St. Mary's. They say that having a bakery in the neighborhood improves mental health, and you'd think that walking into a place practically swimming in butter would keep a smile on, but four customers, and the staff, managed to do without. Yikes!

Oatmeal raisin? Stick with Debra's Specials. Like his other cookies (I've tried them all, twice, but not the Cookies n Cream, my bad?), Anthony gets the flavor and aroma right, but the texture is more scone, or cake, than cookie. And we know from cookies, right?

By the way, if you love marzipan, try the pine nut encrusted marzipan cookies at Dianda's Bakery, right down 25th street from Anthony's, on Mission. They are, quite frankly, Cookie Monster sex. Share them with good champagne, then hide them. Seriously.

Oh, and forget about parking on that end of Valencia, the body shop takes up what the residents don't. Anthony's cookies are wee things, and at $5 for six, it's not worth the double parking ticket. Ride shotgun, and dash in.

Cheers,
John Zane
author: John Z.

description:
These are excellent cookies.  No doubt.
I bake cookies myself, & I must admit, Anthony's choco chip cookies shame mine.  Although truth be told, the choco chips are not my absolute fave.  That would be a close call between the toffee and the ginger cookie.  I've pleasured myself with most all of Anthony's creations, & I actively recommend them to everyone I both know & don't know.  The boxes they pack the dozen or more orders in  are also a nice touch.  The white twine they use reminds me of Rocco's in the West Village.  
Kudo's to Anthony for daring to dream about his own cookie shop, having the commitment and work ethic to stick to it, and baking his dream into a great tasting new Mission hot spot!  I know you mom is very proud of you, she told me as much.   
ME LOVE ANTHONY'S COOKIE !!
author: Roland C.

description:
Cookie perfection! 

Bernie Mac's segment on milk n' cookies comes to mind. I bet they were Anthony's.

http://www.myspace.com/video/ebiztha1/kings-of-comedy-milk-and-cookies-clip/1317810
author: Jen Y.

description:
Ive had anthony's cookies for a long time now...before he even open up his well know store front

I still remember him coming in to the barber shop and selling his cookies to people. It was instant hit and we always bag him on how he should just open a store now

fast foward a year  or two or maybe three....you have now  Anthony's Cookies
heres a quick bit
1)The cookies are by far the best cookies i ever had
2) I like them a bit warm..straight from the oven 
3)Cookies n Cream and toffee...3 thumps Up
4)Anthony and the staff are really friendly
author: Eko A.

description:
These are my favorite cookies in the world! Even better than my homemade ones! My daughter also loves these and my husband goes crazy over them! 

My top 3 favorite flavors:

-Cookies & Cream
-White Chocolate Chip
-Toffee Chip

I'm from San Jose and whenever I get the chance to come here, I buy 4 dozen at a time!
author: Sabrina D.

description: Wow.  I don't know how else to best describe Anthony's besides saying wow.  After reading about them in 7x7 I was dying to try out their cookies and since I have I've been back two weekends in a row.  The shop is pretty bare but what they lack in decor is completely made up with the deliciousness of their cookies.  I've tried a few different kinds there and nothing doesn't impress me.  I have yet to get milk along with my cookie but next time I think I will as that will make my week.
author: Blake B.

description:
pretty good cookies.

yea the Cookies and Cream was pretty tasty.  the only thing I didn't like really was the price.  this place is more on the pricier side, but can you really complain when they can back it up with how moist, chewy, and flavory their cookies are?  ok the size of the cookies are on the smaller side too.  I don't really understand why the box is so big if I only get 6 cookies that are so small.

purely from a taste perspective, Anthony's is great.  but would I return on a weekly basis to get my cookie fix from here?  let me say that a big motivator for me to actually hop in my car and go out somewhere to get cookies is so that I can forego having to bake them myself AND get them at a reasonable price.  Anthony's Cookies are priced more like a luxury, but let's face it, cookies for me are more of a necessity.
author: John C.

description:
Anthony is super friendly and all smiles. You can tell he loooves what he does and loooves that everyone loooves it too. It is rare to find shop owners who make their customers feel welcome with more than just a "Hello".

So the cookies... Evenly crisp around the edges, soft and moist in the middle, and not too sweet. They are perfect! Tried the cookies and cream, toffee chip, and walnut chip. Loved them all and will come back to try out all the flavors! It's just so hard to choose when you're staring at the menu and there's about 5 other people waiting behind you. Oh man, just writing this review makes me want more...

$5 for a half-dozen, mix and match. Cash only. Bring your own milk.
author: Zell C.

description:
I loved this place. The chocolate chip cookies were delicious. 
A bit on the expensive side but it's totally worth it. Their staff was friendly and upbeat and ready to offer you samples, I'll be back before they realize I'm gone.
author: Ignacio A.

description:
I want to keep this short but, 

basically, 

without ever having tried their cookies, I can give this place 5 stars.

The owner, Anthony, is an absolute doll, and totally goes the extra mile to make his customers happy, all in the name of a damn good cookie.  He was an absolute pleasure to work with, and I trust that his business will go very far.
author: Seema S.

description:
Get Cookies & Cream. I don't care if you don't even like cookies & cream, but Anthony has outdone himself with this cookie. It is, hands down, the best cookie I have ever tasted. It has the perfect texture (slightly crisp on the outside, nice and gooey/chewy on the inside), the perfect taste (OH MY LORD, you made a cookies & cream COOKIE?!), the perfect size, and the perfect price.

My favorite cookies (aside from C&C obviously)
- toffee chip
- semi-sweet chocolate chip
- banana walnut

These are perfect gifts when boxed up in one of Anthony's boxes!
author: Aaron M.

description:
Really good cookies! Came here today to get 1/2 a dozen for $5! I got two cookie-n-cream, one semi-sweet chocolate chip, one banana-nut, one oatmeal cranberry, and one toffee.

I like the semi-sweet chocolate chip one the most. It's sooo soft and chewy on the inside that it just melts in your mouth! The cookie-n-cream one is good too. Banana-nut was interesting. It's semi-cone shape and it's like a mini muffin. The oatmeal cranberry was excellent as well. The toffee one was okay. I think someone said it before that the toffee one needed more toffee in it. I agree there.

The staff was very friendly and efficient. Even though I was the only customer there when I walked in, all three staff greeted me.

Overall, they have very good cookies, and I would definitely be coming back for more!
author: Sam W.

description:
Why has it taken me so long to come here?  These cookies are absolutely delicious.  Mm mm I'm almost glad this place is a little out of the way for me otherwise things would not end well for me and my so-called diet. 

My favorite were the cookies and cream and cinnamon sugar cookies.  I also loved the toffee chip.  

The store is also pretty cute. If you come in a group, order together (as a half dozen or dozen).  It's a little cheaper that way.
author: Alea G.

description: Okay seriously 7x7? The cookies and creme cookie is one of the top 100 things to eat in SF? I am really surprised by the reviews. Though my bestie loves the cookies for her birthday, I was not impressed at all. The sample being given was the cookies and creme, but before my roommate and I were told that we were positive it was just a regular chocolate chip cookie. The cookies were too flat and I don't think anything I tried was impressive. I'm glad my bestie enjoyed the bday treat, but I would not come back here again for a cookie fix.
author: Surge C.

description: I may give up baking cookies because of Anthony's Cookies. Warm, crispy on the outside, and soft gooey on the in. Anthony's Cookies are delicious. I bought a half dozen cookies (2 semisweet, 2 toffee, and 2 walnut chocolate chip) for $5 bucks, which is a steal! A single cookie is less than a dollar! Of course they sell milk and have coffee as well as juice to purchase. Can't wait to go back to try their other flavors.
author: Theresa D.

description: We sometimes get these cookies at my work. They are pretty yummy. My favorite is the cinnamon sugar one.  I have tried the toffee, chocolate chip, and cranberry oatmeal one as well but the I love the cinnamon one the most.
author: Nava N.

description:
I don't usually have a sweet tooth, but these are best cookies I've ever had.  And now that I've tasted these, I sometimes get a crazy craving for Anthony's cookies.  

I've tried a few of their other flavors including toffee and choc chip, but my favorite is the ever-so-popular cookies and cream.  The first time I had them, they were fresh out of the oven.  The outside was a little crisp, and the inside was all warm and soft.  It was a deliciously delicate balance.

The only downside is that they're pretty pricey.  I get 2 dozen at a time, cuz I like to share these tasty treats.  But a couple weeks ago 2 dozen was $17 and just the other day it's now $21.  The counter girl said that the price of the ingredients went up and since Anthony wanted to ensure the same quality, individual cookies are now $1.25.  If only they were bigger.

The girl also said they're adding ice cream sandwiches to their repertoire for the summer (possibly teaming up with Humphrey Slocombe or BiRite), but imagine how expensive those suckers would be.
author: Esther K.

description:
Keepin it real in the Mission.  No weirdo CA cuisine combos, just simple down-home deliciousness.

Wholewheat oatmeal with cranberries was caramelized brown sugary crisp on the outside and chewy inside.  85 cents.
author: Melanie C.

description:
I have to say I was pretty surprised by this place.  My friend and I were at the Giants game this afternoon and afterwards I had sudden craving for cookies.  So my friend takes out his BlackBerry and uses the Yelp app to look for places close to the ballpark.  Anthony's Cookies in the Mission came up.

Based on the responses we read on Yelp we thought we'd give it a try.  We weren't really expecting a whole lot, it's just cookies right?  Wrong!  These cookies were outstanding!  I ordered a couple of the semi-sweet chocolate chip cookies and my buddy ordered the (I think) banana-nut cookies.  We were blown away at how good these cookies were.

However what impressed me the most was the owner, Anthony.  I didn't know who he was at the time, until I Googled the bakery when I got home.   Anthony took the time to ask me what I thought about the cookies and I told him honestly that they did not disappoint and I thought that they were some of the best cookies I've ever tasted.  

Needless to say, I will be back for another visit.
author: Jerald B.

description:
YUMMM!!! I love love love the cookies here.  I live in South San Francisco but don't mind driving over to the Mission to pick up a box of these delicious cookies.  My favorites are cookies & cream and toffee chip.  

The shop is inviting and somewhat small.  Very little seating, but I'm assuming it's just because the business is pretty new.  For the most part staff members have been friendly.  I met Anthony for the first time last week and he is a very nice guy, asking his customers what he can do to improve our experiences as customers - awesome characteristic of this establishment, and smart for a budding business!

Other than adding more seating and keeping their sample plate stocked, there's not much more to improve.  The main thing that matters - the cookies - are amazing and reasonably priced.  They keep the milk, tea, and other beverages stocked, so you have a nice drink to accompany your cookies if you choose to eat in.  

Cookies are priced at $1 each, $6 for a half dozen, or $11 per dozen.  You can even pick up a frequent buyer card if you visit often enough.  I definitely pick up a box to bring to parties or to share with friends or to show my gratitude.  Pick one up yourself!
author: Karina C.

description:
No really- all the people that talk about the crack in the cookies are right_ Shit is insanely addictive!

I have given these cookies to 20 people to try. Of those, 19 were totally blown away and the last one is just a hater in general!

Try the toffee chip- it is maybe the best thing of all time!

FYI They just raised their prices and one cookie is $1.25 and 1/2 dozen is now 6$...
author: Tasha R.

description:
Keep your eyes open for this place- it's easy to miss! But just follow your nose and let the smell of freshly baking cookies lure you in the right direction.

As usual, I was craving something sweet after dinner, and the lines at Mitchells and Bi-Rite Creamery were ridiculously long. Then I remembered Anthony's Cookies being in the neighborhood and figured this was the perfect time to try them out.

I got there 10 minutes to closing time, so I was left with a few options. I came out with 1/2 dozen cookies consisting of oatmeal chocolate chip (2), oatmeal raisin, white chocolate chip, chocolate chip with walnuts and toffee. All for $5. 

I agree with other Yelpers that the toffee cookie could use more toffee flavor. Other than that, the cookies were delicious! Just the right size, with a slightly crunchy outside and soft and chewy inside - signs of a perfect cookie.  I can picture myself being at home on a cold night, wrapped up in my favorite blanket with a glass of cold milk and a plate of these homemade cookies.

I really wanted to try the other flavors (cookies and cream, snickerdoodle), but I guess everyone throughout the day had the same idea. But this cookie-lover is not complaining about having to come back another day!
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I have a super sweet tooth, but I am also super picky when it comes to baked goods. Size, sweetness, texture, moistness, crispiness etc. all have to be just right. 

I first heard of Anthony and his cookies (pre cookie boutique) from my boyfriend whom he is friends with. He would rant and rave about his baking skills and how his banana cookies are "off the hook" as well as many others. I was fortunate to taste some of his baked goodness about a month ago, but not fortunate enough to try the banana cookies since they were all eaten by my boyfriend. My confession...I think I had about 4-5 to myself on my drive home from downtown SF to Daly City (no traffic) pretty bad "fat kid" status right there, but I could not help myself. 

Yesterday, 4/26 the fams and I stopped by the grand opening of Anthony's Cookies and there I FINALLY got to taste the banana cookies for myself BF wasn't kidding those things are fantastic! It's no wonder why he had eaten them all! 

When you first walk in you could smell the wonderful scent of baked goods. Simple decor, with two photo's against the chocolate colored walls and old fashioned glass milk bottles line the counter. I love the fact you could see into the baking area and actually witness for yourself how fresh these cookies are. There was a bit of a line, but worth waiting in. 

Anthony has about 14 different other cookies available for such a reasonable price

My favorites are: 

1. banana (better than banana bread-no monkeying around!) 
2. cookies and cream (a cookie in a cookie!) 
3. toffee (love the texture of this cookie) 
4. whole wheat oatmeal with chocolate chips (I love oatmeal and I love chocolate-what can I say?!) 
5. cinnamon sugar (love the crispiness of this cookie) 

The cookies which was perfectly sized had a nice crisp outer edge with a chewy inside. We will be back for more!! 

Check out and try Anthony's Cookies http://www.anthonyscookies.com/home.html
author: Stacie T.

description:
Was at Anthony's again yesterday, as we are most weekends these days.  To further illustrate my points about Anthony and his cookies...

"Everyday I get up and go to work is a day I'm supposed to learn something.  I trained myself to think that way." ~Anthony

Zen and the Art of Baking, anyone?  Love this place. :)
author: Angela B.

description: I hate Chips Ahoy and all those processed cookies you find at Costco. They give cookies such a bad name! Anthony's delivers what all cookies should be like: buttery, chewy, FRESH. My favorite is the walnut chocolate chip, with cookies and creme coming at a close second. I can't wait to go back. The workers are extremely friendly, and might I add, pretty cute!
author: Alexa M.

description: These are the best cookies in SF, maybe in all of California, maybe the whole world. The staff is great, the place is clean, Anthony is the coolest, most friendly business owner on Valencia street and you can catch him in there running things almost every day. A high quality bakery with a high caliber product, expect to see great things from this place in the future.
author: Nick G.

description:
I am so craving a cookie for breakfast today! Earlier this week, I stopped in after a long time and bought some cookies for dessert. Actually, we ate the cookies for dinner. Yum.
My favorite is the cinnamon, it has a ginersnap taste to that I just love and the toffee is just delicious. They are all soo fricken good. Now I just need to stop craving them....Maybe I should just cave in, go back and eat some more!
author: Rachna P.

description: I keep on forgetting to yelp this place.. not that they need it. Can i just say that they have some of the best cookies that i have ever tasted?! I wish this place was closer to home, because i would definitely be here every single day! My personal faves are the cookies and cream and toffee chip.
author: Mertani G.

description:
Thanks to the world of social networking aka Facebook, I heard of Anthony's Cookies. 

Definitely one of my favorite cookie bakery in the city! The cookies are so dense, moist, and chewy! Best part, they're usually fresh and warm when you get them! 

When you're ordering, Anthony is usually in the back baking cookies, and always says hi with the warmest smile. What a cool guy! 

It's been a while since I last got them (I know, blasphemy!) so I can't remember which ones I really liked, but you can't do wrong with any of them. And yes, it's a bit pricey, but you get what you pay for. 

I don't think anyone can emulate/imitate Anthony's cookies, unless they have some kind of baker's superb magical touch, but how likely is that?
author: K. E.

description: If you can bake or are lucky enough to have a baker in your life, you can skip Anthony's. If your experience with cookies usually begins with chips and ends in ahoy, treat yourself to an Anthony's cookie. At $6 for 1/2 doz (or $1.25 each), I got their top three sellers (chocolate chip, cookies and cream, and 2 of the toffee) plus German chocolate and cinnamon spice. They were all just ok. Maybe because I wasn't lucky to get them fresh out of the oven. I came in around 4pm Saturday; no line.  If I wasn't so cheap, I would get the cinnamon and toffee again. Keep in mind, I'm never impressed by freshly baked cookies as I'm spoiled by friends/co-workers/sister who bake. Clean place with a trendy vibe.
author: Yan E.

description:
Four things I LOVE about these cookies:
1) Great, interesting recipes.
2) FRESH out of the oven, moist and chewey.  
3) They are normal sized, so you can try a couple different types without that Specialties cookie bomb feeling in your stomach.
4) Cheap cheap cheap.

My recommendation is stock up on milk, you'll be needing it...
author: Nathaniel H.

description:
Charming shop.  Friendly staff.  Über-delicious cookies.  These cookies have a great balance of moist, chewy center and crispy outer layer.

If you're looking for a larger completely chewy cookie (which I sometimes crave), then these may not satisfy.  Perhaps try Specialty's.  Otherwise, I would highly highly recommend Anthony's.

I can't recommend any particular variety because I thoroughly enjoyed every cookie I tried.  I will, however, recommend you get some milk with your order.
author: Jaymar C.

description:
C is for cookie - but not just any cookie....ANTHONY'S COOKIES!!!

As if anyone is going toread this review because face it - we only really read 1 star reviews....but here is my sch-peal anyway.  I think I've eaten about every cookie under the sun.... A friend of mine gave me Anthony's cookies as a gift and I am hooked!  I finally had a chance to go to the store becuase I wanted to place a big order....and Anthony came up to me and chatted away...even though he had a huge line and was super busy in the back.  WHO DOES THAT THESE DAYS?  SINCE WHEN DID PEOPLE CARE ABOUT CUSTOMER SERVICE.....  I took my wife who thinks her taste bud trumps Michael Mina's and even she loved them (so I'm not biased to cookies....)  This guy is a genius.....flies like a bumble bee and stings with his cookies!
author: Shel D.

description:
OK, I RACED home from Anthony's to yelp him and Mingus beat me to it! No fair!

Anthony makes wonderful cookies. His list includes;

cookies and cream
semi-sweet chocolate chip
cinnamon and sugar
toffee chip
oatmeal and cranberry
oatmeal and walnut
banana
banana walnut
white chocolate chip
oatmeal and raisin


I think I got that mostly right.

I am so afraid for my waist. Anthony has opened less than 2 blocks from my house. This is going to be more dangerous than Mission Pie.

So, this guy totally knows his baked goods. His cookies are a healthy chewy mouthful, with a delicate crisp edge around the supple dense center. Flavorings (the crushed oreos, nuts, fruit and chips) are well distributed and not overwhelming. You get enough actual cookie with each bite. Also a plus, they are not so sweet as to make your teeth ache. They have a well balanced flavour profile and finally, they are cooked to perfection. The hardest thing about cookies is to cook them enough that they are really done, nicely browned with well developed nutty taste found in top quality baked goods, with out being over cooked and hard. Most cookies that are not over done are still raw in the center. Anthony's are perfect.

I came home with one each of what he had left at the the end of the day and everyone in the family is raving. I am partial to the cookies and cream. my daughter loves the toffee. The spouse adores the oatmeal. The chocolate chippers are benchmark examples of cookie art.

Really. some of the best American drop style cookies I have had. I am embarrassed to say they are better than my own!

Anthony is in the ramp up mode right now and will have to find his pace, gauge volume of product needed (more than he had TODAY!!) get his beverages in place and primp and fluff the seating area to create an inviting cookie emporium/parlour.

But having chatted the man up I can see that he is well on his way to creating a cookie haven right in the Valencia Corridor.

I can hardly wait for comfy seating, tea, ice cold milk, cocoa and an endless supply of Anthony's cookies.
author: Sara D.

description:
My friend Victor and I both craved for something sweet one night. So he decided to get cookies.  He then told me over the phone that he bought 6! And without knowing or ever seeing how an Anthony's cookie looks like, I was like, "wow, that's a lot for the two of us!" 

So it turned out Anthony's cookies are small in size, like 2.5 inches in diameter or so. It is also a thinner type of cookie. So the item they're known for from the 7x7.com Big Eat List was the Cookies 'N Cream cookie. I never had a cookies 'n cream cookie before, so I was excited. 

Anthony's Cookies 'N Cream cookie looks like a chocolate chip cookie but instead of chocolate chip, it contains crushed oreo-liked cookies. One bite into it and I was in love! I thought since it is a bit thinner so it probably won't be chewy...man I was wrong! It was chewy and moist! But I should have known when I pull it in half...very gooey and chewy. I could definitely taste the cookies 'n cream cookie in there. I was also surprise that it was not that sweet! I mean an oreo is super duper sweet to me but Anthony's wasn't. 
I also tried the other cookies they have, like the white chocolate--which was pretty sweet! I also tried the semi-sweet chocolate with walnuts, which was just okay, but it was memorable because the chocolate was still very gooey and creamy even though the cookie wasn't warm anymore. The cookie and cream cookie definitely set the bar high for other competitors' out there.
author: Mandy C.

description:
YUM. YUM. YUM.

I've wanted to try Anthony's for a long time, and finally got my chance on a recent weekday. I picked up a dozen cookies and sampled bites of a Cinnamon Sugar, a Semi Sweet Choc Chip, a Banana Walnut, a Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin, a Chocolate Chip Walnut, and a Cookies and Cream. (Um, yes, I sampled 6 cookies, and by sampled, I mean I may have eaten at least 3 of them whole.)

The verdict: I loved everything except the Banana Walnut, Oatmeal Raisin and Chocolate Chip Walnut. These cookies - for whatever reason - were totally doughy and cakey and delivered to me in little golf-ball shapes, versus the others, which were the usual chewy discs you associate with cookie goodness. Is this due to something with the dough used for those flavors? I'm not sure, but those three were not good due to the cakey factor. The others - most notably, the Semi Sweet Choc Chip and the Cookies and Cream - had that delectable crisp on the outside, chewy on the inside texture that I looooooove in a cookie.  All in all, I agree with a previous reviewer who suggested putting the cookies on display, because I never would have ordered the cakey cookies had I seen them first. 

I enjoyed my trip to Anthony's and also enjoyed meeting Anthony himself, who probably deserves an award for Friendliest Independent Bakery in SF.
author: Beth T.

description:
I consider myself a cookie aficionado.  Not only are chocolate chip cookies something of dessert perfection to me, but I've spent months trying to create the quintessential cookie in my own kitchen.  I'll be honest, mine are pretty damn good.

And so are Anthony's.  We were strolling back home from 24th street when we encountered the best advertising ever: the smell of fresh baked cookies wafting out of the door.  Obliged to walk in, we were greeted by Anthony himself, a young guy with a ton of charm and potential.  He was extremely happy to have us as customers, making a point to shake our hands and ask what I thought of his product.  Seared and crispy on the outside, gooey and sweet on the inside.  The perfect cookie.

In short, these cookies are seriously delicious.  You need to pay Anthony a visit.  Your mouth will be rewarded.
author: Tim C.

description:
Okay - here's something amazing: cookies that don't make you feel like a piece of shit after eating them.

Some cookies are delicious but too big.
Some taste artificial.
Others are dry, bland, forgettable.

The thing about Anthony's is that they're just, well, perfect.

The perfect size, thoughtful combinations of ingredients, well-made and flavorful.  Just bursting with flavor!

This is perhaps best-illustrated by their cookies and cream cookie.
When I saw it I remember thinking, "Well...it already IS a cookie, so what?...is it just cream-flavored then?"  Then I tried one and - fuck me blue - it tasted like cookies and cream.  I couldn't even wrap my head around it beforehand but Anthony taught me a little something about the cannibalization of flavors.

The toffee chocolate chip is the other "gun-to-your-head-which-one-would-you-choose" flavor.  Although the likelihood of someone jamming a piece in your face and demanding you pick two cookies to eat is probably slim.
author: David K.

description:
Within the last seven days, I've visited Anthony's Cookies 3 times. Do I have a problem? Could I possibly be addicted to these cookies?!  When I ruin a perfectly good workout to munch on these cookies, I think I might be. May I have a frequent cookie buyer card? Because I know I'll be back for more. Yum! 

Cookies & Creme all day! :) 

Also, the folks that work there are awesome!! Anthony and the crew are on point with their cookies and their customer service! 

Recommendations: 
Cookies & Creme
Toffee Chip
Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin
author: Lisa T.

description: How come my friend from SoCal had to be the one to tell me about this place? Glad she did. Had the toffee cookies and they were drool-worthy. When we got there the place was empty, but as soon as we ordered, one by one, the place got PACKED! I get it though -- the cookies are very good and way cheap -- perfect small sizes too so that you don't feel like a pig after. Swing by!
author: Jonny A.

description: so yummy, and discreet! toffee chip cookies are heavenly, as are the classic white and milk chocolate. get some milk of course!
author: Danielle C.

description: Yummy cookies!!!! One of da best I've tasted! Love it n I want more!!!!  I love da Cinnamon spice n cookies n cream cookies!!!!!!
author: Jay M.

description:
I live in Seattle, so I have only been here once, BUT I was just walking by and the smell of fresh of cookies out on the street made me stop in.
Not only are they yummy (I purchased a whole box) but Anthony and his staff seemed like good people. 
Would have loved a little bit better cup of coffee, but hell I'm willing to let that slide...Warm folks and warm cookies! If that is wrong, I don't want to be right.
author: Meghan S.

description:
I met up with friends at a restaurant across the street for a friend's birthday. While waiting for our food, a friend pointed out that there were yummy cookies across the street. My friend specifically raved about the Toffee ones, too.

Well, I'm not one to pass up "yummy cookies", so off I went to buy some for us. Before crossing the street, I noticed a fire truck parked in the middle of the street on Mission, I thought that there was some kind of emergency nearby...it was an emergency alright--the 2 Firemen were in line at Anthony's...hahahaha! So even though the line was really long, I thought it would really be worth the wait. 

I got a dozen, 2 of each of the 6 flavors left for the day. Everything was yummy but my favorite was the Toffee ones....very very yummy!
author: Barbra C.

description: I'm always weary of a place that ONLY sells one item. Well, I was wrong again. I don't care what people request, this place needs to stick to milk and cookies. I'm sure the rest of the cookies were delicious, but I sampled and stuck with the Cookies and Cream flavored ones. Seriously. Heaven. Get yourself a dozen, and don't look back.
author: Jorge H.

description:
All I have to say is that these cookies are made with a whole lotta LOVE!!! 

The banana cookies are da BOMB - NOT to be missed. 

Anthony is a very cool guy with some serious baking skillz!
author: Cassie G.

description:
Cupcakes were so 2008.  Cookies are the new in thing, and Anthony's Cookies is the best place to get them.  When you think about it, you really can't go wrong. 

One small harmless cookie + a carton of milk = 4 more cookies and a yelp post

They have:
Cookies and Cream Cookies
Toffee Chip Cookies
Walnut and Chocolate Chip Cookies
Oatmeal and Chocolate Chip Cookies
Sugar and Cinnamon Cookies
White Chocolate Cookies
.... anything your heart desires

+ friendly service- Anthony stopped baking cookies to come talk to us :) 

Definitely get a Dozen + 1/2 Dozen.  It's the best deal for $13.
author: Melanie O.

description:
I've heard about this place from a few people so had to check it out. Great little cookie shop right off of Valencia in the Mission. Fortunately I went right in the middle of the day so there was only one other person in there, and lots of cookies to be eaten.

I chose the Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin because I love Oatmeal Raisin and wanted to see how the Whole Wheat tasted. I was pleasantly surprised. It was super moist and not too sweet. It tasted like a homemade cookie, but homemade to perfection. And for $1.25 there is little guilt for this treat.

I sat outside and ate my cookie on the stair. wish i could do that every afternoon..
author: Molly P.

description: I really like the Cookies and Cream cookie, but I have to give the Pecan Chocolate Chip an honorable mention.
author: Menandro M.

description: I just love Anthony's cookies! I usually get a variety of flavors but I always...ALWAYS....end up with more cookies and cream than any other flavor!
author: Chummy S.

description:
I've never heard of Anthony's Cookies until it popped up on the 77 100 Things T0 Try Before You Die list this year. When I tried my brothers fresh Strauss Creamery milk from Anthony's, I knew this was a place I had to try.

The scene:

Located in the quieter part of the Mission, Anthony's lives next to a mortuary, no pun intended.  It's basically just a storefront with a couple of bakers racks and no tables. This is strictly a buy it fresh and take it home to eat kind of deal.

The food:

The cookies are gooood. The cashier was kind enough to break apart 4 cookies for us to try - cookies and cream, toffee chip, banana walnut, and semi-sweet chocolate chip. I quickly purchased a dozen for $9. Note: If you've purchased a bottle of milk here, you can return the bottle for $1.50 recycling credit. Here's the break out of what I got: 4 cookies and cream, 4 semi-sweet chocolate chip and 2 toffee. Don't be alarmed by the ring of oil stains at the bottom of the box. The cookies are sinfully good.

The cookies are exactly the way I like them - thin and chewy. The cookies and cream is made from crushed Oreos and the cream from the cookies are melted into the dough. The semi-sweet is decadent. The chips used are the kind that stay melted, so it smears across your lips with each bite. The toffee chip is good as well, but may be a little too sweet for my sweet tooth.

My bro actually experimented with his own Oreo cookie recipe last night and it's a close match. It might just hold me over until my next craving for the cookies and cream cookie.
author: Sam L.

description: Not just another cookie! Damn good and worthy of standing in line to get a box or two, and standing again in line (uggghhhh) at the post office to ship across country or overseas! nuff said.
author: Gregg M.

description:
I was just at a friends house tonight for her husbands birthday and she had some cookies from anthony`s and WOW. I had to get up , go to the kitchen and find a glass because I WAS HAVING A SERIOUS "GOT MILK" moment .    
   I am coming here next to get my cookies they are awsome !!!
author: Jack O.

description: Anthony has a brilliant cookie and business model. The chocolate chip & cookies  and creams are lovely! They make for a perfect dinner party gift. Hope there may be a cookie discount card deal one day so I can afford them more often.
author: Shanta J.

description: Hmm, price increase? I used to love this place and was just looking up how much I can get or $20 (that's the amount I see people buy when they get a box). Sad to hear that the price went up...the size of the cookie is smaller than Mrs. Fields. Tasty yes, on the first day. The next day they lose their crunch. Hopefully they;ll give a price break at bulk and we can all give 5 stars again.
author: E T.
