description: Yumm. Their cookies are good, but I'm not sure I would make a special trip out here just for that. Oh, wait, I just did that. Parking can get a little scarce, so I parked somewhere along 24th and 25th along the residential area and trekked over. Chocolate chip and CC walnut I liked. Oreo, not a big fan of. Although, peeps I was with, liked it. For me it was chocolate overkill.
author: Vika K.

description:
I've been wanting to try Anthony's cookies for a long time and finally the day came! I walked in yesterday and found myself admiring the decor of the shop and getting excited to taste some fantastic cookies. I mean look at all the 5 star yelp reviews. 

Yes, the cookies are good but I can't say I was swooning. I see all the great reviews and I don't understand. I bought and shared 4 cookies with a friend - toffee chocolate chip, white chocolate, oatmeal & cranberry, and the famous cookies and cream. 

Ok they were good but not enough for me to warrant it a 5 star experience. (Sorry Anthony - I wanted to give you 5 stars but couldn't) I couldn't help but notice at how the sizes of the cookies varied too. Strange - some were big and some were quite small. 

The toffee chocolate chip was just ok for me. Unfortunately for me if I have a craving for this I am going to have to go to my favorite cookie store - Hot Cookie in the Castro. Those guys make a hella good toffee chocolate chip cookie. 

The oatmeal/cranberry cookie was definitely hearty. Lots of cinnamon and that was one of the better tasting cookies for me. You could definitely taste the oatmeal, cranberry, and cinnamon in it. Only complaint about this one was the size. It looked ridiculously small sitting next to the other cookies. 

The cookies and cream cookie was just eh for me. It just made me think that Oreo cookies were just mashed into the cookie batter and then baked. I think this cookie didn't really live up to the hype...sorry.... 

Now the one cookie that I did enjoy was the white chocolate cookie. One bite made me think back to Mrs. Fields when that franchise was at the height of its game. Definitely buttery and with every bite (at least with my cookie) you get a bit of white chocolate. 

Would I return? I can't say I would make a special trip but maybe if I was in the area and craving a cookie I might...
author: Cris H.

description:
These cookies are awesome.  Soft, chewy goodness.  Plus samples galore.

I love you Anthony.
author: Liz B.

description:
Have you ever noticed how the best dessert places in the Bay Area always smell the same? I call it the smell of success! 

I don't care what you people say, the white chocolate cookies ARE the star of the show here. 

Yummy, reasonable, and always served to you with a smile by the helpful staff... Who more often than not includes the owner himself!
author: Black K.

description: Simply one of the best. The cookies are perfectly baked. The price is right. This is one of my favorites.
author: Nance H.

description:
I count myself lucky to have accidentally walked by Anthony's the day after they opened shop.  That sweet smell of fresh baked cookies poured out the door and drew me in.  I was rewarded with free samples and a menu of signature inventions:

Double chocolate
Cookies n' cream
Banana walnut
Ginger snaps (ok, I've had these before, but not nearly as gingery)
and more..

All were sweet and hot-out-of-the-oven amazing.  They're rich - a few bites does the trick.  Coupled with milk, it brought me back to childhood.

Also, at the time, I needed a really good Thank You gift.  A half-dozen, one-of-each box, tied with a string, was it.  I received many happy accolades mumbled over cookies & milk ; ).

Tip: Re-heat cookies for a few minutes in the oven -- it's worth the wait to eat them warm rather than cold.
author: Heather W.

description: Tried bunch of flavors (mostly chocolate) but I like Cookies and Cream the best. Too bad they didn't have my favorite flavor: peanut butter. They are good cookies but not super special.
author: Agustinus T.

description:
My friends just took me to this wonderful little shop. I would have never noticed it on my own. These are some of the most delicious cookies I have ever had, and I know my way around some cookies! 

So far my favorite is the candied pecan chocolate chip. Good lord!

They're the perfect size cookie. I wish they sold soy milk, but that's kind of a tall order. The fact that there's a shop that almost solely sells cookies and milk is just right. That alone makes the world a little more wonderful and sane.
author: Alland B.

description:
cookies and cream is my fav here! been there twice in the last month to buy cookies for family functions and everyone enjoyed them. 

def recommend this place!
author: Connie C.

description: Very good cookies! They are smart to serve them right off the trays they were baked on. You think they are fresh from the over (they are). Oatmeal Raisin, toffee chip, peanut butter and the one with white chocolate chips are the best. $1.25 is a fair price. Most places are $2.50 for a bigger one and I prefer to try 2 different flavors!! When I bring some back to the office they go crazy... Good way to make friends haha!
author: Jim M.

description:
The cookies here lived up to the hype.  Each cookie was baked perfectly, crispy on the outside and chewy in the middle.  I only achieve this kind of perfection in 1% of my baking endeavors.  To find that each cookie I bit into was just as well-made as the last one made me consider giving up my attempts and simply coming here each time I needed a cookie fix. 

I tried the Cookies & Cream, Cinnamon Sugar, Toffee Crisp, and Semi-sweet Chocolate Chip with Walnuts.  The Toffee Crisp was my personal favorite, but I cannot wait to go back and try the rest.
author: Andrew M.

description: Came here around closing time so take everything I say with a grain of salt. Got the cinnamon cookie and the oatmeal raisins and a small bit of milk. The cookies were really good but cold T_T. The service was really good and the place was pretty awesome.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Hadn't heard about this place but happened to walk by after a rainy attempt to see Peanut's Mexican Dance at the street faire. Already drawn in my the minimalist decor but then the smell just knocked me off my feet, wow!

The guys were so friendly and truly seemed happy for us to have walked in; obviously invested in their heavenly world of cookies. Unbeknownst to me, we actually met Anthony who was cheerily taking pans from the oven and chatting with us. When I asked what the cookies and creme was, I was told, "It cannot be explained, only experienced." It was said so earnestly that I took his word.

OH EM GEE! Hella delicious! Perfectly crispy on the outside and just undercooked in the middle to be chewy and amazing. This applies to the cinnamon sugar as well. As I was eating it, Anthony said, "So what do you think?" As I nodded with what I believe to be pure joy on my face, he smiled broadly and said, "Yea, I told you!!" Kudos, Anthony, kudos. As to someone who said "it needed more crunch" they are either lying or clearly mistaken. Don't do it!

Again, love the decor, super classy and modern. I'm sure they'll be adding some tables but I would be ok if they didn't. Liked the feeling of people coming in and out, this being kind of a neighborhood joint. Sat in the window and gave thumbs up to whoever would walk by. Some Odwalla and milk choices (yay for Clover!). As we left, I felt like we were leaving a friend's house.

I'm already planning on stopping by there again before I head to Mission Pie next week. I know, what a glutton; fatten me up!
author: Salina Z.

description:
cookies and cream 5/5
choco chip 3/5
white choco 5/5 (no macadamias yay!!)
toffee chip 5/5

also great for buying as a gift, the have great packaging. the box does cost 25cents but it makes it look pretty. 

im going back. this place is so legit
author: Cindy L.

description:
As I continue my exploration of the Mission, I stumbled upon this little treasure way down on Valencia Street. I would not have know about it if it were not for a invitation to an event I was going to attend. The invite indicated they would be serving Anthony's Cookies.

Sounded great, especially since I love cookies. Unfortunately I couldn't make the event because of a prior obligation. Strange coincidence...that prior obligation was right across the street from Anthony's Cookies... it was one of those signs from the Dessert Gods.

I sheepishly stepped into this simple place that straight up offered an interesting list of cookies. They have a wide array but I was keeping it simple. If they could master the chocolate chip I would return and invest more as Valentine's was approaching I was thinking it would be a great alternative to the box of chocolates.

Anthony's Cookies had to live up to some heavyweights from my past. There was David's Cookies in NY...wow that was an amazing cookie. The classic Chocolate Chunk. Locally, there was Citizen Cakes Chocolate Espresso cookie. Both were great but sadly have fallen in time.

I bit into Anthony's Chocolate Chip cookie and it was great. Perfect balance of moistness with semi-weetness and enough texture to the cookie to pass my test.

So I returned the next day just before he was about to give free cookies away from 1-3 PM. I bought my box for Valentines. Oatmeal, Peanut butter, Chocolate, Cinnamon, all added to the box.

Well worth the adventure down Valencia.
author: Peter M.

description:
Anthony's Cookies are damned tasty.  Eat them and be happy.

I love going to this neighborhood shop.  The sweet aroma wafts out onto Valencia street and grabs you by the face.  It is tastefully and simply decorated with a simple interior.  The stark contrast of white Strauss milk jugs reminds you of where you are.  

Anthony himself is a super cool dude.  Friendly.  curious. inquisitiive.   He is obviously constantly trying to improve, which is the sign of a great small business.

My favorites are the cookies and cream (oreo cookies inside of a cookie - De-friggin-licious) and the toffee.  The toffee is sugary and scrumptious, and melts out nicely to flavor the whole cookie.

Great success!
author: Adam C.

description:
I tried Anthony's not too long ago and am planning to go back already! I got a half dozen for $5 of different kinds. The one I didn't like was the toffee (not toffee-ish enough for me). The rest were yummy, especially the oatmeal w/ raisins & w/ cranberries. Those two were my fave. My fiance liked the choc. chip, which was very good as well. 

The cashier behind the counter was very friendly and helpful when I couldn't decide. I like this place!
author: Freckles H.

description:
I like the owner, Anthony, his enthusiasm about improving his products. He always ask customers what they think about his cookies. 
The quality is amazing. My favorite is White Chocolate. They use Ghilladelli chocolate, and it is cheap, $85. 
There is not such healthy and delicious cookies store in the Mission. Anthony's cookies is definitely a must in the Mission. 

http://missionlocal.org/2009/05/a-recession-time-to-open-a-restaurant-say-mission-district-entrepreneurs/
author: Ayako M.

description: My coworker told me that I HAD to go try these cookies. So, I went in after work after 5pm and i was afraid I was too late because the door was closed and it was empty. To my great joy, they were still open. Even though there weren't any other customers, the atmosphere was still really fun. Good music and really nice service. The BEST part, was that the cookies were still warm! Fresh even towards the end of the day. Definitely get the Cookies'n'Cream. DELISH!
author: Rachel N.

description:
There is nothing like the smell of freshly baked cookies.  Ahhhhh.  And I live down the block so this is all I smell when I walk by... which is not a bad thing, btw.  

FAVS: (1) oatmeal raisin or oatmeal cranberry - crispy on the outside but chewy on the inside.  (2) AND the banana or banana walnut FO' SHO'!  Texture is in between a banana muffin and a cookie.  (3) Don't forget the Toffee!  It's pretty delish.  All the cookies are just the right amount of sweetness - not overly sweet - which is important to me.

I don't have a sweet tooth and rarely crave sweets so it's funny for me to rave about a cookie joint but Anthony's Cookies rocks!!

BTW, Marcus and Anthony ARE the nicest guys in the world.  This is not the reason I am a fan but certainly makes me want to root for these guys!
author: Lisa K.

description:
I have a (great) friend who (generously) bought me one dozen of Anthony's (incredible) cookies.

Now, I have sampled many a cookie, and I'm hear to say that I doubt you'll ever find them as good as this.  Come from near, come from far, just come.   I'm already trying to figure out the next time I can get to SF to eat a cookies and cream cookie from here... and I live in Los Angeles.
author: Chelsee H.

description: Definitely one of the best cookies I've ever tasted. Cookies & Cream and Toffee Chip are my faves!
author: Christian B.

description:
If you want a little piece of heaven in your mouth and i am not available...
the next best thing would be Anthony's Cookies.

I have never eaten a cookie that was both fluffy AND chewy at the same time...

There are several different flavors to choose from....i suggest trying one of each!

I am a total chocolate chip cookie whore.....let me just say...if i were in prison and Anthony's chocolate chip cookie was the prison guard...i would be dropping the soap a LOT in the shower...i'd sooo be its bitch!

i also sampled the banana walnut and cinnamon sugar....both were amazing....

this is a local business..not a chain!!!!  Support this place...please...this place needs to stay around forever!

Thank GOD its a good distance from my house...if i lived next door to this place...i would be in danger!!!!!!!!!!
author: Ripley B.

description: Your cookies and cream cookie just made my day. And a good deal if you're catering for a work event. Love, love, love this joint!
author: Kerri B.

description:
Cookies and cream all the way.  I could eat two dozen of these straight.  They are phenomenal with a glass of milk!!!!! I've tried the chocolate chip, and white chocolate chip also, but cookies and cream don't compare.  Perfect combo of chewy and soft.
The only downside is that the cookies are a bit on the small side and a tad expensive... They raised the price to $1.25 each. They're yummy, but that's a lot of moolah.
author: Marjorie P.

description:
holy smokes cookies and cream cookie.. just don't go too late or they'll be sold out.
appreciate the staff willingly sampling cookies. afterall, you dont want to pay however much they charge (not your typical mrs. fields prices) for a cookie that you'll hate (though tough).

parking sucks as it's on valencia, but if i'm making a quick run, i'll pull into the "do not block driveway" driveway ;) geez, now i hope i dont get bad karma.
author: Rica R.

description:
"Hey Kyle man, I will do nothing to compromise the quality of my cookies.. If you notice anything different, any inconsistencies with the taste, texture, anything- you let me know personally"- That's what Anthony said to me the day before the grand opening of Anthony's Cookies . I was like DAYAM!, what a dude. I've never seen anybody as dedicated and passionate about making cookies as Anthony is, while being super-friendly at the same time.

So I show up at the grand opening, and the place was all kinds of packed with all kinds of folks. So after getting their cookies and Odwallas or what not, some were just hangin around the store for a couple minutes then Anthony comes to the front counter and yells, "Hey ya'll I just wanted to say how nice it is to see everybody enjoyin themselves here at Anthony's Cookies." And I was thinkin "Damn! Anthony ain't bullshittin"- he is really a genuinely nice, decent human being, which is rare these days.

Since I just wasted about 2 minutes of your time explaining how nice Anthony is, imma tell you what I got from him: 3 Cookies n Cream 2 Wht Chocolate and 2 chocolate Chip cookies. Boy lemme tell you none of these survived the trip home- and I live in Pacifica, which is just about 10 minutes away. All of em are pretty official but the Cookies & Cream one stands out the most- If you blend an oreo milkshake from Jack in the box with a McFlurry and bake it, you get a cookies & cream cookie from Anthony's. Best $5.50 I've spent since $5 wednesdays at Roaring 20's.
author: Kyle E.

description:
Everyone who knows me even slightly well knows I have a special place in my heart for cookies. So imagine my excitement when I heard about this joint that actually specialized in nothing but cookies. I went here today and the line was down the block and around the corner. The weather was decent so I didn't mind waiting. About 40 minutes later I finally got in the shop. You can tell they just opened because it's still a little sparse but it will be adorable once they get situated. They have a dozen different cookies and I'd planned on just getting one of each to share with friends but they were running low because of the crowd. Understandable, so I just 6 cookies that were fresh out of the oven. 

What I liked about Anthony's was that Anthony himself came out and thanked everyone for coming. He seemed like a really sincere and nice guy (love that). Of the cookies I tried the banana walnut was surprisingly my favorite. I usually love chocolate chip with nuts, and while these were good they weren't the best I've ever had. I really wanted to try some other varieties so I'll make it back one day soon. Once they work out the kinks I think this place could be great!
author: Holly E.

description: Wowza! Fresh warm cookies. Perfectly soft, melt in your mouth, heavenly chunks, probably not that good for you, but good for you in that they taste so yummy kind of cookies. I mean if these aren't that good to you, please tell where I can get  freshly made cookies better than these?
author: April D.

description: All their cookies are pretty good.  When I don't feel like baking myself and want a cookie, I come here.  Parking is easy.  I like they're not ginormous size cookies so you don't feel guilty after eating one... or two.  They rotate their daily selection so my only complaint is that not all the flavors are available everyday.
author: Irene C.

description:
Pros: Smiling, undeniably charming service
          Yummy cookies
          Smells good

Cons: Hopelessly inefficient (although still charming)
          They often run out of popular cookies, like chocolate chip
           Limited milk selections
           No seats

I'm not gonna make a joke asking if the workers are more baked than the cookies, but, yeah, I'll admit I thought about it.
author: Hayesvalleygirl ..

description:
two star cookies that get an extra star for being a local business.
Perhaps cookies are the new cupcakes. The thing is I can make cookies like the ones at anthony but I can't make cupcakes.

Maybe there are lots of people that don't bake and the mission is filled with hipsters who buy most anything rather than making it themselves.

The cookies are good, almost too buttery. they aren't small but they certainly aren't large like the ones at hot cookie in the castro. We got a dozen and tried all the flavours and all were very good but none were amazing.
I hope as they grow their business they come up with more exciting flavours.
author: DeathandFood H.

description: I love cookies! and I bought 5 different cookies but all was GREAT! and a friend of mine who usually doesn't eat cookies ate it and kinda liked it! just there are not many people working so you will wait a little bit if there are already some people, but you know, Patient is always a key for everything.
author: Hanako K.

description:
5 stars? WTF!? 

Warm freshly made cookies is a good thing but they just seemed like normal cookies, they kind you get from any generic cookie recipe book.

On top of that I had to wait nearly 20 minutes even though there were only 7 people in front of me. No, we weren't waiting for cookies to be made, it's that their staff is that sssssllllllooooowwwwwww.  For all I know they intentionally go slow to make the place have a line and therefore look like it's popular.

The plus is they are not too big and they are reasonably priced. $0.95 a cookie.

If they could get the wait down maybe I'd give them 4 stars because being able to buy a freshly made cookie is pretty awesome.
author: Gregg T.

description:
Cookies - easy to make, difficult to perfect. I'm a baking nincompoop - one of those people who desire the soft and chewy but wind up leaving the cookies in for too long resulting in those crisped charcoal chunks. I guess that's why I appreciate a good pastry item. Anthony took this humble American biscuit and brought out the greatness of this tasty treat. Chewy (do not leave without trying the cookies'n cream), cakey (banana nut), and crunchy - they have it all! You'll piss and moan at the $1 o'piece price tag but giggle with delight once you chomp on one of these bad boys. Don't resist the urge - walk out with the box of dozen and try 'em all! 

Also, Four Barrel coffee?! *squee*
author: Emily T.

description:
WOW!! Butter-licious!!

I heart sweets...have I said it already in past reviews?! There are an OVERWHELMING selection of cookie choices out there and the fact that this place ONLY sells cookies, makes it so that they can attempt to perfect their craft.

Since it's not a cookie cutter recipe, each variety seems to come out in its own shape and size. I got one of each: chocolate chip, peanut butter, cookies and cream, toffee chip, oatmeal raisin and cinnamon sugar. The only one I didn't try was peanut butter since it was for someone else but he LOVED it! 

The ingredients are fresh and the cookies are chewy without being doughy. All of them sweet in their own rights but not with a cavity-inducing sting. I paired mine with some ice-cold coffee milk (my own concoction!) and can easily throw down 3 at a time. 

If ever in the area, I'm there in a heartbeat. Employees are nice. Just wish they did their pricing in dozens or something!!
author: J C.

description: I've been to Anthony's cookies 2 times I love the cookies are really moist and chewy and a dollar each if you get six or a dozen but this one time that I went in the girl behind the counter was very slow about everything. Considering the line so that's why I give took off one star but besides that the cookies are always fresh. I recommend coming early if you want a particular cookie because once they run out they don't usually make anymore. Definitely cookies and cream is the cookie to try and also snickerdoodle I think it was called the cinnamon one was really good I really liked it and the oatmeal cookies are delicious I don't really like raisins but I do like there oatmeal cookies.
author: Whitney N.

description: Nice and fresh cookies. I got peanut butter cookies and they were so yummy :)
author: Nori K.

description:
YUMMO! I came here for the first time and parked around the corner. You could smell the yumminess from there. 

The workers were so friendly and talkative. Anthony was there as well and told me the story about how he started out. It's amazing to see where he is now! The cookies are so yummy! I can't really pick a favorite because they were all pretty tasty but i would totally order more of the one with the oreo cookie smashed inside it and the banana walnut! Nothing is overly sweet either so you can eat the whole cookie. Also the prices are decent. I bought two dozen for $17! WHATTA STEAL!

Definitely coming back here when I need a cookie fix.
author: Jazmine S.

description: This place has great cookies. Their Oreo Chocolate Chip cookies are the best that I have had. Kind of expensive for cookies, but the kids just can't seem to get enough of them.
author: Marty M.

description:
I had a doubly delightful experience yesterday: trying, for the first time, one of Anthony's cookies. I also got to meet Anthony who was just as cheerful and friendly as everyone says he is. I got an elbow bump instead of a handshake as he was in the midst of more magic-making.
I am ashamed to say I'd never heard of Anthony until yesterday but now I am a devoted Anthony's cookie fan. I first tried a chocolate chip cookie, just out of the oven, and it was just the way I like them: soft, thick, chewy, warm, with melty chocolate deliciousness. YUM. You could almost say they are slightly underbaked but in a good way!  I also took a peanut butter for later and ate some of it last night although I wanted to save some for today. it was rich and peanut buttery! 
I am looking forward to my next sampling of cookies and cream, and the toffee. I'm sure they'll be as wonderful as everyone says they are!
author: christine r.

description:
The first time I met Anthony was over lunch at Google. He was just the nicest, humblest, sincerest guy, and when I found out he owned a cookie shop, I couldn't wait to pay a visit. 

The first time I walked into this shop and saw the twelve listed flavors, I couldn't decide. So I bought one of each. And by the time I got home, I found myself brushing off the crumbs from the three and a half cookies I had just downed. Luckily, my cousin and her boyfriend were home to help me finish the rest, and they were instantly won over and marveling about its baked perfection. 

Also, the store closes at 8pm on Mon-Fri, not 7, as listed on Yelp.

The cookies & cream, banana, and chocolate are my personal favorites, but you really can't go wrong. They're a perfect combination of crisp chewiness, and the banana is a nice bready counterpart. Easily the best cookies in SF!
author: Erika C.

description: Omg! I'm highly disappointed at myself that I never knew about this place considering the fact that I used to live around here.  The cookies was so fresh, moist and just overall perfect! Then of course Anthony had us try his fresh baked peanut butter cookies and was asking us for our opinion.  YES!!! They were so yummy!!! This place is a gem! I love nothing more than to give this guy business! Perfect cookies & awesome owner!!! Love it!!! :)
author: Lee E.

description:
Wow...I've been walking past this place for months on the way to work but never felt compelled to try it, mostly in an attempt to avoid the calories and carbs.  I knew that discovering a delicious cookie place a block from home would not be a good idea.  After seeing Anthony featured in 7 by 7 magazine I figured I should finally try them and wow I've never been so glad/scared to have found such deliciously tempting cookies. Scared of course because as I said they are a block from me and these are probably the best cookies I've ever had in my life.  

They're priced very reasonably, get half a dozen for $5.  The cookies and cream is amazing every time I try it as is the cinnamon sugar.  The oatmeal raisin is definitely the best oatmeal cookie I've ever tried.  How do they get them to be crispy on the outside yet soft and a little doughy on the inside!?? So perfect.
author: Lance D.

description: such an awesome small shop. parking can be a bit difficult at times, but the cookies here are amazing! 7x7 magazine was definitely right when they labeled the Oreo cookie from here as one of the "100 things in SF to try before you die." cookies are baked fresh daily and each day they have a special cookie for the day. all of the cookies are definitely worth trying. if I could stop by every morning to have a cookie to wash down with some morning coffee or tea; this place would be such a winner. don't forget to get some milk. you're definitely going to need it after having just one Oreo cookie. :)
author: Germaine L.

description:
Cookies are to die for!!!!! 
I only got one cookie because I was sick. I got a Whole Wheat Oatmeal Raisin cookie!! And in the end I said F- my sore throat. My buddy had a banana which he said is a vanilla based so it tasted like a vanilla waffer but this weekend when I go visit him I'm bring him a dozen! woot woot. and a dozen for my babe and a dozen for my house. But its pretty pricey for cookies.
author: Carolyn Y.

description:
Best damn cookie...evar.

Anthony is a cool guy too. Very humble and energetic!!!
author: Manny C.

description: If you have a dollar and some change, maybe two dollars, stop in here for a delicious Anthony's cookie.  I'm generally not huge on desserts, but every now and then, I like to indulge and this place hits the spot.  Get the toffee cookie.  A-MA-Zing!  :)
author: Terri M.

description: OH-MY-GOODNESS! The cookies-n-cream is just the right mix of crunchy, chewy, delectable goodness. I want another, now, no, right now. Please. Let's go, soon. So so so delish!
author: Shira O.

description:
SERVICE: Impeccable. The guys greeted us immediately as we walked in. They were so sweet and gave us samples as we were narrowing our choices down. It was smart move because we ended up buying more than we intended to because they were SO DARN DELICIOUS!

PRODUCT: We were originally saving them for after lunch but as we walked to get a lunch, we realized that we already went through half of what we bought in a matter of minutes. Yes, they  were THAT yummy - warm, soft, & chewy. It was so tempting to just skip lunch and finish off the cookies! Cookie prices are very reasonable. 

DECOR: Wonderfully simple. Cookies in a window display to the side. Cookie flavors written on a blackboard. Glass bottles of Strauss milk all lined up. Cookies & milk - totally brings me back to my childhood. Who doesn't love that combination? 

OWNER: Walked out of the store and was asked by a young man, "How was it?" At first I thought it was someone who was debating if he should go into the store to get some cookies. When I asked him out of curiosity he replied, "I'm Anthony!" Oooooh! It's always so cool to meet the owner of a store that you support who is so genuine and caring. He looked busy but took the time to talk with us and tell us a little about himself. Left a very positive impression on me.
author: Connie W.

description:
if the cookie monster still ate cookies, he'd leave sesame street for anthony's. 

now, i don't really have much of a sweet tooth. but anthony's cookies are amazing. i first had them when my company got catering from mix't greens, and since then have gone to the flagship for more!

all his cookies are just melt in your mouth delicious. while all the cookies are fantastic, nothing beats the cookies and cream. what a genius concept. chocolate chip cookie dough with oreo pieces. RIDICULOUS. i'm not much of a chocolate person, so when i was in high school my best friend at the time used to bake me chocolate chipless chocolate chip cookies and i used to lovee them. because let's be real, sugar cookies are not the same as chocolate chip cookies. 

now i can enjoy the benefit of chocolate chip cookie dough without the chocolate chips, with the extra yumminess of oreos. thanks anthony's!
author: Jessica S.

description:
Geez Louise, I don't even really like cookies.  But I love Anthony's cookies!

My favorites are the Chocolate chip walnut, the cookies and creme and the cinnamon sugar which are NOT snickerdoodles...it is SO much more.  

There is a whole decorem and process to getting your cookies too.  I nearly had a heart attack the first time I went. 7 PM on a Wednesday and the guy in front of me cleaned out three flavors. Sherwin and I gave each other a look and then both turned to glare at our offender before us.  Freaking out I immediately proceeded to order every flavor for pick up the next day.

My co-worker actually stocks up for the weekend.  Usually a dozen plus chocolate chip walnut.

Honestly I think when butter is sitting on the shelf waiting to be purchased and they all see Anthony strolling up the aisle they all go, "pick me!  PIck me!  I want to be a part of an Anthony's cookie!  ah man...pick me!"

Also, when you read interviews with Anthony he seems like a pretty down chill person who cares about his employees.
author: Yvonne Y.

description:
Ohhhhh how I lurve this place!! Have now gone three times and each time the cookies are better than before!!

Went yesterday and chatted a bit with the super friendly guy at the counter. When I told him I was going to *attempt* to bring my second cookie home to give to my hubby, he smiled and said, "Ok, good luck!" Luckily, the cookie made it home intact- but barely, as it was still warm and yummy when I left! 

My only gripe- why did they have to open less than a block from my Pilates studio? It's already a pain in the arse to get there on Thursdays- now I have to be in danger of having a bigger arse to haul around on top of it?!
author: Jane D.

description:
Yum.

Just like Mom's: soft and chewy throughout, with just a bit crispness on the outside. They taste like they're right out of the oven.
author: Bryan E.

description: Love the chocolate chip cookie! Nom~ so good! I bought one of each flavor and the next day it was still just as good! I definitely want to go back and try their other flavors!
author: Katie M.

description:
Truly fantastic cookies. I tried to eat some others after tasting these and I am ruined. 

But there is a rub or two. Do not ever go there excepting to get your cookies quickly or all the flavors you want. Whether the line is 20 deep or no line at all the staff is very slow moving and fusses with nonsense like strings and stickers.  My husband or I have been there many times as these make great gifts for attending parties and it is never a fast experience. Anthony has a great personality but it is just not fun to have to wait for him to stop holding court with his friends telling stories...if you sell such a wonderful addictive product understand that waiting and hearing stories you are not a part of  is a nightmare.
author: Sion S.

description:
His cookies turned me into a puppet! I was at a party and his cookies were the talk of the night. I couldn't stop taking cookies, even though I should have left some for others. Then bam someone spotted my thievery. "Stop! Cookie monster."  I was a little ashamed. Very little to be honest. Yeah, they are that good. 

I really think these cookies would make a great gift. Or if you want to eat your feelings. Or if you want to reward yourself after a half marathon.

Fortunately I was lucky enough to meet Anthony and I immediately noticed his passion and love for what he does. He is the type of person you definitely want to support. Now, I actually have to get myself there.
author: Roger H.

description: All I have to say is Cookies and Creme!  By far the best cookie I have ever eaten.  Absolutely great cookie selection and Anthony's a nice guy!
author: Matt J.

description:
Gotta love the smell of freshly baked cookies when you walk in the door, especially on a cold, foggy day like today.  

We've been meaning to check this place out for a while, and happened to be walking around the neighborhood today.  We picked up a dozen, expecting to share them with some visiting family staying at our place, but only a few partially eaten cookies made it the whole trip home.

After we ordered our dozen (faves were the walnut chocolate chip and semi-sweet chocolate chip; cookies & cream was good, but a little too sweet), they had us try a new flavor - banana chocolate chip - saying people had been requesting that they make it.  Absolutely fantastic - it's not on the menu right now, but so tasty it's sure to be on there soon.

Kudos for the friendly staff (and other customers) as well - it was a bit of a wait, as everyone was chatting, but well worth it.
author: John H.

description: Jeebus how do they make such good cookies? I felt like a kid again sitting there eating cookies and drinking a small carton of milk. Loved the cinnamon spice, oatmeal chocolate chip, and cookies and cream. $1.25 per cookie and the cookie isn't big, so it can get pricey, but mmm worth the try :) yummy. I will be back for more.
author: Wendy L.

description: The best ones are the toffee chip and cookies and cream.  None of the cookies blew me away but these blew the most.  As a fat ass I eat alot of toll house cookies from safeway.  $2.50 for 12 cookies.  12 cookies here cost $12.  crazy
author: Fatty A.

description:
I love cookies.  Cookies might actually be my favorite dessert.  A perfect cookie is like food from the gods.  Seriously, I love cookies.  

Needless to say, I was excited to learn of a new cookie shop in town and, I must say, these cookies are delicious.  I bought a dozen for a picnic at the park and I ate 4 of them.  As I sit here writing this, I wish I had eaten more.  

Laughter and happiness are things that should be shared with your friends.  These cookies should be kept all to yourself.
author: Renee D.

description: Anthony's cookies are AWESOME-- crispy on the outside and moist & chewy in the center. I love the cookies & cream-- it's like a cookie within a cookie!!
author: Jonathan W.

description: So Anthony's has been open for just over a week and I (with the help of my Partner in Crime) have been through 3 dozen excluding the pre-openning dozen which was shared with my housemates. I was on vacation last week in a tropical paradise. We're talking crystal clear water and white sand beaches. But still, I found myself in the throws of (as short lived as it may have been) an actual  fit of depression when we ran out due to poor rationing.  I think I'm in T-R-O-U-B-L-E.
author: Mingus R.

description: as a self-proclaimed cookie monster, i was disappointed with the cookies and creme flavor, but the dark chocolate was delicious. not sure if i'd come here again though since it didn't find the cookies to be addicting enough for me to crave for more.
author: Jen C.

description:
I stumbled upon this place today while heading to a baby shop just down the road.  I fortunately found a parking place right across the street from here - I saw the crowd and smelled the wonderful scent of freshly baked cookies.  I'm not really eating sweets these days but couldn't pass up trying these.

It is a long line wait and slow service but once you finally get to order, the staff is very friendly and calm.  End result is you get a delicous, warm and fresh cookie.  I got 6 cookies for $5 - Choc Chip and Oatmeal Raisin and wasn't disappointed.

Only have a few suggested changes:
Since this place is fairly new, don't want to be too critical, but they do need to improve their service and wait time.  They need to get a better system on getting the cookie orders out a bit quicker. They probably need 3 people working during the busy times.....one to take the order, one to assembly, and one to bake.  Today, there were only two people so it was quite slow and you could see that they were still very new with the process.

Prices -- a bit pricey for the size of cookie...understand that it's expensive in SF but think they could offer a better deal on a dozen cookies that are $9.75.   You can get a dozen of Krispy Kreme donuts for $6.75.
author: Gina C.

description: Excellent cookies! We got a variety box as a gift and each of them tasted great. Would love to see which other desserts they have.
author: Gagan T.

description: Sooo sad ..cookies keep getting smaller and more expensive ! NO more half dozen price or dozen break !!! Good cookies but at $ 1.25 a pop and 2 1/2 inches wide ..its a bit indulgent for my regular cookie stop from now on .Bummer!
author: mary k.

description: The oatmeal-cranberry cookie I had was delicious, with just a hint of cinnamon (I think) in it, and their menu looked like it would be hard to go wrong with any of their offerings. My cookie was about 3" diameter for $1.25, so I felt like the value was there, and it was nice that they avoid the modern trend of oversized portions. The exterior was pretty, looking like the boutique that it is; however, the interior would benefit from some sprucing up. The walls were mostly bare and the large hardwood floor held only one long, raw wood table. I recommend a collection of art (on consignment?) for the walls and several two-top tables. Or at least put a nice tablecloth on the table to make it more inviting.
author: Bill B.

description:
Next best thing to baking your own. The cookies are warm because they just came out of the oven. The whole wheat oatmeal raisin was good but a little too much cinnamon for our taste. The chocolate chip walnut is great. 

We're so happy we happened upon Anthony's.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
I am seriously believing that Anthony's cookies are made of crack. 

I am an addict. 

Help.
author: Diana J.

description:
Cookies are often divisive.  They seem to be a matter of personal preference with the crispy camp v the soft and chewy.  Some hold chocolate chips to be the highest expression of purity while others hold allegiance to snickerdoodles.

Anthony's makes amazing cookies and has a great variety of flavors.  Whether or not you think these are the *best* cookies evar will depend on your cookie preference.  However these cookies are a flawless execution of the soft in the middle and slightly crispy on outside cookies.  (They aren't the thick cake-y soft cookies),  

The better bargain is to get lots and they are a great and easy gift for parties/the office/gestures of love....
author: MJ C.

description: I tried the cookies and cream (#65 of the 2012 7x7 list of things to eat before you die), chocolate chip, toffee chip, double walnut and the oatmeal.  I liked all the cookies but thought the good old chocolate chip was the best.  I think all the cookies can be a little softer/chewier.  I think they should take out the cookies a little earlier out of the oven but that's just my humble opinion.
author: Sandy H.

description:
Love Anthony Cookies! 
When I had a taste of his cookies, It zoomed me into a time when I remember being 8 years old with my cousin and we had the most amazing cookies-and-milk at a hotel.  I told myself "these are the best darn cookies ive tasted in my whole life". It just reminded me of that moment.
It's funny seeing all the people that got there too. While I was in line, a lot of ladies where giggling, giddy and excited to have a piece of that cookie..RIGHT NOW! (and I MEAN now!)  and i don't know why it has that effect on people.
saccharine and dopamine? made of the same compounds? ya think?
author: Shoe C.

description:
I don't understand the hype. I bake cookies quite often, so I do have my own preconceived notions about cookie crunch/chewiness/thickness/diameter/sweetness/heartiness, and I'm not sure why Anthony priced his tiny cookies at $1.25.

Yes, I said it: they're small - the type you can finish in several brief bites. They were also thin (added too much egg), cold, and had been sitting on the baking sheet for too long. I actually saw the server retrieve the cookies from a baking sheet. 

Anthony let his cookies cool for more than 5 minutes on a baking sheet? Oh lord. I couldn't taste any love in his cookies. All I could taste was an overwhelming likeness to those Tollhouse-brand cookies you buy in the frozen foods section. Then again, I can understand Anthony's predicament: these are just cookies, and I doubt anyone would want to pay cupcake prices just to have a cookie baked with love. If you're not too familiar with baking cookies, these cookies will suit you fine. If you are, however, just warm up your oven mitts. Use the money you would've spent at Anthony's on more expensive ingredients. And don't forget to add love.
author: V Y.

description:
i like chewy cookies, and that's how they make them here, so i love it.

cookies & cream, toffee, whatever they're all good.

the only thing i want: more creative flavors. they've mastered chocolate chip (and all it's variants) so let's put on the aprons, get out our wooden spoons and see what cookie blasphemy we can bake up.
author: Shawn C.

description:
Oh. My. Stars.

Anothony's cookies made their way into my home this weekend, brought by a lovely friend as a contribution to our housewarming BBQ.  

With the very first bite, I became paralyzed with ecstatic joy: the PERFECTION of this bite of chocolate chip heaven!  A few friends and I stood, wide-eyed, trembling with every chew, as if to say, "HOLYSHIT THISISTHEBESTCOOKIEEVER!"  I tore through the back door of the house with the small box of still-warm confections, and vowed to hide them someplace-- anyplace-- to protect them from the jaws of our guests.

I of course changed my mind and shared, being that I would never beseech my loved ones the chance to have a warm cookie from the new baker in the neighborhood.

But seriously, what I love about these cookies (aside from the fact that they are delicious), is that they are the same size as the cookies you bake at home, as opposed to the size of a small dinner plate.  It makes the texture so much more uniform and divine!  No sharing, get your own :)

Also, word has it that Anthony himself is as nice as can be.  A sweet young guy who makes cookies like this deserves a big hug.

Run, don't walk-- you need a cookie!  Now!
author: Laura F.

description:
YES!! ladies & gentlemen boys and girls, come one come all. Anthony's cookies are the best I've ever eaten!! Ever!! If you are ever in the neighborhood stop by this newly opened cookie shop and pick up some of Anthony's thoughtful cookie creations. Anthony has many different cookie flavors but I recommend the double chocolate and the cookies & cream. 

In addition to the delicious cookies Anthony is a genuinely nice person. As soon as you walk into his bakery he greets everyone with enthusiasm which rarely happens these days. Anyway when you get a chance stop by and pick up 2 dozen 1 wont be enough!! no jokin.
author: THE REAL K.

description:
Wow.  This place is AMAZING!  I tried the Cookies and Cream cookie for the first time on Saturday and have been addicted ever since!  I live an hour away from San Francisco, but luckily I had to go back to San Francisco for other reason and HAD to go to Anthony's to pick up cookies each time.  

I tried the Toffee Chip, the Oatmeal, the Candied Pecans one, the classic Chocolate Chip, the Double Chocolate Chip and of course, bought a TON more Cookies and Cream.  The Cookies and Cream are by far my favorite.  The Toffee Chip and Candied Pecans are really good, too..  but, then again, they all are!  

I LOVE Anthony's cookies!!  Too bad they're so far away, but maybe it's a good thing! I'd probably be eating Anthony's cookies EVERY day.  They are really good.  Yummmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm.....
author: Cici C.

description: Love this store! Try freshly baked cookies(Hazel nuts), your mouth will melt for sure:))
author: Maitai N.

description: Aside from service glitches and an apparent zombie staff, the cookies at Anthony's are the creation of sensory jubilation and joy.  My God friends, these chewy, gooey discs are what heaven must be paved with.  I'm not going to describe and praise each cookie, but I hasten to say that their selection is the most diverse I've ever seen in a bakery on either coast, border or country, truly a sensual and subime experience.
author: Stu S.

description:
Delicious cookies that are the perfect size.
Exceptionally friendly customer service.
Prices that kick the ass of any other cookie store.
$5 gets you 6 perfectly portioned, melt-in-your mouth, sugary pieces of goodness.
I'm pretty sure you can't even get 2 cookies from Hot Cookie at that price, at least not the penis one.
author: Mercutio k.

description: Anthony's cookies keeps paradox of choice low and thus increases my overall happiness. They make like 8-10 different type of cookies and have milk, that's it. I really like the park bench table they have in the store so you can enjoy your cookies in peace. The staff is always friendly when I come in and the cookies are very solid. What more can you ask for? 5 stars.
author: Michael S.

description:
I was helplessly walking by when I, in a vulnerable state, heard the smell of Anthony's Cookies.  Homemade cookies, when being baked all day, have a certain way of shooting aroma out of an open door and riding the wind in San Francisco.  If you are anywhere near this, you should probably lose control of your body as it autonomously walks in and forks over cash for cookies.  

What kind of cookies?  Who cares.... It's all about the surrender.
author: Michael S.

description: If you look really hard, you'll find this little cookie shop on Valencia between 25th Street and 26th Street!  We came with the intention of finding the most delicious cookies...and we were NOT disappointed.  The cookie selection has enough variety to come back again and again.  Our 1st visit was a little order of 3 1/2 dozen cookies...a few for us...and a lot to share!  One of the boxes went to L.A. to a cookie monster type family.  Another box went to a "real baker" kind of family.  The last box was shared with a special bunch of friends and family...All raved..and raved...and raved...and wanted to know where is this cookie place!?!  Since our 1st visit, we've returned for more boxes of cookies....all to share of course!  Anthony's Cookies is a San Francisco MUST!!!!
author: Shel L.

description:
After eating Anthonys Cookies I felt so guilty!! a dozen cookies all to myself.... oh man do I have a major sweet tooth... I need to see a dentist soon.... 
I LOVE there toffee chip, cookie and cream, and there double chocolate chip walnut..... with a tall glass of cold MILK ummummm good!
author: Shirl C.

description:
Anthony's Cookies are fabulous. Here are my reasons:

1) They are fresh and taste like homemade
2) They're not too big (read Mrs. Fields) so you can't feel guilty
3) The folks who work there are just as sweet

They have a list of what cookies are baked what day that you can take home with you since the variety does change daily. Also, when you walk in, look at the board up front to the right. That has the list of cookies that's available right then and there. The board on the left wall is their full selection which isn't always available...

My (current) favorite are the cranberry oatmeal, but really, you can't go wrong with any of them. Put them in the oven at 375 for about 5 minutes and it takes like you baked them yourself! Definite crowd pleaser should you need to bring a treat to any event this time of year.
author: Cynthia Y.

description:
Saw Anthony's Cookies on www.thesnackattack.com so had to give them a try. Full disclosure: I have never met a cookie I didn't like. But still what makes this place aside from the delicious cookies (I tried Snickerdoodle, Chocolate Chip Nut, Oatmeal Chocolate, Oatmeal cranberry - I think I like snickerdoodle best) are the people who work there. Super sweet, super cool. 

Other things I like the place: 1. The cookies are normal sized not huge, not tiny, so I can get one and be satisfied or 2 and not hate myself. 

2. They have a banana cookie which is more like a muffin top that I can buy for my kid and not feel terrible. I know muffins have tons of sugar too, but I appreciate that they are a marginally healthier option. (Yes I am a hypocrite for giving my kids a muffin top while I devour real cookies. I am guessing it won't be the last time I espouse a "do as I say, not as I do" philosophy toward child rearing.)

Note that this place is a little hard to find. I was lookig for it specifically and walked right past it and had to double back. Anthony's - get a sign! I think it will dramatically improve you changes for success. 

Best of luck to this store, I hope it is hugely successful!
author: Lynn G.

description: Its a pretty simple store. not much to look at besides the handwritten menu. but, i loooove their cookies! it took a while for me to get mines because they were fresh out of the oven and they had to cool down. their chocolate chip cookies are good, but you wanna get their cookies and cream cookies! they are to diiieee for!  i usually get half a dozen of chocolate chip and half a dozen of cookies and cream. i still need to try their other flavors tho. I think they would be great too!
author: Josephine C.

description:
holy moly, the best damn cookie in SF!!!  a girl friend of mine brought a box of cookies over tonight- a dozen variety of toffee, cookies & cream, and double chocolate.   i heart toffee anything, so i polished off two of the toffee all by myself (the self-loathing shall commence tomorrow).  my 8 year old loved the cookies & cream which was a bit too sweet for my taste, but i also don't really like cookies & cream.   the double chocolate was delectably deeeelicious.    as other yelpers mentioned, they are moist and chewy and really do just melt in your mouth!    i had mine with a glass of milk and felt like a kid again :)

anthony, i'm putting you right up there with paulette and bi-rite for favorite sf sweet treats in my book!
author: Christina L.

description:
The walks that I am trying to take each day to get healthier unfortunately tend to lead me past Anthony's cookies. I have no will power and Anthony has awesome cookies.

My three favorites so far are as follows:
(1) semi sweet chocolate chip. I am not a huge fan of Ghiradelli chocolate which I think they use in these. But, apparently when matched with an ungodly amount of butter in the cookie dough, Ghiradelli semi sweet chocolate can create a near perfect cookie.
(2) Peanut butter. These are rich, peanut buttery, and awesome.
(3) White chocolate chip. Again, not normally a fan of white chocolate chip. But Anthony knows the amount of butter and sugar and chewiness to make me want these. A lot.

The staff is fantastically friendly. There are normally free samples at the cash register. Most of the time, some cookies have just come out of the oven, so you may want to ask for what is warmest and just order some of those.
author: J Y L.

description:
Crispy edge cookies, firm/soft in the middle. Good, fresh, lots of variety.

A little pricey for a cookie, but I didn't mind.
author: Frederick C.

description:
The cookies are small, pricey and oozing butter! I felt my arteries clogging after the first bite.

Mrs. Field's are better. Not worth the hype.
author: Stacey L.

description:
I will rate this place on their product alone because I don't have a high opinion on the guy who helped me and my friend.

Their cookies are yummy and soft and they stay soft.  I don't know what magical ingredient they use, but the cookies are the bomb so I give them 4 stars.

For service, it would like 1 star.  First off, the guy kept on hitting on my friend which was so unprofessional nor did she express any interest.  Secondly, when i left a tip in the jar, the guy said, "Thanks, I didn't expect that from you..."  WTF was that suppose to mean?  So I reached in the jar and grabbed my tip back (just kidding, that's what i wanted to do).
author: Connie C.

description:
Working here must be heaven! Seriously! Being able to around the aroma of fresh cookies all day long? no wonder why the staff is super friendly.  

Anthony has the perfect recipe for success in my book. Stick to one great product and the masses will come. 

I'd recommend Cookies & Creme as it has to be my new favorite cookie flavor.. The irony :P
author: Phong D.

description: Anthony, you are a cookie genius.  Can we be best friends?  I just want to bake cookies with you all day and hang out with a gallon of 1% and watch cartoons.  Call me.
author: Amanda R.

description:
My friends and I stopped in early this afternoon for a cookie. I've never been here before. The smell of freshly baked cookies was comforting and enticing. I was surprised at how inexpensive the cookies. I'm used to over-priced cupcake boutiques and mall cookie shops, you know?

The staff was friendly and the cookies are divine. I like to bake so I don't normally buy cookies but I came back later that day and bought a dozen.
author: Mona M.

description: I've had cookies from here twice.  Honesty, they are just not that good.  I mean, don't get me wrong, a cookie is a cookie, and if you put one in front of me, chances are, I'm going to eat it.  But for the price you pay for one cookie...it's just not worth it in my opinion.  Plus, they're small!  I want a substantial cookie if I'm paying more than a dollar for it.  I'd rather make my own.
author: Shawn Y.

description:
Man oh man oh man.  
I stopped by for the first time today to get some cookies, just to see how they were.  I took them home and didn't try any until 9pm...good thing the store closes at 8, or I'd be heading for the car, keys in hand, just like any crack junkie chasing the high... yes, they really were that freakin' good!  the cinnamon sugar though...that one will probably haunt my dreams tonight.
author: J W.

description: I'd like two toffee chip cookies and a glass of milk, please.
author: Brianne C.

description:
On our many walks down Valencia St., my husband and I have been continually enticed by the most delicious aroma of cookies, but we stayed strong. This past Saturday, we caved in to the temptation, and so glad that we did because it was phenomenal!

Anthony himself was there baking cookies and chatting with customers. You can tell that these amazing confections are his true passion - he described the ingredients he used and why they worked flavor-wise in the cookies and encouraged us to share our feedback whenever we stop by on what's working and what's not. 

Anthony and his staff (the guy at the register was super nice, too) make the experience so wonderful that you don't ever want to leave. Not only can you talk cookie shop with them, but they supply you with endless samples, letting you know that you're welcome to try as many as you like. 

These are the best cookies I have ever had - so fresh and not too crunchy (just how I like 'em!) My husband and I shared the cookies and cream (I can see why this is one of their top sellers), the oatmeal chocolate chip (the oatmeal adds a great flavor and texture) and the double chocolate (WOW! major gooey, chocolatey goodness).

Move over cupcakes because cookies are back at the top of my dessert list!
author: Rachel G.

description:
I just stopped by here today and have only tried the chocolate chip, but YUM!  Unfortunately I bought a half dozen, a deal at $5, and I say unfortunately because I ended up eating them all myself!  The cookies are cooked to the perfect state of gooey in the middle and crisp and chewy on the outside.  Can't wait to try the other flavors

Anthony and his staffperson could have not been nicer, friendlier or more enthusiastic about their cookies.  If only every place of business I went into was this friendly.

Check this place out, you won't be sorry.
author: stephanie m.

description: I will never look at cookies the same after this.. Cookies are fresh, full of flavor and didnt need to gps it..Just follow the scent of fresh cookies.
author: Errol M.

description:
it's just cookies, but they certainly do a great job 4.5.  toffee chip -- great texture with crisper outer edges and soft inside, must take a lot of butter/shortening to get that right.  price is a bit steep if you're just getting 1 cookie.  $1.25
they should go diddy riese style, and get some bi-rite to make a cookie sandwich.
also tried a few others: cinnamon sugar, walnut chocolate chip
same style, moist and soft
oatmeal sugary
candied pecan nice -- got two because came out smaller size
1.75 coffee cookie -- very strong coffee flavor 
don't forget milk
author: Rob C.

description: Flavors very daily - all fabulous. Great for gifts, parties or just a one-stop cookie.
author: Vicki L.

description: Omygod. A very nice friend got me a box of cookies and they are ALL soooo chewy and delicious. They are quite sweet but hey, if you're going to eat a cookie, you might as well go all out :) They are also sized for portion control (I like to think), so I don't feel bad when I eat 2...
author: Lauretta L.

description:
I thought I loved chocolate chip cookies. I would eat them every once in a while. After having eaten Anthony's' walnut chocolate chip cookies, I have a serious addiction, and go there every chance I get, which is pretty often as I live only a few blocks away. The guys in there are not only super cute, but super nice and they always say thanks after you tip them! 
I also love being greeted when I walk in-- makes me wonder why more stores don't do this simple thing that makes me feel so warm and fuzzy. So worth the price!
author: Soledad S.

description: OMG!  these cookies are freakin delicious!!  One of my good friends brought me here the other day and I'm surprised I never heard about this shop! My favorite is the cookies and cream cookie...It's embedded with oreo cookies.  I know, I know it sounds like a heart attack, but you have to try these babies..because it's one of a kind!  I also enjoyed their oatmeal cranberry cookies, toffee, and chocolate chip ones as well!  The only thing is, they're pretty tiny and a tad expensive..it was $11 for 1 dozen.  But everyone who is a cookie monster must try these ones!
author: Kristen T.

description: When you meet a foodie, you'll notice that he or she is willing to spend an arm and a leg on GOOD food for one meal and eat ramen for the rest of the week. Instant ramen, to be clear, since real ramen can be expensive too. With that said, I am willing to spend $2-3 for a MINDBLOWINGLY AMAZING cookie, and multiple ones at that, and have cup noodles with sriracha for dinner. My boyfriend and I came here after seeing the line at Bi-Rite had wrapped around the block twice. We tried the basic flavors - chocolate chip and oreo. I honestly can't tell you how many cookies I have eaten in my lifetime, from gigantic Specialty's cookies to BJ's pizookies. Anthony's cookies are, by far, the best cookies I have ever had. Their cookies harbor the perfect amount of chocolatey goodness, nutty saltiness and buttery dough. The oreo cookie, which is basically pieces of oreo baked in a cookie, was divine. Another reason to move to the city!
author: Priscilla V.

description:
Pros: Delicious cookies, friendly service
Cons: I don't live closer (although I suppose that could be a pro too)

As a cookie lover, I have not been disappointed any time I have visited. Cookies are always moist, chewy and delicious. In addition to the classics, like chocolate chip, and the popular cookies-and-cream, I would also advise trying the toffee chip.

It also doesn't hurt that every time I have visited, I have been met with the friendliest service. The staff is always so warm and nice and it makes you feel a little less guilty for indulging.
author: S C.

description: I've been meaning to try Anthony's for a long time. I've also been craving chocolate chip cookies for a couple weeks so when i found myself near Anthony's, i decided to go. There was a whole list on the wall of cookies available, but when the people in front of me, and myself, tried to order them, most weren't available. No chocolate chip cookie for me, but I got two of their famous cookies & cream that i'd really wanted to try, and two oatmeal raisin. Four cookies for $5, which i thought was fair. They're not gigantic like some places, just normal size, like if you're baking them at home, which is fine with me. I don't need a giant cookie. Cookies n cream has crumbled up oreos inside. It was just way too sweet and weird tasting. I finished one cookie but couldn't eat the second. I know it's on the 7x7 list and etc but I didn't like the texture or the taste. The oatmeal raisin one was a better texture, though i wish it was more oatmeal-y. They were not bad, not good. Just, fine. (i kind of like the oatmeal raisin cookies i make at home a lot better lol) I would give this place two stars but i'm upping it to three a ok because everyone else likes them so much, i feel it must be my lack of sweet tooth coloring my perceptions. Friendly service though!
author: Merredith L.

description:
I wonder if I, too, would be as freaking happy as Anthony is if I baked cookies 24-7. I sure know that I wasn't when I worked as a pastry chef, but maybe, maybe, cookies are different.
And the selection: Cookies and Cream, Walnut Chocolate CHip (my favorite, evocative of Tollhouse cookies from when we were kids), Gingerbread cookies and Oatmeal Cookies are all excellent.
if you dally while ordering they will--get this--offer you a sample, and it's a whole freaking cookie! (Not sure how long this ploy works: stay tuned.)
These people are good people, and these cookies are fabulous--perfectly sized and not too sweet. 
Go here often.
author: Kathleen G.

description: I like the flavors. I tried the white chocolate chip, cookies n creme, and toffee chip. I like that they gave samples. The only thing reason why I deducted a star is because the cookies were heavy. Heavy cookies make me feel guilty afterwards.
author: Jen P.

description: Yummest cookies I've ever had hands down!! Cookies and cream, chocolate chip and banana walnut are to die for, not a big fan of oatmeal cookies but they are good as well!!!! It makes you a happy person again no matter how bad your day went.
author: Hilda H.

description: ARE YOU SERIOUS?!?!?!?!?! I walked into anthony's cookies the other day hoping to buy 2 dozen chocolate chip cookies and they made me wait 30mins when two people came in and both bought a dozen chocolate chip?!?!?! what the heck happened to first come first serve???? anothonys is mediocre at best mrs fields is waaaaaaaaay better lol, way over priced and what the heck is up with one fricking table.He needs to go back to business school where rule number one is first come first serve
author: Korey S.

description: I like the size of the cookies, a "healthier" portion.  And you can taste the good ingredients in it, like the butter, choc chip versus it being just being plain sweet.  The consistency is perfect, and the flavours are tantalising.  My favourite are white choc chip, toffee choc chip and my friend had the oatmeal raisin which was very good.  Very flavourful, nice spice and great texture.
author: Favoloso M.

description:
Holy mother of god. I wasn't  skeptical per se - I was expecting to enjoy the cookies - but I enjoyed Anthony's cookies way more than the normal level of elation associated with cookies.

I'm sure other people have mentioned this, but I'm too lazy to read the 141 reviews. The shop is mostly a kitchen and at first I wasn't sure it was open to the public. Of course it is and we were warmly welcomed when we peered in the doorway with confused expressions. 

So far I have eaten the walnut chocolate chip (FANTASTIC) and a cookies & cream (oreos in the batter? how has no one thought of this? AMAZING).

The best part was meeting Anthony and learning that he was in school to become an accountant when a friend goaded him to make cookies to scrounge up some extra dinero (no one misses poor student days, right?). This local business is a seriously great addition to the Mission and to SF. 

I don't need an accountant. What I do need are these damn fine cookies!!!
author: Shal J.

description:
The cookies blow Specialtys out of the water.  Try the cookies and cream.  Marcus couldn't describe it to me, but said I had to try it.  I did, and now I can't describe it to you, but you HAVE to try it!   Delicious!  

The whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip was just okay.  Something was off - maye it was a little undercooked.  I will have to try the semisweet before I right off their capacity to make my favorite kind of cookie - chocolate chip. 

5 stars for the service - Marcus and Anthony are SO warm and inviting, that I would go back just to hang out after meeting them only once.
author: Amy D.

description:
Anthony is going to make me fat! These cookies are sooo damn good, i'm going to be going back to this joint again and again. I ran down to Ritual with my half dozen cookies so I can give them the dunk test (and write this review). Both passed with flying colours!

All the staff were super friendly, Anthony was personally greeting all those who came in with a friendly handshake, now that's what I call customer appreciation!

These guys deserve all the success in the world, and with these delicious treats, it's won't be far off.
author: Patrick W.

description: I had a chance to try Anthony's Cookies today for the first time and they were pretty darn good.  Not only were they baked to perfection, but they were also pretty unique.  I've never even heard of a "cookies and cream" cookie before.  I'm just glad I don't walk past their store everyday because there's no way I could resist stopping in for a daily cookie fix.
author: Vivek P.

description:
This is it, people! Cookies. A business full of cookies and nothing but cookies. Cookies 'n' cream cookies - not ice cream, cookies. Are you getting the picture? What a vision? What a niche that needed to be filled. I mean, we've seen the pie place take off - that's great, but I'm not the biggest fan of pies. And for years Mitchell's was the only ice cream parlor in town, but at least now we have BiRite Creamery.

But, for cookies, this is the only game in town. Go there now. Support Anthony. This is a bit off the path, but instead of bringing a cake to dinner, next time bring a dozen or two cookies.
author: maureen f.

description: Five stars right out of the oven but four a day later. The double dark chocolate ones are good, but the cookies and cream was amazing. I only bought one because I doubted they could capture the taste of cookies and cream ice cream in a cookie. They proved me wrong. They tasted exactly like the ice cream flavor, and I would love to have the recipe. The texture of the cookies is perfect. They are chewy and they held up pretty well.
author: Emma L.

description:
I'm surprised to see so many reviews of this place already, since it just opened and lacks signage, but I guess it's been written up in enough places to have generated good business. On to the review.

Very tasty cookies at good prices with a friendly staff in a (currently) bare-bones establishment. There are maybe 10 or so cookie varieties available, none of them unusual (see: Humphrey Slocombe ice cream), and every kind I've tried has pleased me. Warm, soft, and a little chewy, a little crispy, just right. Not huge, about the size of the kind you'd probably make yourself at home.

Support your local cookie maker!
author: Tara M.

description: I still believe Anthony's can do no wrong. However, patrons of Anthony's, I implore you: stop being such morons!!!! Seriously, we know the line gets long. As long as you're standing around for 10 minutes staring at the chalkboard in slack jawed wonder, why not take a moment to consider your order? Instead of getting to the front and going "hmm, let's see, I'd like 2 dozen but I'll list them one at a time and deliberate over every successive decision," just make a damn mental list and save us all a lot of time. And maybe even take out your wallet? Crazy ideas, I know, but these steps would significantly reduce the possibility that I'll punch you in the back of the head.  Surely that's worth something.
author: Anonymous F.

description:
Anthony's has one of the best cookies I've ever tasted! The cookies are on the smaller side but they're freshly baked and come right off of the cookie sheet when you place in your order at the counter. I came here on a Saturday afternoon hoping to snag a few of their banana cookies but to my disappointment, they were only seasonal and had them on specific weekdays. I'm a huge bananaholic and I absolutely love anything banana so you could imagine how sad I was to miss those. In any case, the other flavors that Anthony's sold were just as good. 

We had order two dozen cookies for a BBQ we were attending that afternoon and they were a huge hit with nothing left to sneak back to LA. Some of my favorite flavors were toffee chip, walnut chip, candied pecan chip and their whole wheat oatmeal choco chip cookies. I highly recommend these amazing cookies if you're in the SF area.
author: Janet T.

description: Yep, their cookies are still delicious!  I just ate the peanut butter cookie. It tastes fresh, the creaminess of the peanut butter comes through, and it's made with organic peanut butter!
author: Joyce L.

description:
Great cookies! They are super fresh, chewy and not overly sweet! Too bad he ran out of banana walnut because I really wanted to try that! 

I think everyone already said this but he only seems to sell cookies for now. Hopefully he will soon provide some drinks because I was really thirsty that day (when SF was actually 81 degrees). Yikes! 
Keep up the good work Anthony!!
author: Aylee G.

description:
I passed by a month ago and did a double take on my bike.  Cookies on Valencia Street?!   I rode my bike to Anthony's partly to relieve some guilt from eating multiples of cookies.  Anthony's just makes cookies (no other baked goods).  Anthony is baking away while serving and talk witih customers.

There is a gorgeous scent of vanilla, chocolate and cookie goodness leads the way in.  The menu is simple--the beginning price point is $5.00 for half a dozen.  

I decided to wait till I got home to enjoy; just opening the bag was a splendorous scent that I had to hold back and not to eat more than one--I could have easily eaten the whole bag.  The cookie list contained several whole wheat cookies; cookies & cream, banana, toffee chip, and white chocolate chip to name a few.

I still have more cookies to enjoy for a few more day.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: That was a damn good cookie.  About $1 a piece for a regular size cookie, but man they were chewy and crispy and buttery and creamy and perfect.  I'm a pig, I ate 2 before I even got back to my car.  What more do you want, a flubbin cookie, and holding your mates finger walking down the street.
author: A A.

description:
This place is so good!! Their cookies are amazing! Of course, the most popular one to my fam and friends is the cookies and cream one. i've never had anything like it! White chocolate is also good!!! I don't really like any type of peanut, almonds, any nut in my cookies but i do not mind them from this place.

It is a little bit pricey, but worth it every once in a while!
author: stephanie c.

description: Cookies and cream. You've got to try one if you haven't!
author: Crystal L.

description: What a quaint little cookie shop. The decor is spot-on and the cookies even more so. I had the cinnamon spice cookie and it was delicious. The cookies are reasonably priced at $1.25 a cookie or $12/dozen. You can definitely go all out, but probs shouldn't because of all the CALORIES!
author: Kevin D.

description: I get mines from Mixt Greens (downtown) and they are the best!  Cookies and Cream ... Choco Chip .. Oatmeal ... so good!
author: elaine i.

description:
Happened upon Anthony's, and what a pleasant surprise.  

There was a line out the door, and I was thinking "All for a cookie?"  Ok, I gotta check this out for myself.  5-10 min. later I was noshing on a Cinnamon Sugar cookie, which was under $1.  Super fresh, fragrant, and chewy.  I also tried the chocolate chip cookies, which were fresh from the oven.  Better than Mom's, I have to admit (sorry Nancy).  The employees were really friendly and happy.  

Cookie heaven.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Delicious. Chewy, gooey, and just a bit crunchy. 6 cookies for $5. 

Unlike Specialty's cookies (which I OD'd on way back when), they don't weigh 3 tons and are more like a nice, sweet, dessert, not an entire meal in itself.

I wasn't in a really good mood when I went to Anthony's (having just had a dbag experience at nearby restaurant), but one bite of his cookies and cream cookie, and I was a kid again eating homemade cookies fresh from the oven. 

Can a cookie = happiness? I think so.
author: Sabine S.

description: Few places have wowed this cookie critic here...Cookies are probably my ultimate favorite "non-fancy" dessert..  although you can sure dress them up to be as fancy as can be !  Anthony's cookies doesn't look fancy but their cookies are made to impress.  Cookie's and Cream is their claim to fame and YES !  It's worth the $1.25 or more..get the half dozen or dozen and you can taste the oh so delicious whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip! (actually better than Specialties cookies) The cookies here are not large, greasy, overly buttery or too sweet.  They are small and dainty,  light and crunchy but also chewy in the center.  Just the way a cookie should be!  Of note other good cookies include the Toffee, Oatmeal Cranberry and Classic Chocolate chip.  Went on a Saturday afternoon.  No lines & plenty of free samples =)
author: Margie C.

description: Anthony's is so close to my house, i really wanted to love it. But everytime I go, I hand over $1.25 of my hard earned money for what? A very, very, very small cookie. Some of the flavors are very tasty. But are they worth $1.25? I pay that for a macaron, yes. But for a very small chocolate chip cookie? Me thinks not.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
We just happened to be walking up Valencia on Saturday & were drawn in by the smell of baking!

Marcus was a doll and shared his favorite cookie with us - the whole wheat oatmeal cranberry. We got one of that and the cookies & cream - the cranberry was fantastic and the c 'n' c was good too.

Drop by and support this local business - we'll be back to try all their other flavors soon!
author: Sharand N.

description: FINALLY tried Anthony's cookies courtesy of my good friend Jenny K (thanks love!). Their toffee was my absolute favorite! I can't wait to go and try all their flavors and meet Anthony in the flesh! They definitely gave Hot Cookie (yummm) a run for their money. Which reminds me...I should probably do a side by side comparison to come up with the final verdict.
author: Vivian D.

description: The staff is the bestest. Sampled cookies for our noob visit. My cousins and I all got 1 different cookie and they were all chronic. Cookies and cream or the toffee had to be the superstar of them all. Next time I'm going when they make the peanut butter ones!
author: BJ A.

description: These are the best cookies!  I've tried many of their flavors but my favorites are toffee chip and cookies and cream.  I hope they stay open for the rest of my life!
author: Winnie L.

description:
GREAT cookies!  surprisingly, there isn't a cookie bakery that serves warm cookies in the city-- so what a relief to have found Anthony's cookies!

By far, best cookies in SF!  (sorry, specialties!)

p.s.  my fav was def the choc chip walnut.  so classic and the batter part was great (and the choc chip aint bad either)
author: J D.

description: Great cookies. Brought 2 dozen ($24) to a party and everyone felt they were hands-down better than Specialties. Not too big and enough variety to please everyone. Will go again.
author: Laura L.

description: I met anthony while he was working on the build out on his shop.  I belong to the church located right across the street.  One day the children's ministry and I were having a bake sale on the side walk and he came over and told the kids to follow their dreams and don't let anyone tell them they couldnt do anything.  He also supported the kids on their bake sale.  As soon as his shop opened up I took the kids on a little field trip and had the most delicious cookies.  I would have to say our favorite was the COOKIES and CREAM.  CONGRATS ANTHONY you did it!!!! and TRULY DESERVE IT!!!
author: joann U.

description:
it was love at first bite!
