we came in for the very first time on a saturday and we came back again the next day!

i'm now hooked with anthony's heavenly cookies!  for  two consecutive days, i already bought 2 dozen of his cookies! everything was pleasant. the double chocolate, banana,banana with walnuts, cookies and cream, toffee, whole wheat cranberry and peanut butter were ALL delectable!
 the blending of softness and crispiness of the cookies made it divine and excellent.
i was also glad to see that they sell strauss organic milk! 

i will definitely be back for more!
author: Nelle A.

description: Cookies and Cream cookies are the best! I haven't really tried their others but I love the cookies and cream the best. Anthonys a sweetheart too. One time I went there I said Hi and he waved back. Amazing. anyways, I tried a bite of their choco chip and it was ok I guess, thats just because the cookies and cream cookies were too good to pass up. They offer fresh milk too in those cool little bottles, gotta try those next time.
author: Floyd H.

description: Mrs Field's, I'm sorry that Anthonys Cookies has claimed the top spot on my list for favorite cookie shop. I tried all flavors and they are sooo yummy. My favorite ones are cookies n cream and chocolate chip cookies.
author: Melody S.

description:
Stopped in on Saturday for the first time, and glad to have a solid cookie shop in my neighborhood.  There was a short line but the cashier person was friendly and prompt.

The chocolate chip was outstanding.  The whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip was good, as was the oatmeal raisin.  I will be back.
author: K V.

description:
my sweet tooth gets the best of me sometimes and during my visit here i fell victim once again.

i ordered all 11 flavors available that day, two of which stood out. the cookies and cream cookie instantly gave my taste buds a tingle. its like a cookie within a cookie. a crumbled oreo is folded into the cookie dough  and as you take a bite you feel and taste the texture of a crushed oreo dissolve alongside the chewy texture of the cookie. its divine!!! the second flavor that deserves recognition is the candied pecan chip. you can never go wrong with nuts in a cookie and if the nuts are given a splash of sweetness just like these candied pecans then its double the fun.

all of the cookies were very soft, moist, and flavorful. whatever your taste buds are seeking at the moment im sure one of their unique flavors will be able to satisfy your craving.
author: Ryan E.

description: You really can't go wrong here. Toffee chip, cookies n cream, double chocolate... Really... What's not to like.  If heaven had a smell I'm pretty sure it would smell like this place.
author: Echo R.

description: Wow these are yummy cookies. I wish I could say that they are like the ones mama used to make, but I can't.  Sadly mama never made cookies this good.  try any of them, and then maybe go to the gym.
author: Jan D.

description:
i don't even know why i'm writing a review after 435 have already been written for this place.. but once in a while, you go somewhere and it's just so good that you need to tell someone. 

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING, and DELIGHTFUL, and EVERYTHING I HAD HOPED IT WOULD BE. 

cookies and cream? will you marry me?
author: Michelle K.

description: Maybe I am too nice or they are that GOOD....its BOTH!  This establishment must be a gift from heaven cause anything I am sad or happy...Anthony's cookies is always there to celebrate with me.  My favorites are the cookies n cream, toffee and the cranberry oatmeal one.  But be careful though cuz these cookies are so good you won't notice how many you're eating at once.  Next time I'm definitely going to try it with the milk that they sell there!
author: Allison T.

description:
I love the cookies here. So far we've had the cinnamon sugar, Toffee chip, double chocolate, and oatmeal cranberry. The cinnamon sugar was the best. Not to say that the others weren't good, but it was a good cookie. 

The double chocolate was a little too sweet for my taste. Please eat them the same day or better yet, right away! I had the Toffee chip the next day and it was not the same.

The people working there were very friendly and helpful about their products. Very warm and friendly there and you can tell that they love their products too. A huge plus!
author: Em J.

description: Tried for the first time and I loved it! the dark chocolate and the toffee was my favorite. Will go again in a couple of weeks (I hope).
author: Felecia W.

description: So many days I've spent at work in front of my computer imagining myself  pulling a toffee cookie to my lips and munching down on the soft sweet texture of this delicious delight. Then mmm... In those moments in my imagination, in those few seconds, I taste the toffee, I taste the yummy treat... and kazaam-- I'm back in reality, counting the minutes I'm off work so I can drive down to Anthony's and snag a few of those mini pleasure moments he calls Toffee cookies. Thank God this place closes late at eight.
author: Andrea K.

description:
Someone at my office brought in a big box of Anthony's cookies today.

All I can say is: YUM! The ginger snaps, especially, are *to die for*.

(I'm sort of frightened that Anthony's is located only several blocks from my apartment. I foresee gaining at least 10 lbs.)
author: The Other Jeff A.

description: I know I can bake my own cookies and they are good. But Anthony's Cookies are awesome. My mom said, "they must have crack in them, you guys keep coming back with boxes of cookies". I don't know what crack taste like but it must be in Anthony's Cookies, I can't help but go back and get a dozen. I think I tried almost all of the cookies, but my favorite is the chocolate chip. If you haven't tried Anthony's Cookies, I suggest you make your way to his shop. I going to stop by Anthony's after I finish writing this review.
author: Baseemah R.

description: Good cookies but service was oddly slow for a Saturday afternoon.
author: Kevin M.

description: Best Cookie in SF! And so glad they have partnered up with Four Barrel. Perfect Sunday morning. Yum.
author: Erin G.

description: These cookies are addicting. These cookies are better than 99% of the cookies you'd find at any other bakery in the city. Now, I make an adequate choc chip cookie at home, but sometimes you're looking for something special. Anthony's got you covered. They're a perfect combination of chewy near the middle and delicately crispy toward the edges. The cookies and cream are what they're known for, but I haven't had a cookie I didn't like here. I've seen Anthony a few times, and he seems like a happy dude, so glad that he decided to share his talents with us. Yes, the cookies are a little small for how much you pay, so I have to really control myself from shoving them into my mouth. They do sell out of some flavors each day, so try to go early. They also offer frequent buyer punchcards, so the more half dozen/dozens you get, the more you get for free. Score!
author: Saunders C.

description: Freshly baked cookies of all three kinds: flat and crunchy, soft cake like, gooey middle with a crisp perimeter. None are terribly sweet all are pretty good. Most are delightful. They change the flavors on hand daily.
author: Marcus F.

description:
finally, an alternative to the "mall cookie" - you know the mall cookie, a way too big $1.99 cookie that tries to overwhelm you w/ volume to make up for what it lacks in heart and love. Well Anthony's Cookies starts with heart and love - the simple decor, the friendly staff and the fresh baked cookies coming out of the oven at all times of day.

They've got 12 standard cookies, but depending on time of day and demand, not all will be around. No problem because there are always some that you'll enjoy. Our favorites are banana, chocolate chip and oatmeal chocolate chip (although we're still waiting to try the cookies n' cream which always seems to be sold out when we swing by).
author: hunter w.

description: ...i would be one happy dude if i walked through my front door and my apartment reeked like the inside of anthony's cookies bakery...
author: Brian L.

description:
Insane. That's how good these cookies are. I just bought a half dozen (assorted) and had three on my way home. I need to hide the rest.

The cookies are very buttery, soft, and chewy. The chocolate is generous and the nuts are well balanced and not over powering. They are quite rich, but relatively small, so you can have a few without feeling like you're going to die. That being said, make no mistake - these are not low fat.

My favorites so far: semi-chocolate chip, and the cinnamon sugar. I'll update after I've consumed a few dozen more.
author: Aly O.

description:
Awesome cookies and we drive all the way from Gilroy, Ca. just to pick them up......
Keep up the Good Job!
author: ROBERT R.

description: I absolutely love Anthony's cookies! I never thought I could love a simple chocolate chip cookies as much as I do ever since I had one of Anythony's. It's so moist and tasty and the chocolate is just beyond good. I actually stopped by Anthony's 3 times this week, and it's not just the cravings of a pregnant lady but because they're so delicious, I'd go just as frequently even if I wasn't pregnant. Thank you Anthony's Cookies for making the best in the city!
author: Catherine Y.

description:
the perfect chewy cookie. 

so far i've loved every cookie i've tried ... toffee chip, semi sweet, semi sweet with walnuts, and cookies and cream. looking forward to trying the others. and soon!
author: cynthia q.

description:
What I tasted - 

Cookies and Cream - to be honest, it tasted like a well-made chocolate chip cookie, nothing too extraordinary

Cinnamon Spice - my favorite, like a snickerdoodle with a stronger-than-
usual cinnamon kick 

Toffee chip - toffee was subtle

Walnut double chocolate chip - disappointingly small, but with a good chocolate-to-dough ratio.  Chocolate was high quality and gooey - not your store-bought chips.

The cookies were not as fresh or soft as the ones from Hot Cookie.  But then again, they had been sitting on the rack for a bit.
author: Jeremy C.

description: The best cookies you'll ever eat in your life, no doubt about it.  My favorites are the regular chocolate chip, the toffee, and the cinnamon and sugar.  Really, though, they're all amazing.  I also like to get the bottle of Straus Farms organic milk when I go and have enough people with me to share it.  It's the best milk I've ever had and that combined with the best cookies equals heaven.  Also, Anthony is really cool and friendly.
author: Aaron L.

description:
the peanut butter cookie literally MELTED IN MY MOUTH.

just thought i'd share.

that is all.
author: stefanie h.

description: The toffee chip is the reason to come here: they're perfect.  Soft and chewy inside, with just the right amount of crackle and crispiness on the outside.  Also pick up some cinnamon sugar, cookies and cream, and German chocolate.  I usually see Anthony in the back, and he always says hi.
author: David F.

description:
These cookies are really good. I've read some other reviews of this place, and I understand the fear of being caught up in Yelp enthusiasm and wanting to make sure one is not over-rating. BUT... this place deserves its accolades.  First of all lemme tell ya, I've made hundreds of batches of cookies at home, dang yummy cookies. It's a lifelong hobby. But as I get older, I don't want to have a batch of cookies hanging around making my pants get tighter.

Anthony's is the perfect answer. The cookies are inventive, delicious, and taste just like homemade.  I tried several of the samples (ahem) before settling on the cinnamon sugar and the cookies and cream. I took them home with my husband and cousin, and we had them with tea, and felt very, very happy.

Some other bakeries do something weird to their cookies to make them taste... off. Corporate. Like Hot Cookie in the Castro. I used to live near there. But I wound up baking cookies at home instead. I suspect they are compromising on the ingredients somewhere.

Anthony's cookies feel and taste just like a cookie should. Buttery. And Anthony was super nice, and so were his employees.

This end of the mission lacks good bakeries, and I will stop by Anthony's whenever I get a craving and can't find an excuse to make a batch myself.
author: Dusty R.

description: Well, don't get me wrong, it's a good cookie.  But for the price some of the cookies are tiny.  I mean, one bite tiny.  I had to stare at it and think, "I paid a dollar for this?"  For the price it wasn't THAT good.  I'll pass.
author: Jonathan W.

description: Cookies are bomb, just don't think they're worth it for the size.  I had the cookies and cream which was really sweet.
author: Matthew P.

description: Perfectly balanced cookie.  My favorite is the whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip.  I don't really think about the price as I feel like I'm paying for the best cookies in the city.  If you know of one better, please let me know!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Cookies! Really... who doesn't love cookies???

These are great!  Every flavor I have tried from my multiple trips to Anthony's has been awesome.  Chocolate Chip, Peanut Butter, Oatmeal raisin... I honestly don't remember all the ones I have tried because they are all so good!

The price is very good for all the cookie goodness you get!  I don't see any reason to get cookies anywhere else in the mission.  On top of it all, Anthony has to be one of the friendliest people ever!  Next time you are feeling down, go pay him a visit... he'll cheer you up and give you cookies.

Oh and don't try the milk they have as decor... it made my tummy hurts... it's for display purposes only... stick to the ones in the fridge ;)
author: Niko B.

description: My boyfriend and I must try bakeries in every city we visit...sometimes two or three bakeries in one day! My favorite dessert is cake or cupcakes, his is a cookie. He searches for the best cookie, so far nobody has beat Levain's. I must say Anthony's has the best flavor of any cookie we've tried and the customer service was A++! The young men allowed us to try samples from each cookie, and then of course we ordered one of each :) They were polished off by breakfast the next morning!
author: Brittany H.

description: Cookies here are awesome, but what really makes these cookies great is the fact that they still taste fresh baked a couple days later. Go here your taste buds will thank you.
author: Domingo D.

description: They have great cookies, but the "ONE", yes the "ONE" that makes this place special and worth the visit from your cozy nest, is the Cookies & Cream, especially if it's right out of the oven. If you don't like it, I'm sure someone will give you your money back because you will need it to get a taste bud transplant.
author: Mike C.

description: Outstanding cookies that taste delicious. the oatmeal cranberry is awesome along with the oatmeal raisin and toffee. You have to go try it. stop reading and debating. go.
author: Ed C.

description:
I'm not going to say anything anyone else hasn't already said but it does bear repeating.

1. Super friendly service.  These guys are warm and welcoming.  Great customer service
2. Awesome product.  The cookies we had were the perfect mix of crunchy on the outside and soft in the middle.  This is what I strive for in my homemade cookes
3. Simplicity.  Just cookies, milk, and good times.  You don't need anything more than that.

My major points being made, I must recommend a couple of the cookies in particular.  Cookies and cream was tasty, different but not overwhelmingly differnt.  Call me simple but I really dug the cinnamon sugar flavor, it had a perfect crunch/soft ratio.

Run, don't walk, to this place.
author: Ryan W.

description:
Mrs. Field's has NOTHING on Anthony's. Perhaps one of the greatest discoveries I've made is Anthony's Cookies, a small bakeshop that specializes in, you guessed it, cookies. The best part of ordering here is that the cookies are always fresh, baked on the same day. Each cookie is around $1, so it's pretty reasonable pricing. 

The two flavors I would really recommend are the Cookies + Creme and Cinnamon Sugar. Also recommended would be a dozen Cookies & Creme cookies.
author: Efrain T.

description:
Part 2, even better than the first experience...yes its possible. 
We have a new winner (drum roll please)....Toffee Chip Cookie may the perfect cookie. Unbelievably good, serious, sooooo good.
Coming in a close second, Cookies and Cream. 

Do yourself a favor and indulge!
author: Quang W.

description: These are THE BEST cookies ever! Toffee chip, white chocolate chip, and cinnamon spice-- are to die for! They're a little pricey for a cookie that size, but it is all worth it. It's heaven in your mouth.
author: Sarah C.

description:
The secret ingredient must be crack sprinkled all over, because they're cookies are so addicting. 
My kids'll start beatin up other kids for their lunch money to support their Anthony's cookies tweaker habit.  

Please open up a location in North Oakland right next door to me k? You'll make so much money off me (and my kids), that's for sure.. please? Okay? Woohoo!  Yesss! Thxks, k' bye.
author: Sheila S.

description:
im going to be honest. 

Anthony's cookies are so good that I literally walked around to the other tables while people were drinking and dancing and stole their cookies (they were wedding favors) at a wedding I attended last week...

karma is gonna kick my cookie thieving ass..but its gonna be worth it betches!
author: Jason W.

description: Its crazy, My friend who put me on to Anthony's cookies told me they would be the best cookies I have ever eaten, so I took it with a grain of salt but after eating them I have been hooked, and I tell everyone that they are in fact the best cookies they will ever have the joy of eating.
author: Dominic S.

description:
I've been driving past Anthony's store on 25th and Valencia for months now eagerly anticipating the opening. When the economy took a nose dive I panicked thinking we'd never get to taste Anthony's masterpieces because of toxic mortgage debts.

Thankfully he's open for business and the cookies are as good as they get. Anthony is a very charming, sincere and talented guy that just seems to have the great combination of a passion for baking with the love of making cookies.

The Toffee cookies are amazing, the Double chocolates as well. And best of all his prices are depression-proof and really affordable. Buy em by the dozen!
author: nycsfo S.

description:
I'mma be a hater and give this four stars.  

If there was a star-rating dedicated to taste alone, I'd give it a 5.  Unfortunately, we gotta pigeonhole everything together into a single set of five stars.  

I deducted a star for the size of the cookie relative to the price.  They're roughly $1/cookie depending on how many you order and appr. the size of a chips ahoy cookie (maybe a little bigger?).     

I ordered a half dozen in 4 diff flavors: 2 cookies & cream, 2 white chocolate, 1 double chocolate, 1 toffee chip.  I meant to snack on the half dozen over the course of the weekend.   I inhaled them in the car with the quickness.  Every single one of them was cream-in-your-pants good.  I'll definitely be going back to try the rest of them.  

Anthony is a real nice, outgoing guy too.  It seems he really loves what he does.  That should be a reflection on the quality of work he puts out.
author: Per C.

description: Is there a such thing as a perfect cookie? Heck if I know, but I *DO* know if there was a perfect cookie chances are it came from here... I don't know if I can say more than has already been said... these cookies are awesome... If I could FedEx some back to Miami I would...
author: Frank E.

description: I am addicted to chocolate chip cookies. That said, Anthony's Cookies is the best place to go in the City for a chocolate chip cookie! Soft, chocolatey, and just the right size to make you feel like you ate more than a bite but didn't overdo it. I will go completely out of my way for one now and recommend them to anyone who wants to satisfy their cookie craving.
author: L O.

description:
The cookies here are very tasty. 

But at $1.25 a pop I'm over it. 

They're not that good and for the price of three cookies I could bake 2 dozen at home. Not saying mine are as good as this place but still that's a lot of money for a tiny cookie. 

check it out if you live near by or are craving some chocolate chip goodness, otherwise I'd say skip it!
author: Holly S.

description: I just ate here and the cookies are good.  They are just as good as hot cookie on castro street, but everyone raves about these so I made a special trip.  They were good, but $1.25 for a small cookie is not my thing.  If you live nearby it is worth a visit, but don't go out of your way.
author: Jonathan U.

description: I wrote my review when Anthony's first opened.  I'm glad this place is a big hit since the cookies are amazing and Anthony and the staff are sweet.  But price point is too high for me.  I'd love to buy a box to bring to a party to pass off as my own =), but at almost $1/cookie (cheaper if you buy more though) and cuz of their smaller size, it's too much to spend on cookies.  Even with good ingredients, I could bake dozens of my own for a lot less.  So Anthony's is just a once-in-a-while treat just for me...
author: Mimi L.

description: I had a toffee cookie craving and Anthony's toffee chip cookies were simply amazing.  The store was clean and filled with the wonderful aroma of cookies.  Can't wait to go back again (maybe tomorrow)!
author: Toshi S.

description:
Delicious cookies. Nice people.

A little on the pricey side; makes for a great treat.
author: Louis B.

description:
I really like Anthony's Cookies. I hope they never get tables and chairs in there because it seems like the kind of thing that is so good, they don't need people loitering about -- get 'em in, get 'em out and make way for the rest of us who just want really yummy cookies.
In all fairness, you won't swoon over these cookies -- they're not magical or anything. They are just really tasty homemade cookies that you don't have to home-make yourself. And the establishment really adds something good to the neighborhood.
author: Kely G.

description: Great stuff! I ordered two dozen and they were a big hit at a holiday dinner party. Only, maybe, Hot Cookie, has better cookies in SF.
author: Adam Z.

description: Cookies and Creme cookies are delicious! First time I went here Anthony gave me a free cookie because I looked at the menu in awe.  Anthonys cookies makes the best gourmet cookies i've ever had. Highly recommended.
author: Dustin G.

description:
First. . .the shop is sweet. . simple, spare and clean.  they are ALL ABOUT THE COOKIE and I like that about them.  

I got two dozen early on a Sunday and by early Sunday afternoon they were GONE!   No, I did not eat two dozen cookies - I shared.  Begrudgingly.  I am not going to play like I couldn't Hoover through two dozen cookies. . . 'cause I think I could.  Especially these ones.

I think my favorite are the cookies and cream (think chocolate chip cookie base with crushed Oreos - actually I am not sure what that chocolatey crumble in them is but all I know is that it's GOOD!), toffee and semi-sweet chocolate chip with walnuts.  Although the double chocolate isn't bad either.  I think my favorite is the banana walnut which differs from the rest of the sweet little butter bombs. . .it's like little gobs of banana bread studded with walnuts.  The only thing was that the ones I got were way, way over-baked.   I had them one other time when a friend brought some to a party and I really liked them - they were just golden brown and so delicious. . especially with a cup of coffee.  The ones I got were super dark and because they were over-baked, they were dry.  So my only hope would be that they pull them a little sooner and those cookies would be perfect (and I might just die if he ever decided to add chocolate chips to those banana cookies. . .hint, hint!).  I also didn't care for the whole wheat oatmeal chocolate chip but that's because I don't like cinnamon and these cookies are very highly spiced with cinnamon and maybe something else. . . meh, it just wasn't my thing but that doesn't mean it isn't a good cookie.

One thing that really surprised me were the white chocolate chip cookies. . . like many other people, I turn my snooty little nose up at the thought of white chocolate in general but these little cookies are astoundingly good. .. the combination of buttery goodness and white chocolate is very fine.

The people there are very friendly, the prices are fair for the quality of the cookies (two dozen were $17.00) and it's good to support a locally owned and operated business - especially one as sweet as this one.
author: Lainie L.

description:
Hands down best cookies - even better then my grandma, which for my g-ma, these be fightin' words. 
Anthony is great and knows what he is doing with the art of making a cookie.
Don't waste your time with those keebler elf fools or whatever other crap is on the shelves you can get anywhere - you know what you should do, get ya butt to Valencia st and say 'hi' to Anthony and get a box of cookies..your taste buds will love you forever and ever and ever.
author: Cat S.

description:
I have know Anthony for almost three years now.  He is a true friend and is very passionate about everything he does.  I want to first congratulate him on the opening of his cookie boutique.  I manage the Huf store on sutter street and he has been visiting me over the years telling me of his plans to one day open his own shop.  Finally the day has come when all of us can share his great talent of baking the greatest cookies in the bay.  I had to join yelp today just to make sure everyone knows to please take the time to visit him and pick up some fresh baked goodness. The banana cookies are my favorite and a must try when picking up a dozen.   

I wish Anthony the best and please trust you have a life customer right here.
author: keith m.

description: Buttery, warm, with a great range of flavours, this place sells perfect cookies. Another 5x* addition to SF.
author: Brett G.

description:
AMAZING COOKIES!!!! 

I've only been here once which is shocking because I LOVE a good chocolate chip cookie. Downside of this place: Really slow long lines and for $1.25 a pop I wish the cookies were a bit larger.
author: R E.

description: I have been hearing about Anthony's cookies for a while now but i did not have the pleasure of tasting them until 2 or 3 weeks ago... And you know what? now i find myself craving for them every other day... Anthony's cookies are theeeeee best cookies i ever had.. I hope that I'll be able to buy them when I'm out of town, out state and out of the country...
author: Sharae B.

description: I wish Anthony's shipped cookies. My H discovered this place when he was living temporarily in the Mission. OMG. The cookies are heavenly. Chocolate Chip. Cookies and Cream. And sometimes you can get a batch of Cinnamon Spice that are just beyond any words. Long live Anthony's.
author: Cindy C.

description: The cookies 'n cream cookie is easily the best cookie in the world. Period.
author: Kate S.

description: Anthony's Cookies is going to single-handedly turn San Francisco into a world class destination.  Mark my words.
author: Vanessa C.

description: Best cookies ever - its so chewy and just melts in your mouth!!
author: Joiera C.

description:
Anthony creates cookies. That's what he does. Any time you run across a place that specializes in one thing, and have been working hard at that one thing for a long time, things are going to be good. Throw in a pleasant environment and great customer service, and you've got a winner. 

It's worth stopping by to meet Anthony, even more worth it to taste his cookies.

I filmed an episode of The Snack Attack (http://thesnackattack.com/2009/05/11/2-6-anthonys-cookies/) there today - look for it soon and find out which cookie I thought was BEST.
author: Anders P.

description: I absolutely love cookies!  Definitely prefer the chewy type with the right amount of crunch on the edges.  Found the best cookie spot in SF!  Yesssss!  They are smaller in size, but it's the perfect portion to avoid feeling guilty.  I don't even know where to begin.  My favorite is the cookies & cream.  Toffee chip, chocolate chip, and peanut butter are also incredible.  All of them are good!  Get a dozen to save money.  They have samples on the counter.  Important tip - you have to close your eyes when eating them and make sure you have milk for dunking.  All my friends and family love the cookies!  Writing about this makes me want to go back...now!
author: Chad A.

description: Soo yummy, and the cookies always taste fresh no matter what time of day you stroll by.  They don't always have their full menu of cookies available, so that can be a bit disappointing if you're looking forward to one particular flavor.  The only complaint I have is that all of the cookies tend to share the same texture and, to some extent, flavor.  But where else can you get fresh, warm cookies at almost any time of the day?
author: Pearl L.

description:
One word...AWESOME. 

I visited Anthony's yesterday before catching a plane home to SoCal. My girlfriend found out about this place before we visited the Bay Area for the weekend. I had to have the cookie's and cream and went nuts on the first bite. We ended up taking 18 cookies to go. 

From what I've read about this establishment, it's everything and more and meets expectations. There is nothing better than an independent business owner starting up and becoming hugely popular and successful. Unlike Norcal, Los Angeles isn't nearly as riddled with such places and I always find it an adventure trying and discovering places like Anthony's. 

Keep up the great work Anthony!
author: Justin Y.

description:
I love this place for a very odd reason

When I went in the staff was happy and joking around, i made a comment about how good the cookies are and the guy making them came over and high fived me with his elbow.  Why his elbow?  Because he keeps a spotless kitchen and he didn't want to soil his hands.

I have been in charge of kitchens before and I know a spotless one when I see it.

Great staff, great cookies, an immaculate kitchen what more could you want?
author: thomas d.

description:
Preliminary review: AWESOME!* Cookies are tasty, the staff is great, and what hasn't been mentioned is the cookies are great the next day or 2 later.

*I give them a qualified 5 star review because they had been open for 3 days when I checked them out. They're still getting their act together so my review is solely based on the taste and cost of the cookies. Also, the fact that the cookies are still soft and delicious the next day is a major plus. Isn't it disappointing when you eat a day old baked good that was delightful and tender the day before but now is stale and crunchy?

Their grand opening is this coming weekend. I highly recommend checking this place out. The cookies are great, the staff could not possibly be any friendlier and this store is a welcome addition to the Valencia corridor.
author: Rob I.

description:
too much hype= i expected too much.

what makes this place 'so good' is that it's fresh cause  a lot of ppl buy it and they are constantly baking.  so ya know, if you decided to bake some fresh from the oven cookies.. itd taste good too

but in the end, its just a warm cookie 

id prefer more milk options too! only serve 2 %
author: Lily T.

description:
my goal as an amateur cookie maker is to get my cookies to look and taste like the cookies at Anthony's.  these cookies are just simply amazing.  

in each cookie I've tried, you can taste the wholesome goodness and freshness.  the cookies are still even super moist and devilishly delicious the next day.  

their menu has been slightly different each day I've gone here, but the cookies and cream are a must.
author: valerie t.

description: I think fresh baked cookies are just plain hard to beat no matter where you are, but these were nice. Not earth shattering, but really nice and I appreciated the oatmeal options, especially with craisins.
author: Alissa S.

description:
Look no further for some of the best cookies in the San Francisco!

This place is a must for any cookie/sweets fanatic!  Their cookies and cream is so yummy, as well as their toffee chip and white chocolate chip cookies.  You will turn into the cookie monster after having some of their cookies.  It is a little bit on the expensive side for cookies $9 for a dozen.. but this is some buttery, sugary, quality goodness. 

Don't forget to enjoy this with a glass of milk.  It will make your cookie experience that much more enjoyable!
author: Katherine L.

description: Sorry, the cookies here are decent, but nothing spectacular. I'm not sure why everyone is raving about them. Parking sucks, the cookies are small and the price is expensive. I got more than two dozens of cookies, all different varieties. I wanted to try the cookies and cream that everyone here said was the best. Tried it, and were not impressed by it at all. Sure, it's crunchy on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside, and it's softer than Mrs. Fields, but it was so sweet that I was dying to drink something. This is definitely a one time thing and I won't be wasting $30 again.
author: Jordan W.

description: good but small cookies; bad coffee
author: Michael O.

description: Anthony's Cookies are just as good as everyone says!  Five full stars. Anthony is a sweetheart too.
author: Eva L.

description: These are amazing cookies. 'Nuff said. Sweet, gooey chocolaty bliss. I don't know what his secrets are but these are the best you can find anywhere.
author: Matt H.

description:
today was the first time i hit up this spot, and OHH boy! ohhhh goshh! love love at first bite/sight! :D 

i got the infamous cookies and creme, toffee, german chocolate, white chocolate, banana, cinnamon sugar! i always do this.. like not overload myself with spending on a place, if it's my first time. lol ... i shouldn't with this store! ugh..oh wells, better go for the dozen next time! 

i mostly looove the cookies and creme, banana (very interesting texture!!!!), german chocolate, OHHHHHH garsh! i just loved everything that i got! AND DONT FORGET THE MILK! :D j'et aime!
author: Marc K.

description: Seriously good cookies. Didn't even need the milk to wash them down. They were soooo moist
author: Ruben A.

description: You're cookies are so freaking delicious, I don't know if it's a personal blessing or a pain in the ass that you guys seem to be closed a lot.
author: Christine M.

description:
OMG!  What can I say but get your butt to Anthony's NOW!  Amazingly addictive cookies, made by the nicest, cutest man ever...not to mention right on my way home from work.
Perfection.
author: Nancy M.

description: Hot damn these cookies are delicious!  I only intended to buy 6, but walked out with 14. The cookies and cream almost got overlooked until I tried a sample, then I added 2 on top of my dozen others. The service here was so friendly and warm. Loved everything about this place!
author: Aly M.

description: Over the course of watching Anthony's cookies go up I had my doubts, but he was always so nice whenever I'd pass by, I always wished them well.  And now, I'm so grateful for delicious baking cookie smell wafting onto the street around the corner from where I live, and for the great cookies responsible for the smell.  Every cookie I've had is either the best, or close to best, version I've had of that cookie.  Personal favorites are the Banana Nut (imagine a banana bread cookie) and Toffee Chip (thin, crisp and tender).  Lucky for him, others seem to agree and Anthony's Cookies is on the fast track to becoming a Mission institution (thanks, I imagine, the elementary school down the street).  One thing, there used to be more music/dancing/joking going on here, i hope they're not getting weary from the daily grind of turning out these treats--we've come to depend on them!
author: Kathryn M.

description: Yup,if u got the munchies,Anthony's got the cookies.Be warned,not for dieters or people with low self control.Heck,he should charge 25 cents just to smell his cookies.Milk and cookies it's simple,it's great
author: patty d.

description: I keep coming back for their cookies & cream cookie (it's Oreos in a chocolate chip cookie base) and they're great about letting you try any kind of cookie you want. Minus a star for being too expensive.
author: Leah M.

description: awesome cookies! crispy on the outside and moist on the inside..perfect! I got a dozen one of each to try and they were all great! They have samples for you to try if your unsure, but really they are all good! I'm usually just a chocolate chip kind of girl but the white chocolate chip was super tasty. Banana was more like a a little piece of banana bread so you can totally have it for breakfast:).......a dozen cost me $9.25 not bad at all.  btw...the guys working in there were SUPER friendly, love that. I will be back for sure.
author: kelly p.

description: Overly sweet cookies are not my fav. These cookies are also soft baked like Mrs Fields were back in the day so there is no crunch. I like the taste of carmelized sugar as it shatters on bite- an explosion of taste, I want to hear the crunch when I take that bite.  These are sooooo sugary sweet.
author: Ann P.

description:
I don't know if I'm blessed or cursed to be living upstairs from Anthony's Cookies.  
Every morning I wake up and go out to the sundeck and all I can smell are freshly baked cookies = HEAVEN.
However, I can also go downstairs any time I want and get delicious cookies for $5 = FATTY HELL.
I'm no connoisseur of cookies for sure.  My idea of a treat is a quart of milk and a box of Oreos.  But alas, I'm getting older and my palate is definitely more refined (see my review of the Tamale Man).
Today I tried the cookies and cream, chocolate chip, and banana walnut.  The banana walnut cookies are truly like the top of a muffin, not really like a cookie.
The chocolate chip and cookies and cream cookies are excellent.  They are soft, chewy, and you can definitely taste the quality.
AND these guys are so damn NICE.  It's like an episode of Cheers when you walk in.
I have a feeling that I will be updating this review pretty often (daily) because I know I'll be getting all of my cookies from here.
I shall single-handedly keep this establishment in business if need be in increments of $5 per day!
author: Meh M.

description: This place is awesome. No frills about it, just milk and cookies. And let me tell you, Anthony's cookies are damn good. Decided on a dozen cookies and let me tell you, it was a hard choice. My favorites of the bunch was obviously the cookies and cream cookies which was probably one of the best cookies I've ever had. I also really like the cinnamon sugar and oatmeal chocolate chip. They were all good but the cookies and cream was UNBELIEVABLE. Love this place and Anthony seem's like an awesome dude. Whenever I'm in town, I'm coming to Anthony's to get my cookie fix.
author: Thomas D.

description:
It's obvious from meeting Anthony that he loves what he does.

Most excellent cookies.
author: meredith b.

description: My coworker just came from there and offered me a peanut butter and then a macademia chocolate one...can I say you boosted and pepped up my afternoon :)  Yummers, thanks for making close to homemade cookies - this is deep down sweet comfort food :)
author: Elle F.

description:
Taking from 7X7's must eat list, I was lucky enough to have someone bring over a box of assorted cookies for me...um...us. Anthony's Cookies, where have you been all my life?
Next to cupcakes, homemade cookies are my favorite. Especially straight out of the oven! So, I was super excited to see the cookie box in the black plastic bag...I could smell the goodness as I untied the bag and life is good again!
Although there were so many different varieties, all I really wanted was the cookies and cream cookie. I spotted the cookie with dark speckles and I knew...it was the one I have been waiting for. There I was, revving up for a rebirth of an old obsession. Mmm...it was a warm combination of a chewy (without being too chewy) chocolate chip cookie and an Oreo. Wow. Who would've thunk...the marriage of a cookie and and cookie made for my indulgence. Wash it down with a few big gulps of milk and I feel like a kid again. Definitely a favorite!
author: Jennifer L.

description: I heard about this place when my friend hounded me to get her some. i decided to pick up a dozen for me as well. i am not a sweets lover but thought that these cookies great. You need to go early as they run out of the good ones fast. Must try the cookies and creme!
author: joseph c.

description:
delicious!...

my family brought a box of these up for me on thursday, and i ate them last night (saturday)...cookies were still crispy on the outside and chewy in the middle...so far ive tried the cookies and creme, oatmeal raisin (my fave) and oatmeal cranberry...

tom's cookies are still the standard for cookies in my opinion, but with their closures, anthony's sure takes the current crown...
author: JP T.

description: Best cookie I've ever had. Toffee chip. There's little else to say. Perfection. Transcendent goodness.
author: Brandon B.

description: What a sweet little cookie shop! While walking by one day I was distracted by the heavenly aroma and old-school whole milk bottles inside this little cookie shop. The prices are very reasonable: 5 dollars for a 1/2 dozen (even cheaper if you buy a dozen). Also, the woman behind the counter was very friendly and helpful in picking out a good selection. I didn't think that cookies & cream was all the rage like the other reviewers, but it was still a great cookie. I'd suggest the double chocolate, german chocolate, and the pecan cookie.
author: Ralph G.

description: The cookies are great.  I especially like the cookies and cream flavor.  Gave it a 4 instead of 5 because of the price.  It cost the same per cookie when you buy a dozen.  I like places that gives a slight discount when you buy a dozen.
author: Wendy H.

description: Insanity on Valencia & 25th, right next to the Receiver Gallery. I love my neighborhood, I love life, and I love you. That pretty much sums it up.
author: Shannon R.

description: Ohhh boy!! 30 min line but worth every minute.  I couldn't decide so I got one of each. Ate 3 so far and I'm getting a sugar rush!! eeek.  Ooey, gooey with crunchy border!YUM!!
author: mochiBrownie I.

description: buttery-lious!  I haven't been to Anthony's yet but a classmate brought in a box of cookies from here. It's sinfully good. You can tell that Anthony uses only whole ingredients in their cookies. My favorite is the cookies-n-cream! I swear, one single bite and you feel like you're died and gone to heaven. thinking of the cookies makes me drool.
author: Jocelyn T.

description:
Wanna excite all your senses, but don't have the money/connections for illicit drugs?? Well this place has got you covered.

Walking in for the first time, I felt happy tingles all over. The intoxicating smell of freshly baked peanut butter cookies, the sight of Anthony's contagious ear to ear grin, the sound of the cashier complimenting my forever frizzy hair, the feel of warm chocolate cookie melting on my sweaty palm, and finally the taste of the six perfect cookies I devoured while sitting in Bay Bridge rush hour traffic for 90 minutes--and all for the low low price of $5.

Traffic never tasted so good.
author: Reina G.

description:
trekked over after picking up my boys from summer camp, Anthony's cookies did not disappoint! we had been wanting to go check this place out since it was featured in the Chronicle a few months ago. the cookies were gone within minutes!!! 
it was so tempting to try all the cookies, we had the oatmeal cranberry, toffee chip, cookies and cream, white chocolate chip and banana walnut, all so good! 
the oatmeal cranberry was our favorite, will be back for more! 
best of all, its in our neighborhood, the Mission!!!
author: heather z.

description: Their milk and cookie cookies are no joke. Is it literally the perfect cookie. It's crispy and chewy at the same time with this amazing sweetness that's got a clean finish that's not too cloying. I could easily eat a dozen of of these. In fact I think I will right now...
author: Cathy T.

description:
You go to Patisserie Philippe for French pastries or Tartine Bakery if you want Americanized French pastries. 

You came to Anthony's Cookies for one reason and it is to visit one of the best cookies-shop in the Bay Area. Their cookies are soft and gooey in the center with light crispy edges. Plus, their cookies do not leave your hands greasy like many others. Best of all, they are $11 per dozen which my wife and I often finished half within minutes.
author: Philip C.

description: Fantastic cookies and fantastic service! Also conveniently close to a BART stop. I tried Cookies and Cream (which is oreo pieces in a chocolate chip base), chocolate chip, toffee chip, ginger/molasses, and peanut butter. All of these were great, with the cookies and cream as the standout flavor! Staff kept putting out different samples while we were waiting to make our order. Some flavors are only available on particular days of the week--they offer schedules.
author: Katherine S.

description: 2.5 stars.  Cookies are pretty good, fresh out of the oven.  Not incredible once they've had a chance to cool down, but still solid.
author: J S.

description: I haven't tried my cookies yet, but they look really good.  My lips are salivating just looking at them.  The black dude was extremely nice too.  I will be back.
author: James C.

description: I was lucky to catch the actual Anthony as I came in.  He is super nice and super welcoming.  I got to sample a cookie and knew I had to get the dozen to bring back to san jose to share.  The banana walnut and whole wheat cranberry were shaped quite different from your regular cookie.. I personally liked the cranberry a little better.. it was much more moist.  My favorite had to be the cookies and cream cookie.  And the semi sweet was rocking too.  I would skip out on the banana walnut next time though.  It was missing something for me.  If I was in the area, I would definitely come back for the semi sweet choco. chop and cookies and cream, YUM
author: Rainbow B.

description: Love Love Love their cookies but was quite disappointed. Cookies are a bit pricey but willing to pay for the delightful taste of these cookies;however, 1.50 for the peanut butter cookies for it to crumble into pieces that can't be eaten anymore?! I think that needs to be fixed. Extra cost for a crumbled cookie while the rest remain in place? No thanks!
author: Andrea C.

description: I'm a huge cookie junkie, and this place does not only have great cookies, but very friendly people behind the counter.  I only got the cookies & cream one, and it was delish.  I wish it wasn't so tiny, though, but just ignore me -- I'm just being a fat ass.  ;)
author: Chiara H.

description: I have actually never been to Anthony's store... I have always gotten these cookies brought to me so that should show you how much I love them! The cookies and cream one is my favorite but there really isn't a bad flavor in the bunch. There really isn't much else to say but AMAZING!
author: Kristi E.

description: OMG! Anthony's cookies are like a little piece of heaven... SO GOOD!! Fresh from the oven and just like homemade. Not too sweet either! Pricey but WELL WORTH every penny!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
delicious cookies: yes
cute and friendly cookie selling boy: yes 

well, that's all i need.
author: tamera f.

description: I got introduced to these cookies after my amazing friend (Anne) bought them as our dessert after dinner. Please believe the hype. These cookies are A-M-A-Z-I-N-G. I tried the cookies and cream and was speechless. Do you remember the first time you bit into a freshly baked cookie? That's exactly how I felt, as if it was my first time all over again. Yummy, yum, yum!! They're so phenomenal that I salivate almost everytime I think about those cookies. Please try now! I can't wait for more.
author: Chau H.

description:
this place is ridculously hard to find!! i went purposely looking for this place. i knew it was on Valencia between 25th and 26th sts. we walked past the storefront TWICE and didn't even realize it was there! the cashier and beginning of cookie delight is situated about 25ft back from the storefront so from the outside it's hard to tell that the place is open or what they're selling anyway. we half gave up but decided to drive by once more and finally found it!

Anthony offers a solid cookie. perfectly chewy and perfectly crisp. i am super particular about my cookies and this guy has perfected his method. he has a cookies and cream cookie that is yum and a banana walnut cookie that tastes like the top of a banana nut muffin. aside from these two the other flavors are pretty normal but very good.

Anthony himself is a super excited and enthusiastic man. He's really friendly and seems really happy. Let's all spread the word and get this guy's business running!  i'm sure (i hope) that as Anthony's business grows, he will be able to put up a proper sign so that people don't miss out on perfect cookies.
author: Regina C.

description: These cookies are even better than my cookies, and that is seriously crazy!  Omg the toffee chip cookie??  Omg!
author: Rachelle P.

description: We're HOOKED!  I've known Anthony for several years now.  He started out selling door to door and used to sell cookies at the clinic I work at. They were always a hit and once you try them you'll never purchase your cookies anywhere else!  They have the perfect crispness/softness ratio.  Anthony is very personable, warm (like his cookies) and always professional.  Our favorites are the banana, double chocolate chip, chocolate chip, and cookies and cream.  Please support this local cookie joint-you won't be disappointed.
author: anne m.

description: MMMMMM!!!!!!  I doubted this place before I came here.... thinking how good can their cookies really  be?  That it was probably overrated and it would just be like any other cookie... but I definitely will eat my words now because they were SOOOOOOOO good I can't stop thinking about them!  We drove right past the store because there is no big signage or anything but luckily we found it.  There was only one other person ahead of me when I walked in, but when I turned around to leave there was a line almost out the door.  The guys working were very friendly and answered all my questions and even gave me free cookies.  I ended up ordering one of each flavor just because I wanted to try all the flavors and I'm glad I did because even the ones I would never have ordered turned out to be my favorite ones.  I'm allergic to cranberries but I still ate the cranberry one because that was the last one I had left and I really wanted another cookie... haha.  It just has the perfect cookie texture a little crispy and a soft but not TOO soft... and they stayed fresh over the 3 days that I had them.   Must tries are Cookies and Cream and the Banana ones!! MmMmmM!!  I will be back for more!
author: Kymberli C.

description: The best chocolate chip cookies ever! Anthony is always doing his best to improve his recipes.
author: Elizabeth M.

description: These cookies are ridiculous. Just plain ridiculous. Especially the cookies and cream flavor. Do it.
author: Melissa G.

description: Wow.  What more can I say?  These cookies defy logic, science, and life.  I was given a box of Anthony's cookies and after being in possession of said cookies for over an hour (and not knowing how long my benefactor had been in possession of them), the chocolate chip cookies were still gooey, and the chocolate chips themselves were still melted.  I don't get it, but I love it.  The cookies and cream cookies (which prior to knowing their flavor i referred to as the dirty and delicious cookies) are also incredible.  I will certainly be coming here for all of my cookie needs.
author: Nora S.

description: The ratings are spot on.  These are some of the best cookies I've ever eaten.  Chewy, tasty, not to sweet. I tried 6 different varieties and all were great.  They even passed the next day test.  Anybody can make a cookie that tastes good right out of the oven.  But Anthony's taste great the next day as well.
author: p w.

description: Anthony's cookies are delicious. I ate six (cookies and cream, banana, oatmeal chocolate chip, cinnamon sugar, double chocolate chip with walnuts, white chocolate chip) in the car as soon as I could open the box. I had six more that were devoured soon after. Unlike the many other Yelp reviewers, I wish they were bigger so I could enjoy each one a bit longer. I had to deduct a star for the lack of drinks.
author: Jen O.

description: Amazing amazing amazing AMMMMMMAAAAAZZZZZIIIINNNNGGG!  I am completely and utterly in love with this place.  The cookies are to die for and I swear it was like an orgasm in my mouth BUT so much better.  My boyfriend took me to Anthony's Cookies on a whim because he knows how much I love cookies.  They had pretty good reviews on Yelp! so I was super excited.  These cookies definitely lived up to their hype.  They were crunchy/crispy on the outside, while being so moist and gooey and yummy in the inside.  I swear my mouth is completely watering at the thought of having another cookie.  My boyfriend and I ordered 2 of each cookie and ALL of them were ughhhhmazing!  This place deserves more than 5 stars.  Seriously, the best cookies everrrrrrrr.
author: Meryl P.

description:
So so so good.  Has anybody gotten in touch with Sesame Street?  We need to get the Cookie Monster in here, asap.

Toffee chip?  We could promote world peace with this cookie.
author: Zack S.

description: The cookies n cream are amazing! Toffee chip is definitely the next best. Kind of expensive but I'm not rating based on value. I'll go again and again for sure.
author: Christine S.

description:
Anthony's Cookies, what can I say? 
A place where the taste of cookies takes you back in time to when you were so small, you'd barely could reach the counter to watch your mom's mixing up a batch. 
My first thoughts as I happened upon Anthony's, was this is a clean, inviting entrance to an otherwise unknown business, then the glass milk jar motif interior caught my attention. A great humorous quality. The young man awaiting my approach with a friendly smile drew me in even more. As I was slid a menu of the tasty treats as we introduced ourselves, the note worthy scent of already baking batches in the oven made me feel relaxed and humbled enough to chance the various named goodies.
Anthony's Cookies is a great approach to breaking away from the corporate mass cookie turn outs, and bringing it back to the home like up close and personal way of doing the business independently correct.
Have a treat, and go crazy, and just enjoy the experience alone or more importantly, with your buddy, love of your life, or family. Be greedy in a good way and acquire a whole dozen of mixed choice flavors, but don't follow in my footsteps and wipe out the whole dozen before you get to share them. =)
SHINOBI 009
(PIRATE CAT RADIO/ ZERO DEPTH™/ D.R.I.F.T.)
author: SHINOBI Z.

description: I am a serious cookie monster and I have three words to say about Anthony's to sum up their deliciousness: Cookies=Crack.
author: Sara W.

description: Joy is fresh baked chocolate chip cookies from anthony's. What's better than a sandwich from ike's place the cookies from here.
author: Tu D.

description: I'm not going to beat around the bush.  Simply put, Anthony's cookies are perfection.  They are the best cookies I've ever had the pleasure of eating.  Each and every one of the half dozen we sampled, from the favorite Cookies and Cream to the special German chocolate, were just unbelievable! With every bite, you say to yourself, "OMG, I can't believe how good these cookies are!"  The mere whiff of these delectable treats tells you that each batch is made with love and care, and made precisely.  I can't wait to go back to get a dozen or two and enjoy it with a nice, tall glass of milk.  Mmmmmmmm!!
author: Sarah H.

description:
They have the best cookies in town. My favorite is the chocolate chip cookie. Others are all good. Perfect consistency. I wish they disclose nutrition information of their cookies. It is so easy to consume a dozen cookie and still crave for more.
One side note, the boy who works at the counter shall pay more attention to customers instead of chatting with his visiting friends and gave out free cookies just to all his friends.
author: Mary S.

description: "Yo Dawg, I heard you like cookies, so we put cookies in your cookies so you can eat cookies while eating cookies!"--Xzibit, referring to the Cookies & Cream Cookies.
author: Maximillian M.

description: I don't even want to know how much butter is in the cookies... but they taste like heaven.
author: E T.

description: I just want to let you know there is always fresh cookies in there and they call you:) Chocolate cookies are great . Anthony's cookies. They are the best
author: Christina W.

description: We tried the Cookies and Cream, Candied Pecan, Toffee, Oatmeal Raisin, and Chocolate Chip.  They were all fine, but kind of boring.  Really do not get the hype about the Cookies and Cream.
author: Lynne W.

description: Milk and Cookie Happy hour! I'm there! Great job Anthony! Best cookies in SF.
author: Bryan S.

description: I have the biggest sweet tooth known to man and Anthony came to my work today because they are going to start selling his cookies in our cafe.  OMG!  Let's just say I'll be setting aside a weekly budget just for these delicious cookies!  I'm super picky when it comes to cookies, cakes, and cupcakes because I also have a passion for baking.  BUT these cookies are one of the best I've had.  Not too sweet, they're super chewy and gooey.  I can eat the Toffee Chip and the White Chocolate ones everyday if I could. :O)  Or maybe I will...ha ha!
author: Patricia B.

description:
The cookies and cream has this little crispy chewy crust that is soooo good and not too sweet.  

The banana is good also, it tasts so banana-ey (is there such a word?) and is almost cake like.  

Service is terrific, the staff apologizes whenever there's a line and they will always pass out samples.  Anthony is super friendly and is always asking for comments or feedback.
author: C Y.

description:
amazing cookies !! nothing less then fresh everyday .... lots of fav's along with some new ones ( try the oreo cookie cookie) its a new twist on using oreo pieces in a chocolate chip type batter cookie .... 
1.25 fore one
6$ for 6 
and so on ...... so not badly priced .. cookies could be a bit bigger

the cookies are now 1.75$ a piece and smaller then before .. I realize sf is expensive , but NO !
author: Micah W.

description: Damn good chocolate chip cookie. Perfect, in fact!
author: Thanya S.

description:
love any cookie joint that's just about cookies.  love the super friendly service.  love the space, with enough room to sit and enjoy your cookie.

but their cookies have been too undercooked for my liking the times i've tried them.
author: Karen O.

description: Yummy!  It's always nice to find a place that can produce their products that taste like it came from your own kitchen!  I'm still trying to figure out which cookie is my favorite!!!
author: Mrs L.

description: OHHHH! Man Anthony makes the best cookies I have ever tasted. Its so much better than Mrs. Fields and all those other commerical brand cookies. Parking may be hard to find on Valencia St. and the long waited line makes the trip to Anothony's all worth it to try.
author: John D.

description: I have a weakness for cookies and this place is as good as it gets without having to bake them yourself.  And of course since all I know how to make is chocolate chip, it's nice to get variety.  So fresh, soft, buttery, perfect.  I have fallen in love.  It's a bit scary that this place is 1 block from my work so it's easy to make it a daily break and my tummy will show it.
author: Avi S.

description: A little hard to find and not in the fanciest part of the mission, but I loved the cookies.  Love, love, loved the cookies and creme cookie.  I went out of my way to visit this place and would do so again.  I wish they would have a better delivery policy (only 9 dozen or more), but this is a fantastic treat!
author: Chris C.

description: Hmm...these cookies are not that great????  They were SUPER oily.  The peanut butter ones were pretty bad.  The only one I really enjoyed was the chocolate chip with walnuts, but again they are very oily.  The guy who worked there was missing a few brain cells as well.  Anthony was very nice though and he made sure to greet us.  I feel bad about giving a 3 star review, but I'm not super impressed.  Possibly because I like to bake and feel like I can make similar tasty cookies at home or I got caught up in all the hype and had higher expectations.
author: Neety P.

description: SO GOOD.  Love these cookies!  They are soft, chewy, and so tasty.  In the last month I have bought five dozen (no joke! I know it's only March 13th).  And yes I ate the majority of them.  The cookie diet is all the rage you know...  The guys who work there are sooo sweet and for the most part Anthony is always there too.  All the cookies are made and baked in the store and because they have such a great turn over you can bet you will have warm cookies.  They are open now at 10 a.m but I recommend coming around 11:30/12ish because they have more cookie choices.  I usually buy my cookies around then and I never have a problem finding cookies.  Overall it is a VERY, VERY, VERY good cookie place you should really check it out!
author: Lyly P.

description: The BEST cookies, from a bakery or otherwise. I wish I had this guy's recipes. Crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside, almost like cookie dough in the middle... AMAZING. Buttery and full of extras, but not too sweet. It's hard to eat just one and every flavor I've tried so far (double chocolate chip, white chocolate chip, toffee, and OF COURSE the famous cookies and cream) is just phenomenal. I have not been disappointed, and you won't either. A real San Francisco treat!
author: Andria M.

description: Anthony's Cookies is by far the best! My husbands coworker had introduced us to Anthony's Cookies and since then I have fallen in love! I literally have to order 1 of each flavor since I can not drive there everyday. The cookies are just as good 3 days later.  My favs are cookies and cream, banana choc. walnut, ginger, cinnamon, choc. chip...geez ALL OF THEM!
author: Ruby T.

description:
Bomb diggity cookies. Bomb diggity people who work there, offering so many hugs and laughs and occassional free cookies that I blush and curl my toes in glee.

My advice:

1. Get there early in the morning, or call ahead to reserve cookies
2. Many of the flavors are sold out come early afternoon / late evening
3. The Toffee Chip is sublime. Warm chewy inside, slightly crisped and toffeeliciously aromatic outside.

I'm not going to add another star until I finally get to try the cookies n' cream cookie. They're sold out every time I go, because I don't follow my own advice :(
author: Pearl W.

description:
the only reason this place isn't getting five stars from me is ONE, they don't always have a lot of options. sure there are options on the menu, but they aren't daily people!
i walked in craving a whole wheat oatmeal cookie (my favorite), and left with nothing. 
they didn't have it that day, nor the next. 
i don't quite get it
SECOND, it's quite pricey.
if you're looking for big cookies, they serve small portions which are just right for me, but it can get expensive if you go on a cookie rampage. been there. done that. 
however, i like walking in for their free samples. 
very satisfying.
author: Brenda S.

description: What have we here... San Francisco's Last Nobleman? Methinks so. Sir, I am humbled by your dedication to your craft. The world is full of nonsense. You bring clarity and light to a dark landscape. Then you dunk it in some milk.
author: Marc O.

description: Many more visits later, I have tried about half of the cookie types ... In addition to my fav, the cookies & cream, thumbs-up to the white chocolate chip, double chocolate chip, oatmeal raisin, oatmeal cranberry, cinnamon sugar ... and when they are fresh out of the oven, it's just a little bit more happiness ...
author: Melinda C.

description: I don't think I've tasted a better cookie... love the toffee chip, choc chip and the whole wheat oatmeal with choc chips!
author: a l.

description: I like to take my kids for walks down Valencia every now & again.We call it "Going to see the Hipsters". I had noticed this place a couple of times, but never went in.Now I find myself borderline addicted to the Toffee Cookies.I always say "NO!" when they ask if I'd like my box tied up. How else would I eat them all the way back home?Sooooo worth the "too many cookies" stomach ache I get.My hub likes the German Chocolate, though I just can't get the Toffee ones out of my mouth long enough to try them.Next time.Maybe.
author: Ellice D.

description: Cookies are crisp but chewy at the same time, tastes great, I go all the way to the mission to get them--- the people are friendly and all the flavors are fantastic.
author: James B.

description:
Wow. These cookies are really amazing. I'm no cookie monster, and I thought the friend who took me was really being a little overzealous about this place - like "I'm going to get a dozen of them." That's just disgusting.

But no, it's not. I'd imagined these were going to be some monstrously-sized cookies as most bakeries do it, like the size of an EP record, or else two inches thick. But they're really like Chips Ahoy! sized. 

Normal looking cookie. Sublime eating experience.
author: Mattie P.

description: Delicious vegan chocolate chip cookies!?  Shut up!  Yep, they exist and they're about to be unveiled at Anthony's.  Me and this other guy just had a sample/preview.  I live around the corner so I MIGHT have to make a daily pilgrimage so I can be RIGHT THERE when they're available for purchase.  Just to be, um, supportive-n-all.
author: Tijanna E.

description:
love: white chocolate chip cookies

this place is a nice addition to an otherwise lonely part of valencia.  they've got different flavors, so try getting a half dozen or a dozen if you're daring.  i think they're 95 cents each.  not bad considering old school mrs fields charges about $1.39+ and is no where to be found in these parts of town.

check out collective a few stores away while you're at it.  they've got some really cool stuff.
author: rachel r.

description: We went to Anthony's cookies last Sunday with the kids and I have to say I was totally shocked at how small the cookies were.  I went last year and they seem to have gotten A LOT smaller.  Unbelievable they were charging $1.25 per cookie.  Some were much smaller than the others.  I thought maybe it was a mistake and that they would give us two of the smaller cookies for the price of one, but that was not the case.  Too bad, we won't be going back.  My kid's were very disappointed at how small they were and we left with them wanting more.  They do taste good, but I cannot justify the price for such a tiny, tiny cookie.  Anthony, I would suggest you get back to the size they were back when you started.  You are getting too greedy.
author: M C.

description: uh..... WOW. like, I just ate about 5 cookies... seriously dangerous. Ok, the first time ever, cookies n'cream cookie? banana bread cookie, toffee, white chocolate chunk, whole wheat raisin oatmeal? OMG. delicious. service with a smile, and the place isn't even there yet. They were installing the sign today and talking about putting tables out front. Markus and Anthony: super-nice, charismatic, glad-to-know-ya. Magical beginnings for this place... could be Tartine status.
author: Jennifer L.

description: Cute little store, crappy cookies. They are super oily and NOT VERY GOOD. For the couple bucks for a cookie or two, sure, why not stop in if you are walking by, but I would not seek out these cookies by any stretch of the imagination. Oh well, sigh...
author: chloe w.

description: I ran here to get cookies...they were indeed tasty. I got the cinnamon sugar, cookies and cream, white chocolate and whole wheat chocolate chip. The cinnamon sugar was the least favorite...I thought it was going to be like sniickerdoodle but it was more like molasses cinnamon and didn't have much taste. BUT the other ones were SOOOO yummy!! The cookies and cream really does taste like the ice cream and I love that Anthony's cookies makes it because no other place does! The whole wheat choc chip was kinda similar to Specialty's wheat germ cookie, only not as heavy and dense. I will soooo come back around on my next run! :)
author: Joy A.

description: A whole store dedicated to selling cookies! Not quite as impressive as Portland's Knot Store ;), but the cookies are to die for.
author: Tracy Y.

description: I do love me some cookies! Some of the best cookies I ever had. Had to try all the flavors. If you come here you have to get chocolate chip, oreo, oatmeal raisin and chocolate oatmeal. The other flavors were good, but those were the best! They are a expensive for the size of the cookie and there is no discount if you buy a dozen... but I would still stop by anytime I am in the neighborhood. Also skip the coffee wasn't good at all. 5 stars for the cookies!
author: Chris Y.

description: Today, my hubby and I decided to go pick up a dozen of Anthony's cookies for ourselves since I couldn't stop raving over them after my co-worker's dear sweet husband had brought about 2-dozen to our work, which disappeared in less than half an hour.  They were SO good!  Anthony himself is so pleasant, you can't help but like this guy.  We got a variety of the cranberry oatmeal, the cookies n cream (my favorite so far), the semi-sweet chocolate chip, and the toffee chip, as well as some coffee to go.  So far, the best cookies I've ever had are from Anthony's and I will definitely be coming back here to get my sweet-tooth fix.
author: Cindy G.

description: BEST COOKIES EVER! COOKIES AND CREAM IS TOP NOTCH! Visited the place and was recommended to get these cookies, was thinking just ordinary cookies. BUT i thought wrong! It  was GREEEAAAAAT! Sorry Tony the Tiger.
author: Domingo P.

description: Very cute storefront, and I like that they don't mess around.  They sell cookies and... cookies!   The mission has so many amazing ice cream places, but sometimes it's nice to have a little something different when you're craving dessert, and then I head to Anthony's.  The best cookies around.  My favorites are the cookies n cream, which has crushed up Oreos in it, and the toffee chip.  They are soft, melt in your mouth, and usually warm, fresh out of the oven!
author: Lindsay L.

description: Great freaking cookies! Every cookie I tried was wonderful and perfect.  Crispy on the edges and chewy in the middle.  The cookies and cream was particularly delicious.  I crave it right now!  Also, to be noted, really friendly people working there!
author: Regan B.

description: I don't see the hype of this place.  It wasn't that good.  Ms. field cookies taste better than anthony cookies.  Their cookies is small and overprice.  Not worth it coming down here.
author: food lover t.

description: These cookies are really good! The walnut chip and cinnamon spice were my favorites of the ones I tried. Plus, they are priced super reasonably!
author: Sara S.

description: The best cookies of my life!! My first bite, I laughed hysterically because I couldn't believe my mouth. You must try the toffee, forgetaboutit!! Watch out on Sundays though, because sometimes the line can be out of control! But always always always worth the wait...
author: Kassandra N.

description: I've never been to the shop, but my friend gave me a bite of the toffee chip one day and it was so scrumdillyumscious. Today, he gave me another piece and I have to admit if heaven had to taste like anything I wish it would be those cookies. I'm about to stop by the city sometime next week and I'm definitely going to buy me a box of heaven. YUM!
author: Nicole M.

description: I searched up and down valencia and realized i entered the wrong address...141 instead of 1417...damn gps navigator.  when i finally found it, i ended up buying two dozens of cookies, one for myself and the other for the wonderful employees at gstar.  i even got a free sample of my choice.  i took my first bite into a double chocolate chip cookie and it was pure bliss, crispy on the outside and chewy in the center, just how i like it.  its almost like an otis spunkmeyer cookie only with more flavor options.  i've had the banana walnut, cookies and cream, and oatmeal cranberry so far.  They're all good too!  The banana walnut is slightly smaller in size compared to the other cookies and is more like a muffin top.  It has a different texture than a cookie.  brb while i go eat another one for you yelpers...toffee chip.  MMmmm  thats all, its been real.  peace out
author: Michael Y.

description: WOW. seriously these are some of the best cookies I have ever had (and I have had a lot)... Love this place now...
author: Dave C.

description: WoW...what has Anthony's done to my will-power? First of all, I love the cookies.  I'll go out for a 2hr mt bike ride & reward myself w/ a good dozen (not in 1 sitting though!). The tough part is how to get Anthony's cookies out of my head when I'm not home, 1.5 blocks away.  It's like a drug! If you're an oatmeal cookie fan, like me, then this is your place b/c they always have some type of oatmeal mix on the menu.  Which is why I never feel guilty having them for breakfast  ;)
author: richie s.

description:
when i went home last thanksgiving i was surprised to notice that my family still makes chocolate chip cookies, every night. it's been decades. 

sure i know the recipe by heart and bake them often too, but for the time being i'd rather go to anthony's. their chocolate chip walnut cookies somehow stay like they just came out of the oven, even once you get them home. i like cupcakes as much as the next kid, but this feels like a sweeter gift and the people here are genuinely nice.

c is for cookie. a++++++ is for anthony's!
author: Kenya l.

description:
Wow!  okay, at first I was skeptical.  How can a business make sustainable profit by selling ONLY cookies!  After trying my first couple yesterday, I am very glad Anthony opened a shop that I can go grab some whenever I want.  

I tried Cookies & Cream, and Peanut Butter cookies.  Both had nice texture, chewiness, and full of flavors.  Right amount of sweetness without making you feel the uncomfortable sugar rush afterward.  Also, the cookie sizes are sensible. 

Certain flavors are only available on certain days, so keep that in mind if you are craving for a particular flavor.
author: diana t.

description: Very good cookies! I ordered a 4 dozen va riety box  to give as gifts for christmas.  I was able to sample every cookie except for the two banana flavors.  Every cookie was good however I would say that they are better when they're cold. I would agree with Willie C. : add some comfy couches, maybe some internet access and voila! An even better cookie shop!
author: Jerome H.

description: Confession - I haven't actually been to this place, but had one of their cookies at Kasa (they were next to the register and I couldn't resist) and it was quite possibly the best cookie I have ever eaten.  My office orders pretty regularly from Specialty's, and I've eaten my fair share of cookies, but this one took the cake.  Cookies and Cream?  In COOKIE form?  YES, please.  The edges had that perfect crisp/chewy texture, and the taste....my god, the TASTE!  I want to eat these every day.  Always.  It's a good thing it is not remotely close to my house, or I'd be in some deep trouble...
author: Julie H.

description: Anthony's cookies are DELISH!!! cookies n cream are his special. All organic and fresh ingredients used. U can taste the quality. No oily, overly buttery fattening feel or taste just all organic goodness. Try it for urself. And Anthony is such a pleasure to meet. He's so thankful to everyone that walks in. It's like going to ur friends house to enjoy homemade cookies  with a glass of milk. Support your local business people and don't miss out on Anthony's Cookies!!!
author: J G.

description: Went in to try the Cookies n Cream cookie which I ate at the counter (tick = 7 x7 list, yes I had the milk) and ended up walking out the door with a dozen.  Need I say more.  Shout out to all the guys working there, super friendly.  Will be back!
author: L. H.

description: Great cookies, I hate sharing them. I make it a point to order my own cookies so I don't need to share with my wife.
author: ray r.

description: Not only does this place has great cookies, the customer service is refreshingly excellent.  It's been a while since I've experience such professionalism and friendliness.
author: Lynn B.

description: Lives up to the hype. The choco chip and the gingersnap were awesome!!!!!!
author: Christopher L.

description: Whenever I get the chance to rationalize a little reward for myself at the end of the work day ("I barely had lunch", "it was a hard day at work", "it's really hot and I'll burn off all those calories biking"), I stop by Anthony's Cookies.  I usually get three cookies: cinnamon sugar, toffee chip, and (of course) cookies and cream.  They never fail to disappoint.  The only downside to having such delicious cookies is that I hesitate to stray from my usual order, but I promise next time to be a little more adventurous.
author: Rick B.

description:
YUM YUM YUM YUM YUM.

  I am not a sweets person. If I crave dessert it usually consists of something savory not sugary. A friend brought me in here however and man, I could hardly decide what cookies to pick! I had to get the banana walnut since they were straight out of the oven. It was so moist and delicious. Quite reminiscent of banana bread. I also sampled the oatmeal cranberry, which they gave me two smaller ones instead of one normal size one. I really liked that it was packed with cranberries and more tart than sweet. My roomie  later devoured the other one in about half a second while proclaiming how amazing it was while chewing. LOL  I initially snubbed my nose at the cookies and cream cookie but upon taking a bite of my friends my eyes popped open with excitement! It was so good. Needless to say, I'm glad I don't live in the mission or I'd be here waaaay too much. They've made a convert of a non sweets eater!
author: chelsea b.

description: Anthony is wicked friendly, and the cookies are AMAZING. Highly recommended.
author: Katie H.
