description: Anthony, who began baking cookies out of his college apartment 12 years ago, has managed to create the world's perfect chocolate chip cookie.  In addition the toffee chip is pure heaven, the cinnamon sugar is a fantastic explosion of cinnamon and brown sugar notes.  So what am I?  Just another drooling new Anthony groupie!  The owner himself is often there, charming the customers and chipping in with the cookie chores.  This place is going to take off.
author: Thelma Lee G.

description: hi. my name is anthony's cookies.  i crush up oreos and use them as chocolate chips.  i am delicious.
author: Hannah M.

description: Anthony's Cookies are delicious.  I have been wanting to try this place for a while and finally did.  What a great treat! I had the semi sweet chocolate chip cookie and the whole wheat oatmeal cookie.  Semi sweet chocolate chip was great, crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside.  The chips melted as if they were freshly baked.  I think they were and it was a half hour before closing.  Yum! The oatmeal cookie was good too, flavorful packed with raisins and oats.  Definitely deserves another visit to try the other flavors.
author: Audgal G.

description: holy crap these cookies are amazing. and i don't even particularly love cookies. i mean, i'll eat one if you give it to me, but in terms of food i crave, a cookie is not on the list. with one exception: anthony''s cookies.
author: Lily S.

description: Right when you walk in.. you know it'll be worth it because of the smell of FRESH BAKED COOKIES! Hands down best cookies ever! nuff said
author: Anita L.

description: This guy knows how to make fresh, warm, gooey, yummy cookies.  Make sure you try the cookies n cream!
author: Damien S.

description: Dee-licious cookies...but at 95 cents a pop, it can be one expensive addiction.  I get  the 6 for 5$ bargain...when I'm feeling decadent and in the hood.
author: M S.

description: I am not a sweets person per se... but cookies... well, if they are chewy and pass my dunking in lactaid test (I am lactose intolerant... I know... play the tiny violin for me!)... it's on... Lactaid is sweet.... so, the two have to balance out!  Anyhoo... these cookies are worth the trip, the parking search, your first born. I absolutely loved everyone I tried. TO think I had heard about them forever and finally decided to drive by after I saw a woman with a HUGE box of them in line at the BofA on Mission. As soon as she walked up, everyone started talking about these cookies. This was enough to get me to go... I walked in... was given samples and walked out with a huge box myself. I am a fan of the toffee and the oatmeal (both raisin and cranberry). Like I said, they are all great... you have to go and try them out for yourself. You will not be disappointed. I believe they are $1.25 each or sold by the half dozen and dozen at a bit less.
author: Amelia M.

description: 4/4/2011It was a lovely Tuesday afternoon; woke up late for class;bed head and all; I was craving for cookies! Yes, cookies for lunch! I decided to drive all the way from inner richmond to anthonys cookies! There is a lot of metered/street parking! I just wish there was a big. Banner that said anthonys cookies but it would look tacky..if u blink your eyes you will pass up thiis cookie shop really quick. I ordered a half dozen-3 toffee chip, 3 cookies n creme! The girl who helped me out this morning was sweet;maybe a little timid but cgot my cookies! The bakers are cute too . Hah! *wink. $6 for half a dozen. As of right now cookies and creme is my fave! Real good quality cookies also and they're not overwhelming sweet-just perfect!
author: Iba N.

description: Great place.  These cookies are like the one's grandma makes -- taste like they come straight from her kitchen!
author: Jim N.

description: I've never actually been to Anthony's cookies, but was given one of his chocolate chip cookies after a cooking class at Jordan's Kitchen. It was the best chocolate chip cookie I've ever laid my taste buds on. Perfectly soft yet chewy texture, just the right amount of sweet, and not too big or too small. A cookie that can satisfy with just one serving. I can't wait to swing by the store and try the other flavors!
author: Katie R.

description: These are the perfect homemade cookies! I got a baggie of 6: 2 semi-sweet chocolate chip, 2 cookies and cream, and 2 double chocolate. they also gave me a sample of the oatmeal raisin in the store. My favorite was the semi-sweet chocolate chip. It's what a chocolate chip cookie is supposed to taste like (so many bakeries and restaurants need to try one so they can remember what it is supposed to taste like). what NICE people. I'm going to return not only because the cookies are so good, but because I want to support businesses like this with such nice people.
author: Sandi Q.

description:
Yes, please.
Bought my first cookie at Anthony's today.  Found myself back hours later for a dozen more.
Best cookies I've ever eaten.
author: Brian H.

description: My friends and I got 2 dozen of these bad boys last weekend and MAN, that was not enough. We got the chocolate chip, banana, toffee chip, and COOKIES AND CREAM...SO GOOOD. i wanna cry just thinking about em. i can't stop thinking about the cookies and cream cookies, which are pretty much genius...it has oreo cookie bits in it for christ sakes.
author: Mel P.

description: I imagined that the Yelp Hater Brigade (TM) would have something nasty to say, but it seems like even the worst of them can't manage to give Anthony's fewer than three stars, so my review is almost superfluous.  Anthony's cookies are moist and delicious when fresh out of the oven and, in my most recent cookie tranche, the ones left in the fridge for a couple days were still delicious, if substantially less moist.  I was dubious about the notion of such a niche business opening up in the Mission, but Anthony is destined for greatness!
author: Bitter J.

description: Is it the fabulous cookies or that Anthony is so genuinely sweet and so is everyone else who works there?  I don't know that it matters.  They make me happy and thats what matters, eh?
author: Sarah P.

description: Best cookies I've ever had- soft, moist, fresh, good selection. I would drive across town or at least stop if I were nearby for more.
author: Adrian F.

description: Wow!  This place has some of the best cookies EVER!  The cookies and cream and the semi sweet chocolate chip were perfection.  I will definitely be a frequent customer.
author: EK G.

description: I'm a picky cookie eater. One reason is because I love to bake and I made good ass cookies and another reason is because I'm a picky person in general. A box of Anthony's Cookies was delivered to my work and since treats get delivered to my work all the time, I didn't think much of them. However, things changed when the mid-afternoon munchies hit and I started sniffing around the office like a rat in search of delicious garbage. Lucky for me, the cookies were still sitting on the kitchen table and I didn't have to resort to trash can diving, which is so unprofessional. I was weary at first and took just a piece of what appeared to be semi sweet choc chip for a nibble. Delicious! So then I took a piece of something that looked like white choc chip for a nibble. Also delicious! And I don't even like white chocolate. The cookies weren't just all about the sweetness and sugar; there was also a true flavor of the main ingredient, which some bakers overlook. Most importantly, the cookies had the chewy, soft texture that I love so very much. I was soon joined by two hungry coworkers and we ended up crowding around the box of cookies with our cups of milk for an impromptu cookie tasting and discussion. The consensus was that, while they were all tasty, the cookies n cream were the best and our afternoon munchies were very well satiated.
author: Queenie C.

description: Look, they're the best cookies you've ever had.   Moist, rich (one can taste the butter).   I wasn't going to review them because the last thing I need is to spend five minutes in line waiting to get cookies.   The chocolate chip cookies are amazing!   Don't go!!!!!
author: Asit P.

description: Love the bittersweetness of the cookies and cream. The toffee chip is sooo buttery. Yum!
author: Pam G.

description: These are some of the best cookies i have ever eaten. They were chewy and just a little crunchy, perfectly baked and absolutely delicious. I think I tried every flavor and lucky for me I had to go otherwise I probably would have finished every last crumb! You definitely have to try these.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Better than hot cookie, better than specialtys.  Best store bought cookie I've had. Delicious toffee chip cookie, though all were delicious.  Hubs and I bought 6, not realizing how small they were.  All were gone before we hit 101.  We'll be back.
author: H A.

description: Double chocolate chip cookie is the way to go!  The service here is fantastic... they'll give you a sample of anything.  Take advantage!
author: Taryn S.

description: Anthony's Cookies are tastey and affordable.  White chocolate chip and toffee chip are my faves.  They also offer milk and coffee!
author: shannon a.

description:
I was stuck in traffic the other day on Valencia heading towards Cesar Chavez. Looked to my left while cussing not so quietly, saw Anthony's unassuming classy storefront, and the cussing stopped there. Rolled down the window and I swear, despite the exhaust and other choice City smells, the scent of fresh baked cookies wafted to my nose. "I HAVE to go there," I thought to myself. Got my butt over there the next day and I was sooo happy that I did. Oatmeal cranberry? Slammin! Cookies & Cream? Dee-lish! DOuble Chocolate Chunk? Pure Utter Paradise! Bought 6 and thought, I'll have one now and save the rest for my man. yeah, right! those cookies never made it home.

Do yourself a favor and get over to Anthony's as soon as you can say chocolate chip.
author: Lisa M.

description: I am a diabetic and can enjoy a cookie here and there but my partner loves cookies. We started going to Anthony's Cookies and they are delicious. The owner and his staff are wonderful.
author: Jose A I.

description:
i love watching a neigborhood joint open before its got any of the fancy things like seating and decorations.  this means you are coming simply for what they are offering - which is delicious, reasonably priced cookies, and friendly service.  it helps too, when you ask who the owner is, and anthony just so happens to be standing in the back, messing around with trays of cookies himself.  

the banana walnut cookies is my favorite and of course, the old standby, chocolate chip.  i cant wait until they start serving coffee...hopefully its good coffee!!
author: Holly S.

description:
What a glorious addition to the Mission and San Francisco in general.  Friday afternoon my wife calls me at work and tells me we have to go to this new cookie shop in the Mission.  So Friday evening we made our way to Anthony's Cookies and as soon as we walked in I knew I was going to love it.  It smelled great but more importantly there wasn't anything in the store....no tables, no chairs (although I believe they are on their way).  This place screamed to me that it was all about the cookies nothing else and then we met Anthony and Marcus and realized it was about two things.  Cookies and great people.  It is so refreshing to meet people that are good at their jobs.  Unlike the workers at a place like Tartine down the street these two gentleman were friendly, enthusiastic, and you aren't going to believe it but they were smiling.  Yes, people actually smiling at their customer and while they work.  Not only were the cookies great (cookies and cream cookies, who thinks of that SH) but it is extremely refreshing to see people that are kind/down right friendly to their customers.  We liked it so much we went back on Sunday and guess what, Anthony and Marcus were still having a good time.  Really a top notch establishment and would recommend it to everyone.  The cookies and their purveyors are absolutely unmatched.


We had the cookies and cream cookies, toffee Chip, Chocolate Chip and Chocolate Chip Walnut (you have to buy at least 6 at a time).  All were excellent.
author: matt g.

description:
iv known Anthony for about 6 years and iv always liked his coocikes over others. the store is looking good and i especially like that you can see the whole kitchen. its always nice to see how your food is being handled. 

As for the cookies they are always perfect not to chewy and not too sweet but sweet enough to satisfy your sweet tooth and not crunchy enough to loosen a filling.



i will be back for more cookies!
author: T L.

description: Dynamite cookies.  Chewy but with a little crust.  8-10 varieties & growing (we tried four flavors, loved them all)  Very friendly place.  Worth going out of your way.
author: Jerry G.

description:
Cookies N Cream! Yummers. Very nice, outgoing people. Easy people to have conversations with. Worth coming back to. They even have regular customers that call in to place their orders. Fresh, warm baked cookies. The best in San Francisco, period. Anthony's will definitely see us again, and again
p.s., don't you dare try and compare these to a Mrs. Fields or Tollhouse, Pillsbury type. Don't...
author: S. F.

description: Mmm cookies and cream, cranberry. They're all good! Anthony is super nice (he overheard me talking with the cashies  and introduced himself) and deserver good business. It all goes to a good cause. A little expensive but the cookies are  with their weight in gold.
author: Amy M.

description: Anthony's cookies has the freshest cookies. Anthony is a really nice guy who loves chatting with the customers. If you looking for a good after dinner dessert or midday snack, go there!
author: Jeffrey L.

description: will need to exercise more as a result of anthony's cookies.
author: Helen K.

description:
The cookies are almost as yummy as the guys who work there.
Come on, ladies. I know you've all thought so before ;).
author: cat s.

description: Anthony's makes my favorite chocolate chip cookies-- they are rich and buttery without being cloyingly sweet.  The oatmeal cookies are heaven, too.  Best of all, everyone in the store is so cheerful and friendly.  I'm so glad this shop is in my neighborhood and I look forward to witnessing its development and success.
author: Joanna P.

description: I eat a lot of cookies and these are some good cookies. Even better is the man himself who might be one of the most pleasant people I have met in a while. Go get some
author: luke b.

description: These guys are GREAT! They are SO friendly and it's always a fun experience to go in and order some sweets. The cookies are great. The chocolate chip cookies straight from the oven are the best. An interesting cookie variety is the cookies and cream. It's like oreo chunks in the cookie. Super tasty.
author: Mandy C.

description: I am in love with their chocolate chip and peanut butter cookies. Very satisfying and worth your money! Will come back often.
author: Haven L.

description: Opening up a cookie shop this close to my house is like opening up a cheese factory next to the mouse's house.  Just plain dangerous.  I am so addicted.  I especially like when the cookies just come out of the oven and they are warm and chewy *drool*  And I really like the fact that they are small and only 85 cents because I can just drop in and get a quick fix.  The cookies and cream are sooo delicious, as well as the cinammon, banana, and oatmeal, are just some of my favorites.  And the next best thing is the service.  Anthony, Marcus, and the other guys that work there are always happy to see you.  And I'm always happy to see their cookies.
author: P D.

description:
this place is great. simple. just the right amount of choices. perfect.
some of the most delicious cookies I have ever had - not to mention how  sweet the guys are in there. Marcus(spl) is my favorite.
author: Lynz H.

description:
I like cookies.  Anthony's cookies are delicious and not outrageously priced like the other places.The cookies and cream cookies might be my favorite-smushed up oreo's within a chocolate cookie batter. YUM! I tried about 4 kinds, they were all delicious!  I wish it was easier to see off the street, I think it would get more business! spread the word!!  

*Plus, in a city where gentrification has pushed out so many people of color, it is great to support this Black Owned cookie shop!!!
author: End W.

description: Be prepared to be welcomed into the Cheers of cookies in the mission.  The staff including the owner are warm, sincere, and shake your hand and learn your name upon ordering.  The cookies are amazing and the chocolate melts in your mouth.  Tons of options.  Support this local business in a part of Valencia in which I call the dead zone- nothing seems to survive after 24th!
author: Kate B.

description:
I loooove this place and Anthony is such a hoot!  He loves his product and isnt' afraid to ask questions about how to improve (not that he needs to..)The cookies are delicious ,without an attitude (no artisan- fancy schmanse flavors here).  We got a half dozen and enjoyed them all... except for the banana nut (which my bf wanted, but sounded more muffiny to me.. and it was).
Try this place out, and keep it in business! It is on a weird block of Valencia Street, not to far from the sceney stuff and worth the trek up a few blocks.
author: susan h.

description: Anthony and his partner came into  KMEL's studio today and served up an assortment of  cookies fresh out the oven, at first I was offered a cookie, but resisted because it was so early, within 5 minutes the room smelt so good I ended up eating 2. Cookies and creme and some toffee one. Anthony's cookies is official, and they are very cool and humble people. I highly recommend this place. Keep doin work yall.
author: Shadi K.

description:
My boy Anthony has the cookie business on lock down! I dare you to find a better cookie. Yeah I said it! He makes Mrs. Fields look like an amateur. 
I Went there for the first time yesterday and was pleasantly suprised by how good they were. Not only is the product delicious, but Anthony, Marcus and the whole crew were super friendly and helpful. His story is quite inspirational as well. 
This is a must try if you have a sweet tooth. Five stars all the way!
author: Paul H.

description: Holy cow am I going to get fat.  I ate a dozen last week, half a dozen today, and will probably get some this weekend as well.  Anthony's cookies are easily the best in the city (believe me, I'm a cookie whore), and Anthony is one of the most outgoing, enjoyable guys I've encountered from across the, well, counter.  Prices are more than reasonable.  Do yourself a favor, stop by and have a White Chocolate or a Cookies and Creme cookie.  Your mind will be blown.
author: Steve O.

description:
I'm visiting town for a few days, and happened into Anthony's on day one. I've made a trip to his shop every day since, because you can't get cookies this good anywhere else.

The cookies and cream and cinnamon are to die for. Actually...they all are.
author: R H.

description: I don't understand how a mere cookie can be this good -- but they really, really are.  I live a couple of blocks from this place and may never be able to move just because I cannot give up my proximity to these cookies.
author: Sarah B.

description:
ANTHONY'S IS SUPERIOR.
What's beautiful about Anthony's Cookies is the fact that the owner Anthony is as beautiful a person as he is an extraordinary baker.  This guy has been serving up cookies long before any one knew what flavor country was all about.  It's such a wonderful addition to the neighborhood; not just because the of the quality of this man's cookies, but because of the quality of this man's character.
KEEP IT UP ANTHONY'S! SUPER STOKED TO HAVE YOU IN HERE IN THE NEIGHBORHOOD!
author: Samuel J.

description:
ok, this is a review of the cookies themselves. as i have never actually been in the store.  

as we all know yesterday was easter, so i was stuffing plastic eggs all day to hide around the bar where i work.  my friend bonnie sends me a text that she's picking up a bunch of cookies to take to the bar for people.  don't think too much of it until she picks me up and her car smells like heaven. 

i grab a cookie from the box in the back seat and whoa! it was like the first time i ate a warm krispey kreme, or saw it's always sunny in philadelphia, love.  throughout the course of the night i ate about a dozen cookies.  the oatmeal raisin, chocolate walnut, and toffee were amazing! the perfect balance of crispness on the outside and soft on the inside.  the banana, which i was skeptical of, were also awesome. they were unlike any cookie i've had before.  they were a lot like a muffin, but much more moist.

i hope this guy does well, he makes a dang fine cookie.
author: Kate G.

description:
Hello Yummy!  I found them after
seeing all the little fliers around. The toffee ones are so great.
Nice to find a cookie place. Parking was fairly easy too.
Highly recommend them! Great price too at least for now! 
Love the decor for a cookie store.
author: B O.

description: MMMM. Cookies! Cookies and Cream and Toffee Chip are the BEST! Although, they are all so delicious. You can sample for free, just ask. I sampled 4 different cookies once, and they were delicious. I usually walk out with a dozen to take home.
author: Selena G.

description: Ridiculous cookies. Standard chocolate chip - unbelievable. Cookies and creme are also great. Must have
author: Nel S.

description:
Simply awesome. Who would've thought of this -- a shop selling only freshly made cookies!
The cookies are actually quite reasonably priced, too (approx $5.50 for six)
author: bong b.

description: These cookies (especially the cookies and cream) are amazing they are baked to perfection... a little crunch on the outside and soft on the inside. I literally ate a whole dozen by myself. Then I had to go back and get more for the family. Anthony is also a really nice guy along with the rest of the staff.
author: M T.

description:
I LOVE THIS PLACE! Not only are the cookies hella delightful, but the service is unbeatable! I vow never to buy another cookie from anywhere else. Ever. I wish I lived in the MIssion so all the money I use up on gas can go straight  into buying Anthony's chocolate chip cookies!  

On top of that, Anthony is quite possibly one of the nicest people I have ever met. I mean, when I went there, he was hecka friendly, introduced himself to me, and even asked what MY name was! How often are you asked what your name is when you walk into a bakery or restaurant or anywhere?!?!?!? I'm gonna support this place because it'd be a shame to see a delicious cookie store with such a crazy-nice owner go out of business.

I have never wrote a review on yelp (even when my freakin'wedding cake wasn't delivered on my wedding day!!! what the hell?!?!?!?), but I will for Anthony's Cookies!!!
author: jane c.

description: OMG!! The cookies are AMAZING!!! I'll never eat another Mrs. Field's cookie EVER AGAIN. All the cookies are crispy on the outside, moist on the inside, full of flavor, not too sweet, PERFECTION. Is it that serious?? YES!! hehe. If I could give it a million stars, I WOULD!! Thank you Anthony AND your grandma!! Woop Woop..lol!!
author: Li V.

description: This place is amazing! Absolutely loved the cookies n' cream cookie! The people were friendly, and offered free samples to those waiting in line. The line is worth the wait!
author: Raquel C.

description: I believe this is my favorite dessert shop in SF... didn't come because of the hype, just randomly stopped by for a snack on my way to volunteering... the semi-sweet chocolate chip was PERFECT... absolutely mood-altering :)
author: Victoria K.

description: Best cookies in San Francisco!  Love all of flavors.  Toffee chip, chocolate chip, whole wheat oatmeal raisin.  All good.  The cookies are delicious and chewey!
author: Diego V.

description: milk and cookies!! yummers! cookies n cream cookie is Oreo cookies crushed into the batter. unique and delicious! walnut chocolate chip cookie was solid as well.
author: Carol L.

description: The best chocolate chip cookie I've ever tasted. I want more right now as I type this.
author: Ian B.

description: The cookies are AMAZING!!! My favorites are the Cookies & Cream and Chocolate Chip. The others are above average as well. I think these are the best cookies in San Francisco and probably one of the best, if not, the best cookies in general I have ever had. They are the perfect combination of sweet, warm, gooey, and delicious! The people who work here are really nice and friendly, which definitely adds to the awesome-ness of this place.
author: Kimberly N.

description: Yum. So glad this place is here. Great cookies just a short walk away. Love the chocolate chip, cookies and cream, and toffee chip cookies. I'm sure the others are good too, but these are the ones we have had. Hope they gain a following and are here for a long time!
author: Amy O.

description: best cookies in sf.  straight up chocolate chip is the way to go.
author: Mick M.

description: yikes the COOKIES AND CREAM cookie is soooo good and buying them while they are warm and fresh out the oven is just dangerous. a friend ordered 2 dozen of anthony's cookies and we ate most of them in the car before we got to our next destination.... In-n-Out (FAT ASSES).
author: Chanel M.

description: Completely amazing cookies. I think its because they are so chewy and buttery - just decadent. Go try some. You can also get them at Rainbow Grocery store.
author: Christina S.

description: These are without a doubt the best dang cookies I've ever tasted!! I love the toffee chip, the chocolate chip, and white chocolate chip cookies best! They are to die for!! The cookies are moist, taste amazing, and taste good even a day later. The prices are decent as well. I only wish this place was closer to me but I guess it's safer that it isn't.  I love you Anthony's cookies!
author: Marianne Grace L.

description: If your in the area and your craving some fresh baked cookies, definitely stop by here.
author: Kali L.

description: Love the semisweet choc chip. Much better cookie quality than the cookies at Mrs. Fields in the mall. Love the location and the fact that it's a small business with a guy doing his own thing.
author: M C.

description: i love the cookies and the whole vibe in the place. and that especially includes the vibe of the owner, anthony, who seems to have a great sense of humor. so go buy yourself some cookies!
author: danica s.

description: good cookies, helpful & fun staff; my faves were the dbl choc chip & choc chip; the other cookies were pretty good, but dinna really care for the "oreo embedded" cookies, nor the snickerdoodle=type.
author: Ali S.

description: these cookies are amazing. i heard about them on KMEL stuck in 101 traffic during the week and i really wish i could've driven there immediately instead of to work. :) got the cookies & cream and cinnamon sugar cookies. soft and sweet but not too sweet - just right. i nearly walked by it on valencia but as other yelpers have said - the smell of cookies led me to it. the two guys working today were super nice and down to earth. can't wait to stop by again!
author: ally o.

description: Anthony's store is opposite my Pilates studio--so the first time I dropped by, it was out of curiosity. But I have fallen in love with his cookies, and my kids are his biggest fans!  I made it through soccer carpool by picking up a box almost weekly. His cookies are delicious, and equally important--normal size!!  We love the white chocolate chip and chocolate chip, and not a week goes by that I don't stop in for a refill.
author: Christine H.

description: Omigosh - these cookies are so good! I was lucky enough to try a peanut butter cookie straight from the oven and it was delicious. We sampled everything and it was all so yummy. Anthony was kind enough to invite my daughter to come into the kitchen and show her how the cookies are made. He and his staff were so friendly and professional. I can't wait to go back!
author: Keromi K.

description: Really good cookies, nice design of their space, smells so good when you walk by.  Lots of interesting flavors as well.
author: Rusty H.

description: You have to love Anthony, and he makes damn good cookies.  They're all good, literally all of them.  I used to live around the corner when he opened and without fail he would usher me in and foist samples on me.  This is the kind of local little place you want in your hood.  The only thing keeping me from 5 stars is wanting him to fill out the place with some comfy furniture and good coffee and really making it a place to lounge on a Sunday.
author: Will C.

description: Their cookies are great.  I'm a chocolate chip fan.  I plan on trying all their cookies eventually.
author: Nick H.

description: The staff is friendly, welcoming and always wearing the biggest smiles.  The location is clean and you can smell the delicious cookies from a block away.  Hands down, the best cookies I've ever eaten!  I know what I'm getting friends and family for Christmas. Keep up the good work Anthony. : )
author: Melissa S.

description: i got the toffee chip.  it was ok but i was really hoping for some intense toffee action.  i am going to return and give it another shot, primarily because these cookies are so reasonably priced.  i gotta say though, i am pretty darn bummed that there aren't ANY peanut butter cookies which are my fav.
author: Ryan H.

description: These cookies are soo yumi! It always smells so delicious in there it's cute small business but with a whole lot of character...If your a fan of cookies this is the place to go...they have a great selection of some of the most amazing flavors...I personally like the cookies & cream, the bannana walnut, the double chocolate chip, and the walnut chocolate chip...Just visited recent and they had added a new flavor (German Chocolate) taste is just like the the actual cake... Enjoy!!
author: Angela Monique A.

description: I was referred to Anthony's Cookies by Mike Y (See Review Below). I was kind of bum I didn't get a sample cookie since it was my first time going to Anthony's Cookies...But the bakers are so very nice, so I gave them 5 stars on customer service (they seem like they enjoy their job so where there are happy workers there are also happy customers) it shows that they make the cookies with love...The cookies in general would have to be 5 stars also, I love love love how the cookies are crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside (but not soft like its not cook yet), the cookies are perfect...I bought a dozen of the combination since I wanted to try all the diffrent types of cookies they had to offer and a dozen and a half of combination between toffee chip, cookies and cream, and double chocolate chip cookies...All the cookies are so very yummy but if I have to pick a favorite I would pick the cookies and cream...
author: Precious S.

description: Went back again, this time the line was long but moved efficiently. And damn those cookies are amazing.
author: Mission D.

description: ok so yes they may be small but in this case size does not matter cus these cookies are - to me - perfect. i usually always go for the straight up chocolate chip. i'm not a baker so perhaps that is why i'm willing to bay 1.25 for a small yet perfect cookie. btw if you buy them by the half or full dozen they are less expensive ;-)
author: r m.

description: I'm eating them right now and oh my god they're delicious.
author: Zac C.

description: soooo....delicious. and the best part is the atomosphere. anthony and his team are the most enjoyable people to talk to, if you have to wait while your fresh cookies are being made. delightful....
author: Tara D.

description: This place is great. I met Anthony who is a very nice guy, his staff are friendly as well. Buy a dozen, you get a break on the price plus you can try every cookie. I'm glad he's in the neighborhood. I stop here for dessert after having lunch on Valencia or the Mission.
author: John W.

description: Fantastic, helpful, friendly service and the world's best cookies.  If that wasn't enough,  there is excellent coffee as well.  Seriously, cookies don't get better than this.
author: Lucas M.

description: I tried some of Anthony's cookies this past weekend, and can I just say, HEAVEN.  My fiance, who is not a big cookie lover, managed to eat 3 cookies in a row.  Now that's saying alot!  We tried 6 different flavors, the oatmeal raisin and semi-sweet chocolate are currently my favorite although I should try the cookies and cream next time.  Each cookie was moist and the perfect size (not too big not too small).  And it didn't hurt that the workers were all friendly.  I will definetely be returning again...and again..and again.
author: Joyce A.

description: These people/cookies are incredible. I would probably give Anthony and his employees my own savings if their business was in trouble--they are that nice. The cookies are chewy in the middle and crispy on the edges. Deeelish.
author: f d.

description: Friendly service, great cinnamon sugar cookies. I'll be back soon.
author: C B.

description: Congratulation Anthony for opening your business. It's been a long time coming. I remember the days when you used to visit our offices & sell your delicous cookies. They were a hit. Next time I'm in the city, I'll definitely hit your shop to buy your cookies.
author: Pauline L.

description: I want to give this place a lower rating just because I don't think any place should have over 100 reviews and still have 5 stars.  This place is too good for me to lie about so I have to give its well-earned 5 stars. Delicious cookies for a reasonable price.  85 cents for a decent-sized cookie.  Seriously beats the mrs fields-type cookies by price and taste.  The size of Anthony's cookies is significantly smaller that what you may find at hot cookie but seriously, its so much better to have just one snack-sized cookie (or if you want to stuff yourself, order 2 or 3 and get an awesome variety)
author: pauline e.

description: These cookies are the BEST. They have so many fantastic kinds to choose from (yes, I have tried them all-don't judge!). My favorite is toffee chip. To die for! The owner Anthony seems work 24/7 and he is always there to greet you with a friendly smile.
author: r e.

description: I had a birthday party at Cloony's last night and my friends popped two doors down to Anthony's to get some cookies.  We devoured them.  They were so good.  I went back for more today.  I am with Sara d....two blocks from my house and my hips are in trouble.
author: Beth B.

description: my friend's boyfriend always manages to bring us some of these heavenly cookies. they are SOO GOOD. light crust that gives you a perfect crunch followed by melt in your mouth goodness. the cookies and cream cookie is by far the best ive had. these cookies just manage to give you that warm fuzzy feeling.
author: Jessie B.

description: great cookies...nice staff. it's that simple.  there is usually a line, so prepare to wait a few minutes...
author: Roy N.

description: yes, this is the place that has finally prompted me to start a yelp account just so I could review it. why am I writing this review? because I got effin sexually harassed by the counter guy, while the register guy just watched in amusement. seriously dudes? so uncomfortable and unprofessional. The cookies are good, but not good enough to make me want to endure inappropriate advances from some fratty douche creepster in an apron. If I want to get hit on by strangers, I would just walk down mission street.
author: Cristina M.
